Summary: The beds üõå are great. Rooms are spacious and well decorated with modern USB upgrades. Breakfasts are always great with cooks on hand to help cook your breakfast eggs anyway you like. Very friendly cooks also and very very hospitable.

I always stay here when in the area. I love the French vibe and accommodations are perfect  Location is easy freeway access with many restaurants and shopping nearby.  The free breakfast is always great with so many choices.  I would recommend to anyone staying in area

This is a hidden gem in the Seal Beach / Los Alamitos area.  I have been staying at this hotel for over 15 years.  It is super clean and kept updated.  The included breakfast is complete, not  continental.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The Ayres, Seal Beach is a great choice with super access to the freeways going in all directions.

Summary Heading: Not sure I'd return, too far from beach and older hotel
Summary: Seems to be one of Ayres older properties so we noticed the place is a little run down. The two king mattresses we slept in were too soft, told front desk they wanted to move us to two queen rooms without the connecting doors so we declined and suffered with sore low backs from both beds being too soft x three nights. :(  Breakfast was good, basic. Liked the homemade salsa! Pool was closed during our stay :(
Room tip: Just make sure your bed is comfortable cause ours were to soft and didnt notice till our backs...

Summary: The Ayres in Seal Beach is my go to place whenever I travel to the area. It is conveniently located, and although on the freeway, the rooms are quiet and spacious and clean.  Having said that, my yesterday's stay was a shock. Little things make a hotel great or ordinary, and the Ayres is no longer great. Firstly, the toilet paper, which in prior stays was on par with Charmin, was one ply thick. As a money saving measure it fails as one is forced to use twice as much to do the same job. Secondly, while before the bath towels were fluffy and lush, these were as harsh and scratchy as sandpaper. I attribute this again to a misguided money saving measure in purchasing an inferior detergent.. And lastly, I always looked forward to the complementary breakfast provided to guests during

As expected,  wonderful accommodations and staff. Clean, quiet and well appointed.  Only wish they had a frequent program as we stay here four to five times each h year for a week or better. Super location for just about anything orange county

Summary Heading: Convenient location when visiting family at Leisure World
Summary: Very nice staff. Rooms are all clean and beds are comfortable. However the hotel seems a bit worn from the first time we stayed there a few years ago.  They breakfast needs a little updating, too.  Should not be using Styrofoam plates and bowls.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your rating and review! We are thrilled you were satisfied with the service you received from our team and you had an overall comfortable stay. I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding our complimentary breakfast. Our goal is to provide 5-star experiences, and we are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you this time. Your feedback is appreciated, and we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a stellar visit the next time you're in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: One of my Best Hotel Stays
Summary: It was a beautiful stay the entire two weeks I was there. I love the hot breakfasts and miss them now. My room was always clean. All the employees were always pleasant and helpful. I will stay again when I come back to California. Thanks to everyone on the staff who mad my stay beautiful, pleasant and wonderful. You guys are rock stars and I appreciate all your hard work.

Summary Heading: Broken Room, Lax Unresponsive Staff, Glad We Didn't Stay Here
Summary: So I understand early checkins are a thing of the past, no big deal. When we arrived we were told our room was finished being serviced, due to staffing shortages due to holiday, they will do their best, and maybe we can get our room in about 30-40 minutes. When we asked if we can sit in the lobby or the breakfast room to have our lunch we picked up, eyes were rolled, looks of disgust and was pointed "yeah, I guess you can sit over there". So 45 minutes later, I asked where our room was so I decided to take an adventure and walk around. Seeing that our room had no-one servicing it for over 30 minutes, I went back and said "I am not trying to be pushy, but you said our room is being serviced and no-one is there and when I found a housekeeper, they told me oh it was already done"

Loved everything about our stay We were able to communicate by text message for anything that was needed I was able to email before our visit regarding some breakfast questions with quick response The room was clean and cleaned daily Breakfast was a very nice treat Great breakfast choices and snacks ü•∞Belinda waited on us at breakfast She made sure that we had everything that we needed  she was such a pleasant person to everyone and went out of her way to make sure we were happy  All in all Our stay was delightful  we will definitely stay there againüíï

It is a hidden gem in California!  The accommodations were great but the service of the staff is superior. It is in walking distance to so much and a short drive to downtown. I highly recommend this location!

Stayed here for 3 nights for work. What a great little hotel! It was quiet, relaxing and in a safe location. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Great staff. Belinda in the kitchen was awesome üëå Definitely recommend!

Well, lets just say I was surprised. I had never before stayed in an Ayres hotel (spoiler alert: I certainly will again) It impressed me with the lobby, the friendly check in staff, the size of the room, and the attention to detail.  What detail? Texting me before, during, and after the visit to make sure things were ok, give me the wifi code, inform me of breakfast hours. It may not seem like much, but it impressed me. Not, however, as I was impressed by Belinda, the breakfast lady.   Wow. She was awesome. Efficient, helpful, and kind. What a nice way to start the day with her great cooking and friendly smile.  My teenage son (roommate) was impressed by this place too/ He asked why we couldn't stay in hotels like this all the time.  I'd definitely stay at this hotel again, and

Summary Heading: Convenient location, nice hotel, good value.
Summary: We always enjoy our stays at Ayres Seal Beach. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Our son goes to Cal State Long Beach and we visit a few times each year. The hotel has quick access to the freeway, the rooms are clean and quiet, and the included breakfast is convenient. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel in Seal Beach w/Value.
Summary: We have stayed here many times and it was always a pleasure. Great breakfast with an outside seating area. Both breakfast and parking are included. Spacious rooms. Ten minutes to the main drag in Seal Beach.

Stay here three to fours times each year . Always clean, well maintained,  close to everything.  Staff are always polite and accommodating.  Rooms are well appointed,  beds comfortable and the overall size allows visitors without being confining. Free breakfast is possibly the best we've encountered.  Even as a Hilton member this hotel out paces and out does. Pricing is competitive for the area,  $$1/2. Freeway close to weeks worth of activities.  Disneyland,  aquarium,  old Town LB shopping, etc.

I am used to having my rooms cleaned by late morning or early afternoon..  After a week‚Äôs stay, my room hasn‚Äôt been done before 5 pm., if at all.  One night, I only got new towels.  After a full day of work, I expect a clean room to come back to at night. It hasn‚Äôt happened.  I plan on notifying my company‚Äôs travel agents to stop sending our employees to this hotel.

We have stayed here off and on since it opened. Has gone down hill lately‚Ä¶ considering the price. Front desk check-in was great. Breakfast so-so. Not set up properly for ease of self-service. Patio area not cleaned up after late night party nor before breakfast. Lack of personnel perhaps? Grounds look ‚Äútired‚Äù not maintained. Will probably move to Hampton Inn next time.  Sorry Ayres, you were great in your day. (We travel a lot).
Manager Response: Dear djafrica,  Thank you for returning to stay with us and taking the time to write a review! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding the service you received from our team and our complimentary breakfast. We strive to provide exceptional experiences and are disappointed we fell short this time. It is with feedback such as this that we can better improve for the future. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for the 5-star experience you are most familiar with.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Great hotel in a very safe clean neighborhood.  Alice and the other workers including housekeeping are very kind and helpful.  Breakfast was great, cooked on-site, not frozen reheated food.  I will be staying here again when I come to visit my daughter attending college nearby.

Spend one night to catch my friends wedding celebrating close to the hotel, I could not sleep whole night on sagging mattress, I still feel pain my back. I don‚Äôt know how is the manager but that‚Äôs a good idea if can go and check the mattress by laying down to feel how would be painful
Manager Response: Dear Parisa F.,  Thank you for your rating and review! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered regarding the comfort of our mattresses. Our goal is to provide the most exceptional experiences, and we are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you this time. Your feedback is appreciated, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved visit soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Room okay.  Found a silverfish crawling in the bathroom.   Quality of food in dining room has gone down   Day we ate breakfast there was no toast, pancakes, oatmeal or bacon. Hash browns were not good.   Breakfast used be be the highlight of our stay at this hotel.   Prices for hotel has increased significantly and quality has gone down.   Have stayed at this hotel many times in the past and have never been disappointed until now
Manager Response: Dear Saundra B.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding our complimentary breakfast and the cleanliness of our guest room. If you are ever experiencing any issues throughout your time with us, please let us know so we can work to get them resolved promptly. Your feedback on our complimentary breakfast is appreciated, as we can use it as a tool to improve for the future. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a 5-star visit soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I was very disapointed.. Satursay 9:00 breakfast, both eggs and potatoes were cold, less than two cups of either were in the steamer trays. sausage patty, there was only one available, and I assume it was also cold. I am handicapped , and when we attempted to leave our room #217 for breakfast, the automatic door opener would not work . Had to call room service for assistance. On check out as we tried to exit the room , again the opener did not work .We forceably were able to get out. The company that provides television service is terrible, picture would scramble or not work at all. Aside from my complaints, I was surprised when I was charged $30.00 early check in. Having just driven 4 hours to get to your hotel, to me was a bit of get more money from the customer. We arrived
Manager Response: Dear Earl F. Cline,  Thank you for staying with us and taking the time to write a review! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you may have encountered regarding our complimentary breakfast and the automatic door opener for our guest room. We strive to provide the most exceptional experiences and are disappointed we did not successfully do that for you. After review, it appears a large group came in for breakfast right before you arrived that morning, and our team tried their best to replenish the food trays as fast as possible.   Additionally, we appreciate you bringing the issue with the automatic door opener to our attention, and would like to assure you that we are working to get it fixed immediately. Your feedback is appreciated as we can use it as a tool to better improve for the future. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us if you are experiencing any billing issues, as I was able to confirm that you were not charged an early check-in fee. We hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Albeit a bit overpriced, this hotel was very clean, it is close to the beach, shopping and many good restaurants. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms could use some remodel and updating. The pool and deck area are very small.  The beds, however, are extremely comfortable. I loved the breakfast! Lots of choices and everything was tasty. I did NOT appreciate dogs in the indoor dining area, since it is "pet friendly". Dogs do not belong around food. Might stay again.

Of the limited hotels in the area this one is probably the best but I never enjoy my stay.  The rooms are dark and dingy and in need of a remodel.  The dark carpet and sticky tile floors are old and dirty.
Manager Response: Dear KAKSanDiego,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! I sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you encountered regarding the comfort of our guest rooms. Although we wish you had an exceptional experience, we appreciate your feedback as we can use it as a tool to better improve for the future. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: My family enjoyed our stay at the ayres hotel. We have been to this location before.  The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly and professional.  We always start our morning in the dining room for the breakfast.  Everything is prepared fresh in an open kitchen,great selection of breads,pastries, muffins.  Eggs, pancakes ,French toast. sausage.  The pool area is a gated area and private from the surrounding area.  There is an outside dining area with comfortable furniture and a fireplace.  You are close to the quaint Seal Beach shops and eateries.  The beach is nearby also.  This hotel is a diamond in the rough. We highly recommend this location to anyone that wants a great hotel.

Summary Heading: I‚Äôll always stay here when in town
Summary: This is the second time in 4 month that my family and I have chosen Ayres Seal Beach to stay in. The rooms are very clean. The breakfast is great. Conveniently located by the 22 /405/605 freeways.  I highly recommend

Worst Experience ever. Your hotel will NEVER receive a dime from me or my family ever. We stood at this hotel because we were part of a wedding party in which the wedding was across the at the Seal Beach country club. My boyfriend called all week to see if you would accommodate an early check in in which we were told over and over to ask when we got there. I arrived earlier as I was part of the wedding and my boyfriend had to work which is why I arrived earlier. I arrive and was assisted by Melody who was rude but did end up saying after I complained that she would see if the cleaning staff could accommodate an earlier check in (all we were asking for was 3pm to be able to get ready on time for the wedding) I had a hair appointment so I left up to the brides room in which while
Manager Response: Dear msrobles45,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay. Although we wish you had an exceptional experience, we appreciate your feedback on the service you received from our team. We strive to provide stellar accommodations and are disappointed that we did not successfully do that for you this time around, as early check-ins are based on availability and cannot be guaranteed. Your insight is appreciated as we can use it as a tool to better improve for the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: As usual:  the staff was efficient and friendly. The facility and room were clean. Very comfortable bed.  Breakfast was not as extensive as in the past (missing fresh fruit).  Check out was quick but the original quoted cost was off 18 cents so rather than have another credit card transaction, paid in coins

Great experience. Everything was amazing. We stayed for my little brother's wedding. The breakfast was complimentary and no complaints there. The staff is super friendly and helpful.  I only stayed one night and that night made me want to stay at other Ayers hotels.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but not friendly for groups!
Summary: Overall, the property was clean and well maintained. Breakfast is good although they need to have more employees in the kitchen - it was a lot for one poor person to do!!!  However, the hotel was very inhospitable for groups.Staff wouldn't allow our group of parents and teens to sit and chat in the lobby and kicked us outside to the patio at 9:30pm. Then the security guard rudely made us leave the outside patio (where we were told to go when kicked out of the lobby) at 10. Quiet hours should not mean that zero interaction among guests can happen. They wouldn't even allow us to use the breakfast room that was otherwise empty. What are groups of people supposed to do if they want to socialize and enjoy each others' company? The next night 6 girls and 5 parents met in one of our

Summary Heading: trip from Oregon to Long Beach
Summary: Very clean rooms, easy to locate the hotel which was a plus for we who are not familiar with the area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We extended our stay and it was handled very well. In all a very pleasant place to stay.

This hotel is the best place to stay at for the location the rooms and the friendly staff and has a great complimentary breakfast. The staff duringthe check in was very knowledgeable and friendly with ease for checking in.....i stay here several time a month....

Due to a flood in our house we had to stay for over 1 week while repairs were being done. From the reservation being made to our stay in a wonderful, clean 2 bed patio suite was flawless. The gentleman at the front desk graciously helped to accommodate our stay with great professionalism and politeness. Highly recommend this quiet, clean, modern hotel.Breakfast is included and Carolyn is so pleasant and friendly .  I have no complaints and look forward to returning very soon for part 2 of our renovations. Thank you to all the staff, you certainly all show great pride in coming to work. Your efforts are greatly appreciated üëç

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay at the Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach CA
Summary: Always enjoyable staying at the Ayres.  Carolyn makes a great breakfast that is plentiful.  Coffee is great too. The rooms are always clean and comfortable and the location is great with easy access to three freeways or a short drive down to the beach.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable with an extremely friendly staff
Summary: Very nice place to stay and extremely friendly and helpful staff. It seems like all the people staying there were friendly as well. Breakfast was great pool and Jacuzzi were awesome! Great central location to the Seal Beach Tennis Club as well as the ocean and the pier and a bunch of restaurants.Definitely recommend it and we will stay there again.

We came in for a family birthday celebration & remembered how much we enjoyed our stay last time.  Rooms were kept clean.  My only complaint is that the bathroom tub should have a grab bar of some sort. Even if you‚Äôre fine, something to hold on to if you slip in tub.  Breakfast was always good & woman there extremely pleasant & welcoming. Wish breakfast was a little longer, til 9:30am. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

The property was clean and very well kept up.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The rooms were very nice and the outside noise was unheard.  The pool and spa were great and towels were in the pool area.

Great customer service. Clean rooms. Lively and decent breakfast. Comfortable bed and pillows. Overall everything done very well which is hard to find in chain hotels. A little pricey in my humble opinion. And could some updating in the lobby and dining/breakfast area.

Summary Heading: Great Home Away from Home - Isolating Over Holidays With Covid
Summary: After our entire family caught covid during a holiday gathering, we could not return to our house where my elderly  mother was staying with us.  So we spent 9 nights at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach.  The room was very comfortable and spacious, and it was very quiet over the new year holiday even with many guests visiting for the Rose Bowl.  We enjoyed great value with the generous hot breakfast daily, and fantastic kitchenette area in the room with larger refrigerator and microwave and space to store and prepare food.  Easy access to Seal Beach, to wonderful playgrounds in Rossmoor neighborhood, and the many restaurants in the area for takeout.  Overall the best home away from home given the circumstances.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: I always have a great stay at Ayers Seal Beach!  Great place, great service!
Summary: Great place and great service!  The welcome greeting by Krystyn at the front desk started of my first stay at the Ayers right! The room was large, clean and comfortable. The gym was open for my morning workout. Next I got great breakfast and service from Carolyn in the breakfast bar. I‚Äôve stayed there every trip since. Great freeway access, convenient location, the beaches are an easy drive and Spaghettini restaurant is across the street.

Actually I hate to tell people about you ! Might get more crowded!! Sorry! This hotel and staff are amazing.  We try to go every year to visit my mother and always same staff and great service from Carolyn and Jose in the dining area! Great place to stay amazing service plus great rooms very clean! Sincerely Joan and John Schlagel

I just stayed two nights at the Ayres for my wedding weekend. Everything from start to finish was great. They helped me block off rooms for my guests, and the booking process was simple & easy. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful when I checked in, congratulating me on my wedding, offering me coffee, and giving us all our information we needed for our two night stay. When we got into our room we were very impressed with the size of the room & cleanliness. The hotel left a bottle of champagne, chocolate, champagne glasses and a sweet hand written note congratulating us on our wedding. We thought that was so sweet! They also texted us throughout our stay to see if we were comfortable and if we needed anything else. Amenities like the gym & jacuzzi we‚Äôre also a great

Front Desk Service Was Horrible, We Stayed Two Days and we had to come back o Lobby 4 times for them to fix our keys, and one of the staff in front desk didn't understand a word we said,  The Security at the Lobby was Super Rude but the Room Service Staff Were great
Manager Response: Dear Soheyl A,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the service you received from our team. We strive to provide the most exceptional experiences and are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved visit sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel‚Ä¶would definitely recommend staying here
Summary: Efficient check in. They gave me a complimentary room upgrade. It was a little noisy at night but my room was close to the elevators. Breakfast options were really good‚Ä¶better than most hotels I‚Äôve stayed at. Would definitely recommend and would stay here again.

Summary Heading: A perfect and very comfortable and clean hotel stay!
Summary: Everything at the hotel was so clean, nice, and perfect for what we were looking for this trip.  My mom's ADA Accessible room was perfect for her, and our king courtyard room not too far from hers was nice to look out and also to walk out and enjoy the beautiful courtyard fireplace and to sit out and have coffee and lunch one day.  Carolyn serving up breakfast in the mornings is friendly and personable and made up eggs how my mom and husband wanted, and couldn't have been nicer.  Thank you, this was our first time staying at an Ayres and it was perfect!

Always a great experience at the Ayers! I always stay here when in the area for business. The breakfast is always good and very friendly personnel.   The hotel has recently been remodeled and in an excellent location.

Good experience.  Quality of room quite satisfactory.  Good value for cost.  Worth a return trip when in the area.  Recommend this hotel, or others in the group, when in Southern California for business or leisure.  High standards for reasonably priced facility.

We have come here a few times, usually for one night stay-cations. Staff is super friendly and responsive. This time we came to enjoy the pool, and though it would be nice if it were heated, it was still great.   The rooms are showing some mild wear & tear, but are comfortable and roomy. We stayed in a Deluxe King Patio Suite, which opened directly to the hotel's large patio where they have pretty lights and lots of tables and chairs. We enjoyed a take-out dinner and their buffet breakfast just outside of our room, which felt very homey and lovely. Our room also had a deep tub, which was appreciated!

Best hotel experience in 2 years!  We greatly enjoyed and appreciated our week‚Äôs stay at Ayres Seal Beach. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Simply the best daily housekeeping we‚Äôve had in a very long time. Special thanks to Carolyn (and her kitchen staff) for treating us so wonderfully. Her hospitality, energy and kindness is contagious and so appreciated. We‚Äôll be back!

Summary Heading: Hope to return for a stay.
Summary: Lovely accommodations. Full breakfast included‚Äîfantastic service (Carolyn)‚ò∫Ô∏è Front desk attendants were also very helpful and professional. Grateful for the complimentary coffee in our suite and in the lobby. Easy access to highway. Close drive to the beach.

I was at this charming, European-style hotel for a business conference recently and had a wonderful experience. The room was spacious and had a privacy wall partially across it that was perfect for my roommate and I. All the staff members with whom I interacted were friendly and helpful, but I especially was impressed by the workers in the dining area. Carolyn greeted me every day and made me feel so welcome. The food was delicious and plentiful. They even accommodated special orders. And the zucchini muffins were to live for, as Carolyn promised they would be. Overall, it was a delightful four days and I can't wait to return again for my next meeting in January.

Summary Heading: Mattresses not great; pullout bed terrible.
Summary: For a hotel that presents itself as high end, the queen mattresses were not great (they felt decades old - those flat-ish kinds; most hotels we stay in have more of a memory foam or hybrid feel to the mattresses) and the pullout bed was nothing short of abominable.  I would not plan on sleeping 4 in these rooms unless you are sure to book a room with **two** queen beds.  The mattress on the pullout was **very** thin and even my kids (ages 8 and 10) found it uncomfortable so I very much doubt that two adults could manage - for sure it would be a horrible night of sleep.  The bed was also not made up for us, even though we had to mark 4 people for that room when we booked it; we had to go to the front desk and request bedding.  The bedding given included a rough, bumpy dark brown

We have stayed at different Ayres hotels a handful of times and have always had a great experience. This time was not different. BUT, we felt compelled to add a comment regarding the extraordinary service we received from one person in particular. Carolyn in the restaurant was phenomenal. I had to inquire if she just started there as sometimes employees ‚Äúlose their spark‚Äù the longer they work at an establishment. But no, she had worked there for quite some time and she was the nicest, most welcoming employee we met (not that the others weren‚Äôt nice). It is obvious she loves her job and it shows to others coming in contact with her. There is nothing more pleasant than having a positive personality welcome you first thing in the morning, it sets your day. Please tell her to keep

Our family loves coming to the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach. It is clean, service is great and we love the wonderful, fresh breakfast every morning.  We especially love Carolyn- the absolutely lovely chef who remembers us every time and greets everyone with the most cheerful way.  We hope she stays forever because breakfast just isn‚Äôt the same without her.

We have stayed at this property in Seal Beach several times over the years. Stayed there last week.  -No one bothered to tell us they don't make up your room every day -Amenities were so so la la...something like a Motel 6 -Didn't even leave a liter bottle of water in the room -Carpet was stained and filthy -A/C was very noisy -Charged a $100 deposit on check in..did not refund it back to the card for 6 days -Breakfast was greasy ..no healthy options but yogurt..no GF for sure
Manager Response: Dear Robert D,  Thank you for returning to stay with us and rating your recent experience! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the cleanliness of our guest room and the noise from the air condition unit. We strive to provide exceptional accommodations for our valued guests and are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. Your feedback on our complimentary breakfast and amenities are greatly appreciated as we can use it as a tool to better improve for the future. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back for a 5-star visit.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Highly advise against stay here! Right on freeway and plumbing and mechanical are very noisy! If you stay here, don‚Äôt expect decent night sleep!!! Other than that stay was OK.   Breakfast was best part.
Manager Response: Dear jsfrantz,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the plumbing and surrounding noise. We strive to provide the most exceptional experiences for our valued guests and are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. If you are ever facing any issues throughout your time with us, please let our team know so we can best assist you in having a satisfactory experience. It would be a pleasure to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a 5-star visit the next time you're in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Carolyn at the breakfast place was fantabulous. She made sure everyone got that they wanted and even with a mask on....she did with a smile just by her voice.  The food was very good and the fact that they had a very nice outside patio.

Summary Heading: Nice property except for advance billing at check in & NO in-room housekeeping during entire stay
Summary: We were greatly surprised by 2 things which we found hard to tolerate: 1.) At check in, our credit card was charged for the entire (3 night) stay and another $100 for incidentals was run on the card; to say that this is unusual is an understatement. Yes, we have always left our credit card on file wherever we are staying, we are baby boomers and experienced travelers, yet we have NEVER been charged for rooms in advance unless we are prepaying regardless of what state or country we are visiting. When I brought this up with the desk manager, I was told that this is the corporate policy of Ayers Hotels. I asked him if the people who stayed in their hotels were notorious for slipping out in the night and he assured me that, no, this was just their policy. 2.) No in-room

Summary Heading: We moved to Oregon 2 years ago and came back to visit our friends. Ayres was so good that we did not want anywhere else.
Summary: Being next to Two Freeway On Ramps is important to us for saving time wasted in traffic, the atmosphere of eating breakfast outside or inside is special. The free  coffee maker in the lobby with flavored coffee mate is a bonus

Summary Heading: Courtyard view? Not what is advertised.
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres for two nights in June. We paid extra for the ‚Äúcourtyard room‚Äù and when we got the the room we were overlooking a parking lot, the pool house (with a big sign that says ‚Äúdanger‚Äù) and the end of the pool. Not exactly the picturesque view we‚Äôd paid extra for. I spoke with the front desk and they acknowledged this and  said ‚Äúyeah, surprisingly enough that‚Äôs the upgraded view.‚Äù We‚Äôd stayed here years ago when we got married and remembered a pretty view overlooking a‚Ä¶ you guessed it‚Ä¶ courtyard. The front desk staff agreed to move us to a higher up floor but it still overlooked the parking lot and pool. They also made it clear that they were ‚Äústealing someone else‚Äôs reserved room‚Äù to change us to the new room.  It cool.   The breakfast was great and the servers

Carolyn brings 5-star hospitality to an otherwise 3-star hotel experience. Check-in, pool, fitness, room amenities are on par with Holiday Inn, but go down to breakfast and you‚Äôll find the most kind, generous, customer-obsessed guest services manager you‚Äôll ever meet. I‚Äôm not sure why she is working at Ayres when she could easily be in a Relais Chateaux resort.

Really enjoyed the hotel room and it's amenities. Quiet peaceful room lots of space in room. Great breakfast, friendly staff, love the courtyard. Very convenient location easy to access from freeway. Have stayed at other Ayers hotels and all have been wonderful

This is a great hotel in a great location!  The hotel is quiet, rooms are clean and beds are comfy.  Can't tell you how the breakfast is because we went out to brunch with family.  The parking is plentiful and there are even fast food restaurants in the same parking lot.

I stayed for 3 weeks. The hotel is clean and the staff is pleasant. The hotel is centrally located to many beach cities and attractions. You have a 10 minute drive to downtown Seal Beach. A 10 minute drive to the Long Beach Airport. You can easily get to downtown Long Beach and the Aquarium.There are many shops and restaurants within walking distance.   The breakfast served at the hotel is great. They have variety of foods that change each day. Carolyn is the cook in the kitchen, her smile and energy was greatly needed in the morning. She will greet you with a big smile and a friendly greeting. She and her staff will take good care of you.

First time staying in this hotel, everyone is so nice & helpful! The Kitchen team Carolyn & her partner for Saturday morning did an amazing job, we walked in to a line & they did awesome serving everyone, very nice people loved the team work and comfort. Definitely will stay here again :)

Summary Heading: My Experience Staying at the Seal Beach Ayres Hotel
Summary: I use this particular hotel for both my stay and also my daughter's stay. The staff and amenities are to my expectations. The building is clean and appropriately decorated with seascape and nautical paintings. I enjoy having breakfast there too.

The team here is great! Carolyn served up a grand breakfast with great hospitality and Adam at the front desk was incredibly helpful. We‚Äôre so happy to be here! The hit breakfast was great, the outdoor patio nice. Very close to great dining spots. Highly recommend!

Always wonderful customer service, great breakfast, kids love the pool. Staff is always happy to help in anyway. Coffee is great. Beds are comfy! So helpful that they have pack n play for toddler. We don‚Äôt stay anywhere else!

Very friendly service, very clean pool, clean room, and they also  have a complimentary computer and coffee setup. The  breakfast is amazing considering the Covid Precautions and regulations, and the layout of the room and lobby is very well oriented and pleasing to the eye. A bit pricy but it is worth it.

Summary Heading: Very exceptional value, a pleasant stay.
Summary: Book direct and enjoy professional assistance from the front desk , made service providers and a hotel well kept, clean and quiet. We will be returning, very pleasant stay. Thank you Ayers for building, maintaining and staffing a hotel the proper way!

wasnt happy with the bed very uncomfortable, for 200 bks a night i  asked for 2 more towels they said i have to go downstairs to get it, haha wrong if i pay that much money for 1 night you can bring it
Manager Response: Dear Susan J,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any discomfort you experienced during your time with us as we strive to provide satisfactory experiences for our valued guests. Your feedback is appreciated as we are always open to hearing ways we can better improve. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the chance to welcome you back for an improved experience!   Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very helpful, pleasant staff.  Room was very clean, and I have high standards.  A little pricey compared to other hotels with similar rooms and amenities, but I appreciated the competent and kind staff and cleanliness of hotel.

Usually when I come breakfast is decent and the cook is very friendly and accommodating. Not today. I came downstairs at 6:10. It was obvious the cook was late to work. Hash browns were being cooked on the flat top and there were none in the tray. Bacon was barely cooked, all flubbery and inedible for me. There was syrup so I asked if there were pancakes. The website shows fluffy pancakes. No pancakes. I asked what then the syrup was for. The cook curtly replied it was for french toast ‚Äúlater on‚Äù. I asked for toast. There was jelly and butter so I figured it was a safe assumption there would be toast. No toast. I wasn‚Äôt offered an alternative so I asked about the butter and jelly. Only then was I curtly told there were english muffins only. I requested one and I received it
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your most recent experience at our complimentary breakfast. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to our offerings and the service received. As you know from previous stays, it is our priority to provide you with a satisfactory breakfast each morning and we are disappointed that on this occasion we have fallen short. Please know that your feedback is appreciated as our team can use it as a tool to ensure that we stay consistent. We look forward to welcoming you again and offering you the 5-star experience you are most familiar with!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have used this hotel for my daughter's stay for years. This time I decided to stay here. Excellent accommodations and service !! Staff very helpful and friendly. The free breakfast feature is a bonus !! I highly recommend The Ayres Hotels !!

The Ayers hotel delivers a great experience in the best location. Great front desk associates , The best housekeeping team. Hot breakfast every day is delicious. The chefs are always cooking to make sure ev is hot and available. ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è

The room was larger than most places. It also well appointed and clean. There was plenty of towels, soap etc. I loved that it had a small fridge and microwave. The black out drapes lived up to their name. I chose this hotel based on the reviews online. Most were rated 10 plus it was close to the hospital where my husband was having surgery. There are plenty restaurants, shopping etc. close by. I have no complaints about the staff or housekeeping. The front desk staffers were all very professional and friendly and very helpful. There was a certain young man who was very accomodating to our needs. I wont say his name but  appreciated all his help. Would I stay here again? Absolutely

Summary Heading: Used to be so much better
Summary: We have been coming here for years, and this last stay had so many problems.  It seemed like they had changed management, or at least some of the important staff members (I heard introductions going on).  First, my dad tried to pay for our room by phone.  He is in a high risk group for COVID.  They really hassled him and told him he had to pay in person!  Finally someone got on the phone with him and "made an exception".  What kind of hotel doesn't just take anyone's credit card over the phone if they want to pay?  Next, their room key system needs to be updated.  We were locked out of our room numbers times (this happened on other recent visits too).  We were told so many times not to put the key by our phones (we've known this for decades) but of course it wasn't us, it was

Summary Heading: THE NUMBER OF TIMES I HAVE BEEN HERE
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 90% of the time when we come down from the HIgh Desert. My daughter and her family live down here. The foliage is very pretty. The rooms are clean. The breakfast is always very good. We just stayed there yesterday for one night> COVID ugh !!! The hotel was enjoyable as always even during this rough time.  The staff here is professional and friendly and are always willing to help.  The location is great as well. Kobe, the restaurant across the street is great , I must also mention there are several restaurants in this location just as good. We had  comfortable bed, a microwave  a small refrigerator  and coffee pot.  Excellent price to stay . We will be back as always. OH YEAH THEY ALLOW PETS.

Summary Heading: Not as good as the first time
Summary: We stayed in the hotel for out first time. We were so pleasantly surprised. We really enjoyed ourselves. The employees very helpful. Wanted to make sure we had what we needed. Services was excellent. But this time.. We up graded to the patio king suite. The bed sheets not clean. It was really late by the time we got back from fishing. So I just grabbed extra blankets and we slept on Top of bedding.  Then as we were getting ready for our beach day noticed the back of the pillows?? Not sure what it was but on back of 2 of them. Only 1 roll of toilet paper, not even a new roll. And enough towels for 1 person. Expected it to be as good as the first, especially with the money it cost us. üòî

Needed so many things and Jerry sorbel was soooooo nice so patient so wanting to make us have all we needed. He is truly an example of what customer service should be. Wish he could train others!! He was alone as well and was so accommodating to us as well as others. This kind of service is what we all would lov!

Amazing breakfast staff. Carolyn was a refreshing and delightful personality in the mornings to get your morning started. Food was also well prepared, fully stocked, fresh. Clean cooking and preparation area.  Spacious and clean rooms with plenty of seating area hotel rooms were super quiet allowing me to sleep in as long as I wanted camera monitored parking All staff members I saw (front desk, kitchen, housekeeping) were using personal protective equipment at every moment throughout my stay.

Working the Covid unit, I had to go under social distancing from my family. So I stayed at the Ayres the first 3 weeks of May room 317. Working 16 hours shifts everyday, I would come "home" to Ayres at night exhausted. I was always greeted with a warm smile and a thank you from Steve and Athena. It was hard enough working the long hours but being away from my family was heartbreaking. But every night I came to Ayres with the warm welcome by Steve and Athena made it easier. My room was always clean. The bed was soo comfortable. I plan on coming back for a staycation with my family when this whole Covid is over so they can experience what I loved so much about staying here. The staff at Ayers is the epitome of good customer service. Kudos to the Ayres staff especially Steve and

Hotel is clean and classy! Customer service is excellent, what a breath of fresh air, most hotels could care less. I wish there were more of these classy hotels around the country. Breakfast was amazing and outdoor space is great

I would definitely stay here again. Nice, clean hotel. Check-in people were very nice. Breakfast was a special treat with our fun conversation with Carslyn whose daughter works with a friend of ours' daughter. Small California! She is an awesome person!
Manager Response: Dear 1me246,   Thank you for your wonderful review and the compliments you have shared regarding our clean accommodations and our complimentary full breakfast. We are thrilled to know you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and look forward to having you as our guest again.   Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Loved this hotel, only negative would be closeness to highway, but this can also be a positive for traveling to all other locations. Hotel was clean and spacious, affordable and served great free breakfast- best I have had with best staff. Caroline in the morning at breakfast was wonderful- very warm, friendly and welcoming..  I highly recommend this hotel. My only regret was not getting in the heated pool.  Bed was extremely comfortable and loved the ease of being able to control room temperature.
Manager Response: Dear LizW12345,  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughtful review! We are delighted to see you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Carolyn is an incredible asset to our team and I'm proud to read that she made you feel welcomed! We hope to welcome you back soon so you can enjoy our heated pool!   Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The breakfast was amazing! Every morning we were greeted by Carslyn with such happiness and enthusiasm. She enjoyed her job and was stellar at it. We had waffles, pancakes, eggs, and bacon everyday made to absolute perfection. It was the best way to start the day!

Great staff, very clean, outstanding breakfast.  The location is easy to get to, and parking is very convenient.  Have stayed multiple times, and it just keeps getting better!  Would suggest to anyone to enjoy the Long Beach Area.

Hotel looks elegant - more like a four star than the three star it officially is. Staff very friendly. Room was quite large and had all the amenities such as fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Bathroom had large marble-style tiles. Hotel is adjacent to a strip mall with Baja Fresh which I ordered and walked back to my room to eat. There was another small food place next door and across the street what looked like an upscale Italian restaurant. The bathtub is a bit small if you take a bath instead of a shower (as I did). Otherwise no complaints and if I ever need to stay in the area I would stay here again. It is right off I-405.

Great place to stay at. Very friendly staff. Everyone is polite and ready to help. Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast is delicious. They send text messages to ensure that everything is as it should.

This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Our accommodations were spacious, comfortable & well appointed. In our 5 night stay, we were always happy to return to the Ayres. The Breakfast was one of the best ever & Carolyn makes it delightful! We‚Äôll definitely be back!!

Carolyn is absolutely amazing. The first morning we went for breakfast, we were greeted with a big smile and a great personality. She is friendly, caring, and makes sure that you‚Äôre getting what you want at breakfast. I have never met someone who was so happy to be there at their job and was willing to go above and beyond to make sure everyone was enjoying their breakfast. We looked forward to seeing her the following morning and we loved chatting with her. Along with the delicious breakfast, she was a fantastic addition to our morning. Whoever comes to stay at the Seal Beach Ayres Hotel will appreciate Carolyn‚Äôs one of a kind personality and nature as well as the delightful breakfast!

Summary Heading: One of my top hotel stays ever!
Summary: Customer service was great. Easy and smooth check in. Rooms were nice, clean, and daily housekeeping was 10 out of 10. I stayed here for a few months for work and working away from home is not something i look forward to but the stay here made it less uneasy. All the staff was great. Always greeted me by first name everytime I walked thru the door. Finally, the best part of my stay was breakfast. The chef Carolyn was nothing short of amazing. not only was the food great her personality was magnetic. She was very sweet, kind, and accommodating. There were days I got caught up with conversation with her I lost track of time in getting to work. Super friendly. Also they serve complimentary freshly baked cookies in the evening i couldnt get enough of. Hope to come back soon.

Great breakfast service. Very nice and has a lot of character. Went over and above to meet my dietary needs.  She made me wheat bread French toast since I can‚Äôt eat white bread. The place is lovely and one of our favorites to stay when visiting out family.

Writing reviews is not something I normally do but I had to make an exception today. Where to start, the hotel is beautifully redone. My room is large and very comfortable. The staff is outstanding! Very friendly and attentive. The evening reception and morning breakfast are both excellent. The sitting area by the pool is so relaxing.  Thank you to all for making my stay so enjoyable. If I have any say on where my hotel is booked on my next business stay, it will most certainly be here at the Ayers.

Rooms are clean, comfortable and roomy.  However, the highlight of our stay was breakfast every morning - not only because it was included in rate, but THE CHEF, CAROLYN, WAS AMAZING!!   I looked forward to seeing her each morning because of her awesome personality!  She is a great chef (homemade French Toast!!) but so much more ‚Äî made us feel like we were special guests at her home.

Summary Heading: Awesome time. the guy who broke the door handle :)
Summary: My family and I went on the a big 7 day family vac and stayed at all the brands of hotels, hiltons, marriotts etc.  They could not hold a candle to the Ayres Hotel, the two staff members i had interacted with the most were Jenna and I want to say his name was Daniel at the front desk.  These two are a awesome pair, I own my own business and look for people just like this so if they are not already these two should be promoted at the very least a big raise.  Not no like 10 cents , I am talking like more zeros before the decimal point.  They were nice to my kids, my mother in law which trust me she is a handful to being with. made my whole family at ease.

We traveled to attend our grand daughter's wedding and stayed for three days, The room was large, clean, comfortable and well appointed. Customer service was excellent from the front counter to the breakfast service staff. This is our second visit to an Ayres Hotel, and our expectations were exceeded on both visits. We will definitely plan on coming back again.

Summary Heading: beautiful hotel AMAZING breakfast courtesy of Carolyn
Summary: I had a wonderful time at the Ayers Seal Beach. The accommodations were beautiful and the lobby was just gorgeous. The absolute best part of the stay was Carolyn, the chef for breakfast.  She was the highlight every morning we were there. She remembered us, our orders, our preferences and our names. I found myself looking forward to seeing her.  Hopefully i will return and get to eat her yummy food and visit with her again.

Summary Heading: Easy to access, super clean, great breakfast
Summary: Great location and easy to access.  Rooms are well appointed and comfortable.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was a great spread.  Getting French toast with boysenberry syrup was a pleasant surprise.  Definitely a great place to stay in the Seal Beach area, access to everything in the are is easy.

Excellent customer service.  We often stay at this property while visiting our children and have never been disappointed.  The beds are very comfortable and rooms spacious.  I only wish that the breakfast hour was extended to 11am.

This time we were at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach for 10 days.  Great service and Carolyn is still cooking up great breakfast.  This is now our home away from home as we transition into our out of state retirement.

My husband's mother lives in Seal Beach, so we have been traveling there for 40 years. Over time, we have stayed in every hotel in town and have found Ayres to be the best. It's rather luxurious with large, comfortable rooms, an attractive courtyard, and rather baronial decor.     Breakfast is terrific with a warm, active dining room ,headed by Carolyn who exudes a welcoming, generous personality. On our latest stay, she prepared a special, portable breakfast plate for a guest using a wheelchair and carried it up to his room, walking with him.  She greeted exuberantly a five-year-old traveling with her mother, admiring the youngster's princess attire, as the girl reveled in the attention. Carolyn also hugged me when she recognized us from our last trip eight months earlier.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel-Seal Beach a great choice to stay!
Summary: We would highly recommend choosing Aryes Seal Beach Hotel.  It is a short distance from LAX and easily accessible from the 405 freeway.  The hotels great location places you a short distance from the beach community. The hotel staff is very professional and welcoming.  The rooms are nicely decorated, clean and comfortable.  They is both good shopping and restaurants close by. They serve an excellent breakfast every morning, that includes freshly made eggs, omelets, bacon, hash brown potatoes, juice, coffee, and pastries. Chefs and breakfast service was a wonderful way to start the day!

Nice, clean and comfortable hotel. Stayed 3 nights for work and had a pleasant stay. It was made a million times better by the generous, freshly prepared breakfast managed by Carolyn. She warmly greeted each guest as if she had known them for years. I really looked forward to my mornings at Ayres thanks to her!

This hotel far exceeded our expectations. Daniel at registration went above and beyond  to be helpful with a little humor which we needed after a long day. The room was spacious, comfortable and spotless. Looking forward to returning to this or any Ayres property.

Several of us were in Seal Beach for an Uncles memorial service.  Staying at the Ayres Hotel was just perfect.  The staff is professional and attentive.  The accommodations were very nice, spacious and comfortable with reasonable rates.  I think of breakfast as pretty much the same everywhere but their breakfast was outstanding and the service was very friendly. I hope we have the opportunity to stay there again.

I have stayed here many times. This is a European style hotel. I usually get a suite as we usually stay a while visiting family. Very close to the highway. Easy on and off the highway. Close to Seal Beach if you want to walk the beach. Close to lots of places to eat. The rooms are fairly large. The breakfast is cooked and very nice. The price point is very fair. I think a great deal for California

I‚Äôve stayed in many hotels over the weeks for business training and this one by far was the best! It wasn‚Äôt the hotel itself that I was pleased with but Carolyn the morning cook is what made the trip so pleasant. She was so extremely sweet and went above and beyond what her job duties were. She definitely deserves a raise. Everyone knows mornings can sometimes be difficult but Carolyn made mornings at the hotel worth getting up for. Thank you so much Carolyn for your amazing omelettes and french toast they will surely be missed and thank you for your sweet hospitality your an amazing women and chef!!

I am so impressed with the staff, amenities and experience offered at the Ayres Seal Beach.  The experience was definitely 5 stars!  Check in was efficient and guest services staff were very friendly (even remembered my name on day 2 - a level of professionalism and pride I rarely see!).  My King room was spacious, very nice decor - complete with leather sofa, table and chairs, desk, comfy bed / linens, large vanity, coffee station and separate shower / water closet.  Toiletries and bath towels are good quality.  And there is a safe in the room for valuables.  Plenty of complimentary parking.  The hotel is located on the south side of the intersection of the 405 freeway and Seal Beach Blvd.  Walking distance to several great restaurants.  A pharmacy and additional shopping are a

Summary Heading: Customer Service is alive and well at this hotel
Summary: Everyone on staff from reservations, to the front desk, to hospitality with breakfast exemplified the lost art of giving customer service to a guest.  Entire staff went above and beyond at every level to make my stay and that of my group enjoyable. I feel like I have new friends in Kat, Lauren, Catherine and Sally. Great job and a beautiful hotel too.
Manager Response: Dear Virginia Retiree,  Thank you for your wonderful compliments to our team! We work hard to ensure each guest is happy and satisfied throughout their stay and I am happy to see we achieved this for you. Thank you for your fantastic review and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: My Husband And I Came Back To The Ayres Seal Beach Hotel.  Our First Visit Was Last Year For Our Honeymoon. We Came Back this Weekend For a mini getaway. The Ayres Seal Beach Hotel is modern, very clean both inside and out. Their Front Desk Associates are so welcoming and very professional.  (Adam checked us in yesterday,he is very pleasant and helpful.) This morning we went to breakfast at 6AM. Carolyn (THE CHEF) was so friendly and very courteous.  And as always..breakfast was delicious!.. Pancakes, fresh scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage.. bagels, fruit etc. This is why we only come to the Ayres. We did try the Hampton last June.. Nothing Compared to the Ayres.   We also appreciate the * Free Parking *King size bed is very comfortable and very clean.  The Ayres Will Stay
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review. Adam and Carolyn are incredible assets to our team and I'm proud to read that they made your stay that much more memorable. We hope to welcome you back for another getaway soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Every thing at this hotel was FANTASTIC!! Especially Lauren!! All shopping and restaurants were convenient and easy to find! Easy to locate and easy to get on and off the Freeway! All recommendations by Laruen was spot on!
Manager Response: Dear Sherry S.,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a kind rating and review. We are happy to know that you appreciated our accommodations and convenient locations. Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our team and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: I am OCD when it comes to hotels. I bring my own disinfectant wipes and wipe down everything before we unpack anything. I check mattresses and luggage stands for bed bugs. I wear flip flops in the shower. I always read all the reviews on a hotel before looking at price. After reading the reviews on the Ayers Seal Beach location we decided to go ahead and book a room. We were, and still are, highly impressed with this hotel. From the first call to the last goodbye at check out, we received prompt, professional, curtious, and helpful customer service.  Not just from one employee, but all of them we encountered. Cleanliness was beyond what I expected and I was almost tempted not to bother wiping things down.  I could have, but I did say I was OCD about it. The room was comfortably
Manager Response: Dear Janice G.,  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughtful review with us! We are happy to have a friendly and helpful team. I am so thrilled to know that you found our hotel to be spotless and comfortable. Our peaceful courtyard truly makes mornings that much more enjoyable, along with the exceptional service our chef Carolyn is known for. I'm proud to read that she made your stay that much more memorable. Thank you for noticing the small details. We appreciate your fantastic review and hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel and great little town!
Summary: The Ayres Seal Beach is a charming and lovely hotel with great access to the freeway for getting to other destinations and downtown Seal Beach was so charming, a true hidden gem.  Staff was topnotch! The Breakfast was so delicious and Carolyn the Chef is a top notch employee!! Made everyone feel so welcome and taken care of.

I've stayed at the Ayres Seal Beach on three separate occasions. Each experience better than the last.  The staff are all very professional and well-trained, it's always a pleasure to speak with them at the hotel on this and previous stays. They are also quite good at helping with booking issues, as I found on my most recent stay where my travel agency messed up my booking and booked the wrong Ayres hotel in the area. They are total lifesavers and great at what they do!  The amenities are all kept in tip-top shape and I've never had any issue with my rooms. The beds are comfortable, the sheets soft, and the rooms are spacious. The ambiance throughout the hotel is classy and comfortable without feeling too posh. Just the right balance for a relaxing stay outside of my work hours.

I can not say enough about this hotel. We have never stayed in Seal Beach, and now it will be our get-a-way spot!! Our sister had a wedding in Huntington Beach. This location was 15 minutes away from Huntington Beach, Long Beach, and Anaheim!! This hotel was across the street from nice restaurants, and walking distance to shopping centers and fast food!! The breakfast here was FREE !! Not only was it free it was soooooo good! Carolyn took care of us the entire week! We felt extra special all week.  Carolyn cooked the bacon in the oven..not microwave,  but an oven!! This was not commercial food, we saw her make our food!! The French Toast was more than I could image!! Carolyn made us feel like family!! Daniel at the front desk is the best person you want at your place of

Summary Heading: Customer Service and Property are AMAZING
Summary: The property is well kept in a great location.  The staff are excellent always willing to go the extra mile.  Jerry at the front desk goes beyond 5 stars in providing excellent customer service.  The breakfast cook Carolyn is amazingly cordial making sure you get everything you want for a superior breakfast.  She is ALWAYS cheerful and sweet to ensure a great experience for guests.

Charming, convenient, classy and quiet.  Probably the best free breakfast in all of Long Beach.  The beds are so comfortable that the moment you land on them, you are out cold.  Although the hotel is right off the freeway, you cannot hear anything at all of it.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I recommend this place to everyone.

I enjoy staying at the Ayers Seal Beach hotel anytime I‚Äôm in the area for business.  Easy to get to from LAX and centrally located to several small town beautiful beachside communities, it‚Äôs very convenient.  A very well kept hotel, with updated rooms and a classic European details and artwork throughout, it almost feels like staying at an Italian villa.  The courtyard is especially nice to enjoy breakfast in the morning, and relax at night by the pool and hot tub.  Speaking of breakfast, I can‚Äôt say enough about how amazing it is.  The food is fresh and there‚Äôs a great selection, but it‚Äôs really the chef and her staff, whose hearts and helping hands make it special.  Chef Carolyn always has a smile, hearty laughs, and kind words for her guests.  She makes you feel like family

Summary Heading: Another great stay at Ayres Seal Beach
Summary: Ayres Seal Beach has become our ‚Äògo to‚Äô hotel for convenience and all around great service in North Orange County.  We were initially pleased to get such a great value in our ideal location (freeway & beach convenience near restaurants and shops) with breakfast & free parking; however, we were pleasantly surprised with how spacious and comfortable the rooms are with a mini kitchen and many added luxuries.  A special shout out to the gal who runs the incredible full breakfast service who never fails to greet every guest enthusiastically and goes above and beyond to give everyone exceptional service!  This property is a hidden gem in the OC beach cities and ticks all the boxes; great for families and business travelers alike.

Aryes Seal Beach is a great property! I can depend on a great clean room and also friendly service. Their free breakfast is the best that I have ever experienced. I recommend this hotel to everyone. It's a hidden gem.
Manager Response: Dear Patrice C.,  Thank you for your lovely rating and review of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am delighted to know that you were able to enjoy our complimentary full American breakfast and will recommend our hotel to your friends and family. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Friendly Staff, quiet rooms, great courtesy breakfast, managers's reception, charging station for electric vehicles, excellent accomidations for persons with disabilities, and excellent stores and restaurants within walking distance!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for visiting Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the exceptional service from our team, as well as our full American breakfast, great amenities, and convenient locations. We look forward to welcoming you back to ours or to any of our sister properties throughout southern California.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Carolyn's vibrant spirit and personality was a gift in the morning!
Summary: I was in absolute awww the way Carolyn worked the the dining room. First off her bubbly personality was such a pleasant way to start the morning. She had a REALLY BUSY day (9/1/19) during my stay and the way she handled keeping the trays full, hearing everyone's needs (even when they were not talking directly to her) and addressing them, she was all over the room making things happen and making sure everyone was happy, and still maintaining her bright light and laughter, words can not describe how amazing she was/is.Her presence is my most memorable moment for the hotel!.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughtful review with us! Carolyn is an incredible asset to our team, and I'm proud to read that she made your stay that much more memorable. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Chef Carolyn‚Äôs spread was soo yummy, and what a sweetheart. She was so friendly. Best hotel breakfast ever! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Seal Beach. üëèüèæüëèüèæüëèüèæüëèüèæ

Summary Heading: For the value here it has been our choice for the last 4 years.  A real top of the line hotel.
Summary: As usual the service, friendliness, cleanliness and everything about the Aryes was just fantastic.  The front desk personnel are so helpful with any needs you may have.  Jerry Sorbel who we know for years at the front desk made sure our room was near the elevator because of the problem I have with my knees.  They have a breakfast every day that is definitely over the top and the chef Carolyn was just exceptional.  The maid service and overall cleanliness of the hotel is over the top.

Staff is very attentive.  Our room, 321, was next to the freeway side of the hotel but it was still very quiet.  You can also see your car if you park on that side.  There is an Enterprise Car Rental site at the hotel which makes renting a car so convenient.  Price for hotel room is the same for the crummy Best Western in Los Alamitos.  Why not stay in a much nicer place?
Manager Response: Dear Jerry S.,  Thank you for your fantastic review! I am pleased to know you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Thank you for your wonderful compliments to our hotel and exceptional service. We look forward to having you as our guest again in the future.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Carolyn is the Heart Beat of this Hotel!
Summary: Talk about amazing energy from this woman and everyone that comes in contact with her!  You can‚Äôt help but walk into breakfast and see her big smile and her giving huge hugs and compliments to everyone around her!   What a gift of love this woman has and such a pleasure to see it being shared with others!   Thank you Carolyn for making a difference in our lives!         Juli & Suzan

We decided to stay in Seal Beach. We had spent time there before and really enjoyed the Seal Beach local activities. Our stay at the Ayres Hotel was exceptional. Clean and the staff is professional. Bed was firm but comfortable woke up refreshed instead of the regular roll out with lower back pain. We will definitely stay there again.

THIS HOTEL.IA PERFECT WITH ALL THIER MODERN.AMINITIES AND THEIR GREAT SERvices.I usualy stay in.this hotel and i have never imagined to any hotel to stay.I Serve here for a near by company.thank you so.much for the wonderful hospitality

Arrived at 2:30 but room was not ready until 4:00 pm.  AC in room was extremely loud and noisy.  Reported problem but nothing was done.  Choice was hot or noisy room.  Sunday breakfast was much worse than Saturdays most things were over cooked.  Saturday chef should train rest of staff.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  I sincerely apologize that your visit fell short of your expectations. The challenges you describe don't reflect the exceptional service and accommodations we aim to provide for each of our guests and I'm disappointed that we missed the mark for you. I have taken this opportunity to discuss your concerns with our team members. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a much-improved visit.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: This is a great place to stay.  Perfect front desk service - seamless check in with friendly approachable staff.  We will definitely be back next time we‚Äôre in town. üëç Carolyn the chef is a star, she makes everybody welcome. The whole breakfast experience is phenomenal.   Her french toast is out of this world - thanks again Carolyn. üòò I‚Äôm sure that everyone at Ayres knows what a diamond they have on their staff. üëç
Manager Response: Dear Seaden,  Thank you for your wonderful review and compliments to our accommodations and team! Carolyn is an incredible asset to our team and we are thrilled to know that you enjoyed your stay - from the seamless check-in process, to our delicious complimentary breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back to ours or to any of our sister properties throughout southern California.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Easy check-in process, all amenities needed, pool and jacuzzi were great (very clean) and great included "hot" morning breakfast! I will use this venue again as it was near the Spaghettini Jazz club where I was attending a late evening event.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are pleased to see that we were able to accommodate you during your visit to the area. It is a delight to know that you also had the opportunity to enjoy our delicious breakfast. We are pleased to know that you enjoyed the amenities we have to offer and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Carolyn, the Chef at Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach is a super star.  This woman is a dynamo.  Her french toast is out of this world and she is so friendly and outgoing. I hope the Ayres knows how lucky they are to have her on their staff!

Summary Heading: I‚Äôm impressed AYRES HOTEL! Carolyn thank you!
Summary: Thins entire trip has been wonderful!  The hotel is just lovely, and something out of little Italy, in my opinion.  The rooms are quite large and everything from the garden with lights, to the pool and fireplace seating area, was a favorite.  BUT #1 in or book was the PHENOMENAL CUSTOMER SERVICE, especially from the BEST CHEF ever, CAROLYN!   Every morning we would go down and enjoy the wonderful free continental breakfast, which was beyond any free breakfast we had ever experienced.  It was such an amazing variety and selection, and THE FOOD, DELICIOUS! Carolyn‚Äôs french toast and pancakes were something to write home about, and her secret magic that I‚Äôm convinced she used on my over easy eggs...are something I won‚Äôt forget. I know, I know, they are eggs, you can‚Äôt mess them

Summary Heading: The best stay of our trip
Summary: The staff and condition of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach is superb.  Everyone is courteous and helpful.  The breakfast is a real treat.  Every breakfast item you could want and served with such a pleasant staff.   Thank you Ayres Hotel for making our stay perfect!
Manager Response: Dear Alberta M.,  Thank you for visiting Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I'm glad to read that you found our team to be pleasant and helpful and that you had the opportunity to enjoy our delicious hot breakfast. We appreciate your thoughtful feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfy, Cozy with a Friendly Staff
Summary: I enjoyed my two night stay at the Ayres Hotel. The staff was friendly and outgoing. The continental breakfast was out of this world. The chef at breakfast was a star. She should have her own TV show.

Summary Heading: Friendly! Convenient! The most awesome breakfast selection I have seen! Clean!
Summary: My daughter and I needed a hotel convenient to CSULB and this fit the bill! It is located right off the 405. The hotel is lovely. There are restaurants nearby. The staff is so friendly! Breakfast was included and it had just about everything one could imagine! Pancakes, French Toast, Scrambled Eggs, Hash browns, Sausage, Bacon, muffins, pastries, yogurts, juices, cereals, bagels, fruit, and a wonderful chef!  The room was clean. Beds were comfortable. There was a frig and microwave as well as a single cup coffee maker. The bathtub was the cleanest I have seen in a hotel.   Each and every staff member was friendly, polite and helpful!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for sharing your thoughtful review with us! We know that there are many factors that go into creating a lovely visit, and we are so happy to know that you appreciated our friendly team, our beautiful accommodations, comfortable beds, delicious breakfast options, and convenient location. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely property, nice amenities, generous breakfast
Summary: I travel to this area about six times a year on business.  This was my first stay at this hotel and I will return.  The room was generously sized, comfortably furnished, with a large bathroom, fridge & microwave.  The closet was also large and included a safe.  A/C worked very well (happened to be a hot spell on this trip.)  The breakfast includes  a substantial hot breakfast along with the usual continental offerings.  Public spaces are also very nice, including the exercise room and outdoor seating.  The location is convenient if you are traveling by car as it is right off the freeway.  If you want a centrally located hotel with a walkable neighborhood this is not your property.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review. I'm so glad that your business travels brought you to Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! We are thrilled to know that you enjoyed our premium amenities, from our delicious full hot breakfast to our fitness center. We look forward to the opportunity to welcome you again the next time that your travels bring you to Seal Beach.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We are never disappointed at the Ayres Seal Beach. We are welcomed like family each time. We get a good night's sleep. The courtyard is our favorite place to relax with a glass of wine and pretend we are in Europe. Even in the breakfast dining room we feel like lingering because of the cheerful atmosphere.

Summary Heading: Family beach and Universal Studios vacation
Summary: We go on a family vacation each year and the Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach is by far the best! The staff here is exceptionally friendly - Carolyn in the kitchen and Daniel at the front desk really stood out for us. They were always helpful, professional, and willing to assist us with anything we needed. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Great staff that was always friendly, and really helpful!! The French toast Chef Carolyn made in the mornings was so very delicious and hot the the griddle!! How she was so efficient and happy so early was fun to watch!! Great place!!

The hotel was really nice but the real gem to this stay was the breakfast chef Carolyn! My family could not wait to get to breakfast each morning. She was always fun, kind, and happy. It put a smile on our face each day to start our day off right. Ayres should never let her go!

Great place to stay! Very nice breakfast. Room was updated and very clean. Staff is friendly and helpful. It is close to nearby restaurants. Easy access to a freeway. Great place to stay for a business trip.

Exceptionally clean throughout hotel!!! Friendly, attentive, well groomed and uniformed hotel staff. Amazing and generous breakfast spread. Some sister hotels are very limited and don‚Äôt allow seconds. Thumbs up for NOT having a ‚Äúdo it yourself pancake maker.‚Äù Much better having freshly made pancakes off the sizzling griddle and served with a smile.

Summary Heading: Good if you have business close by
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach is a nice property that's convenient if you have business nearby (such as the Ranch complex across the street) but perhaps a bit out of the way if you're more interested in the pier or the beach.
