Manager Response: Dear Gerald781,  Thank you for frequenting Ayres Hotels! We are delighted to know that you enjoy your time with us and hope we have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Ayres Hotel Seal Beach soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: From check-in to check-out, I was made to feel very welcome and appreciated as a valued guest at this outstanding establishment. The entrance/lobby/lounge area of this magnificent 3-story property is warm (in appeal, not temperature), inviting, and as comfortable as one might find in a rather lovely living room of someone's home. The staff at reception were friendly, efficient and courteous throughout my 4-day stay.  The second-floor, double-queen room I checked into was spacious as well as delightfully fresh and clean, with a lovely view of the courtyard, swimming pool, and hot tub area. It included a microwave oven, coffee maker, hairdryer, in-room safe, 42-inch flat-screen television, clock radio, and a large-sized mini-fridge. Also, there was a desk and swivel chair along
Manager Response: Dear MarkAnthony1969,  We are delighted to see that you have thoroughly enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We truly appreciate that you took the time to write such a detailed and kind review of our amenities and exceptional team members. It is great knowing that we were able to provide you with a comfortable and relaxing stay. We truly look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at the Seal Beach Ayres on a number of occasions.  The service is always top-notch, and the hotel itself is clean and quiet.  I like that there are numerous restaurants within very close proximity, and access to the 405 freeway couldn't be easier.  The only negative I have is, and this is just my personal preference, that the hotel has redecorated the rooms from what I thought was a lovely, warm Victorian feel to a green and blue motif reminiscent of the 60s that I found cold and somewhat tacky.  The reception area and hallways still have the old d√©cor, so that is nice, but in complete contrast to the guest rooms - odd!  Even so, the stay was very pleasant and comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear TalulahBelle,  Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review of our hotel. Your feedback is truly appreciated. I am happy to see that all of your experiences with us have been pleasant and that our location is suitable to your needs. We look forward to seeing you again!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: My 26 year old and I stayed here 9/30/17 & 10/1/17 because my niece was getting married across the street from this hotel and we loved everything about this hotel stay. The location and staff were worth the dollars we spent. We would love the chance to do it again and for a longer time. To us this was luxury as we can't afford this any other time since the wedding was going to happen. Thank you all that were at the hotel during these days. I was nice to have the privilege!
Manager Response: Dear Loralee E,  We are delighted to see that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to write such a heartfelt review. We truly do hope you will be able to stay with us in the near future as we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: A GOOD TIME WAS HAD BY ALL
Summary: A  group of seniors on a group trip, while the apt. was being termite exterminated, had a great time in a lovely hotel with an excellent staff.  It's hard to please a bunch of old people, but the Ayres hotel did it.  Thanks!!!

I stay here when I come to Southern Calif  for business. Rooms are great, hotel is quiet , excellent breakfast every time. Staff extremely helpful, and best of all it is a lovely hotel. Very convenient just off the 405.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel stay for one night
Summary: Everything was very nice.  The staff was friendly.  The breakfast was very good. The room was large and open. The beds and pillows were comfortable. There was ample parking. Our only complaint was the noise of the AC unit.

The staff is very friendly, the hotel is nice and clean. Rooms are very clean. Breakfast was delicious. Will definitely stay again. Check in and check out was very quick. Parking is a little tight but otherwise everything was great.

Easy location to get around town. The beaches are close by, within 10 minutes.The real breakfast was a bonus. I would highly recommend the staff and the clean rooms. Free parking. I would stay here again

Well appointed quiet room, very friendly staff and good breakfast. Recently reduced size of coffee cups! Keep facility temperature to low for me despite hot days while there. Location very convenient. Easy parking!  The price is reasonable for the location. Highly recommend.

The room was simply perfect! Bed was comfortable, room was clean and had a perfect layout, location was perfect for what we needed.  AC was a little bit loud, every time it started, it sounded like a sonic boom.  The best part of our stay was the breakfast, it made us feel like home.  Definitely we'll come back with our family.

The room was nice/clean with plenty of room to move about. I especially appreciate the drapes cancelling out the early morning sun so I could sleep in.  The complimentary breakfast was nice with many choices to satisfy everyone‚Äôs morning cravings.

Summary Heading: Strategically located hotel with excellent rooms
Summary: Room and premises were excellent, clean and spacious. Not as 'old' as it looks; it's just the European theme of the hotel. Wifi strength was poor and erratic in my room but strong in the lobby area. Nearby the Rossmoor mall area which is within 5-10 minutes walking distance with food, Target, Toys 'R' Us (if still not bankrupt yet) and other shops - great if you don't intend to drive every day. If you do drive, the hotel is just next to the freeway entrance/exit. Also a few minutes' drive to Seal Beach and Huntington Beach which has great atmosphere and food.

Summary Heading: We ONLY stay at Ayres Hotels when in So CA
Summary: Ayres Hotels are top notch, class AAA We only stay at Ayres Hotels when we travel to Southern CA. Ayres Fountain Valley and Ayres Orange are our favorites. We will never again stay at Ayres Anaheim, it's old and stinky and dirty.

We travel throughout the US both on business and pleasure. When in Orange County we always choose the Seal Beach Ayres. This time we were particularly impressed with the great free breakfast and the wonderful service provided by the chef. The breakfast selections on the steam table seem to be freshly made and not dried out as is often the case in other hotels. The French toast was particularly delicious and on a par with the best restaurants. Unlike other hotels with standard free breakfast fare, the chef cheerfully prepares eggs to order, fresh pancakes and he makes sure the items on the steam table are cooked in small batches to ensure freshness. In all, our stay was outstanding and the only regret was that we couldn't stay much longer.

Summary Heading: The stay was great but there were some problems
Summary: The Wi-Fi in the room was absolutely horrible and there were only two HBO channels and only 1 worked.  The front desk people were fantastic, clean rooms and a good breakfast. The pool area was very nice and the patio with the fireplace was very clean and done well.

Our favorite place to stay when visiting the west coast.  Pleasant staff, clean rooms, lovely decor, fantastic breakfast and a nice cocktail hour to begin the evenings.  Always looking forward to our next return.

Our children's families live in Long Beach and we frequently visit from our home in New Mexico.  We always stay at the Seal Beach Ayres where we are treated like VIPs.  Their recent refurbishments are wondeful and we plan continue to plan to stay here whenever we're in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Lee C,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your review! It is delightful to know that each of your stays with us has been more pleasant than the last. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed our recent renovations and look forward to continuing to serve you and yours for years to come!  Sincerely,  Steven A de Lugo General Manager

Summary: I just returned form a two night stay at Ayres, Seal Beach.  The hotel is easy to get to and the decor is very warm and welcoming.  For the most part i found the stay to be pleasant the room was large and well appointed, the grounds were very nice.  Upon arrival it took a good 10 minutes for the staff that was chatting in the back room to notice I was at the counter as there is no bell and they were in an office behind a wall so could not hear me when I called out.  This also happened at check out so I ended up just leaving my keys on the counter as the women in the  front office was very engrossed in what she was doing and didn't see or hear me.  I was happy to see that they have a water saving policy but was disappointed that even though I hung my towels and indicated my bed

Good Evening,  We enjoy our stay in the remodeled room we were assigned. The staff was very helpful and may out stay a pleasant one. Unfortunately, some of the guests decided not to return the luggage carts. Nothing the staff could do about that. Great place to stay and we will be back.   Regards,  Adrian & Astella Frisco

Summary Heading: Newly renovated rooms are very comfortable
Summary: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Our room was recently renovated and was clean, comfortable, and bright. We liked the updated greige walls, new lighting fixtures, and new furniture. It felt like a new hotel once we were in our room. The elevators are still covered in plywood to protect their walls during the renovation. I was told that a few rooms were still being worked on.   I have always paid to have a courtyard facing room to help us get a quieter night's sleep. It turns out that I didn't need to. I didn't upgrade this time and was disappointed when we were not able to when we arrived. The front desk staff person told me that the windows were all triple pained and that all of the rooms should be very quiet. She was right. Our window faced
Manager Response: Dear stephp,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with this review and for your detailed feedback following your stay. We are happy to see that you enjoyed our recent renovations to our hotel! We would also like to thank you for your insight on our complimentary breakfast and we will direct this suggestion to the proper department. Thank you again and we look forward to your next stay with us!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Our one night stay at Ayres Hotel on Seal Beach was very enjoyable.  While it isn't exactly "coastal" Orange County it is conveniently located.  The renovations are lovely. Our room was beautifully decorated and our sleep was fabulous - not a sound from anywhere! Check in and check out were easy and painless.  We will definitely stay there again!

Kudos to the entire staff and management of the Seal Beach Ayres Hotel. This was my first stay at an Ayres Hotel. My team was on business travel and had to hit the ground running and work long hours. The stay was perfect; clean/pleasant/sylish rooms, nice bathroom with great shower, good breakfast choices.  The evening wine and cheese events were also very enjoyable. The staff was pleasant and went the extra mile with little extras that are very much appreciated by those traveling on business extensively.  The only area with room for improvement-need to have real cream for the coffee vs. the artificial creamer. Doesn't sound like much unless you are running on coffee and pure adrenaline!  Thanks again; would definitely recommend to others and stay at an Ayres again.

I stayed here for 1 night with the family and all went well.  The hotel is clean and conveniently located near the freeway and a lot of eateries.  We had a quiet room I the first floor. Good value.  The morning breakfast was a nice treat.  Waffles and pancakes were good.

Friendly staff, warm, welcoming and clean hotel.  The room is very nice and comfortable.  Waking up to breakfast is such a perk!  The location is perfect and right in the middle of LA/Orange County.  We will come back every-time!  Thank you Ayres hotel!!!
Manager Response: Dear 214isabellek,  Thank you for your review and your kind compliments on our service. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We were looking somewhere relaxing to stay near to the beach and we truly enjoyed with our stay, specially breakfast which was included in our booking, was perfect, thank you. Keep the good job fir more reservations.
Manager Response: Dear asmik427,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us with this review. We are pleased to see that you found our exceptional accommodations and optimal location to your satisfaction. We certainly hope you visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: The people who work there are great. Really friendly and helpful. I was disappointed in the room. I booked a courtyard king size room. When u look at the photos it looks like you have French doors and access to the courtyard but we had no view of a courtyard and a window that only opened 3".   I was expecting a better room for the money.

Overall the place is very nice.  No complaints, the staff was very friendly, a little unorganized as they were training some new staff members.  There was so construction going on in both elevators.  The pool is small. But, overall it was a great time for my class. The dining room staff was very friendly and took care of us pretty well.  They have a nice Spa/gym room.

It was nowhere near the beach, even though the website is made to sound as if it is.  It is right on the highway.  That's nice for convenience but you can hear the highway from the room.  Otherwise, it is really a pretty hotel with every amenity.

Summary Heading: Everything was great except don't expect to eat! The Cook was terrible!
Summary: We are Painting and General Contractors Nu Coat Painting and Construction that works through out the State. Really like the Hotel being one of my new favorite because its well managed and extremely clean . We were there 8/12/17 I always enjoy the full American Breakfast served as Buffet (all you can eat)  between 6:00am and 10:00am normally severed in abundance.  But this last Saturday I went to Breakfast at 8:45 No Food? then Waiting for food to get put out a small Women Making the Hash Browns (Not her Job) and getting everything else out at the same time!!!!! The Cook was Lazily making small amounts of food so Guests empty Warming Pans so People would get scraps of whatever the Cook would decide to make! He took a LARGE BOX of Bacon and was taking 4 strips at a time we never

Booked through booking.com and was placed in a room with a view of the dumpster (141) Large room with old-fashioned furnishings. Comfortable bed. Air conditioning powerful. Low light in toilet room. Good full breakfast included. Front office staff pleasant, efficient but couldn't provide useful local information. We came in for one night to attend a funeral and when local organizer said I should have been given the group rate, the desk clerk said I already had a discounted rate.

Large, comfortable room. Appreciated the fridge and microwave. Clean and convenient with helpful staff. Decor is old fashioned but in good condition. Laundry room could have been swept /vacuumed more frequently. Breakfast was fine.
Manager Response: Dear Brenda D,  I am delighted to see that you had such a wonderful stay with us! Thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review. We look forward to your next visit to our property.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: I told the person I talked to on phone there was someone staying on the sofa bed. When we OPENED it out ourselves at midnight....and it was heavy for two old ladies there was NO bedding. No one at desk at midnight on Sat. night but called 0 anyway and some blackguy came up and handed us the sheets and blanket.  We had to make it up. The girl at desk Sunday morning...all she said was sorry.  No partial refund and kinda snooty.  I didn't ask for one but you could have done more than "sorry" in her accent that was hard to understand.  Breakfast was great

Very friend, professional staff. Breakfast and Wi-Fi included in room rate. Lovely property in very easy to access location. My room was large, bed was really comfortable and room was quiet. I would certainly recommend this hotel

New updates to the rooms are nice. Great easy location to Seal Beach and many other areas off the 4005 or 605. Kids always enjoy the pool and hot tub.  Breakfast included is average, and overall friendliness of staff is average.

The room was clean, the bed was comfortable. My 3rd stay at this hotel.  The breakfast is great!!!! The new chef you hired very professional and very kind! I went to the dining room at 8:45 and no eggs, the chef asked if I would like some eggs & he made scrambled eggs!  It was very appreciated! Great person!

Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great. We were able to visit and enjoy without feeling like we were rushed out. The hotel was right around the corner from out venue for the reunion. The only complaint is that if you want to enter the front entry area you have to be going east on the street, because if you are going the other way you have to go further past the entrance to make uturn to get into the entrance.

We were visiting on a college tour for our daughter. It's the 2nd time we've stayed here and it's a great choice. The location is easy to get to, quiet, spacious, clean, comfortable, friendly and helpful staff, nice courtyard where you can enjoy a full breakfast buffet, close to good restaurants and quaint Seal Beach. We are staying here again in a couple weeks to move our daughter down here for college. Recommended by the university and they give a generous discount as well.

We enjoyed our stay immensely. The breakfast was hot and fresh, the staff was courteous, the rooms were clean. Very impressive!  We were in town for a softball tournament. We would stay there again. Thanks!

Stayed here 1 night to attend a show at Spaghettini Restaurant across the street.  Arrived early about noon on a Friday.  Received a friendly greeting and luckily, our room was ready.  Asked the front desk for lunch recommendations and was directed to Main Street where there is a wide variety of food choices in a lively beach town atmosphere.  Room was large, comfy king sized bed and included small refrigerator.  Hotel undergoing renovations but we weren't disturbed or inconvenienced in any way.  Did not have the opportunity to take advantage of the complimentary breakfast included with our room.
Manager Response: Dear Lee C,  Thank you for providing us with a great review following your stay! We are delighted to see that you had such an enjoyable experience and that our team was able to provide you with a pleasant experience. We hope to have you as our guest again soon so that you may enjoy our renovations.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Family vacation. First off...if you can visit Seal Beach Town...you have to. It's BEAUTIFUL! We stayed at this hotel, and I'll be honest, when I first walked in, I had a "creepy" feeling, simply because the decor is so old-fashioned (not OLD, just old-fashioned--it's "the look" I think they are going for). My hubby loved it right away, as he likes the feel of places like this...says it has "character".  But as we settled in, I started to like this place more and more. Rooms are very large, we easily fit 2 adults and 2 kids into a King room with sofa bed. Has a little fridge and kitchen type sink as well. Bathroom is nice, new tile, very clean. Shower/bath supplies are a little scant, tiny bottles, but we did have 4 people. They are happy to give you more if you ask. Breakfast is

Ayers Hotel Seal Beach is a lovely hotel. Remodeling as we were there but didn't distract or annoy during our visit. Staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. Accommodations clean and comfortable. Full Breakfast was delicious and a great way to start a sightseeing day. I try to stay in an Ayers when traveling and certainly will stay at this property again!

Summary Heading: Perfect for Relatives of Leisure World Residents
Summary: The proximity to Leisure World makes it the perfect place for relatives to stay.  The accommodations were great and the breakfast was fantastic!  The front desk people made checking in so easy. Will definitely have relatives stay there again.

This is our 6th visit to the Ayres in Long Beach.  The property is well situated for visiting Long Beach, Seal Beach, LA and Orange County.  It is currently (July 2017) nearing the end of a major refurbishment and guests are all accommodated in the newly updated rooms which are quite nice.  The staff is both pleasant and helpful.  The complimentary breakfast goes way beyond fruit and muffins with eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, yogurt, etc. Dry cleaning services are available and there is a washing machines and clothes dryer available for guests to use.  We have tried other hotels but this is by far our favorite place to stay when we visit the area.

Ayers Hotel is located on the west side of the 405 with easy access and parking. Loved the building in general, our room was comfortable and quiet, and staff was a pleasure to work with. There are a couple of eateries in walking distance. Breakfast was served in a pleasant setting, no cramped quarters here. I would recommend Ayers Hotel to anyone based on my recent experience.

We headed to Long Beach to see a play and didn't want to drive home that night.  I searched the area for hotels and this one popped up relatively close to the playhouse.  I've stayed at Ayres properties in the past, and have never been let down.  Even though this one is being remodeled, it was not an inconvenience at all and the hotel was up to the Ayres standards - excellent.  Great room, clean, right off the freeway yet quiet, great staff.

I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach twice and have enjoyed the comfort, friendliness and cleanliness of the hotel. My only complaint is the shower head both times were so bad that I could not effectively wash my hair. The water sprays out like a fan and since it is not adjustable, it was very frustrating.
Manager Response: Dear Beth J,  Thank you for your review and insight on your most recent stay. We apologize for the inconvenience you encountered in your room. We kindly encourage our guests to voice any concerns while still in-house to ensure we are allowed the opportunity to recover your stay and make it more comfortable. We are glad to see that you were able to enjoy the rest of your stay, and we hope we have the opportunity to welcome you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Room smelled from Toxic plastic vapors.  New Plastic furniture stinks..i  had to change rooms at zero dark thirty.  Next room had no working tv and housing for light saver broke.  really low rent Ayers is.  Free breakfast is dreadful.  Ayers is really starting to lose it.  i wont stay there again
Manager Response: Dear steve1winston78,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you recently. Please accept our most sincere apologies that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We kindly encourage our guests to voice any concerns with your room while still in-house to ensure we are allowed the opportunity to recover your stay and make it a bit more comfortable. We hope this isolated incident does not deter you from returning as we would love to welcome you back for a much more enjoyable experience. Thank you again for your valued insight.  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights as first leg of our road trip. Hotel was in good location close to good raid links to all parts of LA. Room was very good, spacious and clean. Staff friendly and breakfast was excellent. We would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Malson38,  Thank you for your excellent review and kind feedback. We are happy to know that we were able to provide a positive experience during your road trip. We hope you decide to stay with us again during your next trip!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Lux environment at an affordable price!
Summary: This is my second stay at an Ayres property and my impression was the same both times.  Gorgeous property at a budget property price.  The beds are comfortable, the bathroom clean, the free breakfast was hearty and fresh and the pool was the perfect temperature.  Combine that with a lovely patio area for chatting up friends and a beautiful lobby to greet you.  Both stays were in connection with a family wedding and the atmosphere helped add to the romantic weekend vibe. Bonus -the ice cream cooler in the lobby snack shop was a HUGE win with my 3 yr old!
Manager Response: Dear Annie S,  Thank you for your excellent review and feedback. We are delighted to know that you enjoyed a wonderful experience with us and that you were able to enjoy our many amenities! Thank you for your continued loyalty to Ayres Hotels; we look forward to welcoming you and your son again soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: This was a last minute booking.  Ayres have a good reputation for clean, comfortable and well maintained hotels so, I was comfortable making my reservation.  The hotel is right next to the 405/22/605 freeway interchange.  The room I got faced the freeway which worried me a bit.  However, I never once heard any freeway or traffic noise.  Breakfast was very good as well.  I didn't use the pool but, in looking at it, it seemed very nice.
Manager Response: Dear Sig V,  We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel to be satisfactory. Thank you for your positive review and your kind feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steven A. de Lugo General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Seal Beach Ayres hotel for three relaxing nights.  The room was spacious, clean, nicely decorated and very comfortable. We enjoyed the heated swimming pool and the delicious breakfasts. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Location was perfect for Beach going (only 20 min drive from hotel). Nearby restaurants were excellent. I highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear TravelinLady_77,  Thank you for your wonderful review and kind compliments regarding our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are delighted to know that we exceeded your expectations and we look forward to being able to welcome you again!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay at Seal Beach Ayers Hotel
Summary: I was very impressed with the superb quality of service--at the front desk and breakfast. Hotel staff was very courteous and helping.  Breakfast quality and quantity both were excellent.  I felt the hotel was a bargain for the price. Access to the highway is added attraction. There was some noise due to ongoing renovation of the facility. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel.

During a 2-night stay over a weekend I wanted to change my room from a king to a double queen. The staff was wonderful; they had the room and moved my stuff into it while I was away. It was a perfect room for my added guest and me.
Manager Response: Dear rayjnh,  We are happy to see that our helpful team members were able to accommodate your request during your most recent stay. Thank you for your kind feedback and positive review, we look forward to being able to welcome you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed here recently for one night only. I was initially concerned about noise due to its close proximity to the freeway, but noise was not an issue at all! Very quiet and comfortable room. The beds were super comfortable, as were the pillows. Would stay here again!

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Staff were extremely friendly and answered my questions as well as offered helpful information and tips for my stay. I appreciated the email sent prior to my stay that allowed to sign up for texts as well as complete a pre-check in. I was also offered a room upgrade for a reasonable price and highly recommend the King Patio room, which has a sliding glass door that opens to a patio area with tables and couches. The complimentary breakfast included a range of hot and cold foods, which I really appreciated. I would definitely come back!

Summary Heading: A great place to stop and stay
Summary: We spent a few days here this past week and were very pleased. Check in was very easy. They sent an email the day before our arrival so that we could make requests for our stay. We paid to have a courtyard facing room, we wanted to make sure that our room was quiet at night. I requested, via the link provided, for hypoallergenic bedding, a high floor (we ended up on the second floor), extra blankets, and extra towels. Everything was provided as requested.   The room had 2 queen sized, comfortable beds. There was plenty of space in the room and we didn't feel cramped at all. The furniture is a bit dated to me, but still in great condition. We really enjoyed the artwork and guilded frames.   The breakfast was good. They had eggs, a spicier Mexican style egg, spicy breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Stephp,  Thank your positive review and detailed feedback. We are pleased to read that our complimentary breakfast was to your satisfaction and that our friendly team was able to accommodate all of your requests during your stay. Thank you for being a loyal guest of Ayres Hotels, we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable, great value, with full amenities
Summary: We stayed here for one night in a double queen room facing the street. The d√©cor in the hotel includes Old Masters style paintings and antique furniture. The room had full amenities with wall hair dryer, microwave, small coffee maker, and large mini fridge! The room rate included free hot breakfast (not just continental), including scrambled eggs, french toast, bacon, sausage, and pancakes, which made it a great value! The ladies behind the hot breakfast bar worked hard to keep all the items stocked.

Summary Heading: Amazing staff, comfortable beds - great stay
Summary: We would recommend this hotel. It is very clean, quiet, hot breakfast cooked fresh, very comfy beds. The staff is very accommodating. Although the weather was cooler the pool and hot tub were ready to go and very well maintained which was perfect for my kids.
Manager Response: Dear kmodugno,  Thank you for your wonderful review and rating. I am delighted to see that everything was to your liking and that we were the perfect location for you and your kids! We hope to welcome you folks back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed 3  nights in this hotel it was very nice clean and upscale I highly recommend it And it is close to the 405 freeway witch next door to it And not too far From the beach and there are great pizza place that deliver to it ameci pizza & pizza they have full Italian menu I ordered them online amecilosal.com the hotel employees are super friendly
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review and rate your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are pleased to see that we exceeded your expectations in terms of our convenient location and overall value. We hope to welcome you back anytime you find yourself needing accommodations in Seal Beach.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We were delayed in leaving for our trip, so we didn't arrive until about 3:00 am.  Our room was beautiful and ready for us.  The beds were very comfortable, and we all slept well.  I loved the old world feel and decor.  Breakfast was very good, lots of variety, hot and cold choices.  We didn't stay long, but the time we were there was great.
Manager Response: Dear Beth S,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent travel needs. I am delighted to see that your stay with us was comfortable after arriving late night/early morning from a long trip. It is a pleasure to provide our amazing guests with comfort unrivaled. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: A lovely place to stay in Seal Beach
Summary: A lovely hotel room with a amazing breakfast provided each morning.  It has a nice heated swimming pool and hot tub. The staff are wonderful at this location. With the beach, shops and restaurants near by.
Manager Response: Dear Courtney F.,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay. We are delighted to know that you enjoyed your visit and hope you will return again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This hotel is very handy for getting on the freeway and other amenities near by. The staff was extremely helpful. The breakfast had great choices. The rooms and beds were very comfortable. We had absolutely no complaints or issues at all. This is not an economy hotel so you are paying for the conveniences. If these things are important to you then you can't miss with this hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Los Angeles area.
Manager Response: Dear ChicagoGlobeseeker,  Thank you for your kind feedback and excellent rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am absolutely pleased to read that you enjoyed our comfortable accommodations, complimentary full American breakfast, as well as our hospitable team. I hope you will consider visiting us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I like this hotel mostly because there's Baja Fresh next door, which is very convenient. The pool area is small and gets shaded by 2pm. There are a lot of restaurants and a mall about one mile away from the hotel if you're not into Baja Fresh. They have a good breakfast in the morning as well!
Manager Response: Dear Jessi C,  Thank you for your detailed response and wonderful rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to see that you found our location to be conducive to your needs and you were able to take advantage of our complimentary full American breakfast. I hope you will consider staying with us again in the near future. Thank you again for your kind words.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: My stay there was comfortable and in a location fantastic: close to Boeing's Seal Beach facility, easy access to 405 freeway and close to restaurants and malls. Has everything plus a great breakfast too.
Manager Response: Dear Chaz8993,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our very close proximity to Boeing's Seal Beach facility and the easy access to the 405 freeway. We think these factors through when carefully planning out the location of each Ayres Hotel. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I received an email for easy check in.  Checked in on-line and requested extra towels for the room.  I've done this with other hotel chains and NEVER received the extra towels.  Ayres is the first hotel to ever accommodate this on-line request. Not only did they accommodate, they also sent me a text to confirm they received my request.  I've NEVER had a problem stay at a Ayres hotel (I've stayed at Anaheim & Costa Mesa).  This will now be my hotel of choice.  Thank you Brian for the confirmation texts.  Awesome!
Manager Response: Dear bbbarnard,  Thank you for your detailed feedback and the wonderful rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am pleased to know that you enjoyed our online check-in system, as well as the warm, detailed hospitality of our team members. I hope you will continue to visit Ayres in the future. Thank you for your time and wonderful insight.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: A pleasant stay. Plenty of parking. Nice rooms. Helpful staff. Good basic breakfast. Great location to visit the beach. No complaints, pleasant staff. Easy access, right off the 405. Basic shopping (Target) close by. Downtown Seal Beach a very short easy drive.
Manager Response: Dear ais1977,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach recently. I am pleased to know that you found the hotel to be pleasant and I hope you will consider visiting Ayres in the years to come. Thank you for your time and lovely review.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: My daughter lives in Seal Beach and always try for a room here, but it is usually booked solid.  This time I lucked out and got two nights here.  The hotel is very nicely furnished with great service.  Very quick on and off access to the 405.  Really nice swimming pool that is heated.
Manager Response: Dear ABF49ER,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach while in the area. I am glad we were able to accommodate your stay and I hope you will be back again in the future. Thank you again for your time and have a wonderful day.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This property is right off of the 405 and 605 freeways.  I stayed here after a dinner at a nice restaurant across Seal Beach Blvd. from the hotel.  Very convenient.    The lobby is well appointed and there is a nice outdoor courtyard (and a pool, I think).  My room was large, but had only a bed, desk and couch.  It seemed almost empty.  The bathroom was good sized.  The faux french decor was not to my taste, but not a big deal to me either way.  The desk lamp lightbulb was out.  There was an ironing board in the closet, but no iron.  The fitness room was tiny and has only a treadmill and stationary bike.    Free breakfast was good - hot and cold options.  Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful on check in and check out.    Net, net - this is the best option in the area

This is my second time staying at an Ayres Hotel. They are consistently spacious, clean and all-around a wonderful place to stay. Frankly I wish they were more of them around the country but if you're staying in California I highly recommend these hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Sue1515,  Thank you for the kind feedback and the generous rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to see that you have joined us again for another marvelous stay. I hope you will continue to look to Ayres for your travel needs in California. Thank you again for your time and kind review.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: For my hunnney's birthday surprise I bought tickets to see Selina Albright at Spaghettini's across the street from the Ayres. This hotel was well within walking distance. Soooo convenient! I asked the hotelier, Kelly where to get flowers, was referred and I made arrangements. Kelly said they'd place them in my room prior to my arrival. Later, the hotel called because the flowers were mistakenly delivered earlier than expected and told me if they held them overnight there would be no security. I didn't need to hear that. On arrival we loved the rustic look of the fireplace in the lobby. The tasty fresh cookies in the vestibule and attentive counter service. But to our surprise they didn't have a reservation in my name. I gave my confirmation and told them I booked through
Manager Response: Dear John R,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your special someone‚Äôs birthday. I am pleased to see that you were able to enjoy a memorable evening and hope you will return back soon. Thank you for your kind feedback and fantastic rating.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay close to lots of things
Summary: The hotels is nice with better than the usual furnishings in this category.  Very pleasant Front Desk staff who went out of their way to accommodate our room request.  Very nice breakfast buffet in the morning.
Manager Response: Dear Artemislaw,  Thank you for your wonderful compliments concerning our accommodations, pleasant team members, and exclusive complimentary breakfast. We are delighted to know you enjoyed your stay and hope you will join us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Expensive. Day staff  were great.  FAST internet. Room large with heavy and 1800's decor.  Problems:  Terrible and I mean Terrible pillows, old linens, no wake up call came, TV list did not match TV, no night light in bathroom which was very dark, expensive curtains that leave a gap, clock set to wrong time and could not reset.
Manager Response: Dear Tayalmp,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent travel needs. I am pleased you experienced the friendly hospitality we are known for, however, please do accept my most sincere apologies concerning the inconsistencies you faced within your room. We certainly hope you will allow us another opportunity in the future to earn your trust back. Thank you for your valued feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have used Ayres hotel for business purposes the past 10 years. The rates are not only affordable. They are a steal for the amenities.  This feels like a very upscale hotel with clean, sleek, well appointed rooms. As another reviewer noted, the breakfast buffet is excellent,  with many options sufficient for picky travelers , served all morning.  I've also used business services here, especially conference room rentals and private lunch buffet for job interviews. The service is always exceptional, 5 stars.  This is a great option for business travelers, couples, or families.  It's location is centrally located between LA and Orange Counties off the 405 and 22 freeways. Be sure to ask for AAA discount,  which they honor.
Manager Response: Dear Connie I,  Thank you for being a valued guest of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach over the past decade. I hope you will continue to use Ayres Hotels for your travel needs in the future. Thank you for your time and continued loyalty to our collection.   Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The accommodations were great.  Staff and front desk extremely helpful during major wind/rain storm including power outage!  The complimentary breakfast offered each day is a wonderful service, much appreciated.  We have stayed and would stay at this property in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Joyce M,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent visit to the area. I am pleased to know that you were able to find a safe place with us during the storms and power outage. I hope you will be able to return for a visit when the weather is more agreeable. Thank you again for your time and wonderful feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Clean and spacious, comfortable with all the necessary amenities- fridge,microwave,  coffee maker, nice spacious clean bathrooms. The big room had two queen beds with a divider wall for privacy. The buffet breakfast had everything you could think of,  and it was ready at 6:30am! We stayed here before we took the Long Beach Catalina Express, about a twenty minute drive .
Manager Response: Dear Dazyls,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent travel needs. I am pleased to read that we have left a lasting impression on you. Our spacious accommodations and complimentary breakfast are certainly a selling point for most and we are delighted to know that you found a great value in those exclusive amenities. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We have stayed in this hotel many times over the last 8 years.  The rooms are clean, comfortable, and the breakfast is good for a hotel buffet.  But we return to this hotel because the staff is consistently welcoming and flexible with the requests that we have made and it's a convenient location for the reasons we are coming to the area.  I gave this 5 stars considering the type of hotel--you aren't going to be staying at the Ritz Carlton :).

The staff is wonderful and happy. It is so nice to see smiling faces at the front desk and in the kitchen area! The room is comfortable and large. The bathroom is small but all I need is a shower and a potty room! Wish they had a makeup mirror but its all good..I will just bring mine next time...the coffee maker is small..it is a small knock off of a Kruieg and took a little to get it to work...It has a working refrigerator and microwave!!! WONDERFUL...I brought my own creamer and tea (yes they do supply lipton tea bags) but it was wonderful to reheat left over food from a restaurant I went to in the room micro! Will I stay there again...OH YES!! Considering it is so close to the freeway..it is quiet and staff is GREAT! Pleasant stay!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Eileen H,  Thank you for taking the time to reach out concerning your great weekend with us! We are honored to have left such a positive impression on you and hope you will be back very soon for another wonderful experience.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel Seal Beach was right off the 405 with easy access. Our son was getting engaged and we drove from Arizona to celebrate this special occasion. Our room was very pleasant and quiet.  The breakfast was yummy.  The employees were very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Melanie W,   Thank you for the wonderful review and rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am delighted to know that we were able to accommodate you and yours for such a special and intimate occasion. We hope all went well and perhaps a wedding visit is in order in the near future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This was our 3rd visit in the last 10 months to Ayers Hotel at Seal Beach,CA. They really care for you. Room always comfortable.Good breakfast and a very pleasant atmosphere. WiFi and free parking,exercise room and beautiful surroundings make this place very enjoyable.
Manager Response: Dear Jose M,  Thank you for the kind feedback and generous rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am glad to see that you feel comfortable and welcomed each time you visit. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location, clean and pleasant hotel
Summary: Very nice place, decorated with nice antiques, even though its a mid-range hotel.  Kind of like Hampton Inn but with an edge that makes it much nicer.  The staf was super nice and accomodating,  the rooms and public spaces clean and pleasant.  Worth checking out
Manager Response: Dear Andrea P,  Thank you for your wonderful review and rating. Your compliments are warmly welcomed and deeply appreciated. We hope you will be back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at this property several times over the years, and tend to choose this place when I'm staying in the area.  Despite being really close to the freeway(s) I find the hotel to be quiet and somewhat peaceful.  I enjoy the evening reception and the proximity to Norm's. :)

I loved the super clean room! It made my stay all worth it. A few things though. The heater vent was too loud although it kept the room warm. I missed the breakfast at 9:45am? I thought it was offered for a longer time. Also after I checked in I went to the Target store nearby. I came in through the back door with my bags and a gentleman in a suit named Jeremy just stared at me while I struggled to open the door with my card and with 3 heavy bags. Oh well chivalry is dead. But overall I liked my short stay. The location is great.

Stayed here for the night before heading back home to AZ. Per California State Law, we were told there could be no more than 4 ppl occupying a single room, we had 4 adults and 2 kids (a toddler and a baby). So we requested adjoining rooms. When we got to our rooms, they were not adjoining. Front desk said they had no more adjoining rooms, so they allowed us to all stay in one room and took the other one off the bill. Maybe it was because we were only staying one night? But they were very accommodating and even had a Pack 'N' Play for the baby to sleep in.   The complimentary breakfast is no joke either. Not your standard, coffee and a pastry. Ayers had a full spread of eggs, bacon, sausages, French toast, and pancakes. Muffins, bagels, bread for toast, cereal, yogurt, and fresh

I'm an airline crew.  The times I have stayed at Ayres for work or leisure, my experience has been a positive one.  The staff has always been very courteous and professional.  The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and I have to say that despite the fact that my room has faced the freeway, the room is sooooo QUIET!!!!!!!  Thank you Ayres Hotel and Staff
Manager Response: Dear Chelina2017,  Thank you for your kind feedback and compliments to our team members. We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed our tidy accommodations and excellent service. We hope to welcome you back very soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Our room was quite spacious with a sofa for relaxing.  The breakfast was as usual extensive and good.  The decor tends to be old world plush. The bathroom sink is conveniently located in front of the tub area.
Manager Response: Dear Ida M,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent travel needs. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our distinct boutique style and hearty complimentary full American breakfast. I hope you will back to visit us again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: From check in to check out everything was great. Rooms are 5 stars ‚ú® everything you need. I stay there every time. Beds are comfortable, there is wifi, coffee in the room, no need to bring basic shampoos, great breakfast in the morning. Excellent through and through
Manager Response: Dear camellia163,  Thank you for your kind feedback and excellent rating, following your experience at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is pleasure to see that you found everything both comfortable and satisfactory. We warmly welcome your compliments and hope to see you again soon for another exceptional stay!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel on several occasions when we visit my Mother at Sunrise Senior Living next door. The rooms are very, very nice and represent excellent value considering the luxurious quality. The staff are extremely courteous and professional and we will continue to stay at the Ayres whenever we are in the area.   I believe that the quality of an organisation is best demonstrated when something goes wrong. Yesterday, I was planning our next visit and booked a room online for August 2017. There was a glitch during the reservation and when I went back in to reserve the room I did not notice that the dates had changed and I made and paid for a room for last night (January). While going through all my confirmations today I noticed the date was wrong for our Ayres
Manager Response: Dear Jonathan S,  Thank you for your glowing feedback concerning the guest service you received from our team here at Ayres Seal Beach! It is our pleasure to assist our guest‚Äôs in any way we can. Thank you for your commitment to our collection of hotels. We look forward to welcoming you back in August!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach for a week during the Christmas holidays. We found it to be very well maintained, and the included breakfast each morning was plentiful and had many choices. Our room was spacious with a dressing area, and the staff is very friendly and accomodating.If one wants to do some shopping or eating out, it's a short walk up to the many restaurants and stores along Seal Beach Blvd. A bedside lamp that needed repair was fixed within an hour of our requesting help.My only negative would be that the bed was a bit too soft for our liking.
Manager Response: Dear Rudallrose,  Many thanks for your detailed feedback and the fantastic rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to read that you enjoyed our well-maintained grounds and accommodations, along with our optimal location. I hope you will consider staying with us any time you are in the area. Thank you again for your exceptional review and rating.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I spent mostly every week of this past semester here since I haved moved farther away from the Long Beach area and was finishing up my masters at CSULB. This place is truly home to me.  Lovely rooms and staff.
Manager Response: Dear Laurin P,  Thank you for being a valued guest of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy you consider Ayres your home away from home while finished your master's degree. Congratulations on your high achievement! I hope you will continue to look to Ayres Hotels for your travel needs. Thank you again for your time in reviewing and rating our hotel.   Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Just what we were looking for
Summary: My wife and I are seasoned travelers and enjoy several trips a year. In December of 2016 we traveled to Seal Beach to celebrate Christmas with our family. For this type of trip we do not demand a 5 star experience because we are not in the hotel very much. What we do expect is a clean and quite hotel that has a friendly atmosphere and a great complimentary breakfast. I can say that Ayres hotel at Seal Beach exceeded all of these requirements. I was very impressed at how quite the hotel was after dark, it was very clean, and the breakfast was very good. I did, however, miss the pastries on Christmas morning. Not sure what happened because there were sweet treats every other morning. My only complaint was the price, I felt there pricing policy for Christmas was excessive when
Manager Response: Dear DJB442,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent holiday travel. I am pleased to see that you found so much to enjoy at our hotel. I do hope you will consider visiting us again soon. Thank you again for your wonderful feedback and excellent rating.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying at this very nice hotel. We were attending a wedding in nearby long beach. The location was right off freeway but you could not tell, good parking, close to shopping centers with food, grocery and pharmacy stores. The room was quiet, bed was comfortable and it was one of my best stays at an Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear seasunsounds,  Thank you for your kind review and excellent rating. We are happy to have served you while attending the wedding. I am delighted to see that our location was conducive to your needs and that your accommodations were comfortable and quiet. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: imagine beautiful art, marble sculptures and classic furniture in a classic old hotel it is like waking up in your personal villa small intimate good food and just lovely the staff was friendly and very attentive
Manager Response: Dear redcharlotte,  Thank you for your wonderful rating and review. We are pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay and hope you will return soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the photos
Summary: Checked in and found out our request for the room hasnt even been fulfilled, mind you that I had checked in 1hour and 30 minutes after the check in time at 3:00 PM which is more than enough time to get everything ready.  Get to the room and I need to wait for their staff to come in and change out the requests that I had asked for. The rooms are gaudy and extremely tacky looking with oilesque paintings and a random dirty chandelier hung inside the room. The bathroom which are not displayed at all on their website is TINY, I am also greeted by a huge air conditioning unit in the room, which I find to be more motelish than hotel. Wires are visibly shown, water marks from probably the last guest are all over the night tables and last but not least the bed is squeaky and broken in,
Manager Response: Dear Naomitaitano,  Thank you for your detailed feedback and for choosing our hotel for your travel needs. I apologize you did not find the hotel d√©cor or guest service to be satisfactory. I am disappointed to know that you did not enjoy your stay. We hope to welcome you back in the future for a more enjoyable visit. Thank you again for your honest feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The food was tasty, the location was convenient, the customer service was good, the rooms were pretty clean, but they definitely try for that down-home feel. I'm not sure if that's what I'm looking for in hotels, but for those that are, it's a nice break from corporate hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Mehudson1,  Thank you for your kind compliments and review. I am happy that you have enjoyed your time with us and hope you will return again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable quiet stay at Ayers Seal Beach
Summary: Comfortable quiet hotel, great location.  Good breakfast, friendly and helpful staff. Close to shopping and only a few miles from the beach. Will stay here next time business or family bring me to Los Angeles area.
Manager Response: Dear ronaustx,  Thank you for your warm compliments and outstanding rating. I am pleased to read of your enjoyment and hope you will return soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Luxurious Hotel at a mid range price.  Great Value.
Summary: We had a great 4-night stay at this wonderful hotel.  Absolutely nothing negative to say.  Clean.  All amenities.  Fantastic hot breakfast buffet, for which this hotel is becoming famous for.  Convenient location.  Even on the weekend with a wedding to take place and the "party" members and others coming in for breakfast, the cook was able to keep the hot trays filled.  Impressive!.
Manager Response: Dear Shrewd-Senior,  Thank you for reviewing and rating your recent stay with us! We are pleased to know that you enjoy all that we offer at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and hope you will join us agian soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I most recently stayed for 4 days while visiting my sons in Long Beach. I always stay at the Ayers as the entire staff is great! From the house keepers to the front desk staff I have never once encountered any issues. I am picky and on this trip I had my husband's aunt and she thought this hotel was great!  I stay here for many reasons, location, free breakfast, car rental and the wonderful staff. I have stayed Downtown Long Beach at a very expensive hotel that had absolutely no customer service.   If you are looking for a nice place to stay with great staff and someplace you will feel welcomed then this is your hotel.   Enjoy the stay and I'm sure you will return.

I like the charme and the comfort of this Hotel. The breakfeast was very good and you can sit in the garden. A little but nice pool has opened up to 10:00 p.m. The room was large, very clean and comfortable. We would stay again at this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear susanne400575,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you recently. It is a pleasure to have served you with an enjoyable and relaxing stay. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Had a great stay this weekend... hotel is located right off the freeway so you can not miss it... I had a freeway view bit i heard no traffic... very quick check in... very helpful and friendly staff...  had a king suite... it was hugh and comfy... coffee maker, microwave and fridge in the room... toilet and shower are seperate from sink...i enjoued my stay and look forward to staying there again when im in the area...
Manager Response: Dear Kd1316,  Thank you for providing your helpful feedback following your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are humbled by your warm compliments and look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 4 days recently and had a really nice stay. Rooms are large and the beds are fantastic. It usually takes a day to get used to a new bed, but these are so good we slept well from the first night. Breakfast is included and is way better than any other hotel, eggs florentine, sausage, bacon, potatoes, and the list goes on. Very convenient to shopping, restaurants and the beach. Give it a try.
Manager Response: Dear Lovesthebeach2015,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for providing your wonderful feedback with ourselves and fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I am normally a wordsmith, but Ayres Hotel Seal Beach has done the impossible.  I am at a loss for explaining how truly fantastic our stay was.  We came in for a short vacation and it was the first time my wife opened a door to our hotel room and just stood there motionless.  I wish I was being dramatic, but the room was so beautiful and elegant.  It's by far the nicest hotel I have ever been to when you think about service, parking, proximity to the beach, proximity to entertainment, good restaurants, etc.  The employees at the front took great care of us.  The maintenance crew was speedy and fantastic.  The free breakfast was awesome, especially on Thursday morning when there was an endless supply of bacon.  The buffet style breakfast and coffee, cereal and juices were a great
Manager Response: Dear Robby W.,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent to the area. We are delighted to know that we provided a comfortable and personalized stay. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Upscale convenience in Long Beach area
Summary: I was on business at CSU Long Beach for a two night stay.  Ayres was on the university's recommended list.  I found it convenient to my arrival freeway (405) with easy on and easy off.  I worried that it might be noisy, but I had an interior room and it was totally quiet.  I'm always looking for a bargain, and Ayres provided a bigger room, more comfortable king mattress, couch and sitting area, desk with convenient plugs, excellent free wifi, flat screen tv plus a coffee maker, microwave and mini fridge.  I didn't need the coffee, however, because they had a fresh urn in the lobby when I went out to walk early.  And the breakfast was copious and fully cooked (eggs, sausage, fresh fruit and the rest of the usual).  For me this was overall an upscale treat at a fair price.  And
Manager Response: Dear Djaehne,  Thank you for providing feedback following your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is wonderful to know we are a convenient home-away-from-home for you while on business at California State University Long Beach. We are happy to provide those exclusive in-room amenities, well-appointed accommodations, and complimentary amenities such as parking, WiFi, and a full American breakfast. We hope to welcome you anytime you are visiting CSULB!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Over the past 3 years we have seen a significant drop in value at this popular hotel. On Saturday, October 22nd we spent the night and were told that the hotel was sold out by the check-in agent at the front desk. Knowing this well in advance, why did the hotel elect to have only one person in the kitchen for breakfast on Sunday morning? There was no bread/bagels/sweet rolls at all out for hotel patrons at 9 am, no hot water to make tea, and a long line with people waiting hoping to get french toast or scrambled eggs. Three years ago they actually made you omelets of your choice for breakfast and served bacon or sausage. The hotel used to have 2 people in the kitchen and 1 person picking up plates and wiping tables down. The hotel rates have continued to increase each year as we
Manager Response: Dear WRHughes,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome and serve you recently. Please accept our most sincere apologies for your recent experience leaving you to desire much more. Unfortunately, due to unforeseen circumstances, we were not staffed properly for the sold out evening. It is unfortunate that you were inconvenienced by this isolated incident. We truly hope this does not deter you as it is in no way a reflection of our values or service.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I usually am a Hilton stayer, this time my usual was booked a friend told me about Ayers, so I decided to try it. Check in was effortless, my room was not only clean as it should be but it was a good size. It allowed me to stretch out and work. The d√©cor of the room and the hotel was very interesting and pleasant to look at the history a the art.
Manager Response: Dear Gregory B.,  Thank you for reviewing and rating your experience at our hotel. It is a pleasure to provide you with exceptional service and accommodations, whether you are a usual Ayres guest or not. We hope to have made a loyal guest out of you and would love to welcome you back soon at our location or any of our other 21 locations in California. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Ayres is a super value. Stayed there because we were having our house tented for termites. Super place tons is places to eat nearby. Great staff, good free breakfast, super comfortable, all in all a tremendous value.
Manager Response: Dear Denniscdt,  Thank you for reviewing and rating Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are humbled by your warm compliments and wonderful feedback. Please do visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Cute and quiet...friendly staff...bad wifi connection...dirty towel in room
Summary: We found Ayres Seal Beach to be a nice, moderately priced hotel.  The staff was friendly, and our stay was quiet and relaxing.  Breakfast was not impressive, but it was included in the price of our stay, so we won't complain about that much.  :-)  The wifi was terrible - the connection didn't work for most of our stay.  We found a dirty towel hanging in our bathroom - makeup and a long hair on it.  That was disconcerting, but everything else appeared to be clean.  The room was very pretty and spacious.  We did not think the $10 upgrade for "pool/courtyard" view was worth it, as the pool was next to the parking lot, and we pretty much just looked out at the cars the entire time.
Manager Response: Dear J_b_h_allen_tx,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent travel needs. I am deeply sorry that the cleanliness of the room did not meet your standards or the standards of the hotel. Please now that this has been addressed to ensure we are implementing our strict and detailed procedures of sanitation. I do hope this will not deter you from visiting us again soon. Thank you again for your candid feedback and for the opportunity to serve you.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here twice and loved it both times. The rooms are clean and tastefully furnished. It is quiet and peaceful. The breakfast is great with heaps to choose from. The patio and pool area are pretty and restful. Staff are friendly, polite and always ready to help when you need it. Great value for money. We will be back in a year or two.

Summary Heading: Came to visit family in the area where we formerly lived
Summary: Excellent (central) location, friendly personnel, excellent amenities, extra clean rooms, good, efficient service and EXCELLENT complimentary breakfast !! Would have preferred to be closer to the exits as we requested that, but will just ask again when we stay next, which will be on a somewhat regular basis in the future since we were so pleased with the facility.
Manager Response: Dear Nadine M.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you recently. It is a pleasure to know that you enjoyed our exclusive amenities, clean accommodations, as well as our excellent service. We are honored to know you will be joining us much more in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres hotel in Seal Beach and were very happy with our experience. A very friendly front desk got us to our room without any glitches. They do offer an early check in package for an additional $30 and because I'm an Expedia VIP member they immediately informed me that i had an extra hour at checkout. Very happy with our stay and would return in the future. They also offer a complimentary breakfast buffet that was quite tasty.
Manager Response: Dear GB3VLO,  Thank you for taking the time to review your experience at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are delighted to see that you enjoyed your time with us and the exclusive amenities we offer, such as a paid early check-in and our complimentary full American breakfast. We look forward to your return visit!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: First hotel we stayed with no itchy nose and eyes
Summary: We have stayed many Hyatt and Marriott hotels in LA area.  My wife always have itchy nose and eyes during stay.  This is the 1st time she's fine staying at Ayres Long Beach. Beautiful decoration and friendly staff there. Even the cleaning lady has smile on her face when she greet us at the hall way. Free breakfast is good. Quiet even we face the freeway. I mean very quiet. We will definitely search for Ayres next time we stay at LA.
Manager Response: Dear Mingyuansung,  We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay! We are delighted to offer clean, comfortable accommodations and exceptional service with a smile. We look forward to serving you at ours or any of our other 21 locations throughout California. Thank you for your wonderful feedback!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here several times when visiting the Long Beach/Seal Beach area because it is conveniently located and close to the freeway and restaurants.  The breakfast is one of the best of the hotels that offer it.  The rooms have plenty of space.  We stayed two nights and when we returned late afternoon the second day, our room had not been cleaned.  We called and they sent someone right up and told us we should have let them know to clean room early.  We will do that next time, and we will stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Carol OD,  Thank you for choosing to stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach during your recent visit. It is a pleasure to know that you enjoyed your time with us. My sincere apologies for your cleaning service being later than anticipated. With that being said, I am pleased that our team amended this for you in a timely and professional manner. Visit again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a quick vacation to celebrate our anniversary. Hotel photos are a little misleading. Looks big and grand, but everything is actually small. Exercise room only has 1 treadmill and 1 weight machine. Our room was small and  not the cleanest. You could see the stains on the tables, and I mean it's as if there was something creamy or sticky smeared on the table that was not cleaned. There were dirty spots on our bed sheets. We also had a great view of the highway and traffic, so we didn't open our window much.  Staff was nice, breakfast was great, cleanliness was just okay.
Manager Response: Dear Kristina A.,  Thank you for choosing us for your recent travel needs. Please accept our most sincere apologies for the inconsistencies you faced while a guest at our hotel. It is quite uncharacteristic for our team to miss such items within your room. It is unacceptable and has been addressed with our team to ensure we are operating at our highest level. Thank you for your compliments on our world-class service and our complimentary full American breakfast.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, enjoyable breakfast and afternoon "socials" which are much appreciated with long work days.  It is in a very convenient location - downtown area within 10 mins, airport within 15 mins, and right off the 405.  Shopping within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Kristen J.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you recently. I am delighted to read your compliments regarding our convenient location, complimentary full breakfast, and evening reception. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Room key cards did not work, so had to wait a long time for someone to come up, verify they didn't work, then go back to get me 2 new key cards.  A long wait...  WiFi was 8mbs upload and .8mbs download - very, very slow.  I didn't ask for it, but Sean volunteered a 15% credit.  That never showed up on my VISA.
Manager Response: Dear MikePeggy,  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent travel needs. Our most sincere apologies for the WiFi connection being less than desirable. In regards to the 15% discount, please contact us directly at (562) 596-8330 and ask for management. We would love to look into this further for you.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for vacation or business trips
Summary: That's all we can say is from the front desk personnel, the cleanliness of the hotel, the maid service and the excellent free breakfast everyday, you will definitely come back here after one visit.  Everything and everyone above what we expected and will surely come back here on our next visit.  They have a maintenance staff that is also fantastic.  The front desk personnel were very helpful with any questions we had about places to visit and eat.
Manager Response: Dear JimmyYvette,  Thank you for the kind words and the excellent rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I do hope you will be visiting us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: My husband and I spent two nights here while our house was being fumigated. We had to work, so really appreciated the good, free wifi. The breakfasts and evening wine and cheese receptions were an wonderful bonus - we didn't need to go out to eat either night! the room was quite spacious and comfortable. They fitness center is quite small, but the pool is great for (short) lap swimming. All in all, we'd happily stay again and recommend it to friends!

A very enjoyable five day stay. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Great bed. Good locations to many freeways. The breakfast was good and the staff very polite! We will come back on our visits to Seal Beach and Long Beach!
Manager Response: Dear 32480Robert,  Thank you for the kind review and the outstanding rating of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I hope you will consider returning to the hotel so you may enjoy the same comfortable accommodations and friendly service. Thank you again for your time and valuable feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very helpful people made you feel at home and gave me Great directions on where to go to dinner  Will make a return visit as the rooms were nice and the people were great to deal with  Food was very good
Manager Response: Dear Richard L,  Thank you for the kind feedback and wonderful rating. It is a pleasure to read that you experienced the friendly team service and relaxing atmosphere that we are known for. Please feel free to visit whenever you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel in a convenient location
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for a reunion weekend and was pleasantly surprised the whole stay was great.  I was a little concerned about being so close to the freeway, but never had any noise problems at all.  The rooms were huge and the bed was extremely comfortable.  The free breakfast was in an area that led out to the patio and pool.  The hotel sits near a small strip mall, but the landscaping made you feel that you were isolated from the parking lot.  It is located near shopping, restaurants, and movie theaters.  We will stay here every time we are in the north orange county area.

This is a nice hotel with many amenities. My wife and son swam for a few hours and relaxed in the spa.The room was big and had two queen beds. Room was clean and we had plenty of towels. The beds where comfortable and we had free wifi. We also had free parking. The breakfast was a full buffet breakfast that was really good. They placed cookies out at night for guests. I liked that check out was at noon. The rates are really fair for how nice the place was. They had a little gym with tv and it's own bathroom. Ayre's hotel is definitely on our list to stay at again.

The Hotel is very nice, very clean.  We arrived early and had to wait for our room to be ready, but still was able to get our room around 1 pm. Our stay was very quiet, even though their were kids in the hotel, you could not hear them.  We were on the top floor at the end of the hallway. The breakfast was great, only downfall, no trays to carry plates and cups to room, so I ended up making 3 trips to the breakfast area. Though the room was clean, the next day we left to go to the beach, came back 4 hours later and our room had not been cleaned as yet.  The maid did come in at my request right away, but only did a quick make the bed, clean tub/toilet, new towels and left the room. She did not take any of the dirty glasses or cups, not a big deal, but should have been done. The
Manager Response: Dear Mark E,  Thank you for your detailed feedback and the great rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am thrilled to read that you have enjoyed staying at our hotel during your previous visits and hope you will continue to choose us for all of your travel needs in California. Thank you again for your time and have a nice day.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Extremely clean, somewhat dated but interesting interior, just spotless, incredible convenience to Orange County and the Long Beach area.  Loved breakfast, some of the stuff could be hotter  but it is he best breakfast buffet ever and free!  Staff is the nicest. It was like coming home at night after long hard days, wow.. The hot tub needs some better cleaning but I loved it, will be back definitely. I would love a bar but all the other aspects make it a real favorite. Thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Taffybeach,  Thank you for your detailed feedback and generous rating of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am thrilled that the hotel met your expectations of cleanliness and convenience. I do hope you will be able to join us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at Ayres Seal Beach several times.  I was having work done at my home and they did not finish in time, so I needed a place to stay.  I was helped by a very nice person, I think her name was Regina and another nice man at the desk.    They got me set up no problem.  The evening Wine and snacks was lovely.  FRESH veggies, Cheese and Crackers was a great way to start our stay.  The Hot Breakfast was wonderful.  Yolanda was very busy cooking.
