She gave me some bacon she just finished that was perfectly crunchy.  The Dining room was very clean and everything was well stocked.  My last stay was for a week when we were re-modeling our house.  i have also recommended this hotel to lots of others and they are always happy with their stay.

I booked a room for my son and husband to stay while I stayed with my mother across the way at Leisure World.  I have to say, I was jealous of my son and husband getting to stay in such a fancy hotel.  I've always driven by this hotel and it didn't really look like much from the outside.  I expected an Embassy Suite vibe to it (California /Miami beach colors and outdated furniture.) Boy was I wrong!  First of all, it smelled really nice.  Always a good sign.  The entrance and hallways are decorated in fancy furniture and classic paintings.  Very upscale feel.  The rooms are spacious with a mini kitchen (microwave and small fridge) but not at all tacky our outdated. The beds were comfy and the room was well appointed.  I will certainly consider booking at another Ayres Hotel if
Manager Response: Dear Liza C,  Thank you for your kind words and generous rating of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to read that your son and husband had an enjoyable stay. I do hope you will be able to join us in the future so you may get the full Ayres experience. Thank you again for your wonderful feedback!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have been staying at the Ayres in Seal Beach for a little over a month. The staff's friendly service; from the front desk, to maintenance to the breakfast crew, and many more have made my stay welcoming and easy. The grounds and the rooms are all gorgeous, beds comfortable and the space in each room is more than enough. I look forward to staying here again in about a month!
Manager Response: Dear Bethany T,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach, especially for a lengthy stay such as this. Our friendly and professional service, well-maintained grounds and accommodations, as well as our comfortable Ayres Celestial Sleepers are just a few points which set us a cut above the rest. We are thrilled to have you and look forward to continually serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The Hotel and room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would have rated it excellent however they made a mistake and charged my card for two nights instead of one. Not a huge issue, however it did require me calling the hotel to clear up the discrepancy and get the money credited back to my card. which takes a couple of days to process. With the exception of the snafu, I would/will stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Dear Mike447,  Thank you for taking the time to review your most recent stay. We are pleased to read that you plan on visiting our hotel again in the future. I would, however, like to express my most sincere apologies for the oversight during check-out. I can see how this was an inconvenience and am glad it was resolved. Thank you again for your time and the opportunity to serve you.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Well-run, comfortable and clean - but average.
Summary: I checked in for one night before a memorial service in Long Beach a few miles away.  On the plus side, the desk staff both at night and in the morning were top notch and welcoming, clearly knew their stuff.  The room was very clean and comfortable with all the basic amenities.  It was my first Ayres hotel - and I have to say, I was a bit disappointed.  I had heard Ayres were at Westin or Marriott level, but I wouldn't agree based on this hotel.  I found the decor a bit over the top for a roadway hotel and the location right off the freeway not optimal for anything but a quick stay.  All in all, it was a nice stay in a well-run hotel, but nothing special.
Manager Response: Dear Melissa P.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you recently. It is a pleasure to read that you were met with personalized, friendly service and enjoyed our clean and comfortable accommodations. We certainly hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Not far from the ocean. The room was nice - comfortable. All in all it was a really good place. Breakfast was less than impressive but the front desk staff were helpful and suggested some cool dinner spots near.
Manager Response: Dear MRichrebebel,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I am pleased to read that you enjoyed our accommodations and friendly service. We hope to welcome you back again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This was our first stay at an Ayres Hotel. It was our second stay in Seal Beach. I was concerned about being 4 miles from the beach but it was not an issue.   We originally reserved the king room and upgraded to the king patio for $10 per night. The room is very large. There is a desk across from the king bed and a large open area that had a sofa bed on one wall and a table with two chairs and a cabinet with TV on the other wall. In the entryway is an alcove with sink and large counter on one wall and fridge and microwave on the other. This alcove has a door to the toilet & bath/shower.  The king patio has a sliding door to the outdoor shared patio. The regular king room with patio view is the same size room with a window over the patio replacing the sliding door.  The
Manager Response: Dear BoopTraveler,  Thank you for providing us with detailed feedback following your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We were thrilled to read that you enjoyed your spacious suite and had a chance to sample our complimentary breakfast and evening reception. We hope our exceptional accommodations and exclusive amenities will bring you back sooner rather than later!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Just a short drive to the beach. Close to freeway access, restaurants and stores. Very clean rooms with nice decor throughout the hotel. The staff are very friendly. It is one of the more expensive seal beach hotels but paying for better quality. One of my seal beach favorites.
Manager Response: Dear Sandra V.,  Thank you for your exceptional rating and feedback. I am pleased to know that we are your go-to when visiting Seal Beach and look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Beautiful hotel! Room are spacious, and the staff very accommodating. The hotel is located close to restaurants, shopping and convenient to freeways and most anything you would need. Very clean and well manicured property, with a great positive atmosphere.
Manager Response: Dear Theresannbart,  Thank you for your wonderful compliments and high rating. I am pleased to read that our close proximity to local restaurants, shopping, and freeways was‚Äã conducive to your needs. We hope to welcome you back soon for another enjoyable stay.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The whole hotel was decorated to look high class 1800 style. I just wanted to look around, made me feel like I was in a museum. My favorite part was the breakfast, so many options and it all tasted good. There are good restaurants near by. El Dorado nature Ventura is not far away. I would definitely recommend going there.
Manager Response: Dear Jessie W,  Thank you for your kind words and generous rating of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is excellent to read that you enjoyed our distinctive style and atmosphere. We thank you for your recommendation and look forward to serving you the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: A beautiful hotel!  Smells great and very clean.  Bed was very comfortable, hotel was quiet allowing you to sleep soundly, and the towels are fluffy.  Breakfast was a full breakfast not just yogurt, bagels and cereal.  Can't wait to stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your travel needs. It is a pleasure to know that you enjoyed the cleanliness and comfort of your room, and even had a chance to enjoy our full American breakfast. We cannot wait to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We were greeted by friendly staff who knew their hotel and the region.   This was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at. I travel a lot and always check the room upon arrival (by cleaning it myself...). Our room was spotless...  The breakfast was great. Good variety, hot and cold. (cereal, yogurt, fruit, pancakes, scrambled eggs, plain or with spinach, sausage, bacon...).  Seal beach was a great spot to stay and to enjoy the beach. We parked our car near the metro in Long Beach and took the metro downtown to Holywood and Universal Studios to avoid the LA traffic. Also, only 16 miles to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear Flynnmark,  Thank you for your detailed feedback and the generous rating of our hotel. We hope you had a pleasant vacation and enjoyed the many beaches and theme parks Southern California has to offer. It is a pleasure to read that after all that excitement, you were able to have a restful night‚Äôs sleep in your clean and comfortable room. I hope you will visit us again anytime you are in the area! Thank you again for your feedback and happy traveling.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Our team stayed here for the dragonboat races and found it convenient and comfortable. The early start to the breakfast buffet - 6:30 a.m. on the weekends was perfect timing to get all of us fed and ready to head out to Marine stadium, an easy 15 min drive away.  Hotel was the perfect size - 3 stories, never too long a wait for elevator despite a full house, plenty of parking, spacious communal space inside and out.  We were allowed us to use the breakfast room for an evening team meeting.  Rooms were large and clean and sound proof - hardly heard any noise from other rooms.  Bonus to haven fridge and microwave, bathroom had plenty of soft towels.  Only downside was the disposable cups instead of glass in the bathroom that made an otherwise classy hotel feel like a motel 6.  On

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Seal Beaches the best hotel I have ever experienced!
Summary: Everything was perfect! My daughter and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel to attend a family wedding. The family had booked a block of rooms for attendees to the wedding. The price was fair, the hotel was beautiful, furniture was beautiful quality and very substantial, room was quiet and comfortable, bed was very comfortable, staff was welcoming and breakfast was a wonderful full buffet included with the room. I requested two queen sized beds and the room actually had a partial wall with shutters up to the ceiling between the beds. We were able to be together but also alone when we went to bed. Very, very nice!

Stayed with my husband and 2 teenage boys. Hotel was clean and adequate. Outside area was inviting. My suggestion would be to make sure your room is not across from the elevators. We stayed in room 113 which was directly across from the elevators and exit to the patio/pool area and right by the hotel lobby. I was surprised to be placed there having booked several months in advance. However we did not take it upon ourselves to request a move. I would stay at this hotel again just not in that room. Breakfast was satisfactory and yet free...little to complain about here. The hotel is situated perfectly and is a easy hop on and hop off of the interstate. Seal beach is a very nice and safe retirement community. Keep  in mind as most food places close around 10 pm. It is about 12

Room was ready when I arrive and was nicely furnished, clean and quiet. The breakfast in the morning was a nice touch and very good. With just 3 entrances tot the hotel security was easy and I noticed a guard checking the parking lot one night to make sure guest's cars remained safe and secure.

I stayed in this hotel 6 times over the past year. I've had rooms from the patio suite (best) to the rooms facing the highway (worst). The rooms are always very clean. The beds are comfortable and the staff is friendly and accommodating. I had chance to talk to the Chairman of the chain during one visit. He said that many employees are members of the Ayers family.   This hotel is convenient to the highways, CSULB, Seal Beach and Long Beach airport (no shuttle).  The food nearby is mediocre, but downtown Seal Beach is a short drive.

I stay here often when in seal beach on business. Hotel is run by pros who go out of their way to get the job done. Hotel is clean, quiet subdued centrally located.  I will be back next time I need s place to stay.

I arrived to the hotel early (around 10:30 a.m.) and asked for an early check in but no rooms were available at that time. Kelly (Assistant Manager?) took every effort to make me feel comfortable during my wait: I was able to leave my bag with the desk, I was given a temporary pool access key, wifi access, and was invited to partake in breakfast. After a long travel day I was absolutely delighted by this first class treatment.

I stayed here for 2 nights and had a wonderful stay. The staff at the check-in desk is more than amicable, the way the hotel is decorated is impeccably unique and the rooms are up to par. The outside patio/pool area was a nice hangout spot whenever you wanted to have a mini getaway. The hotel serves breakfast every morning, free of charge and full of options. I was surprised and excited that they served alternate meat options for people who don't eat pork (like me). There was a pretty large selection of restaurants and stores nearby, all within 15 minutes also.  Overall, I loved my short stay, and would definitely recommend staying at this location when in the area.

We went here because we attended a wedding around the corner from it. It was clean and well maintained. The breakfast was nothing special plus it was crazy busy with limited seating. The room was nice with a pullout couch. The bathroom was dated with a tub instead of a shower. The parking was an issue as we had to park next to the hotel near the stores. The outdoor area was nice but unfortunately this is where all the smokers hang out. The pool was smaller than our pool at home with tons of children in it. Over all worth the money spent.
Manager Response: Dear Marty L.,  Thank you for your time and feedback. I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you can visit us again next time you are in the area. Thank you again for your time and review!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: So Clean, convenient, well-priced place.  The breakfast included was amazing and such a plentiful buffet.  The staff was kind and diligent.  The room was spacious and charming.  The old world feel was heartwarming.  The smell was refreshing.  I highly recommend this spot.  It was close to Disney Land and to a great shopping area for our needs with a car, of course.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your exceptional review and feedback. We appreciate your kind compliments on our complimentary full American breakfast, personalized service, and spacious accommodations. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient, comfortable and very good breakfast
Summary: This hotel was recommended to us for it's convenient location for a wedding.  The decor is not my style but the room was nice, beds were comfortable, and nice bathroom arrangement for four of us.  The breakfast buffet was better than average.  The ladies preparing the food and keeping it stocked worked their tails off!
Manager Response: Dear Mary Ellen M.,  Thank you for the fantastic rating and the kind words you have shared concerning our team members. It is a pleasure to read that our attentive team and comfortable accommodations made your time in Seal Beach that much more enjoyable. Thank you again for your time and review!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Stayed 3 nights whilst visiting friends. Good hotel, quiet room, aircon ok, easy parking. Breakfast good but a bit of a bunfight as the breakfast room and buffet are small in comparison to the number of guests, but can take food to outside tables.  Doesn't have bar, does sell booze at reception, fridge in room. Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for choosing us for your travel needs. I appreciate your suggestions and insight. We hope to welcome you back in the future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very nice, the people are extremely nice & helpful and the hotel room was lovely. The room was huge and very beautiful with quite a few amenities. We were very comfortable and felt like we we staying at a very posh hotel! They even have a full on breakfast! We didn't get to partake in it but I heard from friends it was really good! We were even close to our car so that was a plus as well. They even had a little store in the hotel which was awesome, a patio area and a pool area - oh and a fitness room!! I wish I could have stayed longer!
Manager Response: Dear Dollilama2016,  Many thanks for your warm compliments and high rating. I am thrilled to read that our distinctive style and the team‚Äôs attentive care made your stay enjoyable. I hope you will visit us again the next time you are in Seal Beach!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We had never stayed at an Ayres Hotel before, but we definitely will always try to find one from now on. We stayed in 7 different locations on our California vacation and this property was the absolute best. Spacious and beautifully decorated room/bathroom, extremely comfortable bed and pillows, helpful and friendly staff, lovely pool and hot tub with an outdoor fireplace on the deck, delicious breakfast, great coffee. I have 2 teenagers and they both give it a 10 out of 10 rating :)

I had never heard of Ayers before traveling to Seal Beach, but it is a hidden gem.   The hotel was very nice in all aspects, and every single person I encountered working there was very outwardly friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, there was washer/dryer available to the guests, and the fresh cooked breakfast offered more choices than I have ever seen at any hotel.  restaraunts.  Will definitely stay here again!

Convenient, clean, comfortable, everything works, fast elevators, gracious staff, good beds, quiet...all the basics. The perks: fresh, fabulous, bountiful, full breakfast buffets. Lovely patio for breakfast. Decor: elegant Italianate furnishings, interesting pictures, tiled bathrooms,high quality detail as if selected by owners for their own homes. Refrig built in and quiet. Pool small but adequate! We are repeat customers and look forward to returning for that pampered feeling that makes me want to sing!
Manager Response: Dear hdpBoston,  Thank you for your kind and detailed review of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am pleased to see our charm, design, and complimentary amenities were able to make your stay that much moreenjoyable. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and we look forward to your return!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I was very pleased with my two weekend nights at this hotel. The interior is bright and clean and pleasantly furnished. My room was spacious with a full sofa and writing desk, and the bed was super comfortable. The outdoor pool area became quite crowded and noisy on Saturday afternoon. It is a relatively small pool and surrounding area. The buffet breakfast included hot food and fruit salad and other fruit and could be eaten inside or out on a pleasant pato shaded by umbrellas. A plus I discovered was an excellent hair salon just a few steps from the hotel. All the others in my group liked the hotel very much. Highly recommended.

From the parking lots to the rooms, I was very impressed at how clean this hotel was. Everyone we came in contact with was very nice and helpful. I would stay here again if I needed a nice hotel. The breakfast was great, didn't have time to use the pool or gym but they looked very clean and kept up. Thanks For Everything
Manager Response: Dear Tavogee,  I am happy to read that the service you were met with was welcoming and warm. I hope that this elevated experience will bring you back to the hotel in the future. Thank you again for your review.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Pleasant Stay for a family event
Summary: We had the pleasure of staying at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for a family event. The hotel is reasonably accessible to highways and main thoroughfares, and seems well appointed and furnished. Staff was very friendly, and the room came with free breakfast that was the usual stuff, but when i asked about omelettes, i was told no, and then the cook went and made me an omelette anyway. Overall this was a comfortable stay at a reasonable price. It is not a high rent hotel, and although the furnishings suggest that it could be, location and situation dictate otherwise. There were a few negatives- there was no shampoo or bath soap in our room when we checked in, so i used my wife's shampoo. When we mentioned it to one of the cleaning staff, they indicated they would take care of it,
Manager Response: Dear Bearstraveler,  Thank you for your sharing how your family trip went at our hotel. I am happy to read that you were able to enjoy our warm, welcoming team members and many complimentary amenities. I do apologize for the delay you faced getting some of the amenities to your room. I hope this does not deter you from returning in the future. Thank you again for your kind review.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I am very happy that we have chosen this hotel for our out of town guests to stay out in November for our son's wedding. The front desk was accommodating and gave us great ideas on places to visit in the area. The room was clean, parking convenient and service excellent.

We are from the area but needed a place to stay due to termite tenting. We chose this place due to its' location.  The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful in trying to get us our room before check-in (due to tenting).  The buffet breakfast was one of the best that we have had and I was able to get my eggs cooked to order.  Mon-Wed, they have a reception with beer, wine, soda, cheese and crackers.  You are centrally located to freeways, beach, and restaurants.  If you need a bank, then look no further than next door.  I will definitely recommend this place to visiting friends.
Manager Response: Dear Ptamom1967,  Many thanks for your detailed feedback and the opportunity to serve you at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am thrilled to read that you were satisfied with our convenient location and exclusive complimentary amenities. I hope you or yours will be able to join us in the future. Thank you again for your time!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: From the Front desk personnel to the decor excellence prevails! Add complimentary breakfast and parking produces a highly affordable package .The king upgrade is well worth the value and offers outside seating,perfect for a glass of California wine to end the day.

The decor of the room (as well as the lobby and the hotel in general) feels like an European boutique hotel (yes, borrowing their words) - the general feel is somewhat luxurious and overly comfortable. We loved the breakfast!

The staff was friendly, room are spacious and clean.  Loved the green technology this hotel uses.  You just insert your room key in a switch on the wall and it turns the air and light on, when you leave you grab your room key and everything shuts off. You don't have to run around turning off all the lights. Breakfast was good, with lots of choices.  Beautiful outdoor patio if you choose to eat outside.  Coffee was great. Pool area clean and relaxing. Read where some complained of freeway noise, you don't hear it at all and our room faced the freeway, if you don't like the view keep the curtains closed. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the Internet is spotty some of the time. Will be using this hotel when we go to stay by the beach.  Close to beach about 3-4 miles

Location, Service, Free breakfast and great wifi!!! Between five to ten minutes from the beach (by car) and free parking!!! This was our third stay here and once in Costa Mesa. Large, clean rooms and reasonably priced for the area: we will be staying there again!!!
Manager Response: Dear ebonycowgirl,  Many thanks for your excellent score and kind words about your experience at our hotel. I am always pleased to read about our guests stay and I am happy you were able to enjoy our complimentary full American breakfast, friendly service, as well as our convenient location. Please visit us again for the same elevated hotel experience!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: More than just a clean, well-lighted place
Summary: We found the Ayres at Seal Beach from the CSULB website, as my daughter is heading from Napa to Long Beach for college.  We learned quickly from previous visits to the area that things go from "cute" to "rundown" very quickly.  It was a pleasant surprise to learn Ayres looks exactly as it is pictured on their website,with decor that was reminiscent of 19th century (ie. deep colors in wing back chairs and sofas and gilded frames on "oil" prints). It was conveniently located about 8 miles from the Beach State campus. Day of arrival we called ahead to let them know we'd be arriving late; we had not prepaid for the room, but were told a notation had been made and our room would be waiting for us. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a friendly, professional staff.  Our room was on the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Although we are not a shore front property, we are conveniently located just 5 miles from the shore. I am saddened that this was an inconvenience for you and certainly understand your disappointment. Thank you for your honest feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed 1 night and check-in/check-out was quick and easy.  The  staff was very nice and friendly, letting us know what was around our location and even offered us chocolate chip cookies fresh and warm from the oven. The room was very clean with a wonderful bed, mini fridge and microwave, and also the courtyard area near the pool is really nice with a firepit to lounge around.  Very nice hotel for a great price.

Lovely hotel, great location.  We ALWAYS stay at Ayres whenever possible.  We are NEVER disappointed in the room and its comfort & beauty.  Their COMPLIMENTARY breakfast is amazing, and a great way to start the day!  Try it ... you'll like it!

This hotel is a one of a kind: romantic belle epoche style. I felt like back in the 19th century in Europe So many paintings in the rooms and corridors. Wood ornaments and mirrors everywhere. The outside breakfast area has a open air fire place Tuscany style. Three stars but feels like four We make still our regular stopover in the area now!

My friend and I met halfway at the Ayres Seal Beach for a much needed girls weekend, and it was perfect.  Comfy beds, mini fridge, coffee in the room, free wifi: and breakfast was awesome!!!  The hotel has a very European style with lots of cool artwork and lovely places to sit and relax.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating, and I will definitely be back!

Had a wonderful time at this hotel. The breakfast was great but it was same things every single day. After a week there, it got old. Wish they would have changed up the choices a little bit. The pool was great, clean but did have to ask the front desk a couple times to restock the towels. The room was clean but we did learn that we had to ask if we wanted our room to be cleaned. Overall, the people were very friendly. Would come back
Manager Response: Dear GreenDuck15,  Thank you for leaving a great score and review of our hotel. I am glad you enjoyed your well-appointed room and our accommodations. We hope to serve you again in the near future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very nice boutique like hotel. This is a great hotel! Clean rooms, excellent service. Nice happy hour added for free along with the complimentary breakfast that was very tasty!! Would definitely stay there again!!
Manager Response: Dear JeannieOld,  Thank you for your continued loyalty to Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am pleased to read you had an enjoyable stay with us and will return! Thank you again for your valuable feedback.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The breakfast buffet was excellent although the options were the same three days in a row. The pool was clean. The staff was very accommodating when the requested crib was not in our room. The crib arrived in record time with clean sheets. We did have to request the room be serviced because for 2 days we went without clean towels and had to call the desk. Otherwise, a great place to stay!
Manager Response: Dear Czechsue,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your travel needs. I am glad to know you received efficient and courteous service from our team members. I apologize for the delay in your room cleaning. I am glad to know that this did not hamper your stay too much and look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Ayres Hotel
Summary: Had a great stay for 2 nights this past weekend. We had room 134 which was a suite with a patio and it was really nice. The hotel was great, the front desk was very friendly and helpful and the morning breakfast was very good with plenty of hot options. We enjoyed sitting on the patio which was near the pool and ate breakfast out there, we had wine on the patio in the evening. We used the hot tub on 2 occasions and it was very relaxing. We would stay there again on future trips to Long Beach and Seal Beach area.
Manager Response: Dear SFTravelGuy,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent visit to the area. It is delightful to know that you enjoyed our exceptional service, complimentary full American breakfast, as well as pool and patio area. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at Ayer's hotels in the past and have always found them comfortable and accomadating. This recent visit was no expection. The room is spacious and the bed is very comfortable. Having a little larger then most refrigerator and microwave is always a plus for us. The only negative feedback I would have to mention is the single cup coffee maker in the room. My husband and I are both morning coffee drinkers so its a time consuming process( the machine is rather slow). The property is nice and very clean. Location was great for us. The free breakfast was more than just continental style and offered some different choices.
Manager Response: Dear Theresa S,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you during your recent visit to Seal Beach. Thank you for your suggestion concerning our coffee makers. We will certainly take your comments into account when looking to make improvements. I am happy to know that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast and look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The staff was very helpful and accommodating to our requests. The grounds were very nice, The breakfast room was spacious and the options were plenty. It was very nice that the ice room and laundry room are behind a closed door to minimize noise.
Manager Response: Dear Mitch and Laura,  Thank you for visiting us in Seal Beach and for such a generous rating. I am happy to read that you were pleased with your room accommodations and our complimentary full American breakfast. Again, many thanks and we hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice room with a yummy complementary breakfast
Summary: The Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach is in an excellent location near shopping and restaurants. My family loved their up dated, spacious rooms with a great complementary breakfast. The staff was excellent and very helpful finding nearby locations and directions to shopping. We can't wait to return in the summer to enjoy their pool and Garden like patio! The only thing that we were unhappy about is that they put part of my family on the first floor and the rest of the family on the third floor even though we made reservations to be near each other six months ago and repeatedly requested rooms near each other all week.
Manager Response: Hello Bustrorl,  Thank you for your detailed review and excellent rating of our hotel. Our front desk team members do their best to ensure each guest's requests are met and certainly can empathize with your frustration with being away from a family member's room. I am glad to see that this did not hamper your stay too much and do hope to welcome you back to enjoy another stay soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotel is conveniently located directly off the 405 in Seal Beach, CA with many restaurants, shopping areas, and things to do. Quaint hotel with a rustic appeal. Beds were extremely comfortable and the outside patio was equipped with a fireplace pit to sit around and converse.
Manager Response: Hello BobbyC,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to Seal Beach! I am glad to read you were able to sit and enjoy our courtyard area, equipped with our very own fireplace. I would like to invite you to join us again anytime you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We just stayed at the Ayers in Seal Beach.  It was a really nice hotel.  Right off the bat, we noticed how clean the lobby was and how nice it smelled.  The staff was very nice.  The rooms were also very nice.  We really enjoyed our stay and they have a great breakfast in the morning too.  We would stay there again.

So I rolled into this hotel to spend 2 nights for a wine pouring event nearby.  From the moment I arrived the staff was attentive and helpful.  There is a great outdoor patio area with tables. The breakfast which was included was more than just cereal and toast. Will DEFINETLY look for the Ayres brand in other cities if they are as good as this one.
Manager Response: Dear CALIson73,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. I am pleased to read that you enjoyed our attentive team, complimentary full American breakfast, as well as our outdoor patio area. We certainly hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel is clean and quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast has a variety and the food tastes good. The fitness room is well maintained and stocked with towels. There is a public golf course across the street. It is less than 10 minutes from CSU Long Beach and 5 minutes from the beach.
Manager Response: Dear Andy R,  Thank you for your kind and detailed review of Ayres Lodge Alpine. I am thrilled to read you had an enjoyable stay with us and do hope you will consider us again in the future. Thank you again for your time and generous rating!  Sincerely,  Larry Clark General Manager

Summary: I only stayed one night for business, but it had a very comfortable, quiet, and relaxing atmosphere.  The room was clean and inviting. Breakfast was a good variety of hot and cold items and seating was plenty.  I would return on my own dime if in the area again.
Manager Response: Dear MrMDriever,  I am glad that your business stay was a pleasant one at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! Thank you for your kind words and excellent rating. I do hope to have the honor of welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Bland on the outside but funky French colonial decor on the inside. Or something like that. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was perfectly clean and they provided the extra towels we needed for our little family. Beds were comfy. Breakfast was decent but nothing special. Choices and all seemed fresh.  Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear VallGray,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you. I am happy to read that you enjoyed plenty of extra amenities and you enjoyed our team member‚Äôs helpful and positive attitudes. I am flattered you would choose to stay with us again! Thank you again and happy traveling.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Our Wedding guest hotel- 20* rooms.The Staff was outstanding.
Summary: Stayed 2 nights to attend my daughters wedding. .Friends & Family visiting and it was a 3 day party atmosphere.  Comfortable rooms, fabulous breakfast. attentive staff. Close to shopping, and great restaurants was a plus. You won't be disappointed. Planning a wedding? Old Ranch Country Club. is highly recommended. Right down the street! Perfect.
Manager Response: Dear Lewis J,  Thank you for taking time to let us know how much fun you had during your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to read that we were able to accommodate your friends and family together for your daughter‚Äôs wedding! It is an honor to be a vital part of such an important chapter in their story. We hope to welcome many of you back!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We frequently stay at the Orange County Ayres properties and love this hotel.  We were blown away with the level of Service that the Seal Beach property provided to us over the weekend.  When we checked in, I asked if they would be making cookies later in the day or if they only do that M-Thurs, the front desk girl immediately said she would make come cookies just for us as a special request.  That was awesome!  She even called our room when they were ready.  I looked to buy a milk from their little snack area & they didn't sell any, so without me even asking, she ran into the breakfast room and came back with an ice cold cup of milk for our cookies.  Thank you for making our stay extra special this weekend.  The hotel itself it beautiful, but it's the amazing service that we
Manager Response: Dear Valued guest,  Many thanks for you warm words and the excellent rating of our hotel. I am happy to read that our front desk team was able to make your stay extra special with some of our freshly baked cookies. I do hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Beautiful,  comfortable,  quiet,  hospitable,  lovely, great  great breakfast, would stay again, love Ayers Hotel, fourth or fifth one I've stayed in with my husband, we had hoped it was closer to beach. ‚òÜ ‚ô° ‚òÜ ‚ô° ‚òÜ ‚ô°
Manager Response: Dear Janie C,  Thank you for being a valued guest of our Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to read that we exceeded your expectations and hope to see you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We visit family and friends in Long Beach, San Pedro and Orange County several times a year.  The Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach is a perfect central location for us.  The rooms are large, well appointed and clean.  The breakfast is very good and the room is spacious.  We will continue to stay here whenever in the area.

We have been staying at the Ayres in Seal Beach several times a year for five or six years now when visiting family in Long Beach. The facility is very nice and the staff are always most friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear Nancy K,  I am happy to read that you have been a valued guest of ours for some time now. It is a pleasure to read that our charm and comfort keep you coming back. We surely hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This was my 1st stay at the Ayres in Seal Beach.  I was there for work and family joined me on this trip. The staff were great and very helpful in providing directions and answering our questions.  Room was clean and nice area to get ready.  Free breakfast was great. Will be staying there again!
Manager Response: Dear Laurakv2016,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us an excellent review and score of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I am happy to know your business and family trip went so well! I do hope to see you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stay here when visiting our son in Long Beach. It's clean, comfortable, reasonably priced and very convenient to the beach cities and Orange County attractions (e.g., Disneyland, Knott's, and Angel Stadium). They serve a basic but satisfying hot breakfast (included in the room rate) and although the rooms and public areas are somewhat dated they are well cared for and not unattractive. The front desk staff are well trained and, while not overly friendly, are certainly hospitable and professional.

This is not my first review of this property. The Seal Beach Ayres continues to be our favorite So Cal stop. The service, the room, the location and the breakfast are always perfect. Keep it up because we'll be back!

This was my 2nd stay at the Ayres in Seal Beach; and, once again, I has relatives staying with me. What a nice, clean, comfortable place! Very welcoming, from the inviting coziness of the front lobby area to the spacious rooms & great beds. I had a handicap -accessible room, and it was the best-designed & appointed one I've had anywhere. It was obvious that a lot of thought went into its design! What a nice, friendly staff - and the check-in/check -out process couldn't have been any smoother.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

We stayed 9 days because our house was in repair....hotel very clean...convenient to beach, shopping & restaurants of different price ranges & choices.  Happy hour was very nice to have but should be more days.  Breakfast fine.  It worked great for us.  Would highly recommend.

The best part of my visit was the breakfast and the good energy by the Chef. :) She obviously loves her job and it showed.   The hotel was well kept and was very pleasant for my business trip.  Clean, comfortable and centrally located for my trip.

VERY nice room... spacious, clean, quiet, ready early.  GREAT breakfast in the morning.  Would definitely stay here again.  The review says I have to have 200 characters so I'm going to just keep typing.  I don't think readers need anything more than "this is a very nice place, great value, and you'll most likely really enjoy it!"

Summary Heading: Only one complaint:  Difficult time sleeping because of under-window air conditioner cycling
Summary: Beautiful hotel.  Very nice room with comfortable king bed.  Hotel staff was wonderful.  Breakfast was great.  Pool was clean and warm.  Wonderful amenities in the hotel and surrounding area of Seal Beach.  Truly, our only complaint was the cycling of the air conditioner under the window made it difficult to sleep.  Our teenagers stayed in the room across the hall and said the air conditioner, which is mounted close to the ceiling above the doorway, seemed normal and was not noisy as it cycled on and off.  We would love to stay at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach again.  Next time, we'll try a different room without the under-window AC unit.

I stay here on a regular basis for business and pleasure. Have never had an issue. Good staff. Close to several good restaurants and all the other things Southern California has to offer. Short trip to quaint old town seal beach.

This hotel is very accessible from the freeway(405) but you hardly hear the freeway noise.  It is very convenient to restaurants, stores & grocery-shopping.  The room is very clean & cozy.  Bed is very comfortable.  We especially appreciate the refrigerator & microwave in the room, which are not available in other hotels anymore. Staff are very friendly, accommodating & courteous.  Hot breakfast is an added treat.  Since we moved out of the area, we have stayed at this hotel many times when we visit relatives & friends in Southern California.
Manager Response: Dear babot1952,  Thank you for your kind words and excellent rating of our hotel. I am happy that we were able to accommodate you during your last visit to Seal Beach. Thank you for your continued loyalty and I hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: I stayed here one night but would love to return. I found brand new comfortable mattresses in a very clean room. Nicely decorated, chairs and table with a large screen television.   There is no smell, very clean, including the lavatory facilities, which has a nice shower and lots of hot water.  The breakfast in the morning was excellent! With an assortment of eggs, breads, muffins, cereal,  bacon, sausage,  fruits, and juices. Of course coffee and tea is available.   The staff is friendly and courteous.   I highly recommend this Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Gene1955559,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your recent stay. I am pleased to read that we exceeded your expectations in terms of value, comfort, design, and complimentary amenities‚Äã. We look forward to your next stay!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Great location near many restaurants and shopping strip malls. Safe area. Exceptional hotel, clean, nice. Comfy beds and room. Breakfast was cooked on-going by a chef. Great pastries and variety for a complimentary breakfast. Would most definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear AlaskaSheri,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are thrilled to see that you enjoyed our optimal location, clean and comfortable accommodations, as well as our complimentary full American breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary Heading: good hotel, more business then family friendly
Summary: Nice hotel, located right off highway.  This hotel is more business friendly than family friendly, staff was very professional and really didn't get a cozy feeling.  Arrived earlier than check in and was told no rooms were available.  Overall the hotel is very clean and room are very spacious. Shopping plaza parking lot is located directly near the pool and hot tub.  Not a lot of privacy.

Fabulous European hotel. I love this place. I have come back here several times.  It is so comfortable. Very comfortable bed. Beautiful interiors. Reasonable price. Each room has a bed and sofa. Two mirrors so easy for two people to get ready. Wonderful Happy Hour. Wine and snacks or cokes if you want. Breakfast is delicious. Full cooked or cereal, rolls , toast, fruit. Just fabulous. Well maintained. Easy parking. Pleasant staff. Frequent flyer program. Close to seal beach. You can't walk, but a very close drive to the pier. You won't be disappointed. A+++ I will be back!! Beautiful pool and hot tub too.  Tables to eat breakfast for visit with people inside and outside. Close to restaurants and shops

Summary Heading: Elegant hotel, professional and kind staff
Summary: This is my first time staying at the Ayres Hotel, 3 days and 2 nights.  There's complimentary breakfast and courteous staff.  A nice pool and outdoor seating for dining or hanging out.  The staff provide a list of places to visit and by the distance.  It is just overall comfortable and stylish.  Clean too!  Highly recommend this ;)

We have stayed in several Ayres Hotels over the years. All are excellent in every way. The Seal Beach location has a very elegant, yet warm and homey atmosphere. Everything is top notch, at a very affordable rate, The staff are friendly, helpful, efficient. Breakfast is delicious. All of rooms are spacious, immaculately clean,and either has two queen beds or a king and a fold-out couch. Great for families and for meetings and events, They are simpley the best.

This is my second stay at this Seal Beach property and it has been great both times.  The staff followed through on requests we had, they were very helpful in finding restaurants, stores, etc...  It is next to the 405 but it never bothered us and the freeway made for easy access to get around.

Summary Heading: Clean, Well-maintained, Quiet, Friendly Service, Good Value
Summary: My young adult son and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We made a last-minute reservation so double queen beds were not available. Our room had a king bed with a sofa bed. The young man who readily converted the sofa into the second bed after check-in was most courteous and efficient. The front desk personnel at check-in and check-out were also excellent.  Our room was spacious, quiet (no noise from adjacent Seal Beach Blvd), and very well-maintained. The bathroom looked new even though I know this hotel has been here awhile. A full breakfast was included in the rate. With the hotel being nearly full, the breakfast room was very crowded and we had to wait for a table to clear. It was raining so outside seating was not an option. Other than the breakfast experience, I

Ideal location for my business trip; very comfortable and with friendly and courteous staff. The rooms are clean, well appointed and spacious. The location is near several very good restaurants, and easy access to the 405. I will be back!

Summary Heading: Nothing to write home about. If you are not a hard sleeper.... Or even an ok sleeper, probably not your best bet.
Summary: My room wasn't the best but you wouldn't get that from when I was charged.  After paying an extra fee for a patio access and larger room,The hotel was generous enough to  place next to what sounded like a plumbing closet which provided the ongoing sound of all hotel toilet flushing as well as the showers being engaged .
Manager Response: Dear Julianne S.,  Thank you for your informative review based on your stay at our hotel. I am disappointed to read that you did not enjoy the accommodations booked, however, invite you to return to better experience all that our hotel has to offer. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Located just 15 miles from John Wayne Airport.  I have used this hotel many times.  Very consistent and nice rooms.  This location on Seal Beach Blvd has easy access to the 405 Freeway, beach is a short drive down Seal Beach Blvd and multiple restaurants nearby.  No restaurant in the hotel but they do have a basic breakfast and happy hour.  I stay here as the price is often much better than some of the name brand in the area.

Usually a good place to stay, our stay was a little bit noisy, we were on the 2nd floor and could hear running upstairs in the room above. We had an iron that didn't work, took about 20 min for them to bring us a new one. Our phone didn't work in our room either. The shower next to ours was soo noisy, it sounded like it was in ours.
Manager Response: Dear Joann G.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and for your honest feedback following your recent stay. I am disappointed to read that you had the inconvenience of a phone which did not work as well as the noise you encountered in your room. I hope these minor inconsistencies do not deter you from returning as we would love the opportunity to really wow you. Thank you again for your review.  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: The rooms are spacious and clean. The Hotel is decorated so Lovely in French Style furniture and the art is amazing. The Staff are energetic and very accommodating. I will definitely be staying here next time I am in town.
Manager Response: Dear Battistemar,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your stay with us. I am pleased to read that we exceeded your expectations and I look forward to welcoming you back next time!   Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Overall, Solid hotel. Is next to the freeway though. Plus a lot random sounds happening throughout the hotel which made it a little difficult to sleep if you are a light sleeper like me. Besides that, great accommodation, customer service, pool, bathroom, extra.
Manager Response: Dear Samuel S.,  Thank you for your kind and informative review. I am pleased to read that we exceeded your expectations. Please do visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: This was a really nice surprise. I've passed the Ayres a million times, since I live in Southern California and it's right off the 405. I had to work late in the area, so shopped around and this was the best value. The room was really big, quiet and the staff was terrific (Sean at the front desk was particularly friendly and helpful). The views are not much, but everything else was top-notch, including the location (some restaurants in walking distance, and its proximity to the 405 is so easy). Also, a nice complimentary breakfast.

very nice hotel and convenient for my stay in Seal Beach.  There is no valet parking but plenty of parking so it wasn't too much of an issue.  Complementary breakfast was fresh and good.  Nice people, comfortable beds, nice sized room with everything I needed.

Third time staying at the Ayres. Always, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is always good. Next time will book a handicapped accessible room due to the low toilets and tub shower,  otherwise am very pleased with our stay.
Manager Response: Dear vkytwin,  Thank you for your excellent review and kind compliments regarding our accommodations and exclusive amenities. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Search for a city, hotel, etc.
Summary: Stayed the night in aKing size Balcony Room. Room and bed were very comfortable. Staff was excellent. We had paid for late checkout. Room was not quite ready when we checked in. Staff agreed to take off the late checkout charge. Will come back when staying in the area.

Summary Heading: High Expectations - passable, but slightly dissappointing
Summary: Location: On hwy - ask for back side if you are noise sensitive. Room:  Average, clean but walls too thin - can hear people showering. Staff:  Staff and Valets - wonderful, some of the women ok, some snooty. Free Breakfast:  A little above average, someone will make you an omelets but don't have a huge variety - the rest is normal Hampton/Holiday Inn Faire. Appetizers M-W:  Not worth dropping in for except the wine, beer - veggies, dips and chips - nothing great.  Restaurants:  Great nearby - California Kitchen, Paneras, Sbux, misc good stuff Shopping:  ALOT Need a hair cut? I lucked out and found someone wonderful right out the back side of the Ayres.  Anita Allison @ Sanctuary - she and her staff are wonderful.

I attended a funeral with my mother-in-law and our room was very comfortable and roomy.  We had plenty of space between our beds and for relaxing.  The bed was comfortable and everything was well maintained.  The location was very convenient.

Summary Heading: good, comfortable hotel with EV charging availability
Summary: First time in this SoCal chain due to the availability of EV charging.  Turns out the online reviews are true - large room , great bed, good location, very helpful personnel.  Will definitely make this my go to options next time we visit SoCal

Convenient location, clean room, friendly staff, good breakfast, and modest exercise room and pool/jacuzzi. It is what it is and delivers a 3 star hotel experience. I think for the price, you get what you pay for. We enjoyed our stay and got to visit various restaurants nearby. The microwave, mini fridge, and coffee maker are a perfect addition to the room.

large room , great bed, good location, very helpful personnel a little disappointed not having wine & cheese in the afternoon==stayed at the Redlands Ayers about 3 years ago and had wine & cheese then and it very nice Over all a very nice Upscale Hotel and very pleasant personnel . We try to stay at an Ayers Hotel every chance we can.

We really enjoyed our visit at the Seal Beach Ayres. The lobby was warm and inviting. The decorations for Christmas were lovely! The staff was helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included and yummy! I highly recommend staying here when attending a concert at Spaghettini across the street.

Summary Heading: Waste stay for new year eve!!!
Summary: We had booked this hotel a month ago as we had tickets for new year eve at the Spaghettini, Vincent Ingala was perfoming. Yes we had a good time there. We returned to Ayres around 1:00 AM, we had the room on the first floor, 146. Which is next to the boiler room and laundry room. There was so much noise we had hard time falling asleep. Do not accept room on the first floor from 138 to 150. Trust me you will not sleep. I gave one star for breakfast only; poor service too

We were staying at the Ayers Hotel over Christmas visiting family.  This is our third stay at this hotel and absolutely love it. The rooms are nicely decorated, very clean, staff is friendly and very helpful, plus you receive a nice breakfast which is included in the price.  Great place!
Manager Response: Dear Jane M.,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you during your Christmas vacation! I am pleased to read that we are your home away from home when in the area. Our entire team humbly welcomes your warm compliments and hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Quality/ price value is top. We stayed here to visit our daughter in CSULB and before leaving for Vegas. We didn't want to spent too much money on a hotel only for two nights. But this hotel is worth more. We stayed in 4* hotels in long beach that are rated much higher but that are less than this hotel.  Pro's: the room was amazingly large: two queen beds with a separation between the two beds. Small but nice bathroom. Breakfast is also included in the price which makes everyone to go to breakfast and makes it crowdy (a bit too).  The hotel has a nice terrace and a nice pool area.  It is close to the center, to the shopping mall and to the highway.  Cons: there is only one guy to handle the breakfast (as well the food as the area). Although he's doing an amazing job, it's just
Manager Response: Dear family-van-der-Berg,  Many thanks for the kind compliments you have shared about our hotel. We appreciate the time you took to let us know that we are doing a good job. We look forward to your next stay!  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Traveled to southern California on business-- my normal routine is to stay in Huntington Beach, but meeting times demanded that I be closer to work, so I took a chance on Ayres and was very pleasantly surprised.  I'm usually pretty picky about hotels and the Ayres turned out to be great.  As you drive up, you find a classy, well kept property, easy to find, and very close to access to freeways.  Inside I'd swear I stepped into a high-class London hotel-- paintings on the walls, wallpaper, clean, and bright.  Check in area has a nice sitting lounge, hallways were spotless (*no dirty carpets here).  Room was excellent-- roomy, bright, high ceilings, and what looked like new furnishings.  I was worried about road noise, as I was on the freeway side, but no problems!  Even with the

This is the first time we give Ayres a try and  the place was spotless. Front desk staff is very friendly and welcoming. While we didn't spend too much time in the hotel, other than sleeping, it left a great impression on us! The service at the breakfast in the morning, was amazing. There was a good variety of food to choose from.  The rooms were beautifully decorated and clean.   The hotel is next to major highways and about 2 miles from the beach front, and about 30 miles from the center of Los Angeles.  We will definitely stay here again when visiting the area, and would recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Yocasta,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your outstanding stay! I am pleased to see you found your stay convenient and relaxing. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Service was good, room was booked for three people so had queen bed and sofa bed which had not been made up. The room was clean and had fridge, coffee machine etc. Plenty of towels, overlooked a courtyard. Bar and restaurant excellent and very helpful staff. We were staying overnight as we were taking a cruise ship next day.
Manager Response: Greetings Kay,  Thank you for your review concerning your recent stay. Our team works diligently to provide top-notch service and accommodations to each of our guests and are always ecstatic when we know we have exceeded a guest's expectations. We truly hope to see you back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Our daughter lives in Rossmore, so we visit quite often and stay at the Ayres Hotel. It is very. Lean, has great complimentary breakfasts, and is just a nice home away from home. It is central to many Southern California attractions: the Pacific Aquarium, Angel Stadium, Disneyland, and Knotts Berry Farm, to name a few. The staff is very cordial and will take care of your needs.
Manager Response: Hello Iynkse,  Thank you for your amazing review of our hotel! I am delighted to see that you found our accommodations well-appointed and tidy. We love being considered our guests' home away from home! Please come back to see us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I just stayed one night.  The hotel was sold out but I never heard any noise from anyone in the rooms around me.  Beautiful room.  Quiet and comfortable.  All I want in a hotel room. Top notch.  I will be back.

I don't know how old this hotel is, but appears new. Clean, not beat up. Staff was as nice as they could be. Central location for us. 15 min or so to Knott's and 5 minutes, if that to Seal Beach. Maybe 10 min to Huntington and Long Beach. Right off the freeway. Easy to find for a tourist.  Nice breakfast included, nothing fancy, but saves a few bucks for sure. Kinda old Euro style appointments, kinda odd, kinda cool. We liked it. We also thought it was a good value looking at other places in the vicinity. Nice outside eating area with gas fireplace. Pool and hot tub normal hotel type. I will recommend it to my friends

Lynell and Madison, corporate sales, and the entire staff went out of their way to make sure we at Women's Council of Realtors California Retreat "experience" was excellent.  The hotel is a bit older but aging gracefully, lovely suite and large rooms, food was great!  We had a great time and the staff worked with us at on every level.  Great time and experience.

Very accommodating staff. Great morning buffet. Close to expressway, but not noisy. Rooms were very spacious with a Queen bed, couch, and desk. Bath was separate from the lav. Would definitely stay here again if I had to be in the area.

Very nice clean hotel. Recommended. Lots of sodas, and coffee for breakfast and evening, but no water.  Air conditioning was either high fan cold air or had to be turned off.  This is the dumbest thing: requiring 200 characters...

Summary Heading: Not on the beach,  but 1st class
Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights during a conference.   If there is any faults to find, all I would say is its not on the beach.  Thats the only thing that could make it better.   The neighborhood was nothing great.  But the stay was fabulous.  The bed was amazing.  The lobby was welcoming. The staff was very attentive.   Im usually a beach view hotel guy.  However, they won me over.  And considering everything is so close.  Beach is 4 miles away.  The night life of long beach is 20 mins away.  The Hotel is easily accessible from the freeway.  Makes it easy to come and go.  Price was super reasonable.   The fitness room worked out, but is very small.  I wished it was open 24 hours.  And you have to hope no one is there.  Only 1weight machine,  1 bike, and 1 treadmill.  I was alone, so

We were wonderfully surprised on the elegance of this hotel, its rooms and outside spaces. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was the largest and best prepared we have been to in an hotel. A muststay if we are in this area again.

Summary Heading: One of our favorite Hotel chains
Summary: This location was a little smaller than previous one in Costa Mesa, but just as clean and comfortable with great decor.  Loved having the free parking and close promimity to beaches and Huntington where we visited relatives.  The hot breakfast was great with plenty of food choices and indoor and outdoor seating.  The beds are the most comfortable of any we've experienced and extremely important with my husband's bad back!  Only problem we had was the second day when we returned they had not refurbished our towel supply and when we called the front desk, we had to go down to pick them up.  We would definitely stay again.

This hotel was quite clean, the bed was super comfortable, the bathroom spacious. No views to speak of and right off the highway, it's convenient and I didn't notice any highway noise. Not too far from the beach.  If your are visiting Leisure World, it's great too. My only complaint would be the hot, stuffy elevator and hallways. I was impressed by the fact that in the rooms even though the drapes were right on top of the air conditioner (a common hotel issue) the Ayres had install a guard for the drapes so that the air conditioning didn't simply flow up into the drapes but actually into the room.  A good idea for every hotel with this problem and the first time I had seen this feature.

Summary Heading: Overnight Stay for the perfect Birthday Re-Proposal
Summary: Wanna send a special thanks to Joe for helping me make this a memorable stay for me and my wife. We had reservations at Spaghettinis and did not want to drive back to Riverside after a night of drinking so we decided to stay at this hotel. It was my wife's birthday and we didn't have a normal wedding, just went to court house, so I wanted to create a first time proposal and get down on one knee...called Ayres spoke to Joe she assured me they could get the champagne but I'd have to deliver the flowers myself. Due to my work schedule I couldn't get over there so I had 4 dozen roses delivered. I don't remember the name of the woman who set my room up but it was phenomenal. My wife was surprised and brought to tears. Our stay, though short was definitely memorable. Nice hotel, the

This property has lots of character. The bed was by far the most comfortable I've experienced. Room was spacious and very clean. Hot breakfast better than average, actually it was good. Pool was nice, plenty of onsite parking.  I like the idea of being green conscious by shutting lights down when exiting room.

We stayed at the Ayres for a reunion. Loved the ambience. The beds were comfortable. The service was great. The complimentary breakfast was better than most of the hotels I have ever stayed in. Additionally, we enjoyed the inside and outside seating areas to eat. The staff was polite and very responsive. The location was fantastic with easy access on and off 405. I highly recommend this the Ayres as one of the best bang for the buck for your stay.

After being oceans apart from my wife for 4 months we stayed here for a night and were not impressed. Check in was average and the Front Desk Agent lacked personality. Didn't like the way he demonstrated how to turn the power on and felt he did not listen to us. Placed us in a room with 2 queens nice and close to the main road. Breakfast was complimentary and I did like the coffee and bagel selection. For what we paid we won't be rushing back.
Manager Response: Dear Brendan88,  Thank you for taking the time to review regarding your recent experience at our hotel. It is very out of character for our team to deliver anything less than exceptional service. I am truly apologetic that your stay was not up to par. The freeway can be bothersome to those sensitive to noise and I only hope that we can put our best foot forward with you in the future. Thank you again for your honest feedback. We hope to serve you again, should return to the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel with an excellent staff. They were very helpful & pleasant. Excellent location, with easy access to both Orange & L.A. counties. The room was pleasant, beds were comfortable. I would book a stay again.

This is a typical 3 star american hotel. Features complimentary breakfast, and cute courtyard next to the pool. Rooms are a bit larger, with separate toilet/shower but open sink and vanity. Our standard room featured two queen beds with a mini fridge.

The room was beautifully decorated and well maintained.  I can't remark about any of the other things the hotel has to offer because I didn't use any of them.  I was there to be close to Leisure World, where I spent most of my time with a family member during her last days. The housekeeping team was considerate towards my privacy.  I was only there a few days, and I didn't need their services.  They did a good job on getting my room ready for me, and I'm sure they did the same for the people taking any of the rooms at this hotel. I was not interested in using the pool, but there was a sign at the check in desk stating the pool would be closed for 2 days for maintenance.  If the pool is an important thing on your list, call ahead and make sure it will be available for your stay

We arrived late on Friday night and the hotel was warm and inviting. I had worried that it might be a tad worn down due to some of the photographs on trip advisor, but I worried in vain. The hotel was in perfect shape. Our room was large, blemish free, and comfortable. The toilet and shower were behind the bathroom door, leaving the sink and counter in the alcove which made getting ready a breeze. The refrigerator in the room was large and fit our drinks and snacks easily and the microwave worked well.   Our room was facing the pool and I wasn't woken up at all that first night. I slept very well on the comfortable queen sized bed. I usually wake up multiple times a night in a new hotel and was pleasantly surprised when I didn't. That really doesn't happen often. The pool is a

Summary Heading: How to have the perfect vacation. Stay at the Ayers.
Summary: I had my Grandson stay here with his wife and two children. I use this Hotel whenever I want guests to have a really comfortable, nice place as opposed to  my small condo. They had traveled from Florida and were tired and when they checked in and went to their accommodations all tiredness disappeared when they saw that pool right outside their door. They enjoyed the very special breakfast and service from the staff.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel BUT THERE IS ONE BIG COMPLAINT
Summary: My wife and I are staying here from Sept 1st to the 7th and it is a great hotel.  The reason we would never come back is that the workout room is a joke with only 3 machines (no elliptical).  When we made the reservation we mistakenly looked at photos from a different Ayres that showed a beautiful workout room.  It would be a good idea if they got affiliated with a health club in the area where guests could go and work out.  If they had that we would definitely come back but without that, we would never come back.  James and Yvette Sutera
Manager Response: Dear jimmyyvette,  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you!  We are saddened to read that your current stay does not meet your expectations because of our fitness center. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to let us know these details as we use our guests' experiences as a tool to continually improve our property. We do hope that if you are in the area again, you will choose us so that we may demonstrate to you the level of service we are known for.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We spent just one night, as we were in town for a wedding reception and needed to get home the next day.  Wish we could have stayed longer.  The rooms are very well appointed with nice bathroom area.  The breakfast was much better than the average hotel buffet.  The location is convenient and close to many good restaurants, shopping and Seal Beach, which also has good restaurants and a nice beach.
Manager Response: Dear CarolOD,  We are delighted to read that your stay was enjoyable. We appreciate your kind words and hope to see you back in the near future. Thank you for taking the time to submit a review detailing your stay!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: "A TRUE GEM IN SEAL BEACH WITHOUT ANY HIDDEN COST"
Summary: My Wife & I spend 3 wonderful nights at this hotel which included free parking and free WIFI.The rooms were clean and spacious and very quiet and the beds were very comfortable.Every morning we had their free breakfast w/eggs,homefries sausage,ham and everything but the kitchen sink....The staff was excellent and the hotel is only a few miles from downtown Main Street in Seal Beach....which is a MUST to anyone visiting that area in southern California.....Plenty of shops & restaurants and a beautiful beach to awaits you in seal beach. Next time we are back in Seal Beach this is the hotel of choice....Great price....Great Place...and NO HIDDEN EXTRAS!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Dear BOJOWILLIAM,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us! We are thrilled to read that our team was able to accommodate your requests and are especially happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope you will choose to stay with us again in the future. Thank you again for your time in reviewing your stay.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Visited this hotel just for one night. Lovely decor in the main areas as well as the rooms. Nice pool area and gym. Good breakfast included. Excellent service. Would definitely stay again and would recommend for a longer stay. Had a mixture of holiday as business visitors.
Manager Response: Dear Katy O,  We greatly appreciate your review regarding your recent stay with us. We are always looking for ways to grow and improve and sincerely appreciate your honest feedback. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope you will return soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Great hotel, great staff and wonderful breakfast. Had a nice room near a fountain with outside patio. It was perfect for my husband, sons and I. Big room with partial wall between queen beds. Was perfect for our family. Moved our son to Long Beach and needed to stay one night.  Will stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Lindsey M,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us! Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed as our entire team works tirelessly to provide an exceptional stay for each guest. We hope you find your way back to our hotel any time you are in Seal Beach!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Staff was very courteous and friendly. Room was clean and smelled nice. They employ a "energy saving system" in the room which requires you to place your room key in a slot to keep the lights, TV and A/C on. So when you return to your room from your work day, It takes a little bit of time for the room to cool down. Not a big deal. Just thought it was worth mentioning. Other than that, Great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Mike447,  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed yourself during your recent stay. We hope you will come back and stay again next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Family Holiday to Seal Beach California
Summary: The hotel was lovely and spacious and was exactly what we wanted, breakfast was included and the staff where very helpful.  We would definitely use this hotel again when going out to California.  The hotel was about half an hour away from most of the usual attractions e.g Disneyland and Knotts Berty Farm.
Manager Response: Dear Tarathomas231,  It is truly great to hear that you had an enjoyable stay at our property. We appreciate your kind words and hope that you will stay with us again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed 3 nights on 3rd floor. Quiet, comfortable, enjoying. The breakfast was very good. If you complain about it, then you are a very picky eater. They cook the buffet style eggs, hash browns, pancakes, French toast, sausage in front of you. Plus, there is pastries, bagels, English muffins, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, juice, coffee. There is only 1 thing I would have changed, when you put the "do not disturb" on the door, the maid came in to clean. Maybe a different sign needs to be enforced. This really didn't bother me, but might bother others. THANK YOU FOR a very nice stay!
Manager Response: Dear blueyesnurs13,  We greatly appreciate your review regarding your recent stay with us. We are always looking for ways to grow and improve and sincerely appreciate your honest feedback. Thank you for choosing to stay with us and we hope you will return soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel with great large rooms
Summary: Our stay here was terrific.  The hotel staff was so friendly and very helpful.  We loved the large room which was comfortable and extremely clean.  The breakfast was fantastic and included many items to choose from and the best part was that the eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, and hash browns were fresh and cooked right there.  The cook made fresh pancakes for me instead of the usual ones you get in other hotels.The bed was comfortable with soft sheets.  This hotel included a happy hour with wines, beers, and snacks.  My thank you to the staff for making our stay delightful.
Manager Response: Dear Diane W,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us! We are thrilled to read that our team was able to accommodate your requests and are especially happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope you will choose to stay with us again in the future. Thank you again for your time in reviewing your stay.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We chose to stay here as it was handy  to the 405 Seal beach and csulb where our daughter is  studying.   Comfortable bed. Good linen. Quiet well appointed room. The breakfast was good, staff friendly and helpful.  We also enjoyed a few hours by the pool and appreciated there were plenty of towels.  Carparking as also good.
Manager Response: Dear SouthPacificTravellr,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am delighted to see that your room was perfect for your needs and that you were able to enjoy our exclusive complimentary full American breakfast we serve each morning for our guests. We hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Everything was okay but not  a nice as our  last couple visits.  The  hotel was very full so that  may have been why.  But the little extra touches  that make this a boutique  hotel just were not there this time. Plastic throw away glasses  in the bathroom instead  of the glass th used to be there.  Breakfast  was loud and  crowded and they ran out of some  selections.  There  was not enough staff to keep up with the  crowd.
