The folks  that were working  were working really hard and  did a great  job, just nit  enough  staff to keep  up with the  full hotel.The healthy choices  previously  such as granola  was  replaced with sugary cereal.  Again just the little things...but therefore  just an average stay
Manager Response: Dear Tracyf5,  We would first like to thank you for taking the time to submit this review concerning your recent stay. We would like to apologize for any and all issues you had with our exclusive breakfast. I would like you to be informed that I have taken the necessary steps to ensure this does not occur again. Please rest assured that your experience was an isolated occurrence and that our entire team would love another opportunity to improve your view of our hotel.  Sincerely,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Breakfast is M-F from 6-9. Eggs, pancakes, potatoes, yogurt, pastries, cereal, coffee (they even have hazelnut and French vanilla creamer, too! :-))  Happy hour from 4-6. Chips and salsa, veggies and ranch, beer and wine.   Best about the first two things? Included in the price!!! :-)  Room was nice and big. Lots of counter space in the bathroom (huge plus since we had a group of girls).  Staff was VERY friendly and helpful.   Would definitely stay here again.

This hotel, a European boutique hotel, really did capture that feeling. It was so nicely decorated with art and antiques. Everything was clean, and the employees were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was generous and offered both hearty and healthy options. The pool area did not have an adequate supply of towels, however. Overall, it was a lovely place to stay.

Summary Heading: Terrific hotel with best breakfast ever!
Summary: I've been staying at this hotel for several years now and here are the reasons I keep coming back:  * The staff, the staff, the staff, the staff - they are all wonderful from the front desk folks, to housekeeping, to the maintenance worker, to the kitchen staff who provide breakfast * The awesome breakfasts - for free! We're not talking cellophane wrapped muffins and bananas here - we're talking a full breakfast with eggs, pancakes, bacon, potatoes, French toast, fresh fruit and good coffee * The cleanliness and comfort of the rooms * The pool and jacuzzi  * The great location close to shops, Seal Beach, Long Beach, restaurants My only suggestion is to get new desk chairs that are adjustable and allow you to actually reach the desk without looking like a little kid in a

Summary Heading: One of my favorite hotels ever!
Summary: Don't let the three stars fool you.   This place is first class.  Beautifully decorated and maintained,  this hotel is a good home base for exploring Orange County.  They have a great breakfast buffet,  too.   They've paid close attention to every detail,  and everything is fantastic!

Room was nice and clean.  Comfortable bed, good breakfast.  Tip:  If you drive out the back of the hotel, it is easier to go south on seal beach bvd.  Close to a lot of stores and restaurants, but only two within close walking distance.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place for an anniversary trip
Summary: Great pool, felt like we had it to ourselves during the week. We stayed tuesday to thursday and it was awesome, had a evening cocktail reception AND breakfast each morning!! Hot tub was awesome, rooms were clean, the King Suite was wonderful. And there are some amazing restaurants walking distance.

Great hotel.....super clean....up to date....well maintained.  Breakfast, evening finger food / beverages was excellent.  Rooms are well furnished.....nice sized......bed very comfortable.  Ample parking...shopping within walking distance.  Staff were friendly.

Summary Heading: Get away from a crazy neighborhood 4th of July
Summary: Room was nice, amenities seemed fine, we were only there to get away for a nice and quiet escape from our neighborhood 4th of July block party. We stayed on the second floor however the booking staff felt the need to place a family of mammoths directly above us and it seemed as if the ceiling was gonna collapse at any moment. So the nice and quiet was a complete failure. Also the water pressure on the shower was horrible. Water comes out of a coffee maker faster, and more forceful. Other than that stay was fine. Staff was friendly, and hotel and grounds appeared to be well kept and clean. Not sure I'd go back without making sure I was on the top floor.

This hotel feels so homey, welcoming and it was designed with sustainability in mind. Nice size room, comfortable bed, not just talk about conservation when it is the in thing to do, but it is the way they do business. Whenever I can I stay in the one in Seal Beach
Manager Response: Dear Michel,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. We are happy to hear you found our accommodations were fitting and hope that we will see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Clean, reasonable price for area, great breakfast, good location, good people. I would highly recommend this hotel. Not your typical hotel in this price range. Has pretty much everything you would need for a family vacation.
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer,  It is truly great to hear that you had an enjoyable stay at our property. We appreciate your kind words and hope that you will return stay with us again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We only stayed for a night, but it was wonderful. Good shower pressure, comfy beds and plenty of space.  The hotel is conveniently located off the 405. (We had a room facing the exit ramp and there wasn't any issues with noise.) Plenty of parking for guests. The staff was absolutely wonderful. I put in a request for an earlier check in because my friend and I had a wedding to get ready for. They made sure that they could honor my request and even called to check that the room was to our liking. Also, breakfast was delicious!   There is also a pool, hot tub, and an outdoor fireplace. Didn't get a chance to use any of these amenities. It looked very relaxing.  Definitely would stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us! We are thrilled to read that our team was able to accommodate your requests and are especially happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We hope you will choose to stay with us again in the future. Thank you again for your time in reviewing your stay.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach while visiting LA recently.  Very large/comfortable rooms, great service and friendly staff.  Enjoyed the complementary breakfast and afternoon drinks and snacks. Very competitive room rates and would definitely stay here again when I visit LA again.
Manager Response: Dear Steve,  It is truly humbling to see that we have gained another loyal guest. We are honored that you enjoyed a relaxing stay with us and we certainly hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Very nice room, with great amenities. Only thing lacking was a better shower head, more consistent water pressure and the energy efficiency, which requires a card to turn on lights and Air System. After a long day, returning to a sty-fulling room temperature was not very pleasant. Breakfast was awesome and very satisfying. Comfortable bedding and pillows. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Peter,  We greatly appreciate your review regarding your recent stay with us. We are always looking for ways to grow and improve and sincerely appreciate your honest feedback regarding improvements we can make. Thank you for choosing to stay with us, we hope you will return soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We had an excellent stay. The hotels ambiance was pleasant and relaxing as soon as you enter. Staff was very attentive and cheerful, meeting the smallest request with honest concern. Our room was spacious and clean. The bed was so comfortable I completely overslept and missed my first days breakfast, a feat which I usually unlikely to happen with my internal clock waking me early each day.  Breakfast was satisfying and plentiful. Parking and access around the hotel was convenient. Looking forward to returning again when the opportunity might allow- thank you Ayres staff and management!

The European Boutique-inspired room was spotless, fresh, roomy and so, so quiet. Tiny issues were dealt with immediately by a friendly, dark-suited manager within 5 minutes, including providing last minute, quality champagne flutes. All amenities worked perfectly and quietly.  Hotel could've made a mint if provided an honor bar of drinks and snacks.  LG TV/channels and iHome iPod player were nice touches. Marble floors and bathroom /shower/fixtures were quality.   Morning complimentary hot breakfast was beyond amazing. 24 hour calls to front desk were prompt, courteous and helpful.    Heated pool and fireplaced courtyard were sooo relaxing.   Impress someone!   I'd recommend Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach, to Family And Royalty.

First-rate hotel.  Courteous, friendly, responsive staff.  Amenities commendable: specifically, parking, breakfast, wifi services.  As a frequent business traveler to the Los Angeles area, the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach is my first choice.  Strongly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your kind words. We are happy to hear that you found our luxurious accommodations to be fitting of your needs and we are honored to be considered your first choice when returning to the area. Looking forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Value for the Price
Summary: Spent this last weekend at the Ayres Seal Beach and it was relaxing, convenient and worth the value.  The pool was very relaxing and the breakfasts in the morning were delicious and first rate. This is the third year in a row staying at this property and we have never been disappointed.  Staff efficient, courteous and pleasant to deal with.
Manager Response: Dear Randall,  Thank you for your kind words regarding your stay. We are delighted to see that you found our value fitting of your needs. We hope that you will be back again next year!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The room was very nice and the staff was great. Our last night we sat out in the courtyard and decided we would like the gas fireplace lit. The concierge came out immediately and lit It for us and we had a great evening.  The towels were nice and fluffy, which is important to me.  Got great suggestions for local restaurants (and we love Seal Beach!). The free breakfast was really good - loved the scrambled eggs with spinach and peppers.

We stayed one night in Seal Beach while visiting family. We wanted to be close to Cal State campus and easy drive to the beach areas. So we picked this hotel based on its location, having no idea what a really great property it is. Room was large, nice sitting area, fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Bathroom with shower/tub combo, plenty of room in vanity/sink area. Comfortable bed, good A/C. Nice breakfast included, pleasant breakfast room and attractive adjacent courtyard. Our only contact with staff was at the front desk, and they were efficient, friendly and very helpful. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in the area.

Very nice, well maintained hotel.  Quiet when I was there 6/19 and 20.  Great room, efficient climate that you control.  The breakfast is terrific!  Spaghettini and Kobe Steakhouse across the street. I would definately stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are happy to hear that you enjoyed yourself during your recent stay. We hope you will come back and stay again next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Nice property, located by everything you need, quick freeway access, stores, restaurants. We came to explore Seal Beach and PCH beach communities and was great. Hotel was clean, large rooms, friendly staff.....breakfast was exceptional, you don't find a hot, freshly made complimentary breakfast anymore, no dried up donuts and weak coffee here. Kudo's to staff employee's Angel and Sean for great customer service!! Thanks for a great stay, we would recommend this property and will be back.
Manager Response: Dear Marsha,  It is truly a pleasure to hear that our location was conducive with your needs during your recent stay. We hope that you will be back again soon to for another stay!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect combination of price and quality
Summary: I travel often to Seal Beach for business and always try to stay at Ayres. The service is always friendly, rooms are nice, breakfast is plentiful, and the price is right. I would highly recommended for both business and personal stays.

Had never stayed at Ayers hotels but have noticed them while in CA. This hotel was very nice and within my budget. Lately staying within the business budget has been difficult. It is clean with a nice front desk staff. Decor is nice. The rooms were large with a good size bathroom, a couch,table chairs and desk. There is a small workout room but it worked perfectly. Breakfast was included and was a step above most free breakfasts. It seemed fresh and wasn't bland. The patio and garden was relaxing with trimmed shrubs and plenty of seating. There are several restaurants with in walking distance. I was pleasantly surprised. I will be back.

Loved the decor and the breakfast was the best we've had! Room was spacious and very clean - nice touch having a refridgerator in the room. Customer service was great - only minus is no towels for the pool!

The room was spacious and well-furnished with attractive furniture, including a very comfortable bed.  The location is in a nice neighborhood next to the freeway exit. The freeway noise was audible, but it didn't affect my sleep. The noise that did keep me up came from the room downstairs, which had a party that lasted past 2:30am on Saturday night. At first I thought there were parties on both sides of me, but the same sounds came from both walls.  Both wired and wireless Internet were fast and reliable.  The hotel staff was courteous.

Summary Heading: This was my second time staying at Ayres seal beach! We stayed for 3 nights!
Summary: My experience at Ayres was simply wonderful. They have great breakfast, room is spacious and quiet, the hotel is in a safe convenient location, wifi available, staffs are nice and welcoming, parking is free, and hotel is nicely decorated. The rooms are quiet and peaceful. I stayed in the second floor by the elevator but I did not hear any elevator sound which was great.  We had a great time there. My friends who came with me numerously said the hotel was so nice. Especially we really like their breakfast! homemade French toast was my favorite.

Hotel is excellent-staff attentive, room perfect and breakfast delicious. Great location to enjoy the Long Beach area-the ocean, dining/restaurants; pool and spa refreshing.. actauly a hotel WI-FI that works without problems

Room was very clean, bed and linens were high quality. Good soundproofing so I didn't feel the people in the next room were in my room. I had a ground floor with a patio that lead to a larger patio area with a sitting area and outdoor fire place which I liked. Cigar smokers take note, a nice place to enjoy a cigar and libation if so moved. Strong wifi, nice staff, and from what I saw the breakfast is first rate.

I stayed in the Seal Beach location and it exceeded my expectations.  Staff was efficient and friendly, hotel was exceptionally clean, breakfast buffet was well stocked and had several different items to please everyone in my family.  I will only stay here from now on when I visit Seal Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Linda,  It is a delight to read that you had an enjoyable stay. We are always more than thrilled to hear that we are gaining another loyal guest! We hope we see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Check in and checkout was a breeze, wifi strong, room very comfortable (albeit a little gaudy, but that's the decor of this place) and super quiet. Definitely a great place to get some good sleep before 'show time'.   Add to it a quick breakfast that is included with the stay while you wait for your cab, and the experience couldn't have been smoother.  There is a country club less than a mile away where many business functions and weddings are held. Don't try walking though, because even though the address puts it at less than a mile away, the entrance to the facility is much further, and not something you would want to brave in high heels or formal attire.  I will definitely be back.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We are glad to see that we have gained another loyal guest! We hope you will be back soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The rooms are so big & nice and the beds very comfortable!   Check in/out was simple!  Staff was very friendly and very helpful!   The breakfast was very good!   The location was exactly what we needed for a wedding close by.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your kind words. We are delighted to read that you found your stay at our property to be easy and efficient. Come visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I found the hotel to be super comfortable with a nice layout. The location was great by restaurants, supermarket, and drug stores right off the freeway. The full course breakfast was a great start in the morning. The only draw back was the high price of a soft drink if you wanted one. The hotel itself had a nice homey plush feeling to it.
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl,  We are delighted to read that your stay was enjoyable. We appreciate your kind words and hope to see you back in the future. Thank you again!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Many places close by to eat and relax.  The room was immaculate and the furnishing are phenomenal.  The property was well maintained and clean.  Good lighting in the parking lot.  The only hiccup we had was in the elevator.  We got stuck between floors for a short time and when the elevator started again it was confused so we went up and down a couple of times before the door opened so we could exit the elevator.  Did not report this to the front desk as the stay was great besides that.  Would recommend to family and friends.

Summary Heading: Easy check-in/check-out, lots of space, nice breakfast
Summary: Front desk was great... we arrived late and had easy check-in. Room size was large, with a sitting area. We printed for free from the computer in the lobby, which really helped. Hot breakfast was good, with standard choices and cereal, open until 10am on the weekend. We ate outside. Free parking and free internet. I would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  From our entire team, we would like to thank you for your kind words. We are happy to see that we have gained another loyal guest. We hope to see you again in the near future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Great service, quiet room.  Delicious, fresh-cooked breakfast.
Summary: Great access to 405 and 605.  Needed a place to stay near Seal Beach to meet with friends and enjoy dinner in Huntington Beach.  Didn't check in until after 10pm, but Front Desk staff were pleasant and efficient.  Breakfast was delish! and checkout was easy.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us some insight concerning your recent stay. Your kind words are greatly appreciated. We hope that you will come stay with us again next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay at Seal Beach Ayres Hotel Memorial Weekend-Awesome Stay
Summary: This is our third stay at the Ayres hotel. All of our stays have been fabulous so when return to Socal we always return to the Ayres Hotel. The hotel is very cozy and very clean. I like the vintage decorations of the rooms and all the rooms we have had so far are very very roomy. The customer service was fantastic and they were very accommodating. Their breakfast is one of the best for most hotels. Although this was right of the freeway, you cannot hear the freeway noise. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is truly humbling to hear that we are gaining another loyal guest! From our entire team, we would like to say thank you for the kind compliments. We hope you will stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This is a very nice and clean boutique hotel.  Staff is excellent and friendly and the room are clean and roomy.  Really enjoyed our short stay.  I would recommend this hotel to any one that is visiting.
Manager Response: Dear Gayle,  Thank you so much for your kind compliments! We are happy to see that you enjoyed yourself while staying at our property. We certainly hope you will visit us again, should you return to the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotel on Seal Beach Blvd. is an excellent place to stay when visiting the Long Beach, Seal Beach or Orange County area.  The staff; Kelly, Michael, Sean and more were always helpful and friendly.  The room and all facilities were clean.  If you needed a restaurant recommendation they had it and they could quickly give you directions to a nearby beach.  I hope I get to visit them again and enjoy the area more than ever.
Manager Response: Dear Timothy,  Our entire team appreciates your kind compliments. We hope that you will continue to stay with us for any future trips to the area. Thank you again for your time in reviewing your stay.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Several family members stayed at this hotel for the CSULB graduation/Family Reunion. We had a wonderful time.  Hotel is centrally located to close beach, shopping, restaurants and fun.  The great complementary breakfast was a great start to each day. I'll stay again next time I'm here.
Manager Response: Dear Cynthia,  We are thrilled to read that we were able to accommodate you during the graduation and family reunion event you attended. We hope you will continue to stay with us for any future trips to the area. Thank you again for the kind words.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Convenient location, with great food options nearby (even walking distance).  Good parking, and helpful staff.  But the room was very tired and in desparate need of a good update.  Mattress was so soft I felt it compressed 12 inches every time I sat on it.  Sofa was old, a bit musty, well worn, and generally not inviting to sit on.  Desk chair was the same.  No safe in room, so valuables had to be kept on me at all times.  Air conditioning thermostat had a mind of its own and regardless of how I set the temperature, it would come on and turn off only when temperatures went to extremes one way or the other.
Manager Response: Dear Steve,  We are saddened to read that your recent stay did not meet your expectations. We greatly appreciate you taking the time to let us know these details as we use our guests' experiences as a way to continually improve our property. We do hope that if you are in the area again, you will stay again so that we can provide the level of service we strive to provide for all of our guests.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: As usual the Ayres delivers! The cookie greeting, the comfy beds, the spacious room, the professional front desk folks, and even the nice maintainence man who helped me get ice. We were not disapointed!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  \We are glad to hear you enjoyed our fresh baked cookies! We hope you will come back for another batch the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I visited a high school buddy in Seal Beach, and the Ayres Hotel was highly recommended to me. I was not disappointed at all. My check in was smooth, and my room was large and very clean. My shower area was spotless, something I highly appreciate. There was a nice breakfast every morning, with many items cooked fresh. Also, in the afternoon,  there were various wines and cheeses for a relaxing moment before heading out again for the evening. I would definitely stay at the Ayres again. It was a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.

Visited nearly a year ago to check it out, then blocked off rooms for many guests for our son's wedding in late April.  The service is great.  The rooms are nice and with the high ceilings, feel very roomy.  Great location, just off the 405... easy access.  And, you aren't far from Newport Beach, Long Beach, and only 45-60 minutes to LAX.  Their breakfast buffet, especially during the weekdays, is excellent!

This is my second stay at the Ayres and it was as good as my first.  The staff is friendly and professional, the room large, clean and modern (actual HD on the flat screen TV.) The company I work for always uses the Ayres when we visit our HB offices and I've never heard a complaint from anyone.  Good food close by, check out Spaghettini for great crab cakes and Kobe for good sushi.  The Ayres makes me look forward to my trips to Huntington Beach.  The breakfast is quick, hot and good, a great way to start the day (and save some per diem for a good dinner.)  One other plus for the business traveler, actual wired Internet in the rooms with respectable speed, nice desk and chair for working.

loved our stay  can not think of any reason we would not return Great shopping and good places to eat close by.   Rooms are so comfortable and large with everything you could need for a great stay did not use the pool but it looked like everyone was having a relaxing time

This is a nice hotel. The staff is so very helpful.  There are a few key points in which the details do not match the fine surroundings.   Seeing as how more women then men are in business now and traveling, it is vital to cater to women. I needed a magnified mirror (as some hotels have attached to wall), but they did not have them nor had one available to use.  I think they need to upgrade their breakfast offerings to those who are gluten free (like myself), but the eggs were always very good, and they have fresh fruit as well, which I appreciated (but not organic). It would be wise for them to also offer stevia (as opposed to artificial sweetners), and organic cream instead of the chemically laden creamer in coffee mate flavors.   I think that like most hotels, there are too

The hotel is gorgeous.  The staff and service are absolutely the best.  They truly went out of their way to accommodate all the guests we had staying with us that were a part of our wedding party.  The breakfast added the perfect touch.  This will be the place we stay every time from now on....

My group had a meeting in the area. I booked all the rooms at this hotel. All the members in my party were very pleased with their rooms and the breakfast. The breakfast was very good and you can custom order your omelet. The grounds and pool area were very clean and modern. They have very nice two room suites available too. The staff goes above and beyond for the guest. I would recommend this hotel to everyone if your need a hotel in this area.

Clean and nicely appointed.  Nothing shabby or run down in any way.  Staff was excellent:  responsive, attentive and friendly, including in their service to our smallish work group that was set up in their conference rooms.  Breakfast was tasty with lots of options: eggs, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and more.  The hotel is well located to a number of other dining options (from the fancy Spaghettini's across the street to the Baja Fresh next door) and is less than 4 miles to the beach and pier area where you can stroll and shop or dine.

The Ayre hotel in Seal Beach is great location to stay if you want to explore the coast in Orange county.  The staff is very friendly.  However, I rate it 4 stars because the bed isn't as comfortable as other boutique hotels.

Summary Heading: Very nice- would like to come back
Summary: We were here for a birthday party and the hotel was very accommodating to our large group of friends who wanted to gather in the courtyard and in the lobby. The rooms were beautifully decorated with all the amenities I like, including a refrigerator, microwave, sitting area, etc. and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was great, making  good restaurant recommendations, and the complementary breakfast at the hotel the next morning was quite good. I am a very picky traveler, but I would definitely come here again and would like to stay even longer. Highly recommend it.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is a pleasure to read that we were able to accommodate your birthday party group. We hope that you enjoyed yourself and will consider us in the future for events or leisure visits. Thank you again for the kind words.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for 4 nights and could not have had a better place to stay. Very clean, wonderful full breakfast, very friendly staff. Room was large and the hotel was very quiet even though there were a lot of people staying there. Great stay.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  It is a delight to see that you enjoyed your recent stay at our hotel. Thank you again for your kind compliments regarding our world-class team, exclusive complimentary breakfast, and comfortable accommodations. We hope that you will consider us in the future if you return to the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice clean hotel, front desk staff was very attentive.
Summary: all great from beginning to end.  one thing that was a minor negative was the high cost of snacks in the lobby self serve area, but I think this is true of all major hotels.  buy water and snacks at a local market and save money.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. We hope you will continue to stay with us again in the future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The staff were all very nice and accommodating.  The appearance of the hotel, overall, was very pretty and very clean.  Our beds were quite comfortable and the room was very clean.  A buffet breakfast was included in the cost of the room and it was very tasty and prepared by a young man who was pleasant and always on top of our needs.  My only negative was the price of the room was a bit high in my opinion.  But overall, it was a pleasant stay in a convenient location.
Manager Response: Dear Carol,  We are happy to hear that you were delighted with your recent stay. Our team works diligently to ensure that each and every one of our guests check-out feeling satisfied with their stay. With that being said, we are ecstatic to read that we hit our mark with you! Thank you for your feedback and please stay with us the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We traveled from the East Coast to visit a relative in an assisted living center almost next door to the hotel. Popular place--on original call, we could get a room for only the first two nights of our visit. Watching website, the day before we left, it looked like rooms became available...phoned the hotel, call rolled over to Ayers reservation center, and while helpful the representative could not extend our reservation. On a whim I replied to an email reminder/welcome message from the hotel--and was very pleasantly surprised to get a response (yes, a personal response) less than an hour later that our reservation had been extended. This was well outside of business hours. But this attentiveness turned out to be typical of our entire four-night visit. Clean and comfortable. We
Manager Response: Dear Mike,  Thank you for taking the time to leave us some feedback regarding your recent stay. Reviews like yours are invaluable to us as we are always looking for ways to improve our policies and procedures in order to ensure the very best experience for our valued guests. We hope you will come stay with us again the next time you are in the area!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have been staying at the Ayres Hotel a few times a year since about 2007, the quality has not changed. Very clean,  spacious rooms, easy in and out and free breakfast! Price is fair and good parking at no charge! My only suggestion is the beds need some upgrading, little mushy for me!  Air conditioning units can be a little too loud? By the way, the staff members are very friendly and helpful! Will continue to recommend and return!
Manager Response: Dear Chris,  We appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. Thank you for your kind compliments as well as your helpful suggestions. It's reviews like yours that we appreciate to let us know ways that we can continue to provide the best possible service. We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I only needed a room for one night, and traveling by myself.  The lower end places seemed too close in price to this Ayres, near enough to my Saturday class.  Boy, am I glad I paid a bit more and stayed here!  I arrived early and had the pool and hot tub to myself for an hour, then took a brief nap, ate some dinner and read a book.  I slept like a dead man, it was so quiet and the bed so comfortable.  I usually do not sleep well in a hotel, with noise of other people in the hall, etc.  Don't know if it was an off weekend, the hotel parking lot seemed pretty full in the morning. I just cannot say enough good things about this Ayres.  The breakfast was good and nice to sit outside on the patio.  The decorations are very classy and the design touches, such as crown molding are
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Your kind words are greatly appreciated. We value each and every guest and hope that you always feel welcomed when you come and stay with us. Thank you again for your kind words regarding your recent stay. We look forward to seeing you again!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We always stay here while visiting relatives in Los Alamitos.  for just a little more than a Best Western, you get a much nicer room, good breakfast & accomodating staff.  Our bed the first night was not the best and they immediately transferred us to another room.
Manager Response: Dear Carol,  It is truly a pleasure to hear from one of our loyal guests. Our team greatly appreciates your kind words and we are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Let me get you some wine glasses!
Summary: I always put my family up at the Ayres because it is close, convenient and the nicest hotel within 20 miles!When I checked in early for my family I brought some wine and flowers but needed some wine glasses.  The wonderful rooms are quiet and the staff gave me a wine opener and got some wine glasses to put in the room so they would be ready when my family arrived!
Manager Response: Dear Giacomo,  It is a true delight to read that you found our property to be a fitting location for your family to stay! We greatly appreciate your kind compliments and hope that you will continue stay with us long into the future. Thank you again for your kind words.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The room was well appointed, exactly as you see in the pictures. Clean, very comfortable beds and spacious. It was a deal. I would definitely stay there again and will recommend it to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Dear Ursula,  We are pleased to read that you enjoyed your recent stay at our hotel! Our team works hard to provide each guest with the best quality of service and accommodations that we can offer. We are truly thrilled to hear that we did not disappoint you. We hope you will come back to stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: There were numerous things about this hotel that I loved; the fact that it was close to highways, within 30 min of just about anything, the bed was very comfortable, I came home late on a Saturday and there was a security guard walking the parking lot, it was beautiful and the people were very courteous and professional. There was one thing that I found needed improvement; the wireless internet.  Although it was included with my king room, that fact that it was slower than dial-up made it unusable.

Great hotel.hugh rooms.friendly helpful staff.walk to shops & restaurants.full breakfast.pity they are only in  Southern California.do yourself a favor & stay there. 10 out of 10.  Woooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo

This is a good hotel.  Great service, helpful staff.  The only problems I had was the location - nothing around except for a US Navy weapons depot - and the fact that there is no restaurant or bar in the hotel.  There are a couple if restaurants nearby ,  but they close early.
Manager Response: Dear Tom,  We appreciate your time in writing a review. Your feedback is invaluable to our team's success and we hope that you will continue to stay with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Never have I stayed in a hotel like this. I felt like I was under-dressed. The decor was elegant and tasteful, and our room had high ceilings that spoke of another era. There is a welcoming seating area outside complete with a fireplace and a couple of Mallard ducks that make the hotel their home. It was simply charming. The breakfast was second to none and the coffee was the best we had in our vacation.

My wife and I recently stayed here, not once but twice during are trip to the US, we were so impressed the first time that we re-booked in a second time.  The hotel is clean and tidy, the rooms are big, clean and the bed is comfortable, free parking and wifi.  The buffet breakfast is good and there is even a chef there who will cook you anything specific you like.  But what makes this hotel stand out is the staff, never have I encountered friendlier more professional staff, from a member of staff going to his own car to get my wife a box of matches (the hotel doesn't sell them) or the manager contacting nearly every member of staff to see if they had a thumb drive (I was having trouble with my e-mail and needed to print tickets),  these are just 2 examples of the extra effort

The staff was extremely professional and helpful in every aspect. I definitely will book with Ayre's again.. They are located near the 405 freeway with easy access and yet very quiet.  There are many great restaurants from which to dine at whether you which to eat local or many different trendy areas.
Manager Response: Dear Juan,  We are excited to hear that we have gained a loyal guest in you. Thank you so much for your kind words regarding our staff as well as your analysis of our optimal location. I am sure it will assist our future guests who may be unsure of the area. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I received an email a couple days before our arrival welcoming us and giving us information about the area.  So, when we walked in through the front sliding yellow doors we already felt welcomed. Beautifully decorated and clean. It felt like we were walking into another time down to the old fashioned phone on the front desk. All the furniture was solid and comfortable. The elevator with wood panels, mirrors and brass had music playing. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. Breakfast in the mornings was delicious. I loved that you can eat inside or outside  in a courtyard that also had an outdoor fireplace. The pool and jacuzzi I believe had salt water which didn't make your skin soft and not smell like chemicals. The night before we left I went downstairs to print out our

The hotel was nice, quiet and clean. Room was comfortable.  There is a breakfast offered to hotel guest which I did not try due to time restraints.  I like the in room, coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator.  You have all the necessary amenities. Don't forget to get your discount at Spaghettini's too.  :) The only 2negative comments I would have to say would be 1.  The horrible water pressure. The water was not very hot as I like my showers to be and the adjustable shower head did not give the pressure I desired.  My other issue worth mentioning is the Horrible parking.  There is not sufficient parking for hotel guest.  There were what appeared to be company vans parked on the premises which could have been for hotel guest.  Some of the parking was less than desirable when

This was our 2nd time at the property.  It's 2-3 miles to the beach but has a number of restaurants within a short walk.  Extremely clean and rooms are large and well maintained.  Feels much more like a boutique hotel than you would imagine.  Free parking.  Our room was very quiet (not on the I405 side of the building).  Staff is efficient and very polite.  We debated finding a hotel closer to the water; however, we had a great previous experience at the Ayers so decided to return.  We are happy we did.  There is nothing better than an immaculate room, a comfortable bed, and spacious room when traveling.  Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  We greatly value your kind compliments. We are delighted to hear that you have been with us before and hope you will continue to stay with us in the future! Our team is always striving to go the extra mile and we are glad we were able to make your stay comfortable. Thank you again for your review!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel is decorated with flocked wallpaper and faux renaissance paintings in fake, plastic frames. It's a cross between a bordello and a bad Carnival cruise ship.  That said, The rates are reasonable and they are both government rates and leisure world right. it included a nice breakfast and a weeknight happy hour that I was not able to attend.  Rooms include a kitchenette.    It was conveniently located for my purposes. The staff was very attentive and all in all it was a good stay. It's just a bit tacky.

If you have relatives in Leisure World Seal Beach, the location is perfect and a discount too!  Spaghetini's Italian food across street a must!!  Cookies too in the lobby!!!  So close to freeway and the beach and the pier!  Am going to stay here again and again!!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We appreciate the information you provided us with as well as future guests and fellow travellers. We hope that you will choose to stay with us again in the future. Thank you again for your time.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel and Good Value
Summary: Being from the East Coast we had never heard of Ayers before - apparently they are a small California chain. If their Seal Beach property is a good representation of their chain in general, they are going to be very successful. The Seal Beach hotel is a very nice Tuscan style building, upscale furnishings in common areas, great landscaping, and beautiful large outdoor patio area. Service was friendly and efficient. Rooms were well appointed and bed was extremely comfortable. Bathroom was nice, large, with good strong shower head and reliable hot water. Small fridge in room was handy and a nice touch. Free, fast internet. There is a full complimentary breakfast - much better than the minimalist continental breakfast that so many places do as complimentary. Location is also good,

I stay in a lot of hotels as I travel for work and this hotel is head and shoulders above the rest. The staff was amazing, with the exception of one, everyone else was so accommodating I didn't really pay her much mind-everyone has a bad day. The decor was beautiful, the room and bathroom were a very big size, and the hotel was quiet. The first night I stayed, I had a view of the freeway (which I enjoyed), it was quiet, and the curtains were perfect to block the light. The second night I had a view of the courtyard and it was peaceful and relaxing. I only wish I could have opened the window to hear the gentle trickle of water from the fountain. There are food options around so I was able to wak to get dinner and return to the hotel to do some work. High speed Internet was

Excellent service, breakfast, cleanliness, and security. Just off the 405 and very conveniently located.  Staff very professional.  Have stayed there several times and definitely would highly  recommend.

Our room was beautiful, very large, comfortable, and quiet.  The breakfast was fresh, had variety, and the hotel provided excellent service s\during the breakfast.  It was a good value for the money; and was covenant to our business on this thrip.

Our trip to Orange County couldn't have gone better, due in large part to the hospitality shown by the highly professional and friendly staff at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach, CA.  Because of our special situation, we were told about related discounts and other area benefits that were certainly helpful and welcome.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear tripresults,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We are humbled by your compliments and always willing to go above and beyond to offer our guests the best value for their stay. Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our exceptional team. We hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Spent one night while in town for a family emergency.  Have stayed at their properties in the past and have always had pleasant experiences.  Check in was quick and easy.  Room was very nice and clean.  Nice flat screen TV.  Was located on the first floor just down from the lobby but I never heard any noise.  Bed was very comfortable with nice pillows.  They have a small breakfast buffet that was suppose to close at 9AM and even though I got there a few minutes after 9 they were still serving and had plenty of food.  The front desk staff and other staff members were always smiling and very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Michael W.,  Thank you for your loyalty to Ayres Hotels and for choosing our location for your recent stay. I am pleased to read that our team went above and beyond to ensure your stay was comfortable. We hope to serve you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This is our second time staying at the Seal Beach Location. My husband and I stayed 12 nights. I love the location I can hop on a highway for adventure days and I can walk down the street to a variety of stores. The staff is lovely and helpful to everyone I saw them interact with. When I requested housekeeping services they too were efficient. My only suggestion: the weekend end cook is awesome but your weekday cook seems to not care about the product she produces...other than that minor detail I plan on staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear emh720,  Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review regarding your recent stay. I do take all guest feedback into consideration when looking for ways to improve our service and amenities. I agree that our location is quite optimal and look forward to serving you again in the future!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: We love staying at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach when we visit relatives in Long Beach. The furnishings are beautiful. The rooms are large, accommodating and very clean. The bed is very comfortable with a generous 4 king-size pillows. There is a small refrigerator and microwave, coffee pot in a separate area in each room. The king room includes a small couch and coffee table and a desk. One couldn't really ask for anymore when staying at the Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear Anne J.,  Thank you for continuing to choose Ayres! I am truly honored that you found our accommodations welcoming and comfortable. I hope we are able to serve you in the near future! Until next time.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Had stayed here before many times and it's always comfortable. I came to SB for 9 days to tend to a death in the family. Stayed at Ayres for 6 days... My other family members also stayed there, and we all were very pleased. Sean & mark were so nice... going out of their way to make us happy. The chocolate chunk cookies in the lobby in the afternoon were heavenly. Breakfast was so-so. They were low on coffee, tablecloths were dirty.  my family & I was able to hang out in dining room area at night to socialize with no problems. Complimentary newspaper in morning was a plus! Computer use in lobby was nice.The room we had with a divider was great. My 2 adult children were in my & hubby's room and enjoyed some added privacy. Thanks to the Ayres for a great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Gaelen S.,  I am thrilled to read that our accommodations were perfect for your family's needs! I always love to hear about our team going beyond their title to ensure each guest has an enjoyable and comfortable stay. I hope we are able to serve you again soon, hopefully for a more positive reason. Thank you for continuing to choose Ayres Hotels!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel at a reasonable price
Summary: The room was much nicer than what I expected for the price. It was spacious, well-appointed, and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When the sink backed up on the last evening (this could have happened anywhere) a repairman was at my door immediately, and when he was unable to resolve the problem I was immediately moved to another nearby room before I even had a chance to ask. I was extremely pleased with my stay and would definitely recommend this facility.
Manager Response: Dear DonRHonolulu,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is an honor to read that our team was both friendly and helpful as that is what we strive for each and every day. We certainly appreciate your kind compliments regarding our well-appointed accommodations and service. I appreciate your recommendation and hope to serve you again soon!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly, the accommodations very comfortable, and the amenities charming. Breakfast was very good, although not very imaginative. You get scrambled eggs, hash browns, a meat choice, and pancakes or french toast. The beds were very comfortable. The rooms kept very clean and pleasant.  Parking was more than adequate. Compared to other hotels I've stayed at across the country, this one was refreshing with an historical context and a staff who was always eager to please.
Manager Response: Dear rick417,  Thank you for taking the time to review your last stay with us. It is always a pleasure to read that our team is held in such high regard to our guests. Thank you for your warm compliments concerning our complimentary amenities and comfortable accommodations. I am pleased that we have made such an impression on you and hope to see you return very soon! Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: An absolute GEM of a hotel!
Summary: This Hilton junkie has a new favorite hotel chain.  I only wish they were somewhere besides SoCal.  Hotel was gorgeous.  Staff was extraordinarily helpful.  Beds were like sleeping on air. The towels were soft, plush and plentiful!  (I hate it when they give you two tiny towels and sandpaper washcloths.)  The outdoor seating area was the perfect place to enjoy a hot breakfast. My only regret was that we couldn't stay longer.  Next time..................................
Manager Response: Dear Momanem,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach upon your recent visit to Southern California! I am absolutely thrilled to see that we have made a loyal Ayres guest of you! It is always exciting and welcomed when we have the opportunity to serve a guest who has not stayed with us before. It is even more exciting to learn that we have earned your loyalty. We look forward to your next stay! Until next time.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This is a very good hotel to stay.  Location, rooms, amenities, staff, decoration, food.  I love this place for their wonderful european style decorations.  Room was perfect for what I was looking for. I used a king size with sofa room which was very ample and well distributed. Bed was comfortable and quiet to have a good rest and clean. Freeway proximity to get anywhere was wonderful and shopping and banking is just a walk away. This hotel offers not only free breakfast but an evening of free goodies and more. (although I didn't take advantage of it but I thought it was great)
Manager Response: Dear Hugo C.,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to review your stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed by our outstanding team. I am thrilled to read that our accommodations set us apart, as did our optimal location. We hope you are able to enjoy our exclusive Manager's Reception upon your next stay! Thank you again for your time.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The Ayres was only 5 minutes from our relatives home we were there to visit.  The property was exceptional, clean, home away from home.  The free hot breakfast every morning was a great start to our day. Take a few extra dollars put in the tip jar by the buffet.  The entire staff was friendly and very helpful.  Everyone went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and happy.
Manager Response: Dear steindap,  Thank you for your stellar review regarding your stay with us at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! Our team works tirelessly to provide exceptional guest service and we are always humbled when our guests take notice. We look forward to your next stay!  Sincerely  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Stayed here many times and have to say the breakfast not as good as when the male cook was there.  Tables are not kept clean or wiped off.  For the bathrooms be nice if there would be a bar for seniors or anyone with a medical problem to get in and out of the tub.  Also water does not stay in sink even with the stopper water still leaks.  The staff is always professional and helpful.  Love the rooms with the divider.  Love the location.
Manager Response: Dear Patricia G.,  Thank you kindly for your detailed review. Please keep in mind that we do have rooms equipped with additional features, such as grab bars in the restroom, for our guests who need some additional assistance. I do appreciate all of your feedback and compliments regarding our professional team and optimal location. Thank you again for taking the time to review your stay with us!  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel was terrific, the room was spacious and comfortable.  I found the breakfast to be disappointing.  The coffee at breakfast was undrinkable and the flow of traffic at the coffee area did not make sense.  Some of the food was nearly cold and the selection just okay.  The French toast had no flavor (maybe add some cinnamon and vanilla).  Hash browns should be browned.  The in-room coffee was very good. Staff was great and I would consider another stay.
Manager Response: Dear CalGal100,  Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. I appreciate your honest feedback and can assure you that we are constantly looking for ways to improve our service and amenities. We take all guest comments, good and bad, into consideration when making changes in our complimentary breakfast and service. Nonetheless, I am glad to read that you found our accommodations to be comfortable and spacious. Thank you again for your candid review.  Sincerely,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed 3 times this month so its OK. but definately could be better  First the negatives:   Don't believe the talk that the freeway side is quiet. Noise never stopped.    Free breakfast is barely worth it. Good try but in 4 tries eggs and potatoes were never hot. Lukewarm at best..  Beds are soft  Personal pet peeve No Coke Pepsi only  Positives  Nice hotel  Great staff. Professional and friendly  Nice rooms, but avoid freeway side
Manager Response: Dear murph24,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent experience at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is very out of character for our team to deliver anything less than exceptional and delicious breakfast. I am truly apologetic that yours was not up to par. The freeway can be bothersome to those sensitive to noise and I only hope that we can put our best foot forward with you in the future. Thank you again for your honest feedback. We hope to serve you again if you should return to Seal Beach.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: This Ayers Hotel will be my first choice when I visit the area again.
Summary: Very nice...hotel room, service and breakfast met and exceeded our expectations. Room rate was competitive, if not a bargain, considering the quality of the experience. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Years ago, I worked front desk for a national motel chain, so, I know this location is doing their best to be the best,

Just such a great place to stay.  Very centrally located.  Always friendly staff.  Clean and nice sized spacious rooms.............comfortable beds.  Very cozy.  Delicious breakfast.  Reccommend.  Worth the value.

First time at Ayres. Clean, professional, quiet and reasonable rates for a visit or business. History and charm that's interesting and unique but not over the top. Classy place. I definitely recommend. I'm from local area and stayed two nights to prep for a big exam away from the house and kids. It was a surprise from my wife and I was impressed.

Summary Heading: Convenient for the freeway, less so for the town.
Summary: What a welcome sight this was when we pulled off the freeway after a long day's driving.  The interior was no less welcoming with helpful staff and a large comfortable room.  No evening food, except some rather uninspiring offerings from a vending machine, but across the road is Spagettini where a good meal can be had either at the bar or, more formally, in the restaurant section. If you want to go down to Seal Beach itself, then it is necessary to have transport.  Should this be a taxi, then be sure to arrange one for the return journey, otherwise you may find yourself stranded if you are going out for a late evening.

I have always had great stays with Ayers Seal Beach since 2007. Excellent service and friendly staff. Upon my check in this time, it was less than friendly and upon leaving the same way. Not sure if ownership has changed, but other than that it is an excellent hotel with great service. The rooms are comfy and cover all bases. The location is close to the highway, but no highway sounds bother you. It is near the marina, a Farmers Market, Great shopping and lots of outdoor activities.
Manager Response: Dear dssf,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent experience at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is very out of character for our team to deliver anything less than exceptional and I sincerely apologize that our service was not up to par. Thank you again for your honest feedback. We hope to serve you again if you should return to Seal Beach.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: It was such a pleasure staying the Ayers. The accommodations were excellent I had a double bed suit with a privacy wall, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was hot and well prepared! I look forward to my next stay.
Manager Response: Dear Milana O.,   Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am delighted to see that your room was perfect for your needs and that you were able to enjoy the complimentary full American breakfast we serve each morning for our guests. We hope to see you very soon!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: There are things that set this apart from another near-the-freeway, moderately priced chain. The "old Europe" vibe is carefully constructed, not thrown together. The decor has lots of classic painting reproductions. Rooms have comfy beds, pretty drapes, marble door sills, roomy refrigerators. Our king bed room included a sofa and coffee table. Breakfast is delicious, and served in a pleasant room. Wine and cheese reception in the late afternoon is a definite plus, and sitting outside under the climbing roses in late November is a thrill. The lobby at Christmas time has a beautiful seating area with a Christmas tree--and not a tacky, "must we really??" tree--it looked freshly decorated, not pulled out of a 15 year old box. It was lovely.
Manager Response: Dear CramerWashstate,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your most recent visit to the area! It is a pleasure to offer our complimentary amenities to our deserving guests. Our exceptional team works diligently to provide the home away from home atmosphere that Ayres guests have come to familiarize with our hotels. Our design team would be thrilled to hear your feedback. Thank you again for your feedback and we look forward to serving you soon!   Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: We had a power outage in our city and had to relocate. This hotel gook us right away, gave us 5 star service and amenities and then gave us a discount because we lived in the area. It was truly amazing! The hotel is clean, very near 3 freeways, very well laid out and very reasonably priced. We truly enjoyed staying here.
Manager Response: Dear Dan D.,   Thank you kindly for your review. I am elated to hear that we were able to accommodate you during the power outage. We truly appreciate your honest and kind feedback concerning our proximity to local freeways, outstanding value, and exceptional guest service. Thank you kindly for your feedback and recommendation.   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The Ayers chain in southern California is truly unique.  The hotels are based on old world charm and are very nicely appointed.  I recently stayed at the Seal Beach location and was pleasantly surprised by the warm and inviting atmosphere. My room was nicely appointed, clean and roomy.  Plenty of space in the work area to setup my laptop and do some e-mail before bed.  Breakfast in the morning was superb when compared to the other chains that include breakfast! Overall, very pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Dear Rich O.,   Thank you kindly for your detailed review regarding our inviting and comfortable guest room accommodations. I am elated to see that you found your room tidy, well-appointed, and spacious. It is a pleasure to offer such fine amenities like our full American breakfast, in-room WiFi, and self parking. We look forward to your return and appreciate your kind compliments!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at this charming little hotel in Seal Beach,California now for several years when visiting So.Calif / Orange County Area.  It is quiet, very nicely appointed, as an "old world" European Hotel. The rooms are comfortable. It is near freeways if one needs to travel.  Corporate rates are available.  Breakfast is included,6 AM to 10 AM. Overall price is moderate. Enjoy!! Dr. Brian Klinge Santa Barbara, Calif.
Manager Response: Dear briank872,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Our optimal location is one of the many factors that sets us apart from other hotels as do our complimentary amenities. I am delighted to see that you found the value of our services equal to the rate you were given. Many thanks for your kind compliments and honest review.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Old world feeling with new world amenities
Summary: The Ayers is a unique venue that reaches for an old world, European vibe. Oil paintings line hallway walls framed with Rococo flourishes; headboards are dark wood and tall; curtains have embellished tops - yet the price is moderate. There's an abundant breakfast with chefs ready to cook omelets and eggs which definitely makes this tower above most American chains. The hotel chain was started in the 1800's and is still run by the same family. Ample free parking and easy freeway access make the Ayers a very attractive stop in Orange County.
Manager Response: Dear Tripwellgal,  Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay and experiences at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our signature design. I am delighted that we continue to exceed your expectations each time you stay and hope you will continue to be a loyal Ayres guest.   Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome decor! Love the paintings and the outdoor fireplace!
Summary: Staff was very nice and professional. The breakfast was great!  Will definitely stay here again! The evening reception was a welcome relaxing time with friends and meeting other hotel guest. The decor was a welcome break from the cookie cutter hotels.
Manager Response: Dear Reginald T.,  Thank you for taking the time to write a glowing review on your recent stay with us! Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed by our friendly and attentive team. It is a pleasure to offer our full American breakfast and manager's evening reception for guests to unwind and socialize. Our design team works diligently to provide a warm and luxurious ambiance for our guests and certainly appreciate your praise. Again, thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I'm taking module classes at CSULB.  The access is easy and only 10 minutes away. Room was fine for my needs - seemed clean. Breakfast is very good. Nice location right off I-405. I like to walk - there are restaurants & shopping w/i 1/2 mile. Will be back in January.
Manager Response: Dear John C.,  Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am pleased to read that our optimal location and clean accommodations have made an impression with you and that you will be returning in January. We look forward to serving you then. Thank you again for your feedback.  Kind Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for two nights with my 17 year old daughter while visiting colleges in the LA area.  It was very pleasant, easy parking, close to freeway access, with shops and food nearby.  The hot breakfast included eggs, so better than just waffles and yogurt.  A room with two beds actually has a kind of a shuttered divider which provides a sense of privacy within the room.  That was very nice!
Manager Response: Dear Joseph A.,  I am delighted to read your glowing review and to see that we have exceeded your expectations. Our full American-style breakfast adds a wholesome start to our guest's day and I am pleased to see that was the case for you and your daughter while visiting nearby campuses. Our optimal location adds ease when visiting the campuses. We look forward to serving you again should you return to any of our locations in Southern California!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This hotel continues to be our choice of stay when we visit the area.  Fabulous breakfasts with eggs, French toast, pancakes, fruit, muffins and anything else you might want to start the day.  Spacious rooms well decorated.
Manager Response: Dear Ida M.,  Thank you for taking the time to write this glowing review regarding our complimentary full American breakfast, spacious, and well-appointed accommodations. Your feedback is warmly welcomed. We look forward to your return!  Best Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Fabulous Hotel; Review is focused on suggestions for improvements
Summary: Overall, a 5-Star stay for ALL the positive reasons you can read on hundreds of other Trip Advisor reviews. Seal Beach Ayers Hotel rocks!  I‚Äôll certainly return in December.  I would like to reflect instead on things I believe can be improved upon or addressed for better customer service based on my experience.  *The water smells and tastes terrible...it reeks of a mild, sulfur odor.  (Not sure if this is due to being treated to make it softer.)  I used bottled water for drinking and when brewing the coffee.  *The water pressure consistently surges which could lead to scalding when taking a shower and making it more difficult to rinse off soap, especially with soft water when it‚Äôs in the low surge.  *The bedroom desperately needs an electrical wall strip above the desk with

this hotel is ideally located for those wishing to tour around LA area, it was perfect for us and straight off the free-way, very easy to find. The hotel is clean to a high standard and the rooms are very spacious for a family of 3/4. Our room was well equipped with fridge, microwave etc, and there is a laundry room there which was fab. The pool and spa is lovely although we did not use them as we were too busy visiting different locations everyday.  i would certainly return to the hotel, my only criticism is the breakfast, which is the same everyday with very little choice.  Seal Beach itself is a lovely beach and worth a visit, as is sunset beach around a 10 min drive from the hotel and also huntington Beach which is also close by.   There are lots of places to eat close to
Manager Response: Dear themurrays-barnsley,   Thank you for your candid review regarding your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I am thrilled to read that you were convenienced with the in-room microwave and refrigerator and spacious accommodations. I appreciate your feedback regarding our complimentary full American breakfast buffet and will take your comments into consideration for the future. Again, thank you for taking the time to review your stay and we look forward to serving you should you return to Seal Beach!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but need some firm beds
Summary: My wife and I stayed 4 nights. After 2 nights it was necessary to ask for our bed to be checked and to possibly have another room with a firmer bed as ours was causing back ache.  Mattress was apparently flipped and minimal improvement noticed.  Checked another room and bed also very soft.  Surprised hotel doesn't have some rooms with firmer mattresses. Balance of our stay was fine but the bed is the most important part of our experience, we are only in the hotel to sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Marc G,   Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay. I apologize that it was anything less than excellent as that is our main focus for each guest. I appreciate your candid feedback and appreciate your time in writing this review. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: We stayed for the night to go to a tournament at CSULB. Easy freeway access and lots of restaurants nearby. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Full breakfast buffet and free parking were a big plus.
Manager Response: Dear tjtj44,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is always a pleasure to see that we have surpassed our guests' expectations. We look forward to your return!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: We had never stayed at an Ayres Hotel before, but signed up for their frequent stay plan as we left.  The hotel staff, the hotel decor, the comfort of the rooms, the breakfast buffet, and the location all add up to an amazing place to stay in Seal Beach. It's just off the 405 at Seal Beach Boulevard. The value in their pricing for the Ayres is amazing for this part of California.
Manager Response: Dear mmurphy772,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for becoming an Ayres Rewards member! Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed by myself and our exceptional team members. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast buffet and our optimal location. We look forward to serving you throughout Southern California in the future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: I have stayed in Ayres Hotel several times and each time have experienced great staff that are always willing to help.  Rooms are clean and have wonderful amenities. Would highly recommend a stay here.

Very nice, very clean hotel. We stayed in a king patio room with a quaint sitting area outside the sliding door. Ate breakfast on the patio every morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. We liked the cozy feel of the hotel yet the room was quite large. Although the hotel is close to the freeway, the rooms are quiet.   We will definitely return to the Ayres Seal Beach!
Manager Response: Dear Julikins55,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. Your kind compliments are warmly welcomed as our team works dilligently to leave a lasting impression on each guest. It seems that they have done just that with you and your guest(s). We look forward to your return!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: We totally enjoyed our stay at Ayres Seal Beach. Clean, courteous, and a good value for a great stay.  We did the first two days at Ayres Anaheim and were equally impressed. This was our first time at this group of hotels and we will be back. Thank you!

The Hotel is clean, and rooms are great. Breakfast was okay and we used the spa. Easy access to freeway and not far to anywhere in LA We Drove to Queen Mary for Dark Harbor and it wasn't far maybe 20 minutes
Manager Response: Dear DavdCinAZ,   Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! Your kind compliments are sincerely appreciated. I am delighted to see that our optimal location was ideal for your trip to the Queen Mary! We look forward to serving you again in the future.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Stayed in one of the suites with my bridal party the night before my wedding at the venue across the street. Comfy hotel, interesting "Victorian" style decor, in room fridge & microwave, room staff was quick when we asked for more towels. My only complaint was the towel rack fell off & the front desk staff didn't offer any help when I struggled to bring in dresses and luggage by myself.  Rates are good. Close to shopping, restaurants & freeways.
Manager Response: Dear WD4014,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in writing this review. I apologize that you were not offered assistance by our front desk team member but I can assure you that this will serve as a training platform in the future. I appreciate you bringing this to my attention and we hope to see you again in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: What all other hotels should strive for!
Summary: My company lets me stay at the Ayres in Seal Beach when I am In town for business. It is always super clean, the staff is friendly, accommodating and professional. They spoil guests with an amazing free breakfast buffet every day, drinks and snacks on weeknights(includes free beer and wine) and a platter of warm cookies in the lobby before bed! All of those things make it worth the stay but for me the clincher is the staff that remembers you from previous visits and calls you by name upon arrival. The Ayres is owned and operated by people that understand excellent customer service is key to the success of any business.
Manager Response: Dear bobozug,   I am delighted to see that your company chooses Ayres for your business trips! Your kind compliments and recommendation are what we strive for. I am ecstatic to see that you enjoyed each of our complimentary amenities during your stay and that they help complete your visits. At Ayres, we certainly put forth every effort to provide exceptional guest service and leave a lasting impression. Again, thank you for your kind compliments and we look forward to your return!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The hotel at Seal Beach was very pleasant.  The staff were friendly, helpful.  The rooms were tastefully decorated with comfortable furnishings.  Truly the best complimentary breakfast buffet ever.  We will definitely search out Ayres Hotels in the future wherever we travel
Manager Response: Dear Debbie D,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your glowing review! I agree that our team members are friendly and helpful and am happy to see that they left a lasting impression on you! Thank you for the kind compliments in regards to our luxurious boutique-style accommodations and our delicious full American breakfast buffet. We look forward to serving you when you return to the Southern California area!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: I spent two nights at this hotel.  The staff was friendly, helpful, and efficient, the rooms were absolutely spotless, the furniture was comfortable, especially the bed, and the decor was lovely.  I have stayed in hotels all over the world, and this was one of my top 5 picks.  What a delight to find such a fine place in Seal Beach.  I will definitely recommend this as a must-stay to friends.
Manager Response: Dear Donna S,   Thank you for your time in writing this review and for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. It is always with great pleasure that I am able to read such kind compliments from guests. Our team members work diligently to leave a lasting impression and I am thrilled to see that they have done just that for you! We are honored to be considered a top 5 choice for a world traveler, such as yourself. The Ayres family looks forward to serving you again when you return to Southern California!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel with very helpful staff!
Summary: My sister and I spent a night at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach this past week-end. Everything about our stay was perfect from the welcoming and helpful staff to the yummy complimentary breakfast in the morning. The room was clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend this hotel and it is where I will stay if I ever visit Seal Beach again.
Manager Response: Dear Julieelephant,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in writing this glowing review of your experience! I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full breakfast and found our accomodations to be clean and comfortable. Our team members work very hard to keep our guests returning and it looks like they accomplished just that with your sister and yourself! We look forward to serving you when you return to the area!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager
