Summary: What a lovely hotel. The staff was outstanding, the premises were very clean, the room was spacious and well appointed. I loved the decor and overall feel of the place. Breakfast in the morning was a plus. I can't wait to stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Jacqueline P,   Thank you for your glowing review and for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! It is our pleasure to provide and comfortable and enjoyable stay for each of our guests. We look forward to serving you when you return to the area!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Last minute decision; enjoyed our stay
Summary: We live nearby but decided to give it a try for a one-night get away. I knew it was fashioned after a European boutique hotel, and the decor certainly depicts that (framed art everywhere was a little ‚Äúspooky‚Äù), but the room was very spacious and well-appointed with a large four-poster bed, microwave and a small fridge. We arrived late after a nice dinner across the street at Spaghettini, and at check-in were told we were being ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù to the Executive Suite. It had a separate sitting room, high ceilings, and a view of the pool (but also the parking lot). It is located right off the 405/22 Freeways, but not so close you can hear them. I found the room to be very quiet, although I could hear the laundry going late into the night. We did also sample the complimentary breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear OC48,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in reviewing your recent stay with us. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our spacious and comfortable accommodations. I am also glad to see that your husband enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you again for your time and we look forward to serving you for your next get away!  Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Reception staff, cleanliness and presentation of Hotel were all impeccable.  Ease of check-in was wonderful.  I stayed during home reconstruction and needed a bigger Suite for our family and Ayres Seal Beach staff accomodated us to their best ability with ease and professionalism.  Breakfast was a nice touch as well as the Mon-Wed wine/beer hospitality hour.  Right off the 405 fwy, so easy access to sourrounding areas and 10 minute drive straight to beaches.
Manager Response: Dear Royed1,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach while your home was undergoing construction. I am thrilled to see that our staff was able to accommodate you with ease and professionalism. Our complimentary full American breakfast buffet and Manager's reception are a welcoming touch that I am glad you were able to take advantage of! Our location is quite convenient and I am happy to see that you agree. We look forward to serving you again!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Staff was extremely friendly, very well decorated rooms, lobby and hallways. Great location, easy in and out. Close to a variety of restaurants and shopping. This was our first stay at an Ayres Hotel, being business travelers for over 30 years and staying at every known first class hotel, it is unbelievable I had not discovered Ayes until this trip.
Manager Response: Dear Edward S,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for taking the time to review your recent stay with us! I am contented to see that you enjoyed our signature European styled ambiance and our optimal location. I am thrilled to see that we left a lasting impression on a seasoned traveler such as yourself and I hope we have made a loyal Ayres guest of you!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: My wife and I have just spent 2 nights here as part of a tour of California. The hotel is situated just off the Interstate although we approached it from the old Pacific Coast Highway. There are places to eat and supermarkets nearby. The hotel itself is decorated in a traditional European style, I don't really know why but it all very pleasant. We had a great room on the 3rd floor, it was very large with particularly high ceilings. We used the self service laundry facilities which are always welcome. I had the complimentary breakfast both mornings and I thoroughly enjoyed it. There was a good selection of of hot and cold items and it was all very fresh. There isn't a huge amount in Seal Beach itself, the Main Street was nice and there is the pier and beach, but it served as a
Manager Response: Dear Gavin W,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in writing this detailed review. I am glad to see you found our signature European boutique style pleasing to the eye and that you enjoyed our accommodations. It is a privilege to offer a complimentary full American breakfast buffet for each of our guests as it is a delicious and wholesome start to the day! Thank you again for your time in writing this review and I am very appreciative of your recommendation!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Great service. Very large and well furnished  room. Excellent hotel.
Summary: We stayed here during a sailing regatta at Long Beach. From the first welcome at reception, thru breakfast to checkout, the service was very good. The rooms were large, well equipped and comfortable. The look of the hotel is traditional and classical rather than modern and boutique.  The price was extremely reasonable relative to the quality of service and facility so this was a perfect 10 in terms of value for money.  My brother owns a group of luxury hotels, so we are acute judges of other people's hotels and the ayers seal beach passed with flying colors!
Manager Response: Dear Justin S,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your time in writing this review regarding your recent stay. I am happy to see that you found the service provided by our staff exceptional. I agree that our value in terms of quality of service and upkeep of our property is top notch. I am ecstatic to see that guests with personal ties to the luxury hotel business find our accommodations pleasing and look forward to serving you again when you return to the area!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Priced right, Well run, Clean, Comfortable, Quiet, Great location to go to Spaghettin's for a Great evening. Morning breakfast was flavorful area was very clean and the check out process was also easy.
Manager Response: Dear callawaygolfer,   Thank you for writing this review concerning your recent stay with us. I am contented to see that you found our location convenient and our value ideal for your visit to Seal Beach and Spaghettini! Our complimentary full American breakfast buffet is a delicious way to start each day and I am thrilled to see you enjoyed that amenity! Our staff works diligently to provide a clean, comfortable, and overall enjoyable stay for each guest. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and we hope to see you again in the near future!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Although the location is close to the freeway and looks  plain from the outside. It's lovely inside and great staff.   There are 3 rooms courtyard/poolside/fireplace that make  an awesome area for a gatherings.  Wonderful breakfast included..
Manager Response: Dear djgerritsen,   Thank you for your time in reviewing your recent stay. I am thrilled to see you enjoyed your time with us. It is an honor to be able to provide our guests with a wholesome full-American breakfast buffet each morning complimentary of your stay. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and we look forward to serving you when you return to the area!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: A well- run hotel in Seal Beach
Summary: Although the hotel is situated near the highway, it is quiet - the rooms are spacious and clean, if a bit "Victorian"  Breakfast is included , and offers many choices, as well as eating indoors and out.  The staff is both friendly and helpful.  The rates are reasonable.  There are several restaurants nearby to choose from for lunch and/or dinner.
Manager Response: Dear Jane W.,   Thank you for your detailed review regarding your recent stay here at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach! I do appreciate your kind words concerning our friendly and helpful staff as well as our complimentary amenities that you were able to enjoy! I am pleased to see you also appreciated the optimal location of our property. We hope to serve you again the next time you are in the area!   Best Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: After staying at a few other local hotels at similar price points during recent months, we have found a clear stand out in customer service, cleanliness, overall value and comfort. Easy in and out access, even with the 405 being under construction. Rooms were clean, quiet, comfortable and nothing appeared old or outdated. Parking was free, as was internet access (wifi) and a great breakfast. Hotel is surrounded by restaurants and shops, easy on and off access to the freeway, as well as an easy alternate route to CSULB.  Will definitely stay here on future visits to the area.
Manager Response: Dear Ontheroad4fun,   Thank you for recently choosing Ayres Hotels and for your pleasant review regarding your stay! I am delighted to see that you were able to gain easy access to and from our property even with the 405 freeway construction that is taking place. Our complimentary amenities are an added luxury as is our convenient location. We hope to serve you again any time you are in Southern California!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: We blocked off a series of rooms for a large wedding party with many out of town guests. The staff here is so kind and professional. Great daily breakfast and nice areas for socializing in the lobby, dining room and patio. The bridal suite was great! Although the pool is small, it was another great place to congregate. Lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance, a short drive from downtown long beach and seal beach. Groom loved the cookies in the lobby every day! I would definitely recommend the Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear vespartina,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your wedding party! We are always honored to be a part of a guests special day. I am elated to see that the bridal suite exceeded your expectations and that the optimal location of our hotel was convenient for you and your guests! I appreciate your positive feedback and hope we can serve you any time you are in the area!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: This hotel surpassed my expectations. It's adjacent to the freeway, so it's not really a destination hotel, but my stay there was quite pleasant. The staff was friendly and profession, the rooms were clean and well maintained and FREE parking ,FREE wi-fi and FREE breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear vdasilva,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your kind words regarding our accommodations. I am contented to see that our staff offered friendly and professional assistance to you during your stay and that we exceeded your expectations with the cleanliness of our hotel. The complimentary amenities are an added luxury to our exquisite accommodations and we're happy you were able to enjoy them. Again, I would like to thank you for taking the time to write a review and we hope to serve you again in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location - five miles from beach, ten miles from Disneyland
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach, CA is a  good choice if you want a nice room, free parking, and complimentary breakfast for a lot less than the price of the hotels near Disneyland.  We were having work done on our house on short notice and needed a room for a few nights.  They worked with us to get us rooms for the duration of our stay.  At first they could only do one night, but when another room became available they moved us into it and were very accommodating.  There is a lot of construction in the area, but we were not bothered by any noise.  However, I would not want to spend too much time out at the pool and patio because it is right next to the freeway.  We have also stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Redlands several times and would recommend it highly.

We've stayed at two different Ayres properties in Southern California on numerous occasions over the last few years (Orange and Seal Beach). The rooms are always clean, the service always friendly. When traveling to SoCal, I'll always check to see if there is an Ayres property nearby because I know I'll have a good experience
Manager Response: Dear Becky W,   Thank you for your most recent stay at our hotel and for your wonderful review in regards to our Seal Beach and Orange Ayres properties. Our staff works diligently to provide a comfortable and enjoyable stay for each of our guests. I am elated to see that you will remain a loyal Ayres guest when traveling to Southern California!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The Ayres is close to the airport, wonderful restaurants, and the beach. Its decor is well beyond most motels we have visited. The amenities such as the breakfast, welcome reception, fitness room, and patio are very special. The only thing I wish is that their rewards program would extend to all booking sites.
Manager Response: Dear ChrisBarlow,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your glowing and detailed review regarding your stay. Our team is very selective when choosing our locations. We work hard to provide convenience for our guests so you may experience local businesses and activities hassle-free. I am pleased to see that you were able to enjoy our complimentary amenities as well as our elegant European-style decor. Again, I would like to thank you for your continued loyalty to Ayres and we look forward to serving you again!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Well kept but expensive for what's offered
Summary: The breakfast was serviceable but limited - the bed comfortable but a bit soft. The rooms are spacious and very quiet, but the blackout curtains are not particularly effective; if you need complete dark to sleep well this hotel is not for you. The hotel is in very good repair and very well-kept, though an odd mixture of modern and faux manor house. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and well turned-out. Overall, it is not great value for money though. There is also the issue that the motorway/freeway immediately next to the hotel is under construction which makes getting in simple, but getting out upon departure quite complex to navigate.
Manager Response: Dear Nick A,   I want to extend my most sincere thank you for your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for leaving a detailed review regarding your stay. I do apologize that our complimentary breakfast buffet seemed limited as we do our very best to offer many options for our guests each morning. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our spacious European suites as well as the cleanliness of our property and the friendliness of our staff. I can certainly understand how the construction could be frustrating when accessing out hotel and I do apologize for that temporary inconvenience. Again, I would like to thank you on behalf of our entire staff for choosing our hotel and we hope to serve you again in the future.   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: I'm was Scared to book at this Property considering I'm use too Hilton's & Marriott's. I found this Hotel to be very welcoming, I stayed Aug, 4- Aug, 10 2014 the front desk staff was very helpful. I arrived more then 3hrs early but they had both of my Patio Suits ready & allowed me to check-in without charging me. The Hotel was very clean along with the rooms no dust anywhere. The beds was so soft like I was at a Hilton, There service was just as good every request it was always yes never they could never help. There was only one dislike Breakfast was great first day but the rest of the week all they served was sausage, they need too keep the rotation of meats going people like more then sausage. This Hotel Staff went well above & beyond. They can look forward too seeing me
Manager Response: Dear AlexG5,  I want to thank you first and foremost for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your detailed review of your most recent stay with us. We are always eager to serve new guests and showcase our quality of service and beauty of each of our 21 properties all located in Southern California. I am thrilled to see that you were able to check-in to your Patio Suites upon arrival. Our hotel staff does their very best to accommodate for early check-in whenever it is possible. I do apologize that you were not able to try the other meats we do offer at our breakfast buffet. We do rotate between sausage, bacon, as well as ham every few days and I am sorry that you were not able to enjoy our other options. I am, however, very pleased to see that you were impressed by our hotel's cleanliness and the welcoming atmosphere our staff provided you with. Again, thank you for choosing to stay with Ayres and we look forward to your continued loyalty in the future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo, General Manager

Summary: On-line pictures are exactly what you experience.  Clean, very clean! Beautiful attention to all the details.  Lobby,  hallways,  elevators, breakfast/happy hour room and elegant patio all welcome you as if you're at your own home.  Room was better than Disney's Grand California Resort at a third of the price. The six night here were wonderful memories.   Close to 405 but never heard it.  Staff friendly,  even at 3:00 am (one of us felt ill, OTC meds in convenience shop) and ever other contact. Hot cook breakfast was something to look forward to enjoying every day. Free parking and Wi-Fi, not a given every where in southern California. Can't wait to make any excuse to come back.......2000 miles from home.
Manager Response: Dear Greenthumb27,   I want to thank you tremendously for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your most recent stay in Southern California. We pride ourselves on being one of the few hotel chains with a family owned and operated reputation and we're delighted that we were able to exceed your expectations. Our amenities are a most favorable convenience as well and I am pleased to see that you were able to take full advantage of those during your stay. I am also overjoyed to see that our staff was friendly and helpful even in the wee hours of the morning when you needed assistance. Again, I want to extend a most sincere thank you for your glowing review and recommendation as our entire staff works very hard to leave a lasting impression for each of our guests. We look forward to serving you again in the near future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Hotel belongs to a small chain, but is unlike other chain hotels. It is described as a European-style boutique hotel and fits the bill.  It was very convenient for visiting a relative at nearby Leisure World retirement community (main purpose of visit), within walking distance of a large number of stores and eating places, close to the freeway ramp to/from the airport, though noise not a problem, and not too far from the superb Seal Beach.  Rooms large, well equipped and comfortable.  Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Breakfast a little limited but more than adequate.  Pool quiet in July/August, but comfortably warm.  Fitness room has limited but newish equipment and is clean and air-conditioned.  Highly recommended hotel.

We stayed 2 nights and we're very happy with our stay.  The staff was very pleasant, rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet, and breakfast each morning was excellent!  The distance to Seal Beach was a little longer than we expected (approx. 5-7 miles), but there were many restaurants and stores close by on the other side of the hotel.  We would definitely stay there again!

Very nice rooms , Nice computor station and, work area Very well lighted  Our room. went out to the patio area which was nice they have table and chairs and a fireplace, also close to pool. Ice machine for 1st floor. is on 2nd floor that was the olny thing i didnt like.

Summary Heading: Ayres Seal Beach, enjoyed my stay
Summary: I asked my daughter what she would like before going back to school.  She said to sit in a nice hotel room and just swim in a pool, relax and sleep.  Ayres did a great job the Thursday evening we stay. Aside from the expensive $200 a night summer rate, we did enjoy ourselves. The pool was clean and the spa was maintained well. The area was clean when we visited late at night.  When we noticed there was one towel left by the pool side, there was a phone next to the fresh towels. I called and immediately the towels arrived.  My daughter commented the man, wearing a suit, was over dressed and looked like a clean cut limo driver.  The room was clean and the bed was comfy.  Staff was friendly upon arrival. The man that checked me in made us feel welcome and cookies were waiting for

The hotel was comfortable and clean.  The staff was very accommodating -- gave us room/floor options when we checked in, changed out shower head when the water pressure seemed really off.  They were quick to respond if we made any requests.  Breakfast buffet was replenished all the way until it closed.  We always stay here when we visit family in the OC area and have never been disappointed.  Parking is easy and centrally located to many restaurants and shopping.
Manager Response: Dear Eunice K,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach whenever you are in the area visiting family. I am thrilled to see that our staff was attentive to your requests and friendly while assisting you! We do take great pride in being able to offer our guests a signature American style breakfast buffet complimentary of your stay. Again, thank you for your continued loyalty and we look forward to serving you again in the near future!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The hotel was awesome. It was clean and comfortable. The pool and hot tub were great and there was a nice outdoor sitting area. Breakfast was excellent and the staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel is very convenient for people who are spending time near Long Beach or Seal Beach. It was also located very close to a big shopping centre for people who like to shop. I really enjoyed my stay here and I would recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: Dear Sandra P,   Thank you for your kind words regarding our property and your stay! I am delighted to see that our complimentary amenities exceeded your expectations, as did the friendliness of our staff! We are very selective in choosing our locations to help convenience each of our guests. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your shining recommendation.   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: The hotel was wonderful.  Unfortunately, the exit from HWY 405 (Seal Beach exit) was crazy dangerous.  Also, the exits were under construction and there was a lot of construction noise throughout the night.
Manager Response: Dear Liz9252014,   Thank you for your compliment of our wonderful accommodations. I do apologize for any noise you experienced during your stay. Please know that our front desk staff is always eager to assist our valued guests who would like to be relocated for any reason and at any time. We strive for each guest to have an enjoyable and comfortable stay and I do apologize if yours was anything less than that. With that being said, I do thank you for your feedback and look forward to serving you again in the future!   Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a business meeting several years ago and highly recommend this hotel.  The rooms are cozy and the beds are extremely comfortable.  Great location and the staff is always friendly and accommodating.
Manager Response: Dear LuvJaBad63,   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your glowing recommendation of our comfortable accommodations! It is our pleasure to offer exceptional service to each of our guests. We hope to serve you again the next time you are in Southern California!   Kind Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: when visiting So. Cal - I always stay here.  Fairly decent prices - clean orderly rooms and a good start for the day - as the Breakfast is included.  The Ayres is 10 minutes away from excellent beaches in Seal Beach and Long Beach.  Downtown Seal Beach is a small quaint city with some good restaurants.   Nearby in Long Beach - you can walk around the harbor along with some good restaurants in the Long Beach areas of Naples and Belmont Shore
Manager Response: Dear rickpp,   Thank you so much for your kind compliments about your recent experience at our hotel. We choose our locations very selectively so and were delighted that you found our hotel to be so conveniently located. We truly appreciate your generous recommendation and look forward to your next visit with us!  Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manaer

Summary: Only complaint was 405 construction which is not the hotel's fault at all... Great big rooms w/comfy beds. One of my best hotel sleeps ever:-)  Nice cable tv channels, staff fast and friendly. Even brought out delicious cookies on a random request-sorry hotel staff if that leads to more cookie requests.  The location was not as coastal as I'd like, but the dinner across the street at Spaghettini was fantastic w/fun live music. Not having to drive to a great dinner was a nice surprise. Dinner 10% for hotels guests too:-)
Manager Response: Dear Matt C,   Thank you kindly for your glowing recommendation about our hotel! We are thrilled that your overall stay wasn't anything less than exceptional and that our European inspired suites and friendly staff were able to exceed your expectations. Thank you again for your generous compliments and we look forward to welcoming you back soon for some freshly baked cookies!  Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: we just returned from a 10 day trip down the Califorrnia coast. We booked hotels solely on reviews. We were so very pleased with the Ayres Seal Beach! It was located in adorable Seal Beach, rooms were HUGE and very very clean. the customer service was the best we had all trip and the free breakfast and afternoon happy hour(snacks and beverages for adult and child) was WAY beyond expectations! The courtyard and pool area was peaceful and beautiful. We had a bottom floor room facing the 405 so I thought it would be loud...NO! It was great! Thanks Ayres for going the extra mile to make a place that is priced great feel like a 5 star! We will be back!
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl K,   Thank you so much for your incredibly kind words and the five stars! Our customer service is important to us and are extremely flattered by your recommendation. Thank you for staying with us and we really look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Stayed for one night, hotel room was spacious. Bed and pull out bed seemed dated along with the decor. I wasn't sure if the hotel theme was old style or if it was just dated and renovated here and there. Would've picked a more modern hotel if this wasn't so close to where we needed to be
Manager Response: Dear KokoBware,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. In regards to your recent stay, I apologize that you did not find our European inspired d√©cor to exceed your expectations. Our collection of boutique hotels are designed with European inspired essence in mind, ranging from classic to contemporary for a variety of tastes. In the future, I kindly encourage you to explore more of our beautiful and unique collection of Ayres properties. Thank you again for your candid review and hope you choose to stay with us again in the future!  Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed in this hotel for many many years. I really enjoy it. The room is well equipped with microwave and fridge. The decoration is really nice. The beds very confortable. Location is excellent, lots of stores, malls and the beach is close by. I really like this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Gloniva,   Thank you kindly for your genuine compliments and loyalty to our hotel! From our European inspired decor to our clean and comfortable rooms, our service is very important to us and we‚Äôre pleased that we are able to impress you time and time again. Thank you so much for your recommendation and we look forward to your next visit!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet, Comfortable - Everything I need for a short stay
Summary: I stay here when visiting family in the area (have stayed several times over the past few years). Once, when visiting, I stayed in another slightly cheaper hotel and quickly learned my error and returned to Ayres on my next visit. It's in the suburbs (about a 45 minute drive from downtown LA and Hollywood). It is in a nice area (I was safely able to go for a long jog by myself in a nearby neighborhood). There is shopping and restaurants nearby. It is also a 10 minute drive from Seal Beach. Lovely beach with a pier to walk down and little shops to visit... and relax on a sand in the sun as well! I don't know if there is much sightseeing around the area, but that's not our main reason for traveling there.  The decor is up-to-date, the rooms have always been clean, the hotel is
Manager Response: Dear Laurel H,   Thank you so much for your honorable mention. We are so thrilled to hear that every aspect of your time with us was so smooth and relaxing.  We want all of our guests to feel care-free when they come to our hotel which is why our staff works tirelessly to provide the friendliest service possible. Thank you again for your kind words and we look forward to welcoming you back again soon!  Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo  General Manager

Summary: This week we celebrated my aunt's 100th birthday! I often have stayed at this hotel while visiting her at nearby Leisure World. It is so refreshing to come in after a day with my aunt and "crash" in such an elegant, quiet and accommodating place. I always sleep well in a very comfortable bed. The full breakfast is a plus and beautifully presented. The chefs do a great job of keeping everyone satisfied. The entire staff is gracious and helpful. It is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Thank you, everyone, for all you do to make this a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Diane32696,   It is a thrill that we could provide you such a rewarding and relaxing experience with us. Service is very important to us and we are happy to serve you with a smile no matter where you are in our hotel. Thank you for your kind compliments about our delicious full American breakfast and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Thank you once again for your generous recommendation!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The elegant decor, comfort and friendly service combined make this a great place to stay.  We were attending a wedding across the street at the country club, and this location was perfect! The amenities and furnishings are both lovely and comfortable. We only wish we had more time to enjoy this beautiful  hotel.   I highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Dear Orchmo,  Thank you so much for your incredibly kind words about your recent experience at our hotel.  Our design team puts a lot of depth and thought into our European inspired decor and we are extremely flattered by your kind compliments. Please come and visit us again soon!  Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. The free breakfast was really good, with made to order vegi omelets along with many other items. The location was really good for our needs, spending time in West Garden Grove and Seal Beach. Will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear h20skimom,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor about your positive experience at our hotel. Our staff work diligently to create the most relaxing, personal experience around and we're delighted that you were able to enjoy our facility and amenties. From our clean and comfortable rooms to our complimentary American breakfast, it is always our pleasure to do what we do. Thank you again for your feedback and we look forward to your next stay with us.   Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Visited for 5 days in July. Hotel was easy to find, access issues were more related to local 405 construction and traffic.  Check in was smooth and efficient, pleasant, and made great first impression. Desk clerk was able to determine I was eligible for a better rate than originally booked, and swiftly made adjustment.  Room was very spacious and clean.  Hallways truly feel "European" with art and decor details.  Pillows very good, water pressure medium, good hot water, towels very good large and soft.  Breakfast included in mornings was robust and generous!  Coffee was very good.  Outdoor patio area as overflow for breakfast was very pleasant.  We did not participate in e evening happy hour, unable to rate that feature.  Daily in and out of lobby with greetings and awareness by
Manager Response: Dear BlueMaxx14,  We are so glad that you chose to stay with us for your five day stay and are delighted to hear that your stay was a success.  From our full American breakfast to our world class customer service representatives and clean and comfortable rooms, our service is very important to us. Thank you again for your generous recommendation and we look forward to your next visit!  Warm Regards,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have stayed in!!
Summary: My fiance and I were beyond happy with our stay here. Our room was the perfect size, not small at all. The AC worked great. Extremely clean hotel. I love how the toilet and shower are seperate from the sink so that I could get ready while my fiance was showering! Great idea! Our favorite part was the complimentary breakfast. It was no ordinary hotel breakfast, they have a great chef who makes pancakes, western style eggs, breakfast meats, and all other breakfast choices you can think of! We were amazed. Definitely worth the money to stay here, we were sad we had to leave after only 2 days! And we are most likely coming back to stay here for part of our honeymoon next year!! Loved it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone anyday.
Manager Response: Dear Holli R,  Thank you for your generous recommendation of our hotel. It gives us great pleasure to know that all of your expectations were exceeded during your stay with us. We take pride in the breakfast we serve because we always want you to start your day off with a smile. Thank you once again for your kind compliments and we look forward to seeing when you return for your honeymoon!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: The hotel is clean and nicely appointed. Staff is courteous and professional. You get the distinct feeling that you matter and are appreciated. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for professional and courteous service.
Manager Response: Dear Joseph R,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor.  It is a joy to hear how thoroughly impressed you were with the service and that our customer service was so accommodating to you. We are truly appreciate you kind compliments and look forward to your next visit!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: This is quite close to Cal State University- Long Beach. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, the free breakfast has a large selection of good food, my bed was extremely comfortable, and if my neighbors were making noise, I sure didn't hear them in my nice, quiet room. My only criticism is that the Internet connection was crazy slow so I had a hard time responding to emails in the evening.
Manager Response: Dear MatSciTeacher2,   Thank you so much for your kind words in complimenting our signature European-style rooms. Our staff was happy to give you that experience and provide clean and comfortable accommodations. We apologize about the inconvenience you experienced with the internet connection and have certainly looked in this issue in order to prevent it from occurring in the future. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again soon!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Would Liked To Have Stayed Longer
Summary: We were attending a convention in Long Beach and needed a place to stay Saturday evening.  The Ayres Hotel got great reviews so my wife and I elected to stay. We were not disappointed. Even though we stayed only one evening, the Seal Beach Ayres Hotel was wonderful.  Gabby at the front desk was friendly and had us checked-in in record time.  She advised us that one of our favorite restaurants was only a ten minute walk from the Hotel.  Also, they have a pretty darn good breakfast spread.  Needless to say, if we're ever back in the Seal Beach area we will stay at the Ayres Hotel.

We've been staying at this hotel off and on over the past 10 years. It has been consistently great, with one (also consistent) caveat - I have never had a "good" shower in this hotel. Water flow is so restricted that it's difficult to get shampoo out of your hair. Aside from that, love this place! Rooms and hallways are quiet, feels like a much more expensive hotel, but retains self-parking (always a plus for me), and has luggage trucks available.
Manager Response: Dear MaryR1975,  Thank you so much for all of your wonderful compliments and for your 10 year loyalty to our hotel. Our quiet, relaxing rooms and in room amenities make for a wonderful time at our hotel and we love hearing that we can exceed your expectations time and time again. Please accept our most sincere apology for any inconveniences causes by our shower and we appreciate you informing us of this issue. We thank you again for your generous recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back again soon!  Warm Regards,  Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: Clean, great staff.  An oasis of calm in busy southern California.  Rooms are a good size.  Beds are comfortable. Bathrooms are well designed and spacious. The breakfast was outstanding with a good selection.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Seal Beach/Rosmoor area
Summary: My daughter and I spent last week down in So Cal to visit family, friends and attend VidCon.  From the moment we arrived, the staff was very pleasant and made us feel very welcome. The We chose a room with two queen beds and were pleasantly surprised by the dividing half wall between the beds. The breakfast room was beautiful - you could eat inside, or outside on the beautiful patio. We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Really liked how clean and convenient this hotel is. Staff is super nice and breakfast is good.
Summary: I think this hotel is nice, clean, convenient and reasonably priced. I will use it again on future travel. The only negative is that some people are super loud coming in during middle of the night..but in no way reflecting on the hotel. Just rude guests.

The Ayres Seal Beach is fantastic!  An easy on and off the 405 expressway is an added benefit.  The property is very nice and small enough you feel like you're special.  The rooms were spacious and very quiet.

We stayed here for a week. It was just great. The rooms were tastefully furnished and serviced each day. The corridors were hung with beautiful paintings, that in themselves were worth walking to view them all. The lobby was very comfortable and again tastefully furnished. The breakfast, which was included was all we could have asked for, great range of foods fruits, yoghurt, cooked, a selection of breads and pastries etc. it was buffet style so one could have whatever they wanted and however much they wanted. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful.We are definitely planning to go back next year. The hotel is not far from downtown LA. The rooms are all soundproof from traffic. There is a nice courtyard with a swimming pool where we could take our breakfast out to.

My family stayed here for a almost 2 full weeks and we loved every second of it.  The rooms were sound proof and well maintained and spacious.  The breakfast was unexpected, unwarranted but much appreciated-- homemade French toast, omelets, fresh fruit, etc. Jose, who was the chef, made a point of greeting my children each morning and asking if they wanted blueberries or chocolate chips in their pancakes! Happy Hour and freshly baked cookies each day created a festive sense of community amongst the hotel guests;  and we were a part of a large group of sailors sailing at an event on Alamitos Bay and the outdoor terrace was the perfect spot for bringing in food each night to feed our sailors. The pool and hot tub perfect...there was a washer and dryer at the end of each hallway
Manager Response: Dear kendall s,   Thank you so much for you review and we're very happy that you and your family selected our hotel for your stay! We're truly glad that you and your family loved our fresh and delicious American breakfast, our friendly staff, and our world class amenities. We always strive to provide a home away from home experience for all of our guests and we're thrilled that you took notice of our efforts. Once again, we thank you so much for your patronage and we hope to see you again in the future!   Warm regards,   Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Seems almost like a European style hotel with the decorations and style, but large rooms. Clean and well maintained with a friendly staff.  Very nice breakfast spread as well.  Nice outside area with a  fireplace (byob at night as there is no bar, but that is almost cooler). Interesting location, good value.
Manager Response: Dear 1TravelingNole,   Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a TripAdvisor review we're happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel! European inspired is definitely what we're aiming for in terms of our ambiance and decor and we thank you again for your generous compliments. From our friendly staff to our continental American breakfast and hotel amenities, we're absolutely thrilled to hear that you loved our property so much. We thank you once again for your recommendation and we hope to see you again soon!   Sincerely,   Steve DeLugo  General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres in Seal Beach on 6/16/2014 and found it to be an excellent property - clean, modern, quiet rooms, nice amenities (pool/hot tub), good breakfast (included), and a nice 'happy hour' during the week.

We had a wedding so my family of five booked two rooms to stay for three nights.  We were pleasantly surprised at the nice accommodations this hotel provided.  The staff was very friendly, rooms clean and spacious. Although hotel is next to highway the rooms are sound proof.  The hotel offers complimentary full breakfast and a nice complimentary happy hour of wine,beer and cheese.  The pool is quite small but pleasant enough.  And the best part very very reasonable.  We would stay again.  Seal beach is ten minutes away and Huntington beach a half an hour.  Hotel is located near many strip malls for easy access to food

Loved my room..We got one with two queen beds..I liked how the beds had dividers ..The room was very large and clean! Great water pressure in the shower..The breakfast that is served in the morning has something for everyone..Just wish it went past 9 am. The hotel is located close to the beach and many fine restaurants. I would definitely stay here again..
Manager Response: Dear Denise V,   Thank you very much for your lovely review and for choosing our hotel for your recent trip!  In addition, we love hearing that you enjoyed our pristine and spacious guest rooms, delicious all-American breakfast, and our world class amenities! We always strive to provide top tier hospitality and service for all of our guests and I am truly pleased that we were able to exceed your expectations. Once again, we thank you so much for your warm compliments and we hope to see you again!   Best,   Steve DeLugo  General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach. The staff is very helpful and appear to be very pleased that you chose to stay there. Instead of the usual "motel" art on the walls there are nicely framed copies of some of the old masters. The music in the elevators is light classical. Breakfast has something for everyone and it is freshly made right in front of your eyes. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment on that. Our room faced the freeway off ramp but we could NOT hear the traffic. Overall the noise level from other rooms or the hallway was almost non-existent.
Manager Response: Dear bevjerry,   Thank you very much for your kind compliments and we're so happy that you chose our hotel for your recent trip.   We're thrilled to hear that you loved our European boutique inspired ambiance, world class amenities, and our freshly made American style breakfast buffet! We strive to provide top quality service for all of our guests and we're truly delighted by how much you enjoyed our hotel.   Once again thank you for your recommendation and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!  Sincerely,   Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: The rooms are big, and the decor is classy. The only thing I don't like is that the water pressure in the shower isn't very good.  It's also difficult to get the proper temperate of the water.  You either freeze yourself or scald yourself if you're not careful.  The breakfast is good, but if I could convince the guy to make me a ham and cheese omelet, it would be better.  No bacon either, only sausage.  For the most part it's a great hotel in a great location.  I've stayed several times and had a great experience each time.
Manager Response: Dear GIKimber,   Thank you so much for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to write a review of our property! Your comments are very much valued.  In regards to your recent stay, I would like to offer my most sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced with the shower temperature gauge. Please know that I have looked into this issue with our maintenance team to ensure that it does not occur in the future.   Nevertheless, we loved reading your wonderful remarks about our European boutique inspired decor, spacious rooms and our specialty breakfast. Thank you for continuing to return to our hotel and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Thank you again for your thoughtful review!  Warm Regards,  Steve DeLugo General Manager

Summary: Went out for a wedding and the hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating.  The honored a request to have me close to my mom's room and when she said she was afraid of slipping in the tub a staff member went out and bought a brand new Rubbermaid bath mat!  We all enjoyed the breakfasts, pool, and patio.  Wish they had these hotels in New England where I live.

Large clean rooms . Friendly staff.Good breakfast buffet n convenient location . European decor. Only down side is small work out room  n next to freeway but can't hear any road noise . Current freeway road construction. Walking distance to several fast good outlets n Sunrise senior living

My wife and I stay here every year for our anniversary because of the location, value, and awesome customer service! Having two kids that are heavily involved in school and sports we can't get away too far, but staying here makes us feel like we're way out! Thanks Ayres staff for always making us feel like royalty!!

Definitely would have given them five stars if I did not have to call them every day to clean my room and the other guests rooms that were in the wedding party.  Also, the construction on 405 makes travelling a bit difficult, but CA traffic is known for being time-consuming and stressful.  Wonderful rooms, staff, and breakfasts!!!   Wonderful pool and hot tub!

I stayed here because of a job interview. The lobby was very clean and I liked the Victorian style theme the hotel had. I stayed on the 3rd floor, and the room was very lovely. The colors were deep and rich and the bathroom was spacious. Big bed and very comfortable pillows made it easy to fall asleep . Close the Rossmoor shopping center, Seal Beach Blvd and the 405. The hotel is very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would totally stay here again :)

Enjoyed our stay overall.  Our room was very clean and spacious.  The rating of 4 out of 5 was due to the bed.  It was not very comfortable...woke up with a backache.  Still a good deal and would recommend this hotel to our friends.
Manager Response: Dear Ulalena1,   Thank you sincerely for your review. We are glad our accommodations were appreciated in regards to cleanliness and the spaciousness of our rooms. Nevertheless, we are truly sorry that our beds were not up to your standards. We are looking into this issue and hope it does not keep you from returning to our hotel. Once again thank you for taking the time to share about your experience and especially for the recommendations.   Sincerely,   Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We are in the Long Beach/Seal Beach area perhaps twice a year and always stay at the Ayres Hotel. Very convenient to I-405 and 22 (directly into Long Beach). We have never been disappointed and we recommend the hotel to family and friends: clean, comfortable, quiet, and a fair price for the area. Relatively limited choices of restaurants, which is fairly typical for suburban hotels.

My wife and I stayed at this property for one night, 9 May 2014.  Outstanding in every respect - cleanliness, quietness, comfort, delicious breakfast, and a responsive, courteous staff.  We highly recommend this property when your travels take you to the Seal Beach, CA area.
Manager Response: Dear William R,   Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your experience at our hotel! It is such an honor to hear that, in your opinion, we are outstanding. Cleanliness and excellent guest service are keys to guest satisfaction and we strive to go above and beyond to please our valued guests. Thank you so much for your recommendation and for your review. We hope you consider staying with us again.   Sincerely,   Steve de Lugo  General Manager

Summary: I took a chance on this hotel because of location and I was pleasantly surprised with the quality, cleanliness, and comfort of this hotel. The price was right too! The chocolate chip cookies every evening was awesome. Lots of choices for breakfast and friendly staff. Everything about this hotel was perfect. I will definitely be back.

We found the hotel to be clean. Our room was spacious.The bed was comfortable. We had a patio suite and enjoyed having the courtyard right outside our door. The patio and pool area was clean, except for when someone dropped pool towels right in front of our room, in the courtyard. We saw not less than 4 employees walk right past them and just leave them lay there. We enjoyed the breakfast it was well done and kept fresh. The walls and paper thin, we could hear everything the people in the next room were doing, including their crying kids. We love kids but would have enjoyed not hearing them cry as if they were in our room.
Manager Response: Dear ChurchMouse2010,   Thank you for taking the time to share a review about you stay. We are delighted to hear all the wonderful things you had to say about our hotel and we are also thankful that you noted some of the faults you experienced during your stay. Please accept our apologies in regards to the slow reaction and lack of service from our team members. Unless the towels were thought to be yours and still useful, they should have been picked up immediately. We also like to encourage our guests to input special requests upon booking, such as a quiet room or a room in the top floors. Though these requests are not guaranteed, we strive to go above and beyond to meet our guests' needs and wants. Once again, thank you so much for your review and we hope you consider staying with us again.   Sincerely,   Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Another mini vacation visiting my daughter who is in college
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres in Seal Beach many times over the past 3 years and love it.  It's a beautiful hotel.  It is kept very clean, the staff is  friendly & accommodating, it has a cozy, sunny breakfast room, and is in a great location in a safe area.  Not to mention the free parking, free wifi, & close to lots of great shopping & restaurants!
Manager Response: Dear Dawn S,   It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you sincerely for taking the time to share about your experience and for choosing our hotel! Your loyalty is greatly appreciated and it was a delight to hear that you loved our hotel. Guest satisfaction is our main goal so we strive to provide excellent guest service and to keep our hotel in tip top shape. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you soon.   Sincerely,   Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: The front desk staff was very kind & accommodating.
Summary: The hotel, rooms & breakfast area were spotless! The front desk staff, reservation agents and even housekeeping were incredibly helpful and accomodationg.  Two nice Resturaunts are across the street.  Also, more shopping, food, groceries and pharmacies just two blocks away.  3 miles to seal beach pier!  The location is very convenient.  The breakfast was great!  The hotel is classy and an incredibly priced rate.  Stay here!

Summary Heading: A great three days at the Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach
Summary: First, everyone was helpful and professional. The breakfast was very good; with enough diversity of choice so everyone can find something to eat and drink. The Desk Staff was helpful with all requests; i.e. a good restaurant, assistance with booking a cab for a very early plane. The rooms are spacious and accommodating. The cost is very competitive.

My hubby has mentioned this hotel several times, so I booked it for his birthday last week. Great choice! We absolutely loved it. Spotless, comfy beds, free breakfast and Wi-Fi, great staff and location! What`s left to say? Reservation time, baby!
Manager Response: Dear ebonycowgirl,   Thank you so much for your candid review and for giving our hotel a try! We are honored to hear that you loved it and that you had the opportunity to enjoy our delicious complimentary Full American Breakfast. Guest satisfaction is our top priority and we strive to make each stay memorable. With that being said, we kindly encourage you to stay with us again, perhaps on your next special occasion! Once again thank you so much for your review.   Sincerely,   Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Pleasant room with very comfortable beds, average complimentary breakfast.  Very quiet room for a hotel adjacent to the freeway 405.  Convenient location to Seal and Long Beach.  Only downer was the maid forgot or missed our room for servicing.

Summary Heading: A beautiful hotel!!! I would stay again in a heartbeat!!!
Summary: Stayed for my daughters 16th birthday... Mom with teenagers alone ... I felt very safe!!! Rooms were beautiful!!! Free breakfast was awesome!!! Saved me $$$ for feeding friends:) I really enjoyed the clean comfortable bed!! It was a beautiful hotel ! Rooms were gorgeous and very CLEAN! Excellent choice of hotel ! I will stay again & again!

Summary Heading: Good hotel, good rooms, not so great locations
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in April, and overall experience was alright. The positives are the cleanliness and the size of the room. The breakfast was OK, nothing to be excited about, the location is next to the road construction, so it is quite noisy, but our room was facing the pool, so it was alright. The only real negative was the check in process: we requested early check in while reserving it, and the room was not ready, so we had to wait for an hour or so.   Have to mention that the bed was really comfortable. Will probably not stay at this location but would stay at other hotel of this chain.

I put my brother and his wife in this hotel when they were visiting here, I was nervous since they are fussy.  They loved it like I thought they would.  My brother liked the wine and cheese at 4:00 and the big breakfast.  The room was big and lovely clean bed.  Had refrigerator for their wine and milk.  He liked sitting in the gardens reading and she went in the pool, comfy chaise lounges.  Restaurants with bars you could walk to and whole shopping centre a block away.  Next to freeway offramp but quiet inside the hotel, you heard nothing.  Buses stopped outside and was a mile from the Beach.  They are coming back later this year for a month !!

I stayed here while attending a family party I the area. The room was nice, the photos make it look a lot older than it is because of the decor. The bed was really comfortable and the too was nice and clean.   The free breakfast was good. I just had the eggs and a little salsa. Make sure you don't get a room on the freeway side if you decided to stay here. This was the second time I stayed at this brand of hotel and I have to say it is a nice brand with a great value.

This is my first time writing a review on anything and I felt compelled to write a review for the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach because my experience was fantastic. I felt like I was staying at a relative's house.  The atmosphere was inviting.  The furniture was comfortable and clean. The morning breakfast had a personal chef cooking fresh blueberry pancakes, omlettes that were made-to-order and lots of other choices that were all fresh and delicous. The rooms were quiet and very clean.  The staff were happy and professional.  Just an overall wonderful experience!
Manager Response: Dear Pam,   Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us. Wow! I am so happy that we could be your first review and could provide you with such a remarkable experience! We work hard to provide the best guest service possible to ensure our guests are given a great stay. Again, thank you for taking the time to write an enthusiastic review and I hope you will have the chance to visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Steve De Lugo General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed just one night so we wouldn't have to drive home after a family birthday celebration nearby.  We were very pleased with all aspects of our stay from check-in to the moment we left.  First and foremost in importance to us is cleanliness, and our room was spotless.  The bed was very comfortable, and even though our room was close to the freeway, we did not hear any noise.  This is a great hotel, and we would stay again in a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Dear Anna,   We are so glad you chose to stay with us for the night, and we appreciate you taking the time to write a thorough review. We know that providing a clean and comfortable room is very important to ensure our guests have a satisfactory stay. I am happy to hear that we could provide these accommodations for you. We appreciate your kind notes and hope you will have the chance to visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Steve DeLugo  General Manager

Summary: We stayed here during a visit with family and found the hotel quite reasonable considering the fine chef prepared breakfasts with anything you'd want to choose from.  Several kinds of juice, fruit, pastries, and yoghurts were available but the pancakes, French toast and eggs were being prepared on the spot by a smiling chef.  The large dining area was warm and comfortable.  I will definitely stay here again.

I stay at this hotel regularly because of their commitment to excellence to hospitality, service, comfort, courtesy, cleanliness and so many more reasons. The Ayres Hotel is in Great location and they never disappoint in making every guest comfortable and welcome. A sense of luxury greets you as soon as you enter their property and carries through to their lobby and large rooms and bathes.  You will not be disappointed!

Summary Heading: One Of The Best In Both Seal Beach and Long Beach
Summary: I was in Long Beach for 6 nights. I tried several brands of hotels over the course of the first 3 days...all had issues such as thin walls, bad coffee, spendy parking or internet, old rooms, nonfriendly staff and so on.  Finally I decided to try Ayres Hotel, and hoped 4th time would be the charm. It was.  This is a large boutique hotel that really impressed me, despite it not have room service...everything else made up for it. 1) Excellent free breakfast - real eggs mixed with veges or bacon, real potatoes cooked, a chef there making you pancakes or omelettes or whatever else you want. Good coffee. Free. 2) Free parking. 3) Free internet. 4) Beautiful outside patio with water fountains and trees, quiet and relaxing, despite it being right next to the 405. 5) Nice pool and

This was a Spring Break trip for my teenager and a friend to visit CA beaches and the Ayres at Seal Beach was a great basecamp for this purpose.  The hotel is conveniently located off of the 405.  Even with construction, access off and on the 405 was easy.  All the staff members were very friendly and helpful and the room (2 queen beds) was very spacious and clean.  The free breakfast and free wi-fi were wonderful amenities. And for teenage girls to think this was a very nice hotel means a lot!  I had checked out locations and rates of several hotels before deciding on the Ayres and I was very happy with the decision to stay here.  It  offers a very good value, clean and spacious rooms, and a wonderful staff.

Summary Heading: Very good place in Seal Beach
Summary: I have had the opportunity to stay at the Ayres Hotel on Seal Beach Blvd for several business trips. It is a very nice hotel, very clean, great breakfasts and nice happy hour. The only area lacking for any business traveler who like to stay fit and healthy is a extremely small exercise room! The treadmill does not incline and only three people can be in the room at the same time.
Manager Response: Dear Lubes60,  It is always a pleasure to welcome you back to our hotel when you are visiting for business. Thank you for the compliments on the hotel being clean and having an excellent full American breakfast buffet. We are pleased to know that you are also able to enjoy the week night Manager's Reception with complimentary beer, wine, and appetizers. It is always a big hit with our guests. We apologize if the fitness room does not completely satisfy, we will keep your feedback in mind when making improvements to the hotel. Thank you again and we hope to see you once more when you are in the area next time.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo  General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent value, no compromise. We will be back!
Summary: Parking, Wi-Fi, AND breakfast for 4 included. And the spring special made for a very reasonable price at around $145 tax-in. If you do the math you should see a very good value here. This is no Motel 6 either, the European interior decor is faux but well done if a little french Full hotel but rooms were quiet. Service was excellent - and quick. The hotel is the perfect size in my opinion, small enough that it almost feels like home but large enough to have your anonymity. But yet again, not so large that it take a lot of time to get to breakfast or your room or parking lot etc. either. We had a room on the end so access from the parking lot was superb with the card system. We left early and came 'home' late all week like it was our personal residence. Hotel was great. Try it if
Manager Response: Dear Trevor C,  We cannot thank you enough for the glowing review of our hotel on TripAdvisor, your kind words are greatly appreciated. We are pleased to see that we became your "home" for the week, we were very honored to have you as our guests. We are also thrilled to know you enjoyed the extra amenities such as complimentary parking, WiFi, and the full American breakfast buffet. We hope you will visit again soon and thank you for taking the time to recommend our hotel by leaving a review on TripAdvisor.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: My first stay at an Ayres property, big thumbs up!
Summary: Really loved this hotel, will go back when next in the area. Very clean and well run.  We had a king size bed and it was so comfortable, sheets and towels are top quality! Bath room is newly tiled of top shiney materials and tub enclosure was extra wide, deep and hour glass shaped, not a seam with any mold in sight. One complaint... The water was hot in the shower but the pressure was poor in room 219. Sink is outside the bathroom, which I love! Outlets are well placed and plentiful. Wireless is free with simple code sign in.  The breakfast during the week includes an omelet chef cooking to your liking with several options.  On the weekends there are fresh, well prepared, scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, french toast etc.  There is an outdoor fireplace and ample tables to hang
Manager Response: Dear Flosser,  Thank you very much for your kind words on your experience at our hotel, they are greatly appreciated. We are so pleased to see that you found your accommodations to be clean, convenient, and comfortable. Thank you for your feedback on the water pressure in room 219 as we will use it to improve future guest satisfaction. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are thrilled to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. Thank you for taking the time to leave a flattering review on TripAdvisor and we hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: This was a awesome hotel for a quick overnight after a night of heavy drinking,  partying and dancing at a jazz show. The staff member at the front desk if I was sober enough name was Michael, just a genuine nice guy. The breakfast buffet was basic and ok, I'm not a pork Eater so I wish they had more options. But all in all a great boutique style hotel!!

Excellent, Excellent, Excellent is all I can say !!!  Truly a lovely European boutique like feeling, with large rooms and comfy bed and bath. Breakfast just O K, better than continental breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. Here to attend show at Spaghettini, which is very convenient, directly across the street. Also close to beaches, shopping and freeways. We will definitely return.

No complaints, the room was clean, the staff was very nice and the hot breakfast was great!!!  It wasn't the most quite hotel, but I think that was because there were a few events in the area that day.  I suggest bringing earplugs, but I am a VERY light sleeper - My husband didn't notice it.  Hot breakfast was fabulous and the outdoor area was really cute!  Wonderful value!
Manager Response: Dear Lauren G,  We were so very honored to have you and your husband as our guests recently. We are pleased to see that you found your accommodations to be clean, apologies for any noisy groups. Thank you for your feedback and compliments on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we are delighted to see that you enjoyed it. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent in every way...I will return.
Summary: Truly a lovely European boutique like feeling with large rooms and comfy bed and bath.Fabulous breakfast and yummy cookies.Staff friendly and helpful.Close to beaches, shopping and freeways. I will return.

I've stayed at a few Ayers and this location had the friendliest staff. Rooms was older but in ok condition. No bar, but a few restaurants close by so wasn't that big of a deal. Breakfast wasn't awful but wasn't very good either. Average place, average cost, nice people.
Manager Response: Dear James A,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a straightforward review of our hotel to let others on TripAdvisor know of your recent experience here. We sincerely appreciate your feedback on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we will definitely use it to improve guest satisfaction. We are pleased to see that you found our team to be nice, it is truly what we strive for. Hopefully, we will be able to welcome you another time in the near future and improve upon your impression of our hotel. Thank you again!  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Loved the bed and spacious room. Furnityure was top notch and their were 3 sitting areas.  bathroom setup was great with microwave and nice fridge (not your dinkiest)  preparation surfaces were great. sofa, desk, as well as  a table for 2.  free wifi  free hot breakfast.  very close to target and restaurants of all types and prices.

We arrived on tues. am , our room was ready, [ on time ] . pool was heated and so was spa very clean , breakfest  was great, fresh cooked to the asking, staff very friendly. We had the pleasure of meeting the general manager Steven de lugo , he was so helpful, his knowledge of the area was great, whenever we needed anything his help was greatly appreciated.... I cant say enough about the hotel great time, and thanks again to Steven.. He made our trip I will be back and referring all my friends...

We stayed at this hotel this past weekend. The staff was very attentive and very helpful when we needed info on catalina island. The room was very comfortable, clean; halls smelled fresh...full breakfast was excellent! We definitely will be returning to this establishment! Well done, Ayres!

Summary Heading: Large room, great breakfast,  no recycling
Summary: We vacation in SoCal every spring & stay at Ayres for its  high quality comfort.  But when are you going to start recycling and offer guests same? Your card in room with reduce, reuse, renew is missing another word: RECYCLE. Thanks.
Manager Response: Dear Ruth R,  We sincerely appreciate your kind feedback about your recent visit to our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how pleasant your stay was. We are so pleased to see that you choose us when you are in the area, your loyalty is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your comments on our green practices. We do, in fact, sort through all recyclable materials in back of house. Thank you again and we hope to see you another time in the near future.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not to far from Seal Beach
Summary: My wife is from the Seal Beach area, so we fly there to visit family every other year or so, last time we stayed at this hotel. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, the breakfast buffet was great. My only complaint was the teens and pre-teens that took over the pool and hot tube a couple of nights, NOT the hotels fault, just bad parents. My favorite beach in all southern CA is only a few minutes away (Seal Beach). Great place for families.
Manager Response: Dear bsanderson81,  It was a pleasure to welcome you again during your visit to the area. We sincerely appreciate your loyalty and kindly worded review. It is such a delight to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Thank you for recommending our hotel as a family friendly hotel on TripAdvisor, it is a great honor you consider us to be so. We cannot wait to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We had a team meeting with about 30 plus folks staying at the Ayres.  I was skeptical about the location but it turned out to be great.  About equidistant from LAX and SNA and right off the 405.  Pretty decent location if you are using it for a base to get any wthere in South LA County/or in Orange county.  There are plenty of restaurants within in a 15 minute walk and even more if you are willing to drive, there are tons of options in Long Beach, Cerritos, Garden Grove, etc.  Not very much to really do near the hotel.  The rooms are quaint and cozy.  It feels as promised...a boutique hotel experience.   The meeting room adequately held our 40 folks in attendance.  I wouldn't put too many more than 50..but they could open up another section if needed.    I'd use this place again!
Manager Response: Dear TahmiJoh,  We are so very pleased to see that your team meeting was quite a success at our hotel. Thank you for your kind feedback and recommendation on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience. It is nice to know that you enjoyed the central location of the hotel and found it to be convenient during your stay. We hope the next time you come to stay we will be able to suggest more activities for you in the area. Thank you again and we cannot wait to welcome you and your team another time in the near future.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at Ayers Hotel for a week in January. This hotel was great. Staff is very friendly and helpful, location is great you can actually walk to some stores. The laundry facility is great, breakfast was good. I travel to this location frequently and have stayed a some very expensive hotels in the Long Beach Area and I can tell you none of the staff at the other hotels were as nice or helpful as staff at the Ayres Hotel. I would highly reccomond this hotel. I am picky and I could find nothing wrong with my stay. I will certinally be making Ayres Hotel my go to spot during my California stays. Try it you'll love it. Eating breakfast in the courtyard is refreshing!
Manager Response: Dear emh720,  Thank you for taking the time to recommend our hotel by leaving a review on TripAdvisor; we sincerely appreciate your kind words. It is very nice to know that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay and found the complimentary full American breakfast, laundry facility, and location to be satisfactory. We truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are delighted to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We cannot wait to welcome you another time in the hopefully near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: A one-night stay, part business, part pleasure.  It was lovely. Front desk agent was very friendly.  Breakfast was super, we enjoyed having the hot options, which included scrambled eggs, pancakes and french toast, and sausage; as well as the more usual juices, coffee, danish, cereal, breads.  They did not have yogurt though.  Also nice touch to have a coffee to go cart in the hotel lobby in the morning.  We enjoyed having use of the jacuzzi.   Beds were quite nice, the bath area felt regal.  Appreciated having the micro and fridge, and free internet and parking.

we visited the area for a local wedding...the room was imaculately clean, the staff was overfriendly and most helpful...loved the breakfast and cookies in the evening. we can not wait to visit again, very nice hotel.
Manager Response: Dear  Susan C,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience. We are thrilled to see that you found your accommodations to be exceptional, we greatly appreciate your kind words. It is also nice to know that you enjoyed the team, we truly strive for the highest quality of service and are thrilled to know you found it as such. Thank you choosing our hotel, we hope to have you in the near future.   Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: After checking into the hotel on Thursday I had an allergic reaction to either the bedding or the water, at the moment I am covered in a very uncomfortable rash from head to toe. I felt slimy when I showered and washed my hands, using the water for brushing my teeth caused whatever is in the water to get into my system.
Manager Response: Dear Rhonda P,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave some feedback on your recent experience at our hotel, it is greatly appreciated. Please be assured that the water issue will be looked into as to prevent future incidents such as this. We do hope your stay was enjoyable besides the set backs. Please accept our heartfelt apologies that you were not more comfortable during your stay. Thank you for leaving a review on TripAdvisor so that we may use your feedback to improve guest satisfaction.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We always stay here when we travel to the LA area. The staff recognizes us and it feel like home away from home. It is a great experience, comfortable, great breakfast, close to everything. Internet service is excellent, washer, dryer on each floor is very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear Joseph S,  Thank you very much for choosing to stay at our hotel when you visit the area, we were so pleased to have you. We truly appreciate the compliments! It is nice to know that you find our hotel to be a home away from home, comfortable, and convenient. We cannot wait to hopefully welcome you back another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Clean and comfortable room, friendly staff, close to many attractions, and excellent breakfast. We usually stay at Hampton Inn or Spring Hill Suites and did stay at all three on this trip and Ayres was by far the best experience. Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear BK84065,  It is such a delight to see that you found your accommodations to be clean and comfortable, it is truly what we strive for. Thank you for the compliments on the friendly service and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We are so pleased to see that you chose to stay with us this trip and that you were not disappointed whatsoever. We look forward to welcoming you another time soon and thank you for taking the time to leave a review!  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: This place is a huge fake, ghetto, wanna be, "boutique hotel". List of MANY WRONGS: No movie channels, Ice machine broken, bathtub plug doesnt work, no room service, tiny rooms, pathetic bedding, I asked for a comforter and got an itchy camping blanket and was told comforters were all out being cleaned...yeah right. Also there's no left turn back into the hotel from the ONLY area you CAN get food after 11pm. You drive far to flip it. Cheap decor everywhere, yet it's trying hard to look expensive. They are cheap with toiletries..ONE COMBO SOAP AND SHAMPOO, FOR A TWO BED ROOM!!!! The soap doesnt even lather and smells horrible..some unscented, non soap. It didnt make us feel nice coming out of the shower (forced to shower since tub broken) There are no housecoats (even comfort inn
Manager Response: Dear VegasBaby13,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a very candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know of your recent experience at our hotel. Please accept our deepest apologies that you were not completely satisfied with your visit. We are very saddened to see that you were disappointed with your accommodations and amenities.
