Rest assured, these issues will be looked into so that we may prevent future experiences such as this. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We are usually customers of Hampton Inns and there is a Hampton close to the Ayres, but the Tripadvisor reviews of the Ayres were much better.  Now that we have stayed at the Ayres for two nights I would say that it is a cut above the Hampton.  The rooms are comfortable and the d√©cor is of a distinctive style.  The breakfast is excellent.  A wonderful chef personally cooks eggs, sausages, French toast and pancakes.  He will even make an omelet.  There is an array of cereals including muesli.  No Styrofoam and plastic, but rather stainless steel utensils and china.  The only comment I would make, that other reviewers made, is that the cooking, the re-stocking and the bussing of tables is all too much for one person, no matter how cheerful he is.    We were able to get a ‚Äúwinter
Manager Response: Dear 5670,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a glowing review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so very pleased to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay. It is nice to know that you were pleased with the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve the guest experience. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: I have stayed at many hotels in my travels, but this place far exceeded my expectations.  Very clean and spacious rooms.  Great breakfast and friendly staff!  Highly recommended.  Will definately stay here again.

I've stayed at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach twice now in connection with business meetings.  The staff is helpful, and the facilities are well appointed and well maintained.  The hotel is very easy to access from the 405 Freeway, and it's easy to get back on that freeway if you know the secret (to drive out the back entrance of the parking lot, not the front one!).  There are very good restaurants ranging from fresh-fast-food (Baja Fresh) to burgers (Islands) to fine dining (Kobe Steakhouse), less than half a mile away and walkable.  Sometimes the hotel runs special discounts, which are a good bargain if you can catch one.

This was a very comfortable hotel, lovely interior and rooms, different than many cookie cutter chain brands. The room was very comfortable and the location was convenient near I-405. The staff was very helpful and attentive.

Been here twice, very nice hotel, all clean. Very helpfull staff, allso at breakfast. Very near to highway without the hassle. But "European" ? No! But still very nice. I Would come back here everytime.

What a wonderful hotel, the furnishings and attention to details were so evident! The room was large with a beautiful carved headboard and massive armoire. There was a lovely couch and coffee table that reminded you of antiques. The bathroom was stocked with amenities, and even the tile had a beautiful finishing on each piece. Breakfast was hot and plentiful, with a chef making fresh pancakes and french toast to go with the bacon and eggs. It was too cold outside to swim, but the hot tub was a perfect temperature! They even had a laundry room on our floor, and sold detergent at the front desk. We were totally satisfied and will definitely return!
Manager Response: Dear Ihorow1160,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for the fantastic review and your kind words. Also, thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. It is nice to know you enjoyed the complimentary full American breakfast buffet and hot tub. We are very pleased to see that you left completely satisfied and will return another time, it is truly what we strive for. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: It is nice to have a hotel to come to after a hectic day.  My mom lives in Leisure World right around the corner.  It gave her piece of mind knowing we were so close, yet gave us the space to unwind.  Love the breakfast choices and the fact that there is a happy hour time during the week...helps the unwinding process.  Sean at the front desk and on the phone is great/very personable and makes you feel comfortable right away.  Housekeeping is great, our blow dryer died and was replaced by the time we returned...very courteous and friendly.  Loved the size of the room, nice to have a king bed and couch/living type area. We used to stay with my mom in Leisure World, that is no longer an option, so staying at the Ayers really works....close to everything we need, reasonably priced

We had a GREAT visit to Ayers Hotel Seal Beach!!! It was a perfect location for anybody visiting the sites of LA.  It was close to everything (LA, Hollywood, Disneyland, etc.) All types of restaurants and shopping close! The kids LOVED getting in the heated pool and hot tub! It was beautifully decorated and clean! Everyone was friendly. It also helped having a fridge and microwave in the room. Nice size rooms too. I would highly recommend it for the value!

Nice place but the beds were uncomfortable, especially the sofa sleeper that my son had to sleep on cause they were out of room with 2 Q beds. The shower was so loud in the room above us it woke me up. All in all a nice place and the staff was very helpful.
Manager Response: Dear MMart2195,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a candid review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. Please accept our heartfelt apologies that your stay was anything less than exceptional. We hope you will reconsider staying with us another time so that we may provide you accommodations specific to your liking. You feedback is greatly appreciated and will be used to improve guest satisfaction. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: We LOVE the Ayers Hotel Seal Beach~!!!  My parents live in nearby Leisure World, and we stay at the Ayers every time we go down south to see them.  The rooms are BEAUTIFUL; they are roomy, and have everything you need: microwave, refrigerator, etc; the beds are very comfortable; the bathtubs are deep and comfy; and the service is top notch.  We also LOVE the breakfast; the choices are more than plentiful, and the food is delicious.  We'll see you next trip.

It was our second time at an Ayres property and we enjoyed our stay. The lobby area and rooms were stylish and comfortable- and the staff very friendly.  Our only two issues were that the breakfast hours are more tuned to the business traveler (6-9am) and not families on vacation- especially during the Christmas/New Year Holiday. It would be nice to have extended it to 10AM during the week of the holiday- so that those who need to sleep a but longer from a busier day the day before can enjoy a little sleep and a nice breakfast. The other issue related to this is that this caused a major rush on the breakfast area around 830 or 845- which led to a shortage on a number of food items. The breakfast Chef was excellent- but had to try to do most everything himself- and this was a
Manager Response: Dear Hankmax,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a kindly worded review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your visit to our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you chose to stay with our collection for a second time. It is nice to know that you found your accommodations to be stylish and comfortable. Thank you for your feedback on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we will definitely keep it in mind when making improvements to the hotel. We hope to see you and your family another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely,  Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary Heading: I would have rated this hotel higher but for the air conditioning.
Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel after several trips to this area. We requested an upper floor away from the freeway construction, which was honored by the staff. The room was quiet, clean and well stocked with towels and soap. I appreciated the all day coffee in the lobby.  The breakfast was a cut above the normal for a hotel in this price range, but with frequent shortages. The chef seemed to be doing everything to keep items stocked, but needed help at times.  My main complaint was the temperature in the room. The first problem was a constant cold draft coming through the front door and in the bathroom. Secondly, the AC unit was constantly cycling between hot and cold air all day and night. I cannot believe that this is considered an energy efficient unit. All we needed
Manager Response: Dear David S.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We sincerely thank you for your feedback, it will surely be used to make improvements to the hotel. Your room's air conditioning will be looked into and repaired so that we may prevent future incidents such as this. Thank you for the compliments on the well-stocked room and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us when you visit the area so that we may prove to you how pleasant a stay with us can truly be.  Thank you again, Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: This hotel and staff are wonderful!  Not only are the rooms clean and quiet, but the hotel is close to shopping, restaurants, and the beach.  The beach is about 10 minutes away, but Seal Beach is a quaint little beach that has boutiques and niche restaurants as well.  We left our iPhone charger in the room by accident, and the housekeeping staff found it, called us, and we were able to pick it up.

Every one was nice at check in, room was good but chilly. finally figured out that the thermostat was off by 8 to 10 degrees. We had to set it at 88f to get the room comfortable. Whenever the heating unit turned off it made a loud sound. Not much rest the two nights we were there. But the breakfast was great! And check out was smooth.
Manager Response: Dear gonzo25k,  Please accept our sincerest apologies that your room accommodations disturbed your sleep quality. It is disappointing to see that this inconvenience caused such a low rating from you. However, thank you for your feedback as it will come useful to improve the quality of the room and hotel overall. We will definitely look into the thermostat issue to prevent any further disturbances. Thank you for the compliments on smooth check in and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope you will stay another time in near future and thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let us know about your experience.  Sincerely, Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: Looking for a hotel to recommend for family and friends coming to a wedding in March. We know it as a business hotel, not bad as a family hotel. Pool pretty standard, workout room has a recumbent bike, a treadmill and a combo weight machine not much to speak of. Rooms are nice with nice look and size.
Manager Response: Dear Keith N,  We are so pleased to see that you are considering our hotel to recommend for friends and family for your March wedding. Thank you for the compliments on the nice look and size of the accommodations we have to offer. If you would like to set up a group block of rooms with a special rate for the guests of your wedding, please contact our Director of Sales. We hope to see you, your friends, and family soon and congratulations!  Sincerely, Steve de Lugo General Manager

Summary: A bit antique looking but big spacious rooms and a good complimentary breakfast. We came for a one night stay for a soccer tournament. If staying more than just the night I wouldn't recommend as they don't have any room service or in house dining

The hotel was near the beach, shopping and a casino.. Nice location, everything was a short drive away. You can walk to the beach and the quaint town of seal beach if you start early its approximately 6 miles from the hotel. Get tired take the city bus its $2 and you get a free transfer!

This is our second stay at the Seal Beach location. As before, it was a fine choice for comfort, value and reliability. I can only add pluses to my fellow reviewers. The Seal Beach bridge construction is complete but the I-405 freeway mess is the only minor glitch to get to the hotel, but only if you arrive late in the evening. The "free" breakfast selection is one of the top's in the Ayers chain. And this is the best choice if you are a lover of Jazz and need to crash after a concert at Spaghettini restaurant across the street. That will be in my restaurant review. I must confess, though, that I failed to remember the young lady's name who checked us in. She helped us select a quieter room. I know that it's their job but If someone goes above and beyond we need to recognize
Manager Response: Dear Bill L.,  Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us for a second time; returning and satisfied guests are truly what we strive for. Thank you for the compliment on the complimentary full American breakfast, we are so pleased to see that you enjoy it during your stays. It is also nice to see that one of our team members was able to easily accommodate you into a quiet room. Thank you for taking the time to leave another review to let others know about how pleasant a stay with us can be and we cannot wait to welcome you back another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Steve de Lego General Manager

Summary Heading: Attentive, attractive and comfortable sums it up!
Summary: We enjoyed our Thanksgiving stay of four nights. We had a small issue with a loud guest, however, before we complained, the security guard had the situation under control!  So much appreciated. Beautiful hotel and breakfast!  Staff served us well! We will return!
Manager Response: Dear Cindyn3671,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how great a stay with us can be. It is very nice to know that our team was able to handle the inconvenient situation quickly and effectively. Thank you for your compliments on the attractiveness of the hotel and complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope to welcome you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Steve de Lego General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed at Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach for four nights. It was an excellent stay! The front desk service was excellent multiple times. The breakfast was actually good, which in my experience, is unusual for hotels. Another benefit; there are quite a few restaurants within walking distance. I would recommend this facility, and if I go back to this area, I would stay there again. One note: If you don't like fluffy pillows (I don't), bring your own.
Manager Response: Dear Sandy5261,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for the compliments on our excellent service; we truly strive to offer the highest quality of service and are so pleased to see that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. We are also delighted to know that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast buffet, it is great to know that we exceeded your hotel breakfast expectations. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we cannot wait to welcome you again soon.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillps General Manager

Summary: I've stayed in many 5 star expensive hotels and I have to say my first time at Ayers feels like a high end hotel but with excellent rates that include a full free breakfast.  The hotel was immacculate, the room was plush with a designer feel and the bed extremely comfortable.  The manager and staff were all very professional and friendly.  I will be recommeding your to friends and family.   Thank you.

When we travel to this part of Orange Country (Seal Beach, Huntington Beach or Long Beach) we always choose this hotel.  It is not located near the beach, but is near the junction of the 405/605/22 freeways, so it is a great location for access.  The rooms are spacious and furnished with extra chairs and a sofa, at a price that is very reasonable.

Have wanted to try out this hotel in Seal Beach, and finally got the chance. Close to 405 freeway, and lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Beautiful, clean, comfortable room. The staff were friendly and amazing. Would highly recommend, they didn't have their own restaurant but offered hospitality free drinks and snacks in late afternoon, and free hot breakfast with a chef to make omelette in the morning.

Extremely friendly staff!  Rooms were very spacious, clean, and inviting.  The  grounds offered a nice swimming pool and spa, outdoor fire place, and a fantastic breakfast - what more could one ask for.  Not to mention; no resort fees, and no parking fees, finally a hotel not trying to make an extra buck.  We would stay here again without a doubt.

Summary Heading: A good accomodation for business trips
Summary: Over all it is a good accomodation for a business trip and if you don't mind to go out by car. The rooms are large and confortable. The breakfast is good even if the variety of jam could be better (only one type was available, no honey, no plain joghurt).
Manager Response: Dear Klaus S.,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a straight-forward review of our hotel on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience. We are so pleased to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and found them to be large and comfortable. Thank you for your compliments on the full American breakfast buffet, your feedback is greatly appreciate and we will be sure to keep it in mind when making improvements to the breakfast. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: This hotel has great service, but if you need air conditioning this is not the place to stay. Every room is set to 69 degrees (to hot for us). We had to buy a fan in order for us to be comfortable. I understand they are trying to keep costs down, but 69 degrees to a little to hot for the average person. We will never stay here again because of this feature.
Manager Response: Dear Irene P.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of your recent experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor. We are pleased to see that you found our service to be accommodating. However, we truly apologize if you felt inconvenienced at all by the air conditioner in  your room. Guests do have the ability to change the temperature of the room and we apologize if this was not made clear or if it was not working. We hope this did not put too much of a damper on your stay and hope that you will reconsider staying with us another time in the near future. Thank you again for your review.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: Great       So much fun to swim the cook was great they are clean here  I like the breakfast here it is great the suit patio next to the outdoor fireplace and heaters next to kitchen and pool make me ready for another night for classy rooms and romance at my feet I feel pampered and loved here very much at home Thankyou
Manager Response: Dear Regina M.,  We were so very honored to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience. We are so pleased to see that you found your patio suite to be classy and romantic. Thank you for the compliments on the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, they will definitely be passed along to the team. We hope to see you another time in the near future, thank you again.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: We stayed here while attending a funeral.  The decor is very formal and traditional, but nice.  The free continental breakfast was also an added perk.  I got little, to no sleep during our stay here.  A party started at 2:00 AM in the hallway and the room next to ours.  We called the front desk and, to their credit, they did go and ask the group to quiet down. The group was quiet for a bit and then carried on slamming doors and yelling.  The staff really should have returned and made sure that the party had actually stopped.  We were staying on the 2nd floor and we could hear every footstep above our heads.
Manager Response: Dear MPLSUnfiltered,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a candid review of your experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor. We truly appreciate the compliments on the decor of the hotel and the complimentary full American breakfast buffet, we are so pleased to see that you enjoyed both. Please accept our heartfelt apologies for the less than exceptional sleep quality. We truly strive to make everyone of our guest's visits as pleasant as possible and are devastated to see that we did not succeed in that goal with your stay. We do hope that fellow guest behavior does not hinder you from letting us welcome you back in the near future. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Ayers this past weekend ( to attend a wedding) and were impressed with service , decor and general state (cleanliness) of the hotel. Shucks, we missed out on the happy hours but enjoyed the breakfast that was included in the mornings. It would have been nice if there were a small bar open say from 4-midnight but I managed as I had a rental car. Overall though we very much enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Dear doktordre56,  We were so honored to have you as our guest recently. Thank you for your compliments on our impressive service, decor, and cleanliness. We truly strive to make every guest's experience as pleasant as possible and are so pleased to find out that we succeeded in that goal with your stay. Hopefully the next time you come visit us you will be able to enjoy the complimentary Manager's Reception. We hope to see you another time in the near future and thank you again.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary Heading: Research before booking especially as part of the bridal party.
Summary: Excuse any typos as I am a bit frustrated. My best friend was getting married at old ranch country club and Ayres Hotel is the nearest of course.  I booked the couples escape a month a head and also booked one of the bigger suites for the bride and all the bridesmaid to spend the night and get ready for the next day.  As we checked in on a friday the first gal was not very friendly at all.  We wanted to see the room since we were going to use the room saturday morning as part of our photo shoot.  She told us to return later in the evening since someone is currently occupying the room.  I asked, since I'm already in the hotel on friday if I could check in early saturday morning so my boyfriend doesn't have to worry about the keys and all.  Her response of course is, "you can try
Manager Response: Dear Vanessa L.,  Please accept my belated heartfelt apologies that you and your friend's special day was anything less than exceptional. We truly strive to offer the highest quality service and are devastated to see that you felt our service was not accommodating. We apologize that you could not see the room early or get in early, but some things are simply out of our control. As for checking in at 3PM, we are terribly sorry the room was not ready and that your significant other did not have a place to prepare for the wedding. Again, we are deeply remorseful for your unpleasant experience. We do hope you will give us another chance to show you how truly pleasant a stay at our hotel can be.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: This is third time we have stayed at this hotel.  The property is well maintained and the staff provides outstanding service.  It is  a very comfortable place to stay.  Seal Beach is a reminder of the good old days.  Wholesome and fun.
Manager Response: Dear IrvB,  Thank you for choosing us as your home away from home, we are so very honored to welcome you back on numerous occasions. Your compliments of the well maintained property and accommodating staff are greatly appreciated. We are so pleased to see that you find our hotel worthy of a glowing 5 star review, thank you for finding us as a comfortable place to stay when you are in the Seal Beach area. We hope to see you again soon!  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: Hotel was nice.  Dosen't have any shuttle service to anything, so if you want to go somewhere you must rent a car or use a cab.  They do have a car rental on site, but not open on Sat or Sun.  Price is a little high for what the have.  No restaurant on site.
Manager Response: Dear Susan C.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you found our hotel to be nice. Our sincerest apologies if the lack of a shuttle service put a damper on your stay. We understand that this may be an inconvenience, as well as not having a restaurant on site. Some things we simply do not have the ability to offer; we hope that the restaurants located across the street and nearby were able to satisfy your needs. Please do give us the pleasure of welcoming you back another time and thank you again.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: The hotel is awesome and the customer service is great. But with all of the fwy construction it's not easily accessible. Great free,HOT breakfast! The rooms are nice and clean. The microwave and fridge are an added value!
Manager Response: Dear Shana D,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a kind review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your recent experience at our hotel. We are so pleased to see that you found our hotel to have great service and value with the extra amenities such as the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. Our sincerest apologies if the freeway construction made it hard for you to access the hotel. We do email and offer detour information at the front desk and apologize if this was not enough notice for easy accessibility. Again, thank you and we hope to welcome you back another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: This property is beautiful.  We had a king room that was very well-kept, without a speck of dust.  The staff met every question with a big smile and good advice.  We had some trouble finding it, as we expected it to be farther from the interstate, but with a call to the hotel we drove right to it.  there was some road construction but the room was quiet. The breakfast was delicious and the afternoon Happy House spread was a nice surprise. Based on this experience, we would absolutely stay in any of the Ayres properties when we are in CA.

We have stayed at the Ayers, Seal Beach location several times this year for personal travel.  It is very comfortable and conveniently located.  The rooms are nicely furnished,have plenty of space and are very clean.  They also provide a hot breakfast every morning and if you are there during the week, a happy hour time with drinks and appetizers!  The staff is friendly and professional.  We had a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: Best Value for the Money Spent!
Summary: This hotel is located near major freeways which makes it very convenient to everything! Easy to get to LAX and Disneyland.  Breakfast is a nice amenity...ask for a made-to-order omelette...done with a big smile!  Could not find anything wrong with this hotel! Make your reservation already!
Manager Response: Dear Akamaiguy2,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a straightforward review on TripAdvisor to recommend our hotel. It is such a delight to see that you truly enjoyed your stay. Thank you for the compliments of the convenient location and the complimentary full American breakfast buffet. We hope to see you in the near future and thank you again for your kind words.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: GREAT Stay at the Ayers Seal Beach
Summary: Great room - two queen beds with wall separating the two -Great for families. In room small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker. Free Happy Hour ! Close to all. Looking forward to staying here again!
Manager Response: Dear N C,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a direct and honest review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. It is such a great pleasure to see that you found the 2 Queen Studio Suite with partition wall accommodating for you and your family. It is also nice to know you enjoyed the room amenities and the complimentary weekday Manager's Reception. Thank you again for your kind words and we hope to be able to welcome you another time in the near future.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in Seal Beach: Ayres
Summary: Everything about the hotel was top notch: furniture in room, cleanliness, attitude of staff, great free cookies, and lots of parking.  Buffet breakfast only is served in the restaurant.  Plus the price of the hotel was very reasonable.  You can walk to the nearby country club which was great.
Manager Response: Dear Rick G.,  Thank you so very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know how top notch your visit at our hotel was. We truly appreciate the compliments of the decor, cleanliness, service, and complimentary parking. It is nice to also know that you enjoyed the full American breakfast buffet and the convenient location. Thank you for considering our hotel as a good value. Again, thank you for your kind words and we hope to see you in the near future.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: What I asked for and what I got.
Summary: Since I have mobility problems and walk with a cane, I asked for certain things.  I asked for a lower bed, which I didn't get.  When I booked the room, the person asked if I needed to be lower.  But the bed was almost too high for my 5ft. tall frame to get into.  It was, however, lower to the ground floor.  I wanted to take the shuttle to the event from the hotel, but were told the steps were too high, so I ended up driving.  I wanted a weightwatchers-style breakfast that was diabetic friendly, but there was mostly eggs, pancakes, and sausage. There was, however, sugar-free syrup.  I wanted help checking out and getting my things to the car on Sunday. I was told that the "men didn't work on Sunday".  When I explained my situation, they got me someone from housekeeping, who got a
Manager Response: Dear H B,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a candid review of your recent experience at our hotel. Our deepest apologies if your stay was anything less than exceptional. We do offer ADA Accessible rooms and typically they suite our disabled guests well, we are truly apologetic that your room did not accommodate you as it should have. We truly strive to offer the best possible accommodations and service and are devastated to see that you thought otherwise. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future and hope to see you soon so that we may be able to prove to you how pleasant a stay with us can truly be. Again, our sincerest apologies if you felt we did not cater to your needs accordingly.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I'm only 60 miles from home, but stayed here because my daughter was getting married at the Old Ranch Country Club up the street. My room was vary large with a king bed & pull out sofa, fridge & microwave, and liked the idea of the sink area being separate from the shower area, they serve an excellent full breakfast, where you can sit outside in the beautiful California weather.  Several other friends & relatives stayed here too & also enjoyed their stay.   The beds were very comfortable.  I would highly recommend staying here.  The staff was courteous & welcoming.
Manager Response: Dear Joanne D.,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a fantastic review of your visit to our hotel on TripAdvisor. We are so pleased to see that you chose to stay with us during your daughter's special day. We truly strive to offer the most exceptional accommodations and are so glad to see that you thought so. Thank you for the compliments of the complimentary American breakfast buffet, it is nice to know that you enjoyed it. We hope you come to stay with us again soon and thank you again for the flattering review.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I have heard nothing but nice things about Ayres Hotel, but have never stayed at one of their hotels. I was getting married at Old Ranch across the street so I figured Ayres was the perfect location for myself and bridal party to get ready at the day of my wedding.  I originally wanted to book 1 big suite, but it was unavailable for the night I wanted so the lady on the phone recommended we get 2 king patio suites and she would make sure they were right next to each other. I didn't really want to have separation like that but just rolled with it.  I asked her about 3 times if that was a guarantee that they would be next to each other and she said yes.  I then proceeded to call Ayres a week later and verify this information with a man at the front desk.  I felt more relieved, but
Manager Response: Dear KScott927,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a candid review of your experience with our hotel on TripAdvisor. Our sincerest apologies if your stay was anything less than exceptional. We truly strive to offer the most accommodating and friendliest service and are devastated to see that we did not succeed in this goal with your stay.  I have reviewed your reservation and it looks as if originally the rooms were booked together, but upon arrival there was a change. This was most likely due to a maintenance issue and for that, we offer our deepest apologies. As for the shower curtain, we are looking into it. Every room should have one. It is possible through a deep cleaning of the room it never got replaced. Again our we are so very sorry if this put a damper on your special day. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Pretty good hotel with so-so location
Summary: We thought the rooms were very nice and had lots of room.  The breakfast was good except they won't make you an omelette on a weekend.   The downfall is it's a good drive away from the actual beach (took us on average 15 minutes).
Manager Response: Dear Josh B.,  We were so honored to have you as our guest recently. It is nice to see that  you thought your accommodations were spacious and nice. Thank you for the compliments on our full American breakfast buffet. However, our apologies if you were not completely satisfied. We are also so very sorry to see that it took you a while to get to the beach, a situation that is plainly out of our control. Hopefully, the distance from the beach did not put too much of a damper on your stay and we hope that you will visit another time soon. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay with us; we do hope the next time you come to stay with us we will be able to wow you enough for a 5 star rating.  Sincerely, Kelly Phillips General Manager

Summary: I have been staying at the Ayers Seal Beach for about 6 years. Jerry has been an amazing employee always making me feel welcome and asking about my family. This week was a rough week at work and when I came "home" to my room, Jerry had placed my favorite chocolate chip cookies on a plater. I saw him and he said he was going to put wine in my room too but didn't know if I wanted red or white. After I thanked him for his thoughtfulness, that it was the thought that counted and that red was my favorite, he had a bottle of Pinot Noir brought up to my room 5 minutes later. It was a wonderful surprise and a true delight. I believe the Ayers is so lucky to have the insightful staff and for the company to allow it's staff to surprise and delight the customer.

The rooms are very nice - beautifully decorated with high ceilings.  The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  The complimentary breakfast was great with eggs, bacon or sausage - pancakes, french toast, fruit, breads, assorted muffins and pastries and juices.  I have stayed here 3 times and have had excellent experiences each time.  Plan to stay here my next trip to Seal Beach.

Very impressed by cleanliness of rooms, friendliness of staff, nice hot buffet breakfast. Would definitely stay here again. Guests were warned of construction noise on 405 fwy. closeby, but there was no noise that kept me from sleeping peacefully on my very comfortable mattress.

My husband and I attended a wedding across the street at the Old Ranch Country Club.  We booked a room at the Ayres for convenience and price.  The reception desk was friendly, efficient, and surprise - they were out of the room we booked, so they upgraded us at no charge.  Although we only stayed one night, it was a great experience.

The Seal Beach Ayres hotel provides the perfect location for my time in Southern California. It is close to the beach, freeway, shopping and friends. Although there is an extensive freeway construction project going on all around the hotel, neither access nor noise was a problem. Parking is free and the breakfast is more than adequate.  This friendly place is my first choice when visiting the coast.
Manager Response: Dear tonysutera,  Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your experience at our hotel. We are so glad to see that you enjoy the location and find it convenient. Your compliments of the amenities are greatly appreciated. We truly strive to offer exceptional accommodations and are so glad that the freeway construction did not disrupt your stay. Thank you again and we cannot wait to welcome you in the near future.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I have big issues with this hotel in making reservations, in checking into the hotel, and with staff follow-up. There is major construction outside the hotel that is performed at night, and it is very loud, so it may interfere with a guest's sleep. It certainly interfered with min. I was not informed of this when I made my reservation, and I feel I should have been. In addition, I was put into a room on the side of the hotel that is next to the construction, and I was not informed of this; thus, I was not given an option to be put into a room away from the noise. While this is bad enough, when I asked to be moved into a room away from the noise, I was told that the hotel has only ever received "one complaint", and they refused to change my room. Finally, at 11:00 at night, when
Manager Response: Dear SLL00,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a candid review about your experience at our hotel on TripAdvisor. Our sincerest apologies for your less than exceptional stay. We truly strive to provide outstanding customer service as well as accommodations and are so devastated to see that we did not succeed in your stay with us. Typically, when we send out confirmation letters and pre-arrival letters there are notices about the freeway construction; we also have freeway construction notices on the front desk about detour information. We are deeply apologetic if this was not enough notice for you. Thank you for your comments and we will be sure to let others know about the freeway construction as they are making reservations from now on.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Despite the current bridge construction nearby, the hotel is always REALLY great!  Since staying here 3 - 4 time a year for the last three years, every time has been an absolute pleasure,  The reservation process has always been smooth and efficient   Great staff, great breakfast buffet and great accommodations.  The mattresses and the linens are SO comfortable and very high quality.  (That means a lot to me!)  I enjoyed the Happy Hour that is available every week night (not weekends).  And of course, there is always plenty of hot water for EVERYONE in the morning!.  Ayres is definitely a wonderful choice to select for your stay in CA.  I just wish there were other Ayres properties in neighboring states, but at least we have the opportunity to enjoy them while visiting in CA.

My stay started off on the wrong foot, but I understand things sometimes happen: somehow my reservation had been messed up and somebody had added a note that I required their best suite?  Then when I mentioned that i most certainly did NOT require that suite but only a standard room, it took a few minutes before I could convince the nice lady that she should honor the rate I had originally been promised (as shown on my printed, original invoice).  Regardless, it was straightened out eventually and I was able to take in the hotel.  My take: I'm a bit younger than the crowd that would traditionally enjoy this establishment.  Everything is done to make it feel like this place was plucked out of old Europe and plopped down in CA.  I personally didn't care for the decor, especially
Manager Response: Dear mxlonerider,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a review on TripAdvisor to let others know about your stay at our hotel. Our hotel chain is inspired by European Boutique hotels, we understand that the decor is not for everyone so we appreciate the comments and difference of opinion. Our sincerest apologies if you felt as if our service was not the friendliest. Rest assured, I will discuss this with the team to make sure we are living up to our standards. The freeway construction has been an issue, and we are sorry if it may have put a damper on your stay. Again, thank you for the candid review and we do hope you consider staying with us again in the future so that we can make your stay more than exceptional.  Sincerely, Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Quite a pleasant surprise to a New Englander.
Summary: Traveling cross country from New England, we were pleasantly surprised to find this gem of a hotel in Seal Beach. Unfortunately, we only had an overnight stay. From the moment we entered the inviting lobby, the French antique furniture sprinkled throughout the hotel gave us the feeling we were in a fine French hotel. The receptionists were helpful and accommodating. Our king sized bedroom was beautifully appointed. The  bed was very plush and comfortable, and the room was impeccably clean with a full size couch. I must say this hotel was the quietest in which I have ever spent a night. And, it wasn't hard to take sitting under a canopy on their outdoor patio to enjoy the delicious full hot breakfast. The only reason we gave 4 stars in location is because road construction

We prefer to stay at the Ayres, Seal Beach when we visit Southern California.  The accommodations are very comfortable:  We especially love the lobby d√©cor, beds, pillows and shower. Staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. It's always nice to have breakfast and watch the morning news  in the dining room. The happy hour snacks and wine are great too! We've had rooms that faced the parking lot  and rooms patio/poolside. We have never been bothered by noise while trying to sleep in any of the rooms we've stayed in. Can't go wrong here!

We came back and used the hotel as our out of town wedding location.  Ayres is a great value with old world charm and very well appointed rooms. Breakfast and afternoon snack spread daily.  Would highly recommend!

I've stayed at the Seal Beach Ayers Hotel on three occasions. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is fairly quiet, which allows for a peaceful stay. The accommodations are nice, very comfortable bed, and having a refrigerator in the room made it easy to keep food costs down. They provide complimentary coffee (if that's your thing) in the room. They have a very nice breakfast buffet every day, included in the cost of your room. They also have a heated swimming pool and jacuzzi.  As a State of California employee traveling for work, I look to find the most reasonable accommodations. The Ayers in Seal Beach is the currently the most affordable option, and it is such a comfortable stay. It is conveniently located immediately off of the freeway, just 25 minutes from the

My husband and I just completed a 7-night stay at the Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach, California.  We stayed there primarily for location and cost ... because our niece's wedding was across the street and we were charged a "wedding group rate."  We usually stay at a Starwood Hotel, such as Westin or St. Regis, as we are Starwood members and have been for years.  I don't think the Ayres can compare to a Westin or St. Regis, of course.  However, we were pleased with our stay at the Seal Beach Ayres.  We arrived early in the day and the staff were very accommodating about getting our room ready quickly and allowing us an early check in.  Our hotel room was very clean, comfortable, spacious, and offered nice amenities, such as a microwave and small fridge.  They also offer a free full

I rated the service average.  When checking in I felt the lady on duty was a bit salty and perhaps I was bothering her.  She did not show me or explain to me about the eco-lighting system.  When asking her if there was book in the room explaining the amenities of the hotel she said no and what did i need to know anyway?  I was told there is no room service (a minus) and no restaurant (another minus).  I asked for a hair dryer and the reply was are you sure there isn't one in the room? When the maid came up with one she wanted to look in the room to ensure there wasn't one already there.  A bit insulting.  Cleanliness:  I was out all day, returned at 4:30 and the room had not been cleaned.  When I questioned that I was told that they do work until 6:00!  The room was average and

Just spent 4 nights at the Ayres in Seal Beach. CA Nice staff, great breakfast, nice reception in the evening with beer and wine and great snacks. Lots of choices for breakfast- fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, bacon, eggs, pancakes, bagels. The hotel was clean and a friendly helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Visit to Move Daughter to CSULB in 2012
Summary: I stayed here in August of 2012 when moving my daughter to grad school at CSULB and it was excellent!  The staff (Kelly, Sean) was so helpful and provided lots of great information.  The room was more than big enough and the wine and appetizers at the end of day was so nice.  I look forward to a future stay here.

Ayres Hotel Seal Beach is by far the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed in! I travel a lot so this means a lot to me. I've been staying there a few times a year for as long as they have been there! It's near the 405Fwy and close to the beaches of Seal Beach and Huntington Beach. Really large rooms, great parking(free) and breakfast included! What more would you want! Bonus, the staff are all so friendly and knowledgable of the area!

The romance package made the stay exceptional, after a fantastic show at Spaghettini‚Äôs across the street. When we arrived back to the room we enjoyed our sparkling wine on the patio enjoying the company of other friendly guest. An array of restaurants is within minutes in either direction of the hotel for lunch and dinner, but for breakfast the hotel is great with a variety of choices to choose from. I will be staying here again in the near future.

We just stayed at the Ayres in Seal Beach to attend grandpa's 90th birthday.  This is our go-to hotel when we visit family in the area.  The rooms are clean and all of them have a microwave and refrigerator in them.  The prices are reasonable and include breakfast.  This tine we requested a crib for our ten month old and were told it would be set up when we arrived.  Since we weren't getting in until 3 am, we were happy it would be ready for our son upon arrival so we could do a quick carseat to crib transfer and he would stay asleep.  Unfortunately, we got to the room and the pull out couch was made up, but...no crib!  We called the front desk and they eventually sent up a pack 'n play--fine, but we thought we were getting a crib and our son was wide awake already at that

Summary Heading: great free breakfast,willing service,needs a tweak
Summary: Lovely place, everthing included, but, they didnt warn us about the 405 renovation horrors,nice to have mini fridge and microwave, but neither worked.When I asked for a heating pad, or ice pack housekeeping was really concerned, but they didnt have them. So just a bit more attention to detail, but everyone was sweet., and the king room with couch was very comfortable, including a desk with sturdy cushy chair(we are seniors)  would refer a friend and would return.

Getting out of the Arizona heat for a weekend was enriched by my delightful stay at the Ayres Hotel. Friends had a fabulous house on the beach and it was a bit crowded for my weekend away sanity so I opted to find a hotel instead. I was totally taken care of by the staff at the hotel. I was lost for 2 hours in the road construction. Once I contacted the hotel to help me find my way back they were amazing and waited for me at the door at 2AM. The hotel is well taken care of and the staff could not have been more accomodating. The price was fantastic and I would definatly return and recommend the hotel to my Arizona summer heat relief seekers.

I cannot say enough about the genuine smiles and customer service I experienced this past weekend.  I thoroughly enjoyed the weekend with my sorority sisters at our annual retreat.  We utilized the meeting room and the board room, and at the grace of the staff, we were allowed to also use other space for our Paddle Party.  From the parking lot to the patio, everything was just right....lots of space, beautiful setting, plenty of parking and is in close proximity to banks, both dinner and fast-food restaurants, and the freeways.  It is always GREAT when I can stay the whole weekend in a beautiful, clean, and spacious hotel at an extremely reasonable rate. The breakfast was great...and the warm chocolate cookies were delicious.

Summary Heading: Beware of  freeway construction and the Sasquatch families
Summary: This was a pretty good hotel, a bit older in style, but clean and comfortable.   Two knocks against this hotel:  The Seal Beach Blvd overpass over the 405 freeway was under construction at the time we stayed (end of July-early August 2013 and this made it a lot harder and longer to get out of the hotel and get onto the freeway, or anywhere south of the hotel (the beach).  Also, there were two incidents of obnoxious guests - one during check-in, when our otherwise pleasant and friendly check-in was interrupted by a screaming match between a portly female guest and a woman who looked like one of the managers of the hotel.  Dunno what that was about, but both seriously needed anger management classes.   The other problem was the guests staying in the room above us, who were either

From the warm welcome and easy check in, to the lovely accommodations, to the comfortable bed and well appointed rooms, a stay at this Ayres Hotel is a perfect one.  Is there anything more disappointing than a hotel shower whose flow is barely more than a sprinkle?  Nothing like that here at the Ayres Seal Beach.  The pillows and bedding are fresh, crisp, and fluffy clean.  Even the smallest single room is spacious.  The staff goes out of their way to maintain a culture of fine accommodation.  And, for incredible dining and entertainment, Spaghettini Grill and Lounge, just across the street is a little bit of heaven.  The groove of a New York music club/restaurant with the panache of Southern California.

I stay at these hotels quite often. They are absolutely beautiful and I recommend them highly. I would give 5 stars, easily, if not for one thing: Fox News plays at every Ayre's during breakfast. If you need to have the TV on, and it needs to be on the news, it should be on a neutral channel so that everyone, no matter what political leanings they may have, feels equally welcome and comfortable. I have actually heard people talking about it while eating, and not in a positive way. Otherwise, a very, very classy hotel with wonderful employees.

Summary Heading: 2 night stay at Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach
Summary: The hotel room was clean and nicely furnished (I loved the 19th century pictures in the rooms and the hallways/lobby.  Staff was friendly and efficient.  Hotel was close to beach though traffic congestion and construction made it a 35 minute by car trip. Two quirky things:  before you can turn on a light switch in the room you must insert key card (we fumbled around in the dark before we found it) where it remains as long as you want electricity.  Second thing:  the blackout curtains didn't overlap which left a bright slit of light in the room all night.  I tried a few things to close it and finally gave up.  The only real gripe: We arrived at breakfast room by 7:45 am and the fruit bowl was already empty and was not replenished.  Next morning we got there even earlier in hopes
Manager Response: Dear Karen -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel and for choosing us for your stay. While I am pleased you enjoyed the decor and the hotel's cleanliness, I do apologize if our energy savers and breakfast offerings impeded your stay in any way. We try to do our part to be eco-friendly and in room energy savers are part of that effort. I do apologize if you were not informed of this feature by the Front Desk and had any difficulties at all. I have reviewed these comments with them to ensure they are letting all guests know of this. As to the breakfast, we try to provide a variety of healthy options to our guests, including fruit, and I am very sorry if this was not an option during your stay as we were out of this item. We will do our best to maintain our stock in the future. We appreciate your review and hope you will visit again soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: If you want a relaxing, beautiful hotel in Southern California, I highly recommend the Ayers Hotel in Seal Beach! The hotel has European charm without the European hotel sized rooms! There is a wonderful breakfast every morning that is included in your stay. During the week at 5:30 there is a happy hour with wine, beer, soft drinks and appetizers.  The staff is fabulous and will do everything they can to make your stay the best it can be.  The rooms are set up so that when you leave, you remove your room card from a slot on the wall in the room and the electricity goes off to save energy as is done in many European hotels.  The hotel is conveniently located to a I 405 and 22 entrance and is convenient to many of the attractions in the area such as Disney, Angels Stadium and of

So far so good. We are here until Aug 10, 2013. Allyson (Front Desk) is great. We arrived late. When asked about the restaurants across the street, she volunteered to check the business hours and even offered to let the restaurant know we were on the way. Other staffs are friendly, too. Always greet with a smile when you walk in the lobby; a must for service industry. Access to hotel a little tricky due to highway construction. Clean & spacious guest room. Fitness room a little small, but no big deal. Complimentary breakfast is convenient. Plenty free parking. WiFi works great. Will definitely consider to come back.
Manager Response: Dear Stewart -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you recently. It means such a great deal to us that you found your stay so remarkable. Please know that your comments will be shared with the entire team so they know how much they are appreciated. We hope you will visit again soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Beautiful area.  Great customer service.  THE BEST breakfast buffett I have ever eaten at.  You would have better food hear than at any restaurant!!!  Our room was on the freeway sigde and you could not hear ANY noise.  This is a must stay establishment!!!
Manager Response: Dear DR -  Thank you so much for your very enthusiastic review of our hotel. We appreciated being given the opportunity to welcome you and are thrilled you found everything so comfortable and inviting. We are especially pleased that you thought the complimentary full breakfast was so delicious as it is one of the amenities we are proud of. We hope you will visit again soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We had a few nights here , and  its really nice . . The staff are great and its clean. They have a nice pool and hot tub. . It's a real nice hotel and would definitely stay again.the beds are nice and comfortable . It's nicely located for several different places to go, we went to Latona beach and orange, both were about 25 min drive . We flew out of long beach and it was only 15 min to the airport,

My wife and I always stay at the Ayers Seal Beach hotel due to its poximity to Spaghettini's Jazz Club which is directly across the street, The Ayers is a "Real Plus",the rooms are very spacious and always clean and fresh.The staff are always friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast is very enjoyable.  We will continue to use Ayres Seal Beach exclusively,not only for its proximity to Spaghettini's but for other places of interest that are very close as well.  Sincerely, David and Lori Marquez

Loved this hotel! Great decor, and very clean. Staff was very helpful. I will definitely stay there again. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful, and included cook-to-order omlets and  freshly made pancakes and French toast.

I booked the hotel on orbitz because it was a very reasonable rate, this hotel was so much nicer than I expected, we were very impressed!  The decor was really nice and the breakfast was amazing! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

This is an exceptional value!!!!We stayed for five nights and couldn't have asked for a better experience! The room was very clean and cleaned everyday beautifully during our stay! We enjoyed the hot breakfast, friendly staff, and comfortable bed!!!!!! We would definitely stay here again!!

The hotel facility is beautiful but the outstanding thing that all of our 16 guests mentioned was how kind, helpful, and cheerful the staff were.  The warm cookies helped too!   Breakfast saved us lots of time getting our wedding party out to a morning wedding.

You expect value and you get it. Comfort, security, friendly. Clean, very well-kept facility. Breakfast is good, free. Internet is fast. Spacious rooms, coffee machine, microwave refrigerator in the room. All make for easy comfort.

My family and I always stay at this hotel to visit my husband's family and I love staying here.  We have stayed at this hotel about a dozen times so far and will continue to stay there when we are in town.  The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean and they offer a wonderfully huge breakfast every morning.  They offer a discount if you are visiting someone in Leisure World, which we are.  The staff has always been very friendly and helpful.  I love the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach.  There are plenty of stores and restaurants close by.  It is right off the freeway but that doesn't seem to affect us in any way.

We have stayed in several area hotels but the Aryes by far is the best.  From the front desk staff to the wonderful breakfast this is our favorite hotel in Orange County. Rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are comfortable. The one complaint would be the air conditioner is loud, but this wouldn't stop us from staying here every time we come.

I was already used to staying at the Ayres in Manhattan Beach, but was needing to stay at a place near Spaghettini Grill & Jazz Club to go see friends of ours perform, Lisa Gay & Tony Drake (Gentlemen of Thrill Band) with Magnetiq and Mark Gabriel Hasselbach. it just so happens that there is an Ayres property direclty across the street on Seal Beach Blvd. After checking rates out at several hotels and motels in the area the Ayres finally grabbed us with the "Romantic Romp" package. We already knew we could always depend on the level of Ayres service, but it's always a challenge to maybe find that one other deal out there that you might take a chance on - not this time we could't resist the offer of champagne, chocolates, bath robes, full buffet breakfast and a late 2pm check-out

I was a little shocked on arrival as I had not expected it to be located quite so close to the freeway. However, staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were new and spacious and very clean. Breakfast was excellent.

I was provided with excellent service, beautiful rooms and comfortable accommodations, while enjoying a perfect location!  We will be using this Hotel as well as giving great recommendations for your outstanding service.  Thank you!

We stayed here for a week in June for a family vacation to Disney and Universal. The hotel is in good shape, room was clean, the pool was small and not heated, but the breakfast was good. My husband used the computer in the lobby to print Disney passes and the hotel staff was friendly although not very knoweldgable with the area. We asked a few times for directions to different locations but were advised by the staff they were not familiar with the area. Being my first time to California, wasn't too sure about the Seal Beach location. There are restaurants, a shopping center including a Target all within a close distance. There's a retirement home behind the hotel and it seems many of the guests staying were visiting relatives in the home. There were a few families with
Manager Response: Dear Gingy25 -  Thank you so much for your review of the hotel. While I am very pleased you found your stay comfortable and the breakfast exceptional, I was disappointed to read that the local construction caused any inconvenience to your stay. We anticipate the construction to end relatively soon and do apologize if there were corresponding noise issues that impeded your stay. We do hope you will give us another chance to show you how remarkable a stay at our hotel can be.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Nice location and easy access to beaches and other great southern California attractions. Hotel staff very friendly and helped print boarding passes when another guest was using lobby computer and also recommended food options for dinner with directions.
Manager Response: Dear Sue -  Thank you so much for your kind review and for allowing us the chance to welcome you recently. I am very pleased the location proved convenient for all of your Southern California travels. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you again in the near future.  Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We've stayed several times at this location and it is consitently top notch.  Room are very comfortable.  The 3rd floor room is a bit nicer with vaulted ceilings.  Quiet surroundings for a good night's sleep on a very comfortable bed.

We traveled far and were very tired when we arrived late at night, so we went straight to bed. In the morning we found loose M&M's in one of the drawers, a muffin wrapper on the floor and a set of false eyelashes on the soap tray in the bathroom. The cleaning staff did not replace towels, soaps,lotions or coffee. We were told about the breakfast at check-in, but, not the cocktail hour. Wi-fi was down for a day as they were switching over to a new server and we were never alerted when it was fixed or to the new username/password. Breakfast was a disappointment-no brewed decaf and as a vegan, the only option was fruit salad and INSTANT oatmeal. For the money we paid for 2 rooms for a week, we expected much better service.
Manager Response: Dear JDrluk -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. I am so very sorry to hear that you found your unsatisfactory. What you describe in the guestroom and at the Front Desk is absolutely unacceptable as we want our guests to be in the cleanest, friendliest hotel possible. Please know I have already discussed these issues with the appropriate parties to ensure against anything like this in the future. We apologize and do hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Hotel is Convenienly located to beach, freeway and stores. Hotel staff were helpful, readily available and very pleasant. Would recommend this hotel. Has nice pool area, outside seating area, fabulous daily breakfast
Manager Response: Dear Susan -  Thank you so much for your kind words and for allowing us the chance to welcome you. It is fantastic to know that you found our location convenient and service welcoming. We are very grateful that you took the time to recommend us and we hope you will visit again very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: On or recent visit to Seal Beach we stayed at Ayres Hotel on Seal Beach Blvd. and had a bad experience with quite a bit of noise on our 2nd floor at 7AM in the morning. It was either noise coming from the room directly upstairs our the hotels housekeeping laundry and supply room. The other unpleasant experience was the taste and smell of the water for showers, brushing your teeth or anything you needed water for. The hotel simply needs to put some kind of filtration that removes the horrible odorous smell that the hotel water has. The water was honestly undrinkable. There is a strong sulfur smell to the water that you get when you take a bath or shower or brush your teeth that you cant get rid of. We had to go buy bottled water just to brush our teeth because it was so bad
Manager Response: Dear robertscb -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel. I am very sorry to hear that you found your stay with us mediocre. We are always happy to investigate noise issues should we be notified at the Front Desk and encourage our guests to contact us if they are being disturbed as we definitely want guests to feel at ease in their rooms. As to the water, while this has been a rare complaint indeed, I do understand the issue and will address it with our corporate team. Most of our guests find the energy saver in the guestroom very efficient and eco-friendly. The device simply requires that a key card be placed in the slot to keep the lights on, so we are always happy to provide a second one to guests so they do not experience any darkness when another leaves the room. We thank you again for your review and hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I might give this place 3  but I was annoyed by the management request that if I enjoyed my stay would I please make a trip advisor rating There was a piece of tape across the carpet in the hallway in front of my room. I didn't understand the lighting right off the bat, came in the room in the dark and had to find a small slot to put a card in to turn on the lights after calling downstairs. Then there was only soap for the sink and not the bath, and no tea or hairdryer. The breakfast is fantastic with real cooks, but things are not restocked promptly and I have to ask for things a lot. These are small things compared to the fantastic and patient staff and their doing everything possible to make my stay wonderful. Kelly at the front desk solved a problem with my bill even more
Manager Response: Dear Susan -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor and for allowing us to welcome you. While I am pleased you enjoyed the breakfast and service, I do apologize if your stay was not an exceptional one. The missing amenities are concerning as they are standard in each guestroom, so please know I have reviewed this with the appropriate team members. I am so sorry you did not thoroughly enjoy your stay. Hopefully you will give us a second chance to make your hotel experience a remarkable one.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel experience not as good as previous visits.
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times in the past. This time I was disappointed. The hot tub was broken for 2 of the 4 days we stayed there. The treadmill was broken down the first day. The "heated" pool was not that warm. The wifi was sketchy, even though I was on the 2nd floor which was suppose to be the best place for the wifi. In addition they were switching over to a new wifi account so it was down for part of one day. Overall, this visit was disappointing.

We enjoyed our stay at the Ayres. It is like a step back in time how the rich used to live, but VERY modern and clean. The room we stayed in was spacious, the hotel and grounds very meticulate. The purpose of our stay was to hit Seal Beach before Disneyland and it was a good location. Although not right near the beach, it was very accessible by car. The staff was all very helpful and knowledgable giving very informative local information that was great.

When we first arrived, we didn't expect the hotel to literally be right off the freeway.  Surprisingly you didn't hear any of the freeway noise but the view wasn't the prettiest. There was also construction going on which made it slightly difficult to figure out where the GPS was having us exit and such.    The room front desk reception area was very open and very pretty.  The staff was very friendly with the exception of the first younger female we encountered. Everyone else was very friendly and helpful when we asked questions or needed anything.  The breakfast in the morning was buffet style but all of the food was pretty tasty.  Only thing that was a dissappointment was when we got dressed to go in the hot tub only to go down and saw it was out of order, which was a
Manager Response: Dear KCoordt -  It was a pleasure having the chance to welcome you recently. Thank you so much for choosing us and for taking the time to share your experience. I do apologize that the hot tub was out of order during your stay. It has since been repaired and is working perfectly so hopefully you will stay again and have the chance to use it. I also apologize if your bath amenities were lacking. We actually do provide a shampoo/conditioner and this must have been an oversight. I will be sure to discuss this with the Housekeeping Team. We appreciate your review and hope you will visit soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Had a ball at the pool with some guys from Canada... They took real good care of me & my man with some drink called Fire Bomb! Went to dinner at Kobe Steak house had a ball dancing to the live band. Sunday had brunch at the  Jazz spot across the street . That was great. Will stay here again for the location.
Manager Response: Dear Havingfun1977 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. How fantastic to hear that you had an amazing and fun time while staying at our hotel. We do have quite a few local dining establishments and other attractions that guests will find enjoyable and I'm thrilled you were able to take advantage of a couple of them. We are very grateful for your review and hope you will visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice boutique hotel, shame about breakfast
Summary: Ayres hotel at seal beach was a great place to spend 6 nights as a base for Hollywood, Disney, and some of the famous beaches around LA. Located near a freeway, 30 mins to LAX, 30 mins to Disney, 10-15 mins to seal beach itself.  Our room was large and extremely comfortable and well decorated. Not your average hotel room at all!! Big flat screen tv, comfy sofa, large comfy bed, coffee maker, air con etc. Only negative was the metallic tasting water from the tap.  Breakfast was our only niggle, but still not probably a big enough issue to stop us going back. The breakfast room was very small and could get quite crowded. There was no variation day to day so it got quite boring. Not enough choice of hot food-only scrambled egg, omelette or potato bits. This wasn't really to our
Manager Response: Dear Matthew -  It was wonderful having the chance to welcome you for six days recently. I am so please to know you found the Front Desk team welcoming and rooms comfortable. I do apologize if our breakfast offerings were not to your taste, though. We are constantly reviewing what we serve, so I will be sure to utilize your comments when we next revisit our breakfast menu. We hope you will still come visit again very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Very well run property - **read about road construction
Summary: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel and they run a first class operation!   Great property, well maintained, and spotlessly clean.    Nice breakfast and perfect location in Seal Beach - close to everywhere we needed.   ADVICE FOR WEEKEND TRAVELERS:  There is major road construction - weekend nights only - very close to the hotel.   There is NO NOISE PROBLEM WHATSOEVER, however the roads nearby are closed from 11pm to 5am on Friday and Saturday  nights and you NEED AN ALTERNATE ROUTE if you are coming in from LAX late at night.  Your GPS will be of little help.  Call ahead and get the alternate route and it will be EASY.  We did not plan ahead and it caused us a 1 hour delay in traffic after getting to within 1/8th of a mile of the hotel at midnight on Friday.   Poor planning on
Manager Response: Dear silvertravel -  It was a pleasure welcoming you back for your second stay. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your thoughts about our hotel on TripAdvisor. I am very pleased you found everything well run and the accommodations quite and comfortable. I also appreciate you pointing out the nearby road construction for fellow travelers so they will be well informed upon arrival. We hope to welcome you back for a third time very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres in early May and were very impressed with the hotel. The rooms and public areas were definitely a cut above most hotels in this price range.  Taking advise from others, we requested a room not facing the 405 freeway and the room we had on the second floor overlooking the pool was very quiet. Beds were great and the room was spotless. Parking was plentiful and the breakfast was just OK. A word of caution though is there is a major construction project taking place on the 405/22 freeway interchange. The Seal Beach Blvd bridge over the 405 is restricted to one lane each direction causing major backup in both directions particularly during rush hour. Take this in consideration when planning your day. I asked if the front desk if there were plans to open more
Manager Response: Dear Crock -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for sharing your experience with fellow travelers. It was an absolute pleasure providing you with clean and comfortable accommodations. We are VERY excited for the opening of the Ayres Resort & Spa Paso Robles in 2014 and hope you will have the chance to visit us and the new resort some time in the near future.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Like a Classy European, But Larger!
Summary: Staying in an Ayres Hotel was a new experience for us. We were most impressed with the "old world" decor and atmosphere in the hotel. Our compliments to the interior decorator for general decor and furniture selection. The room was large and high-ceilinged, the bed was comfortable, and all amenities were included. Further we enjoyed the breakfast selection, although my wife and I generally have a light breakfast and did not try the more traditional hot food options. Staff were courteous and helpful, and check in and check out were quick and efficient. All in all the Ayres Hotels are absolutely great places to stay and provide good value for a quality stay. We stayed at the Seal Beach and the Manhattan Beach properties. I look forward to the Ayres Hotel chain moving further

The facility, ambiance, location and aplomb of the property was as expected - Marvelous.  The staff could not have been more accommodating or attentive.  Breakfast was satisfying and delightful - The chef (cook) was pleasant, skilled and attendant to guest's requests.  All-in-all a most pleasant experience.
Manager Response: Dear bertfalbaum -  Thank you so much for your very kind review and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. We revel in the chance to provide our guests with the best possible service and most comfortable accommodations, so to learn your stay was "extraordinary" is absolutely wonderful! We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope you will visit again very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Couldn't have made a better choice!
Summary: I can't say enough good things about this property. Everyone from the front desk staff, to engineering, to housekeeping, to the restaurant crew couldn't have been more pleasant, and or helpful. The quality of their management team is obvious from the moment you step inside. The decor is very tastefully done, making the quest feel quite welcome and comfortable. The rooms have crown molding, floor molding, stone tile in the bathroom, great color choices, and really everything you need for comfort, with the exception of your own personal valet. :-) Fridge/freezer, microwave, coffee set-up, and a nice little extra counter space for your morning preparations. Really, really pleasant experience. Would return in a heartbeat, and definately recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear PSDavidPalmSprings -  It was an absolute pleasure having you as our guest. Thank you so much for your enthusiastic review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. Our number one priority is to provide the best possible accommodations and service to our guests, so it is wonderful to know we were able to do so for you. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We have had a very short stay of two nights. The room was very large room with two big beds. The hotel was easyly to reach and near the highway. Free internet WLAN. Free swimming pool. Refrigerator empty to use.   Room for improvement: 1. the slang of american english was hardly to understand at the reception desk. 2. I missed the fruit salad at the breakfast buffet 3. there was no shower gel in the bath room
Manager Response: Dear Franz -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you recently. We love having the chance to make an impression on our international guests! We appreciate your constructive comments regarding the bath amenities and will do our best to review them with the Quality Assurance department. We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Good, Comfortable place to stay in Seal Beach
