Summary: Needed to go down for business and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel.  Clean, quiet room and nice wide hallways.  Easy parking- but once in rooms you do not hear the cars.  Breakfast comes with room and has some non greasy options which was also nice. I will return on business trips.
Manager Response: Dear Daisyss -  Thank you for your kind review and for taking a chance on an unknown hotel. We are thrilled to know that our service and cleanliness exceeded your expectations and that we can look forward to welcoming you on future business trips. Thank you again.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: My family stayed at this hotel as it was close to my grandmother's place. We cannot say enough nice things about our experience at the Ayres. Everyone at the front desk was friendly, the complimentary breakfast in the morning was a perfect way to start the day, and the rooms were clean and spacious.  I unexpectingly became ill on our last day. Checkout is usually 12:00pm. My husband explained the situation and they were kind enough to extend our checkout until 3pm. The front desk saw my husband loading the bags to the car and asked how I was doing.  We will definitely stay at this hotel in the future. They have our business!
Manager Response: Dear turnthepaigep -  It was wonderful having the chance to welcome you and your family recently. Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. It is our number one priority to make sure our guests are comfortable, so it was a pleasure extending a late check-out to you so that you were able to recover somewhat. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will visit us again soon.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I was the mother of the groom for a wedding at nearby Old Ranch Country Club.  A block of rooms at the Ayres had been reserved for wedding guests. I made my reservation 1 1/2 months early and requested early check-in. It was a late Friday afternoon ceremony and I needed to be at the country club early for hair and makeup to make 2:30 p.m. picture-taking session. I meant to call hotel the day before to confirm early check-in but as it goes with weddings, it just slipped my mind. On my drive there, I was hoping there would be no problems checking in. To my great relief my early check-in process was friendly, quick and easy and I even made it to the venue early. The room and bathroom were both big and comfortable, not to mention clean and beautiful. The free buffet breakfast was

We have stayed here once before and we have to say how wonderful this boutique hotel is.  They are attentive, rooms are large and clean, and the nice surprise was the assortment of healthy choices for the breakfast buffet; egg white omelettes to order; fruit bowls; instant oatmeal; fresh whole fruit, too, whole grain bread.  We appreciate your attention to details and we will definitely stay at your place again!

One of our most delightful experiences.  Ayres is at the top of their game in every way... courteous, professional, accomodating and friendly in an old fashioned way...  so missed these days. We give you 5++ stars!!

Summary Heading: Recent stay at the Ayres on April 27th
Summary: First, you have an excellent staff.  They were very attentative with our needs.  The moment we enter we were welcome from the front desk personne, housekeeping, chefs and etc.  The bed was very comfortable and the room spacious.  I could have stay in my room for the whole trip.   I felt very welcome.  I would stay at any Ayres Hotel in the future because this was one of the top of the line hotel.  I was very impressed.  I stayed in a hotel in Temecula "Roadway Inn" on (April 19th) and it was awful.  I check in at 10:00 a.m. and check out the same night at 09:30 p.m. I wish more hotels could have your training and the elegance of the room.  I would like to thank all of your staff members for an lovely stay.  This is a five star rating hotel.  Thank you, thank you, and thank you!

Sad that we stayed only one evening.  The room was very large.  The bathroom area was very spacious.  This is is a very nice and comfortable place to stay.  We asked for glass wine glasses and two people rushed to accommodate.  Within minutes our request was handled.

We attended a wedding at Old Ranch and it was right across the street...very convenient! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast offering was great. The front reception was nice and accommodating. We were able to check in early which was nice because we had traveled since 4am and it was nice to take a nap before the wedding. My only complaint was the server in the breakfast area. We decided to work one morning and he keep trying to get us to leave because he wanted to sweep. I said he was welcome to sweep while I was there but he wouldn't budge on getting us to move. I kindly said that I had too much paperwork and my computer to move so I wasn't going to move. He sat there and tapped incessantly in the table to irritate me and hemmed and hawed. They should lock the facility

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel with a few drawbacks
Summary: We stayed for two nights here for a wedding and would have given it 3.5 dots if that was possible.   We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and attractiveness of the rooms. They were large, clean, and very comfortable. Obviously if you are attending a wedding at Old Ranch, the location could not be better (it's right across the street).   The reason for the deduction of a dot and a half is for a couple of reasons: 1.  The location and proximity to the freeway is not awesome. It was especially bad due to the construction going on during the night.  2.  The staff was not terribly accommodating. The were decent but could have been more welcoming as opposed to focusing on the "strict no partying policy". Check in for the bride took longer than it should have and there were

Please understand that I am normally a very positive person and rarely complain about things. BUT on the first night of my stay, in order to get at least some sleep I chose to move rooms at 230 in the morning because of noise (annoying beeping and banging) from the ongoing road construction on the freeway side of the hotel. The person manning the front desk acted somewhat disinterested in my trouble and said causally "yeah, the noise is only a problem at night".The two rooms I was offered both had an annoying smell. I chose one of the two rooms, moved all of my things and was back in bed by 4 am. The room was very musty and warm so I set the thermostat lower, but despite my efforts the room never cooled below 75 degrees. I was awakened at 530 am by an alarm that remained on and

This was an excellent property.  The property is well maintained.  The decor is very classy. The service was excellent, It is within walking distance to nice restaurants and it is a close drive to Seal Beach and sand and the ocean! We would defnitiely stay there again and I would recommend to anyone.

This hotel is one of my favorites.....close enough to lots of things to do and see in the Long Beach area.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  Note: Fresh baked cookies in the lobby every 20 minutes or so!   Rooms are always super clean. Beds are comfortable and the price cannot be beat. There is a mini fridge in the room should you purchase snacks that need keeping...the standard continental breakfast make the entire package a good deal   If you are looking for a gym and a pool, both are small.  The gym consists of one treadmill and two other full body machines.  The decor is Victorian mansion style with lots of oil painting down the hallways and floral tapestry and such...kinda reminds me of a grandmothers house!  But time and again, I will stay at this hotel - its

This was our first time staying in Seal Beach and after reading other reviews, chose to stay at the Ayres. It was a good choice...very pleasant staff, comfortable beds and super clean rooms. Great quality for the price and we did not have any noise issues with outside traffic or inside conference room as I read on another review...was perfect. No frills, but clean comfort and quick access to the freeway(and Disneyland) as well as many shops, restaurants and the beach. The only negative was the overpass construction which made traffic a bit tricky at times, but obviously that could not be helped.  Will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Total surprise how nice it was
Summary: Huge rooms, conveniently located to the 405 fwy with no traffic noise.  Extremely clean, very friendly front desk.  Nice touch to have a microwave, mini frig, and sitting area.  While a Victorian decor is not "our thing", the furnishings were lovely, bed comfy, and breakfast with eggs, sausage, pancakes, french toast in a clean and open room made this hotel a good value and very pleasant experience for a one night stay.

Very friendly and accommodating staff.  Located right off the highway so easy to get around.  Close to both beach and the Disney properties. Free continental breakfast every morning. Any concerns I had were addressed immediately (needing more towels in room etc)

Close to I405 construction and traffic, this hotel is a wonderful place to come back to.  i did not notice any noise from the nearby freeway or construction. The rooms have everything that you could want - refrigerator, microwave, spacious room, spacious closet and all very clean!! Breakfast was delicious and the dining room kept super clean. For the warmer mornings, the outdoor seating area adjacent to the breakfast dining area is quiet and nicely landscaped. The staff was incredibly professional and attentive. I would highly recommend this hotel to those visiting in the area!

Summary Heading: Great staff, extremely helpful & attentive support staff & clean rooms from all angles
Summary: The entire experience was fantastic & I'll be telling everyone I know about the experience. I'll be back again. The reception staff were always attentive & followed up on requests. There was never a concern when asking a question as they understood I was not local & really wanted to help.

Summary Heading: I love this hotel! Great price, service, staff, clean!
Summary: Very nice room with fridge and microwave, a lot of room!  Great breakfast buffet included in the rate! Staff is very friendly.  They made some cookies on Thursday night, hmmm it smell so good.  You can get coffee or tea all day long. Pool area was large and clean.   I enjoyed my stay so much that I have booked Ayres Hotel in Costa Mesa and Anaheim for my next trip in May. Thank you!!!!

Helpful staff.  Friendly people. Breakfast was very well done. Clean lobby. Clean rooms. Health facilities a bit sparse but fine if not busy. A quiet hotel. It is right beside the freeway but you hear next to nothing. I highly recommend this hotel.  Not a walking location. You need a car.

Came for a weekend event -- the room was clean and comfortable -- small refrigerator is a great plus -- also good breakfast buffet is included.  Great stay for a great price. Would definitely recommend or stay again.

Summary Heading: A place where comfort and aesthetics are outstanding
Summary: While I had visit the Ayres in Seal Beach before, I had never stayed there until last week. I was amazed at the size and furnishings of the room I was assigned, and the comfort of the bed I slept in. The foyer and the hallways also contain lovely and comfortable furniture and quality art.  The service was also courteous and prompt when problems were brought up. I would not hesitate to recommend any Ayres hotel.
Manager Response: Dear rabbijon -  Thanks so much for finally deciding to stay with us! We appreciate you allowing us to welcome you and all of your kind words. I'm so pleased the first impression you had of us was positive and that you enjoyed our furnishings and oversize guestrooms. We are very grateful for your review and hope to welcome you back in the near future.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Aryes Seal Beach a few times while visiting Family, and they have never disappointed us.  The rooms are very clean and large and comfortable. I enjoy the microwave and min fridge. It sits next to the busy 405 freeway but you wouldn't know it.
Manager Response: Dear Rainrun -  Thank you very much for visiting us again and for your continued patronage. We know you have a choice of many hotels in the area and are honored you continuously choose us! It is our absolute pleasure to provide you with the best in accommodations and service. We don't like to disappoint. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Superb Hotel right on the freeway
Summary: We decided to try the Ayres Hotel from other Trip Advisor comments. We were not disappointed.  The hotel is steps away from a busy highway but once you are inside the hotel you don't even notice.  The room is tastefully and comfortably furnished; the staff are welcoming, efficient and accommodating.  We arrived early for check in but that was not a problem.  There is a cocktail reception each early evening in the lobby area.  Oh my goodness.  What a lovely buffet table with various appetizers including a huge veggie tray which was welcome for the vegan diet.  There was also wine, soft drinks, cheese, crackers and a hot appetizer that turned out to be samosas my husband said.  Very nice separate room with tables to sit and relax which also serves the morning breakfast.  This

Not what I expected when thinking of Seal Beach, but the hotel itself was pleasant even though the location is in a strip mall just off a freeway offramp.  The decor looked more elegant than it actually is; most of the architectural details are cheap.  Even so, my room was quite comfortable.  The staff was excellent, very helpful in many ways.  I didn't have a chance to try the breakfast buffet but I was able to grab a banana on my way out.

The hotel rooms are comfortable. Breakfast on the veranda was beautiful. We also enjoyed the pool and hot tub each morning. Cocktail hour was very nice. I think we had full beds - so it was a little tight for my husband and I who are used to a king. With the construction on the 405 bridge, you need to learn the alternative ways around.

What a delightful hotel. Old world charm, prompt, courteous service, upscale rooms and very quiet.  Would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. The price is excellent and not what I would expect for such a great hotel (don't change the price though)!  Planning a wedding here in Orange county and this will most likely be our location for out of town quests.

Summary Heading: Luxury hotel at a reasonable price
Summary: Beautifully decorated rooms and common areas.   Nice pool and patio area convenient to all rooms.  Close to 405 Freeway making it easy to visit all that Southern California has to offer.  Free breakfast buffet in the morning is convenient.  Nearby stores and restaurants within walking distance.  Wine and light snacks offered on weekdays is a nice touch.  Very quiet hotel in a nice area.

If possible, I always like staying at your hotel because of the amentities.  The rooms are great, it is a quiet hotel, and is within easy reach of my corp. office in Santa Fe Springs.  Breakfast is always a delight, and during the week, they offer a cocktail receiption for those that would like a snack and glass of wine or a beer.  I highly recommend this hotel and it is one of the better hotel chains in CA and should be rated as a 4 star hotel.  They need a business office with more than one computer so you can print boarding passes, e-mails, etc. as I am from Florida.

As a business traveler  on a tight budget I look for creature comfort (comfortable bed, free wifi, and maybe a light breakfast), and with Ayers Hotel you get the very best of everything. great rates, large rooms, immaculately clean, outstanding beds, large bathrooms, full breakfast, afternoon reception and the most courteous staff you will find anywhere. The online reservation is simple to use and any changes are to a reservation are hndle quickly and efficiently.  Definitely worthy of 5 star rating. This is now my preferred hotel for personal and business travel. Irvin Howard, Grants Director

Loved the Breakfeast buffet. Nice accommodations. Good place to stay for the money. Close to downtown and the restaurants across the street are good. Wish you had a bar though. The rooms were clean and well maintained.

Once again the Ayres Hotels come through. Spacious rooms, free parking, full breakfast, and convenient locations. If you travel frequently I can't stress enough of the opportunities of joining the "Stash Rewards" program. You accumulate points for using the various hotels in their program. And in turn you are eligible for free nights. This was a birthday weekend from my wife. So she set up a whale watching day along with some wonderful restaurants to eat at while we visited the Long Beach area. I will review these separately. This will be the hotel review. This is a cautionary review, though. We arrived shortly before the 3:00 pm check-in time and they had a room ready for us. We asked for a quiet room and they gave us a room overlooking the garden and pool area. It had a nice

We were very delighted with every aspect of this hotel; cleanliness, large nicely appointed rooms, and friendly staff.  We were also pleasantly pleased at not being nickel and dimed at every opportunity... there were no "extra fees" for parking, refrigerator/microwave, WiFi, and a very satisfying breakfast buffet. The hotel does not have a restaurant - however, there are many to choose from VERY nearby (next door and across the street). The breakfast room is nice and roomy, and there is an adjoining patio for outdoor dining. It was truly lovely and we will definitely lodge with them again. (Will also explore some of their other locations too!)

I had a great time here.  Very friendly, helpful staff who knew the area, and places nearby.  Convenient location off the interstate.  Comfortable, spacious rooms with great amenities, and comfortable beds.  Wi-fi worked well, and parking was very convenient with multiple entries and exits so you are not far from your car when you exit the building.  Cookies and complimentary drinks in the afternoon, and complimentary breakfast are nice benefits too.  Obviously will recommend to anyone staying in the area.

This is a very nice property.  Friendly staff.  The guest rooms are nicely furnished with very comfortable beds.  They offer a complimentary full breakfast that is excellent.  They have an outdoor heated pool and spa.  Great value for the money.

I am not a person to write reviews but this hotel was amazing. I have nothing but good things to say about it. Big rooms, excellent decor, very clean, staff very nice and friendly and great breakfast. We stayed 4 nights with our 10 month old and will definitely stay there next time. Very family/baby friendly. It is at an excellent location with convenience stores and shopping centers near by.

We stayed for 10 nights in this hotel when I visited my boyfriend who lives in LA.. The hotel is beautiful and is spotlessly clean.. The complimentary breakfast was more than we expected, there was loads to chose from and their complimentary buffet Mon - Fri at about 5pm ish really took me by surprise there was even cans of soda, beer and wine for you to help yourself to (you dont get that back in the UK). As we are smokers we were out in the patio area a lot and it is so pretty out there especially at night with all the lights on and a couple of times we sat with a table and the fire was put on for us. The staff are very nice and always helpful. The room we had was very spacious with a sitting area and a fridge and microwave were provided too.. It was a 5min walk from 2

I stay here several times a year for work and am always happy to stay here. The rooms are big, clean and well furnished. The breakfast is great and there's a great evening snacks with free drinks. I've stayed at most other hotels in Seal Beach before discovering the Ayers and this is by far the best.

We have stayed at this hotel several times.  It seemed that they may be cutting back a little.  On the weekends you can no longer get a breakfast cooked to order (eggs over easy or omelet). The scrambled eggs that are available on weekend taste like they are powdered eggs.  Mon through Fri they cook to order.  Still what they provide is better than most.  The beds are comfortable.  The location is perfect for us because we visit my aunt, who lives near by, when we are there.  There are a couple of decent restaurants nearby.  The hallways can be very cool especially right now during this cold spell.
Manager Response: Dear Johanna A -  Thank you so much for allowing us the chance to welcome you once again. While I am pleased you found your stay generally comfortable, I do apologize if the breakfast offerings were not up to par. We are constantly reviewing them and will utilize your comments in doing so. We appreciate your candid review and hope you will allow us to welcome you again soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I came into town for the weekend and decided to stay at The Ayers. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and very clean. Breakfast in the morning was really good. They had a variety of hot and cold foods. The one complaint I have is the wifi is very slow and hard to connect to. The solution they gave was to plug into the Ethernet. That would work if I had a laptop, but an iPad doesn't have that port.
Manager Response: Dear Kelovell -  Thank you so much for your positive review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the accommodations so comfortable and complimentary breakfast delicious, I do apologize if our WIFI connectivity impeded your stay in any way. When occupancy is high it sometimes causes slower speeds as the bandwidth is being used by many guests simultaneously. I will be sure, however, to pass along your comment to the corporate office for review. We hope you will visit again very soon.   Many thanks,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Good accommodation and nice service. The hotel is not perfectly located but gives the enough distances to South Coast Plaza mall and some Outlets.  Is important to consider that the prices are under the average for the accommodations, is a cheap price for a really good accommodation.
Manager Response: Dear Juan V -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. I am thrilled to hear you found everything in order and so much value in your visit. We are very grateful for your review and hope your travels will bring you to the area again very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I boked a room for myself for one night when my husband had to go to the ER at the end of our vacation.  I didn't know how many nights I would end up needing to stay there, but they were very gracious to allow me to add one night at a time.  My husband needed surgery and I spent most of my time at the hospital five minutes away and came back to the hotel to sleep.  Only caught breakfast once or twice while I was there, but it was good.  The staff were helpful when I got lost due to detours and road destruction on Seal Beach Blvd.  They were courteous and inquired how my husband was doing.  When he was released from the hospital, we stayed together at the hotel for a few more days so that he could rest and heal before driving home to Arizona.  The room was very comfortable and
Manager Response: Dear chiwawa4556 -  It was wonderful welcoming you recently though the circumstances were clearly difficult for you and your husband. It was our pleasure and duty to do our utmost to make your stay as comfortable and convenient as possible while you were dealing with this unexpected complication. We hope your husband is recovering well and that the two of you will have the chance to visit again under more positive circumstances.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Great hotel. Fantastic staff, nice clean rooms, really good FULL breakfast (not the Marriott type!)  Hot tub was sparkling clean and really relaxing. Lots of towels and pool was heated too! Picky Loved the fridge and microwave. Cute sitting areas. Ask to have the outdoor fireplace lit and sit on patio at night. It is awesome.   things on my part.  No conditioner or shower gel. Road Construction was rough.
Manager Response: Dear krileykat -  Thank you so much for your positive review of our hotel and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. We absolutely strive for "great" so it is fantastic to know you found everything in order and conducive to a comfortable stay. We are currently in the process of reviewing the complimentary toiletries offered and may have some upgrades upon your next visit. We appreciate your recommendation.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Very good hotel, friendly staff, good location, walking distance to many restaurants, and short driving distance to the beach. Beds are really comfortable, and the room is very clean. I was there for the 5th time, love it and really recommend it! Very good breakfast!
Manager Response: Dear Glu2012 -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you a fifth time! To know we have provided the kind of service and accommodations that keep a guest coming back is just wonderful and we are so grateful for your continued patronage. We appreciate your enthusiastic recommendation and look forward to visit number 6.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Love, Love, Love this gem of a hotel in one of my favorite towns, Seal Beach, CA.  The interior and exterior are detailed with "Old World European Charm".  The rooms are large, very affordable, comfortable beds, yummy breakfast, etc., etc., etc.!  Relax at the wonderful garden/pool area.  Short walk to restaurants and shops.  Take a 3-mile ride to Main Street - Seal Beach and take in the ocean, view of Catalina Island, and walk the pier.  Enjoy!!

This is by far the best hotel in Seal Beach.  I frequently visit my parents in nearby Leisure World, and I stay at another hotel only if the Ayres is booked.  The rooms are charming in an old- fashioned way, amenities are modern, the beds are large and quite comfortable, and there is laundry on every floor.  Breakfast is free and very good.  The rooms are uniform in quality; there are no "clunkers".  reliable internet is free.    There is just something pleasant and inviting about the Ayres that is hard to find in the land of sterile and characterless motels.  I have never had a bad stay there.
Manager Response: Dear Michael S -  We are pleased to be so reliable! Thank you so much for giving us the chance to be by making us your choice of hotel in the area. We are always thrilled to learn we have been consistent in providing comfortable accommodations and efficient, warm service. We look forward to hosting you the next time you visit your parents. Thank you for your recommendation!  Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: It was busy, so somewhat loud, but other than that, they have a decent breakfast, and nice spacious rooms. I stay here regularly and am never disappointed by this hotel. Even though it's right off the 405, I rarely hear street noise at all.

The Ayres Hotel is a treat we give ourselves a few times each year. It is clean and comfortable. The staff is wonderful and treat us like family. My favorites:Relaxing in the wonderful courtyard that makes you feel like you are in a European Garden; and the classic Southern California beach town - Main Street in Seal Beach. We never stay anywhere else.
Manager Response: Dear Amafina G -  What a kind review! Thank you so much for allowing us to be your special indulgence during the year. To know we have earned such loyal guests is heartwarming and we are beyond grateful for your continued patronage. We appreciate you making us your choice of hotel in the area and look forward to welcoming you during your next little getaway.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: First stay at this hotel and very much enjoyed the experience.  Room was large, clean and comfortable and fit four easily.  Very good breakfast although no decaf coffee.  We had a drip in the shower which was promptly fixed.  Will definitely stay again.

We arrive close to midnight check in was flawless. We had requested a higher floor room and our request was fulfilled.  Staff were extremely pleasant and efficient.  Room was large, clean.and very comfortable.  Great breakfast.

Stayed at the Ayres on Business for a Night in November. Wonderful location at Seal beach close to some real good shops and eating joints.  Had a wonderful breakfast with a Live Counter and an excellent spread. They also have an enticing evening reception with lots to eat and drink.  Had a real snuggy large room and the linen and carpets smelt fresh. Internet speed was OK and did use this extensively as I had a lot of work to catch up.  There was quite a lot of construction activity going on nearby which made driving in and out a little difficuly but I did not mind!  This also turned out to be a successful trip and that will make the memories even better!  Ravi

The hotel was wonderful! Clean! Charming and warm.  Many Many complimentary extras!! Free internet in rooms, free business center, wonderful full free Hot breakfast buffet (sausage/eggs/pancakes/french toast/fruit etc..).  Weekday happy hour 5-7 w/complimentary wine/beer, cheese crackers etc... wonderful outdoor patio w/fireplace. I don't know of any other hotel offering all the amenities this one does without a charge. We were pleasantly surprised.  Located immediately off the highway its very easy to travel anywhere. We highly recommend Ayres Seal Beach hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Giselle H -  It was wonderful having you as our guest! Thank you so much for choosing us for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. It sounds as if you were able to take full advantage of our many complimentary amenities - including full American breakfast, WIFI, parking,  Manager's Reception and shuttle service within a five mile radius of the hotel. We are always thrilled to know a guest has enjoyed his/her stay so much and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I had to attend a business meeting in Long Beach and dinner at a restaurant across the street from the hotel. Traffic around the hotel on Friday afternoon/evening was horrendous due to road construction but it did not affect my stay.  The hotel was quiet and clean. My room was very spacious, although the room with the toilet and tub/shower was small compared to the rest of the room. I loved the hot breakfast in the morning. The next morning (Saturday) I went to Disneyland for a few hours before returning home and the hotel is closer than I thought to the parks. I was able to get to the parks quickly and easily via very quiet surface streets.  My room (2nd floor) overlooked the patio area and a parking lot.
Manager Response: Dear Lynne A -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. How fantastic to learn that the accommodations met your needs and that the complimentary full American breakfast proved a highlight of your stay. We are very convenient to many Southern California attractions such as Disneyland, so, as you state, our location is perfect for those looking to experience them. We are very appreciative of your review and hope you will visit again soon.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Ayers is MY hotel. It is lovely, quiet (even though it's next to the 405 Freeway) and beautifully decorated at the moment for the holidays. The food is great and the continental breakfast always has a very nice spread. If you have time to walk around the hotel, you won't be disappointed! If you stay at Ayers, it will become YOUR hotel too!
Manager Response: Dear congotrekker -  And we are so proud to be your hotel! Thank you so much for your kind review and for making us your choice of hotel in the area. We know you have so many choices in Seal Beach and are thrilled to have earned a place as your favorite. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Consummate customer service in an immaculate setting
Summary: What a wonderful stay we had at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach this weekend.  From the cordial, warm welcome at the front desk, to the nicely appointed room, everything at this hotel was perfect. We have stayed at several hotels in the Ayres group, and have never been disappointed. By the way, the breakfast is just wonderful! If you are looking for a good value, combined with all the bells and whistles, stay at an Ayres.
Manager Response: Dear Rich943 -  Thank you so much for allowing us to welcome you for the weekend recently and for your continued patronage to our hotel chain. How wonderful to know we were able to meet the high expectations set by our sister hotels. We appreciate your recommendation of our hotels and hope your travels bring you to the area again very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Very accomodating to my toddler's needs
Summary: We recently stayed here while in town for a wedding. Not only was the location ideal, directly across the street from the wedding venue, but they made traveling with my young toddler very easy. They accomodated my need for an early check in, had a crib set up in our room with in minutes of checking in "just in case the baby needs a nap before the wedding", and having a fridge in the room and small snack offerings in the lobby made everything easier.   At breakfast there were lots of child friendly foods as well as cups with lids. And, best of all, there was a huge out door patio to eat at, giving my daughter a chance to run around without disturbing anyone and me a chance to relax, even if some of her eggs ended up on the ground.   This was a great experience. Thank you!

The service and the rooms consistently exceed expectations.  A group of us stay here for business and are always impressed.  The omelettes in the morning are outstanding!  The location is fantastic...easy access to the highway!   Pleasant & convenient surroundings for a morning run, a trip to the store, or a nice dinner.  WIll definitelty stay again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy B -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel once again. We are always happy to welcome you when you visit on business. Consistency is most definitely a top priority - both is accommodations offered and service provided - so we are thrilled you seem to experience this in all aspects of the hotel. Thank you so very much for your recommendation. We look forward to your next visit.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Our favorite place to stay when in long beach area
Summary: Very convent, clean, comfortable rooms, easy to get to Disneyland, Seal Beach, Huntington beach, very centrally located Beautifullly decorated, the breakfast is awesome, not just your continental pastries.  We have been here many, many times, and will continue to come back
Manager Response: Dear cherie a -  Thank you so much for your concise review of our hotel. I am pleased that the hotel provided you everything you needed for a comfortable and convenient stay. Any time we have earned a place as a guest's "favorite" we know we have done our jobs. We are very grateful for your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: It was such a pleasure to find a hotel that was well located, clean and very comfortable.  Our expectations were met and surpassed by our visit.  The breakfast was varied, with healthy alternatives if you were looking.  Front desk staff was very helpful especially finding a restaurant that was open late.
Manager Response: Dear ann_olivia_66 -  Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. I am thrilled you found the hotel so accommodating and clean. We absolutely love being able to exceed guest expectations and are so pleased your stay was an exceptional one. Hopefully your travels bring you to the area again very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: This place is so nice, and feels so warm and cozy to me.  The rooms are great, the view is great, and the breakfast was great!  .  It's very close to plenty of restaurants and shopping and the freeway, but you don't hear the freeway at all with the windows shut.  We loved it and will definitely stay here again

Summary Heading: A nice clean hotel with a friendly staff!
Summary: The Ayres hotel is where I stay when visiting my family is Southern California. It is close to their home but even more important, it is quiet and clean. The rooms just feel less of a "hotel room" and more of a "guest room". The staff is great and accommodating. I would definitely recommend the Ayres hotel if you are looking for a place to stay in the Seal Beach/Rossmoor area.
Manager Response: Dear Ingrid -  You are too kind. Thank you so much for your positive review and for making us your choice of hotel when visiting family in the area. I am pleased we are able to provide such consistently clean and comfortable accommodations. You are most certainly our guest from the time you walk into the lobby! We are very grateful for your review and look forward to welcoming you again very soon.  Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Ayres is a very nice hotel, great pool and hot tub.  The breakfast was better than most free  breakfast-we didnt realize we could have ordered an omelet but apparently you can do that.  The hotel is close proximity to freeway and to other stores and restaurants.

Summary Heading: Quiet Oasis Right on the 405 Freeway
Summary: The Ayres Seal Beach boasts large, clean rooms, a friendly staff and a great free breakfast. While its location right on 405 offers easy access to all the area has to offer, the hotel is still a peaceful oasis. A great value! We will stay again.

Hot breakfast and they even make eggs the way you want. Well decorated. Also there is shopping close by. Across the street is a restaurant which is really good - sphagetinni  Hotel staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean. Overall I truly enjoyed my stay and plan to stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Bizintinc -  Another Spaghettini lover! Thank you so much for staying with us and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We are thrilled you found every element of the hotel conducive to a comfortable visit and that you were able to give Spaghettini a try. Many guests find this to be a highlight of their stay. We are very grateful for your review and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Nice I really liked it
Summary: This is such a nice hotel!  Everything is so clean and pretty.  The staff is very helpful and I would and will stay here again. Its not too far from the beach and it is very close to shopping.  I thought because it was so close to the freeway that it would be loud be that was to problem!
Manager Response: Dear Fancithatt -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your kind review. It is wonderful to know you found the accommodations so comfortable and the location convenient for your needs. We are definitely close to the beach, so are pleased you were able to take full advantage of it. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again in the near future.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: we visited this hotel sep 2012 for 7 nights,location excellent for visiting the tourist attractions of so california as it is just off 405 freeway exit,it is a spanish style with a courtyard to eat breakfast outside if you wish,is quiet business exec type establishment,no bar or restaraunt,but is surrounded by various places you can walk to.Staff are all helpful breakfast and parking are FREE! choice of hot or cold breakfast,as much as you want,outdoor pool and jacuzzi,small fitness room all free for residents,hotel is immaculate clean and luxurious rooms,nice large tv's bathrooms,fridges and coffee makers provided,also iron and ironing board,really relaxing base to tour this wonderful coastal area of California,cannot fault it.
Manager Response: Dear Stephen -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for your thorough review and for choosing our hotel for your week long visit to the area. It sounds as if the many complimentary amenities - including the breakfast and parking - really contributed to an overall satisfying experience, so we are thrilled. Hopefully your travels bring you to the area again soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I love its old world charm and the luxurious ambiance. I sleep really good in the comfortable bed every time I stay at Ayres Seal Beach. The breakfast is the best hotel breakfast I've ever had! And just as an added plus, the room air conditioner is quiet and efficient.
Manager Response: Dear Comequickly -  Thank you so much for your positive review and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel once again. How wonderful to know that the Ayres Dream sleeper lived up to its name. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: nice hotel with bad wifi and reception
Summary: This is the fourth time I stayed at this hotel. It is convenient to the 405 and reasonabl priced. The rooms are quite nice. The problem was terrible WIFI connections and poor cell phone reception in the room
Manager Response: Dear Robert -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel and for your continued patronage. While I am pleased you found the rooms comfortable and location convenient, I do apologize for your experience with the complimentary WIFI. While rare, the connection can be slow due to many guests attempting to access it simultaneously. I will be sure to share your comments with the appropriate corporate team members for review. We hope this experience was not enough to make you reconsider staying in our hotel during your next visit to the area as we value your business.  Regards,   Bill Dolan

Summary: This is the only place I stay when I come to Orange County whether its business or pleasure.  Top-notch (five star) hotel with a couteous and friendly staff and offers a superb hot breakfast, can't ask for anything more!  Close proximity to the beach and attractions in Anahiem and Long Beach.

We stayed here for a couple nights during short trip to Anaheim.  Room was clean and bed was comfortable.  Breakfast was very good.  The only two complaints I have was the shower head pressure was really low as mentioned by one of the earlier review and the internet in my room on the third floor was very slow as well.  There is a construction on the bridge existing to Freeway so it is a bit of inconvenience. The reason we chose this hotel because of the reviews and we wanted to check out this hotel to take the kids back in January for the Disneyland trip for 10 dyas.  For the same price we will be looking at different option now.  I would give it a 3.5 if possible.
Manager Response: Dear Calvin -  It was a pleasure welcoming you recently. Thank you so much for your candid review of our hotel. While I am pleased you found the guestroom clean and comfortable, I do apologize for the issue with the complimentary WIFI and the water pressure. I will have the Maintenance Team look into the pressure situation promptly to ensure against it in the future. As the WIFI, when a large number of guests attempt to access it simultaneously, sometimes the connection slows. However I understand why fast WIFI speed is essential and will look into this immediately. Thank you again for your review and please do reconsider staying with us in the future.   Regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Clean hotel with friendly staff. The breakfast  buffet is one of the best I've seen and the evening reception included hot wings, assorted cheeses, crackers, vegetable and dips, wine, beer and soda. No skimping here. The only problem was the work being done on the offramp which caused detours and sometimes almost impossible to get back to the hotel. But that wasn't the fault of the hotel. I would stay here again. I attended a meeting and recommended this hotel to many people and they all said the hotel was great and a good find.
Manager Response: Dear Lynnda -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. It sounds as if you were able to enjoy our weekday Manager's Reception and all of its offerings! We are always thrilled to learn a guest has had such a comfortable stay. A guest recommendation is the highest honor, so we are also pleased you recommended us so highly and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff, easy access and very clean rooms. Decor was  "tuscan"themed...a nice change from the typical chain store look. will definitely recommend it ...business or pleasure. I worried abt finding it in the dark ( it was 8pm by the time i got there), but it was conveniently located off hwy22. My husband who met me there took a different route off hwy405 and was as simple for him too. Breakfast was included and there was a nice patio outside . Pool may be a little small for travellers w/ family ...and it may be a little noisy outside since its close to hwys...but for our  purpose it was perfect.
Manager Response: Dear Jminghwa -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you to our hotel recently. Thank you so much for choosing us and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. We are so pleased to have provided you with a significant value and a hotel stay "perfect" for your purposes. We hope you will visit us again very soon - for business or pleasure!  Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Currently staying at the Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach, California. I have to say that this is a fabulous base for a vacation, the hotel is modern, spotlessly clean and very quiet (despite being right beside a couple of freeways). The staff have all been polite and courteous at all times, I also like the fact that they are all dressed as I would expect proffesionals to dress, they all look smart in their uniforms, the meet and greet buffet was very welcome after a long and arduous drive from north LA, I would definitely stay here again if I were in southern LA,and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, in my opinion it is 5*

Stayed here for five days.  Very comfortable with luxurious feel.  Rooms large and comfortable with microwave and fridge. Couldnt fault the cleanliness.  Staff friendly and very helpful.  Complimentary drinks and nibbles Monday to Thursday evening. Quite a few nice restaurants within walking distance and can recommend the hair salon across the car park.  Not the best location if you want the beach but good if you are travelling.  Would definitely stay again.

Great little hotel. Loved the patio . You could bring wine for the evening or have breakfast in the morning. The pool was small but very nice.My only complaint was the breakfast. We were diappointed. They were out of many items. Our son attends Long Beach State. This was easier to get around than Long Beach. Our grand daughter loves the beach. We ate at Islands resturant. Would not go back. I Thought it was expensive for hamburgers and fries type place. There is also a Whole Foods in Seal Beach. Which was nice . We have also stayed at the Hampton Inn. Liked Ayres the best except for the breakfast.  The staff was nice and friendly.

Summary Heading: Excellent for a quick business trip.
Summary: A couple of colleagues and I stayed here for a conference.  It's a beautiful hotel in a convenient location.  The comfortable room and friendly staff made this a great stay.  Our only complaint was that showers took longer than normal because of poor water pressure in the shower.

Summary Heading: Love the French d√©cor and the tiled bathroom!
Summary: I have stayed many times in the Ayres Costa Mesa, but this was my first stay at Seal Beach's Ayres. The location is so convenient, right off the 405, and it was actually closer to my event destination at the Old Ranch Country Club than I realized. What a nice surprise! The room was clean and comfortable and the happy hour Thursday evening was very nice. Breakfast was hearty and had good protein choices. Check-in and check-out procedures were smooth and the service from everyone was pleasant and friendly. And the price was more than competitive, it was excellent. I really do love the French style choices found throughout the hotel, from the artwork to the furniture. I would definitely choose AYRES Seal Beach again!! Thank you!!

I stayed just one night but the rooms were nice and the hot breakfast was great. The front desk was friendly. I would stay there again. It is also next to lots of shopping and restaurants. I don't think I would pay$179/night but, I got a discount which made it worth it!

Unique and welcoming decor. Classy! Easy check in/out. Friendly and helpful front desk staff. Room was exceptionally clean and tidy.  Yes, including the bathroom, impressive! We were on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet. Comfortable beds w/plenty of pillows. Furnishings looked new! Liked the location of the kitchentte (bathroom sink area, which was behind a wall to the sleeping area). Would have like to see two sinks but at least it was separate from shower and toilet so someone else can get ready while someone else can be showering.  Plenty of parking w/convenient access to the inside (didn't have to walk around the whole hotel to find an entry). Although we didn't use it, the pool/spa area looked well kept within nicely landscaped grounds. The exercise room was quite small,
Manager Response: Dear HCUSA -  We completely agree that clean rooms are key to a comfortable stay! We feel it is most definitely a top priority. How wonderful to know the cleanliness of our hotel met your expectations and that the service proved helpful. I do apologize if travel around the hotel wasn't easier. We currently have construction in the area, which is leading to some road congestion. I do hope this did not totally hinder your stay, though. Thank you again for your review and please keep us in mind should you return to Seal Beach in the near future.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Ayres Hotel for my friends wedding, which was held on Seal Beach.  What a wonderful, comfortable experience it was.  The bed and pillows were very comfy, the whole room and facility was very comfortable.  Next time I go to southern CA, the Ayres is where I will be staying!  Thank you!!!
Manager Response: Dear Steffyrae -  It was such a pleasure having you as our guest. Thank you for allowing us the chance to provide you with comfortable amenities and warm service. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope you will consider us the next time you visit the area.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We had our daughter's wedding guest stay at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach.  The location was perfect as the wedding was at Old Ranch Country Club, 0.2 miles away. Staff were friendly and helpful despite that there were three weddings on the same weekend.  Only negative, which had nothing to do with the wonderful service at the Ayres, was the terrible traffic due to construction on Seal Beach Blvd. Our guest all commented on the wonderful breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear HazelHB -  Congratulations on your daughter's recent wedding! Thank you so much for allowing us to be even a small part of such a wonderful event. We know that weddings in particular can be stressful to plan and execute, so we try to do our utmost to ensure all guests of the bride and groom are well taken care of during the event. It is wonderful that we were able to provide such exceptional value and amenities and we look forward to welcoming you again in the near future.   Regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a king bed on the 3rd floor facing the street.  Surprisingly you couldn't hear any traffic noise.  Room was very spacious with a love seat and coffe table.  King bed was very comfy.  Rooms are energy efficient so you have to keep your room key in a slot to have the power on in your room.  Just remember that if you are charging anything that you will need to leave a key in the slot when you leave the room.  We kept wondering why our stuff wouldn't charge while we were gone.
Manager Response: Dear Cassitini -  We appreciate your kind review and are thankful you chose our hotel for your visit. I am so pleased you found you guestroom comfortable and quite enough for a satisfying experience. Thank you so much for your recommendation and please consider us the next time you are in the Seal Beach area.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Great Hotel, very close to the freeway and not far from shopping and attractions.  Nicely decorated, comfortable beds and quiet rooms.  Complimentary snacks/beer/wine weekdays. Daily complimentary breakfast with hot entrees.  Very great value.  Front desk was great, very friendly.  The minor issues we had, maintenance was up prompty.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Cindy -  Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. Our goal is and always will be providing the most comfortable accommodations and warmest service to our guests, so it means a great deal that you found your stay so satisfying. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: A wonderful stay at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach
Summary: My husband and I recently spent two nights at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach.  We have stayed several times at the Ayres location in Anaheim, but they were sold out for the weekend we were there, so we tried the Seal Beach location.  We were very happy to see the same high standards for cleanliness, friendliness, welcome, and comfort carried over!  The room was very similar to the rooms at the Anaheim location, but not exactly the same, which was nice.  The bed was very comfortable, and our room was clean and quiet.  We did not hear any noise from the hallway or other rooms.  The beautiful decor and wonderful amenities were the same, and the staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful.  There was a letter from the general manager waiting on our bed when we first got
Manager Response: Dear Chiwawa4556 -  It was an absolute pleasure having you as our guests for two nights recently. Thank you so much for giving us the chance to welcome you and for taking the time to share your thoughts with fellow travelers. To have matched the positive experience you received at our sister hotel in so wonderful to hear and we are thrilled to have been able to deliver a comparable hotel stay. I am also pleased to learn that the service provided made you feel important and you ARE important to us and we wish to create the warmest possible environment for each of our guests. We are very appreciative of your review and hope you will consider us the next time you are in the area.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach is exceptional - all employees friendly, informative, and highly trained in their responsibilities.  The room was extremely large and the furnishings first class.  From the fresh baked cookies served each day at 5:00 PM, followed by the complimentary cold/hot snacks to the fresh and delicious breakfasts each day - this hotel surpasses all other franchises.  The well manicured courtyard and pool were very inviting.  After a social event one evening we returned to the hotel with the front desk personnel greeting us with "Welcome home, we hope your evening was great!"  We will always search for an Ayres property before having to select another choice at our next destination.

We had a pleasant weekend stay. The bed was very comfortable the hotel staff was very courteous and the hotel and room were very clean and in terrific almost brand new status. The breakfast was included and it was terrific as well. We usually stay with another hotel chain but we will be planning to book w/ the Ayres location in the future.

I have a daughter who lives close to this hotel, so we always stay here.  We are always very happy the moment we walk in the door. The hotel is always very accomodating,  clean, and the rooms are always perfect.  Perfect location and close to everything.  You won't be dissapointed.
Manager Response: Dear Theresa -  It is always a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. Thank you so much for making us your choice of hotel when visiting your daughter. It is wonderful to know that your visits are so consistently comfortable. We are very grateful for your review and hope to welcome you back again very soon.  Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: we stay here all the time it is great, it is accross the street from Spagahttinis great music and food so it is perfect! the rooms are decorated great every room is like a suite :) The breaikfast area has good food  and a nice sellection.
Manager Response: Dear Ginger6_67 -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest once more. Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for your continued patronage. How wonderful to know that our close proximity to Spaghettini's proves convenient for you and that the rooms are spacious and comfortable. We are very grateful for your recommendation and hope to welcome you back very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I absolutely loved this hotel! I stayed there for 6 nights with my husband and daughter. It is right off the freeway (the 405) but in the hotel you cannot hear the freeway noise at all and we found its actually pretty convienant considering you take the freeways alot in long beach. The staff was very friendly and HELPFUL. There are tons of restaurants and a grocery store, CVS, Target..the list goes on...2 lights away and some closer....definately within walking distance. The decor in the rooms was very pleasant and modern. The towels and bedding were really soft (a down comforter in a hotel!!) And possibly the best continental breakfast I've had in a hotel (eggs, sausage, waffles, pancakes, bagels, cereal, toast, juice, muffins, potatoes, and omelettes on the weekdays). Very

We have stayed here dozens of times.  It is reasonably priced, clean, appointed nicely. The paintings down the hallways are lovely and the high ceilings in the rooms are great. Also, the lobby is cozy and elegant.

This is my second stay here and it was great both times.  The staff is exceptional nice, helpful and courteous. The location is super close to CSULB. There is some extra traffic there right now because of freeway construction. But we stayed in a room on the freeway side and I never heard the cars driving by. It is very close to many stores just up the street. It was very clean, the only things I might add are a fan in the bathroom and also a stronger showerhead. I will continue to stay there while in that area.. You all there do a wonderful job!

This is a great family hotel loaded with high quality of breakfast, free parking, free Internet, and a nice pool. The staff were very nice and helpful. The room is spacious, comfortable, and clean. Highly recommended!

I recently celebrated my wedding aniversary here and it was as good as I expected. The wood furniture, real paintings with wood frames. The wallpaper was even textured. There was a refridgerator, microwave and a sink. I had a free "full" breakfast and not the continental that some people serve. The staff was excellent, the room quiet. It was right across the street from Spaghetini's restaurant and jazz club. There are resaurants, grocery stores and even a target nearby. The traffic didn't bother me. They had room darkening drapes and even an ihome divice for my ipod. There was a flat screen tv also. I would stay here again and check out the jazz next time.

Summary Heading: Not a luxury hotel by far
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. I was disappointed with the hotel and it's location. Its right off the interstate and not walker friendly. At first glance the room looked clean. I didn't care for the decor, but that is simply a matter of taste. If you are a Best Western type, then this hotel will suit you fine, but for those seeking a bit of luxury, do not stay here. We climbed into bed our first night only to notice the white down was mildewed on the inside. We took it off the bed and requested a new one when the mAid came to clean in the morning. We even told the front desk why. Needless to say when we returned the next night, our bed was freshly made with the same molded down or maybe a new molded down. They put an additional sheet over it though. On the bright
Manager Response: Dear Louisianasweetheart -  Thank you for your candid review of our hotel and for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you for two nights. I do apologize if your stay with us was anything less than exceptional. What you describe is completely unacceptable as we take the cleanliness of our hotel and guestrooms very seriously. Rest assured this issue has been discussed with the Housekeeping and Front Desk teams to ensure no guest will experience anything like this in the future. Again, I am sorry and hope this incident has not soured you on our hotel for good. We would love a second opportunity to prove to you how remarkable a stay with us can be.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Staff friendly and helpful.  Rooms are spacious, comfortable and very clean.  Great breakfast and nice to order what I want. The cook is a pro.  I would recommend this hotel. Our next visit to this area we will definitely stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Gary -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. We strive to create the best possible hotel experience for our guests by providing warm service, comfortable guestrooms, and enticing complimentary amenities, so it is wonderful to know that each of these elements met your expectations. We are very grateful for your review and look forward to your next visit to the Seal Beach area.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We totally enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel!! It is in an excellent location..very close to many restrautants and shops. It is next to the 405 freeway, but our room was quiet and very comfortable. The staff is friendly, helpful and made us feel welcome. We will definitely return to Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and will recommend it to our family and friends!! Thanks again Ayres!!!
Manager Response: Dear Patsy -  Thank YOU for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel. I am thrilled to know you found the location convenient and the accommodations comfortable. We are always excited when a guest feels confident enough in us to offer our hotel as a recommendation to friends and family, so thank you very much. We hope you will find an excuse to visit us again soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: The hotel was excellent very clean & cozy. The staff was very nice and helpful and the hot breakfast there was delicious. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to my friends & family. My next trip there I will be staying at the Ayres Hotel it is definitely my favorite hotel in California thus far.
Manager Response: Dear Kelly -  It was a pleasure having you as our guest. How wonderful to know that we made such an impression on you with our cleanliness, service, and amenities and that we were lucky enough to be chosen as your favorite in California. Thank you for allowing us to be a part of your mini-vacation and for taking the time to share your experience. We hope you travels bring you back here very soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: The hotel is next to the 405 freeway onramp which makes it easy to mover about the area.  Also Seal Beach Blvd. is a main connector to Pacific Hwy 1, which is great when getting to the beaches. The hotel clean, new, and nicely decorated.  Our room was a king bed, with lots of room, microwave, fridge and nice bathroom. The breakfast is certainly much more than a continental breakfast which is nice. We asked for a room away from the freeway side and away from families with small children, which was accommodated nicely.   The only two issues with our room was that the wireless signal was not available and the shower water pressure was not stable regardless of what hour we took a shower.  We found out that wireless access point for our floor (3), was quite far away which is why we

Summary Heading: Perfect L.A. headquarters for a family trip
Summary: Our family of five enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Seal Beach location.  It was a great spot to enjoy the L.A. area to its fullest.  The hotel was immaculate and the staff friendly and helpful.  The hot breakfast in the morning was terrific.  The kids loved swimming in the pool and spa.

We had our son's wedding at the Old Ranch Golf Club in Aug. 2012 and had 3 rooms at the Ayres Seal Beach in our name.  (The total party had around 25 rooms!) We could not have been happier with our experience.  The rooms were clean, spacious, and pretty.  The whole facility was wonderful and the staff in ALL areas were friendly and helpful.  The happy hour was unbelievable, and the breakfast was very nice.   We couldn't have been happier with the accommodations, staff, and price!  WONDERFUL IN ALL AREAS!!!!

Ayres Hotels are always clean and the Staff are warm and friendly. Seal Beach is our favorite. Unbelievable location and you can't beat how close you are to all the major OC attractions. Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach rocks!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Wayne -  It is always a pleasure to welcome you. What a treat to know that we are your favorite of the Ayres Hotels chain! We are always thrilled to know we have made an impression on our guests, and I am especially pleased that you find our location so convenient to many Southern California attractions. You absolutely rock too! Thank you for your review.   Sincerely,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel Seal Beach is a beautiful hotel with very intelligent and friendly staff. I really liked the fact that I was greeted upon passing through the lobby, whether it was to wish me a good day in the morning, or ask me how my day was in the evening, or whether or not they could do anything for me. It is seldom that I've seen this level of unsolicited courtesy, which appeared to be genuine and not merely a rote part of someone's job.  Additionally, the hotel is very conveniently located. I love the fact that there's an ATM and two restaurants literally out the back door, within a sixty second walk from the hotel (and you can rent a car at the hotel as well). The courtyard area is lovely, a great place to sit and have a meal or morning coffee.   The complimentary full
Manager Response: Dear Tess -  It was an absolute pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for your kind review and for taking the time share your experience on TripAdvisor. Our number one priority is to make sure our guests feel welcome during their time away from home, so it is fantastic to hear that you felt so valued. I am also pleased that the location proved convenient and our complimentary amenities made for a wholly satisfying hotel stay. We appreciate your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We spent a night at this hotel last week and were amazed.  The room was large, and the bed was very comfortable.  The complimentary happy hour with appetizers, pop, wine, and beer was very impressive.  The next morning we thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast with piping hot freshly cooked food.  We stayed at seven hotels during our California/Oregon trip, and this one was our absolute favorite.
Manager Response: Dear McSix -  Wow! Thank you so much for your kind review and for choosing our hotel for your stay. To be chosen as a favorite among the many great hotels in California is such an honor and we are thrilled to have made such an impression on you with our accommodations and complimentary amenities. We were pleased to be given the chance to "amaze" you and hope you will give us a second chance very soon.   Safe travels,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We stay at this hotel often as a family and I'm never disappointed.  The service is friendly, the rooms are clean and tasteful, the hallways and common areas are kept in excellent condition (a very rare thing), and the little things I've needed have always been provided without charge or irritation.  Need quarters for the washing machine?  No problem.  Need to print tickets you just bought to an Angels game?  No problem (and no charge).  Also, the breakfast is much, much better than any I've tasted at a similarly priced chain.
Manager Response: Dear Laura -  Thank you for making us your choice of hotel in Seal Beach when you and your family are in the area. To be described as "amazing" in any capacity is thrilling and we are so pleased you consistently find your experiences with us comfortable and accommodating. We are more than happy to provide the best possible value to our guests and hope you will continue to visit us when in the Seal Beach area. Thank you again.  Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: we stayed at the Ayres last week and we loved it ! Great beds,  very clean bathroom  and the happy hour was super . We loved the pancakes during breakfast  , jummie .  Staff is very friendly and very helpfull ,   We'll be back for sure!
Manager Response: Dear Grace -  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your stay. Our ultimate goal is to create a comfortable and welcoming hotel experience, so I am very pleased we were able to provide this to you along with our many complimentary amenities. We are always thrilled to make our guests feel at home and are anxiously awaiting your return. Thank you again.  Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: A late change in travel plans necessitated a brief detour to Seal Beach, where the Ayres Hotel is always my first choice.  I was fortunate to get a July 10 reservation on short notice.  I arrived in the evening just in time for the Hospitality Reception, which is always a welcome treat.  Since I had stayed at this property several times before, I knew what to expect, and was not disappointed.  The staff were efficient, friendly, and professional, and the room was quiet, spacious, and clean.  I'm sure I'll be back again.

Summary Heading: Excellent service, spotless hotel, wonderful stay
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Seal Beach for two nights, a weekend getaway in July, and we absolutely loved it! From the friendly & helpful front desk service at check-in, to the spotlessly clean rooms and vintage decor, to the steaming hot complimentary breakfast in the morning (and outside seating!) this hotel is a great value and will be sure to provide a wonderful place to stay during your travel time in Southern California. There is a nice outdoor pool, and I highly recommend the restaurant/jazzz bar directly across the street, Spaghettini. It's a bit pricey, but definitely worth it. The hotel is about a 15 minute drive from the beach, and located just off the freeway. We plan to come back again in the spring, and we will be staying at Ayres!!!

We love staying at the Seal Beach Aryes.  It is always clean and the rooms are very comfortable.  The breakfast has a nice variety and you can get cooked to order omletes. No parking fee and free wireless makes this our favorite in Southern California!

we love staying here.  We come every summer.  Clean, safe & great customer service and we love the small boutique feel along with the breakfast and happy hour options!  You can't beat this deal and location.

we attended a wedding and spent last wednesday thru sunday at this splendid hotel. the staff was very friendly and efficient. the breakfast buffet was very generous and delicious. the pool and jacuzzi were relaxing and towels were provided. towels were also provided for our large crew so we could go to seal beach. the hotel resembles a european hotel with the art and furniture. they also have energy efficient rooms, and encourage green beddings/towel use. you can still have things cleaned everyday with new linens, but it wasn't necessary with us.  our only criticism is that they don't recycle newspaper and paper. they do recycle bottles/plastic bottles  and cans. we took our newspaper to the long beach airport to recycle. we also heard there was a free happy hr, but never had a

Summary Heading: Ayres deserve the #1 Review Spot in every city!
Summary: Stayed at many different Ayres, stayed at Seal Beach once a few years ago before a cruise, it was great as always. I've stayed at Orange as well as Anaheim, for the money, it is the best hotel, even if it was a bit more expensive I would still stay here, they include everything, breakfast, internet, parking, no bs, just clean, nice and great service. I try to stay at Ayres hotels anytime I visit LA area, but they are becoming harder to get reservations lately, guess the word is out on these great hotels. Staying at Seal Beach hotel again after a week in Disneyland area, tryed to stay at both anaheim hotels, but both sold out that week, bummed! At least we can finish our vacation at Seal Beach which is a bit farther from the beach, but well worth the drive, since its so nice and
Manager Response: Dear Troyster903 -  Wow! What a very kind review of our hotel and the Ayres Hotels in general. Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience and for your continued patronage. To have made such an impression time and again is very humbling and we are so thrilled to have been able to provide such consistent hotel experiences. We are so grateful for your review and do hope to have the chance to welcome you again very soon. Thank you again for your kind words.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Quick, efficient check-in.  Enjoyed the evening reception and delicious cookies.  The lobby is beautiful, as well as the rooms.  Our granddaughter enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi.  Great for families.
Manager Response: Dear DebbieG29101 -  It was an honor having you as our guest. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. What a treat to know that you were met with efficient service and found the many complimentary amenities welcome. We welcome guests of all types, including families, and are thrilled that yours had such a lovely experience. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will visit us again in the future.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Well-maintained, conveniently-located, "Courtyard"-level hotel with a few independent touches.  The decor is more lush than the chain hotels, and the breakfast is slightly more elaborate; but this is a Courtyard hotel located at the intersection of several highways at the border of LA and Orange counties.  No hint of any problems.  Very pleasant and competent staff.  Fitness room and (outdoor) pool are small but pleasant.  Free wi-fi curiously is not documented, but it worked very well.   Hotel also clearly serves small business customers, with a few meeting rooms.  And the hotel has a billing arrangement with the nice restaurant across the street, so it would be ideal for a small business's sales meeting.
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey -  It was a pleasure welcoming you to our hotel. It means a great deal to us to know that you found the accommodations so comfortable, the service warm, and our various complimentary amenities conducive to a remarkable hotel experience. The Ayres Hotels are know for their European-inspired decor, so it is wonderful that the unique ambiance of our hotel made a lasting impression. We do our utmost to create a convenient environment for our business guests as well and it is fantastic that you noticed the many services we have available for them. Your review is greatly appreciated and we do hope you will visit us again soon.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I had a HORRIBLE time at this hotel. First when I checked in, the middle eastern man checked us into a room that still had a condom wrapper on the table and blankets everywhere on the floor. I immediately went back downstairs and wanted a new room. Got checked into another room and thought everything was okay. Very next day we go out sightseeing and get back at 11:30pm and we are locked out of our room. Go back downstairs to see why and the person at the desk tells me SORRY it's not your room, you are checked into a totally different room and someone else is in that room. I then proceed to tell them that MY stuff is in that room and he tells me can you just stay in the room your assigned for tonight and we will fix in the morning? I say NO WAY, GET SOMEONE TO GET ME IN NOW!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Rachel -  Thank you for your very candid review of our hotel. I am terribly sorry that your experience with us did not prove satisfying and do apologize for any inconvenience caused by the issues noted. Unfortunately, it appeared as if an error was made in our property management system which accounts for the room confusion and, while our night auditor was following appropriate hotel procedure, I do apologize wholeheartedly for this mistake and have already discussed this and your other comments among my team at length to ensure against anything like this in the future. We always encourage our guests to approach hotel management with any issues or concerns they may have, and I do also apologize if we were not able to come to a satisfactory resolution for all parties. I will be sure to work directly with our corporate office until we are positive the matter is resolved completely. Thank you again for your review. We do hope you will give us a future chance to show you that a stay at our hotel can be exceptional.  Regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: This hotel is close to restaurant and beach. The lobby and rooms are basic and the staff is average and the breakfast average. The walls are paper thin and we had one incident. The room next to us was having a domestic dispute so I had to call security. I heard the woman in the dispute tell security to take a hike and then we had to deal with police yelling a the couple. All of this transpired between 2-3 am. When I asked the hotel took 20% off our stay however I would not stay there again based on the incident.
