To gain my business I would have expected them to ask the couple to leave and refund that entire night that we had to deal with security, a screaming violent couple and police.
Manager Response: Dear Halleybop -  We appreciate you taking the time to review our hotel. I am truly sorry if anything that transpired during your stay hindered your experience in any way or caused any inconvenience. Unfortunately this situation with disruptive guests did escalate beyond our normal security and it was necessary to contact the police, who were on property for a total of 30 minutes. I do apologize if the reduction in cost was not a satisfactory resolution. We have attempted to discuss this issue further and would be more than happy to explore different options should you contact us back as we want nothing more than for our guests to have had a remarkable visit with us. Again, thank you for your review. We do hope you will reconsider staying with us in the future.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Love this hotel.  Have stayed there twice when we are visiting family in the Seal Beach area.  Everything is great, with one exception.  They are not in too much of a hurry to service your room and it became an issue for us when we returned and found the room had not been serviced at 4:00 p.m.  We;re fussy about this, but it might not bother other travelers.  Still, despite this, we would stay there again.
Manager Response: Dear Poppieorjackie -  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your stay multiple times. While I am pleased you found your stays comfortable overall, I do apologize for any inconvenience caused by what you describe. Often times due to requests for late check-outs or high occupancy levels, rooms can take longer to service than normal as generally we are VERY concerned with making sure rooms are cleaned in a timely fashion. Please know your comments have already been shared with the Housekeeping Team to ensure guests do not experience this issue in the future. Thank you again for your review. We hope to welcome you back a third time in the near future.   Regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: ALWAYS A GOOD EXPERIENCE AT AYRES SEAL BEACH
Summary: Great location for business or personal travel.  Right off 405 freeway and close to all L.A. and O.C. attractions.  Free breakfast, internet and parkiing is a nice touch too.  The rooms are also very spacious and clean.  Highly recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Mike-in-bako -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay and for your kind review. I am pleased to know that the accommodations and location fit your needs so well and that you find us satisfactory for both business and leisure travel. A guest recommendation is the very highest honor a hotel can receive and to be highly recommended is even more wonderful, so thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We are so appreciative and look forward to your next visit.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: This was the third time my family and I have stayed at this hotel and it has never disappointed. The breakfast is a full breakfast with pancakes, eggs, sausage, cereal and much more. The rooms are always clean and the service is friendly and prompt. We even had a special request for our room and they made it happen without any fuss. You can not get a better hotel for the money.
Manager Response: Dear Singleboost -  It was an honor welcoming you for the third time. Thank you so much for your continued patronage and for your kind review. We do our utmost to ensure each guest has an "exceptional" stay and are thrilled everything from the cleanliness of the accommodations to the service contributed to yours. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you a fourth time.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I love that this is a local and very friendly hotel, with an element of charm that gives it more of a homey feel.  Excellent walking distance to all kinds of great food, shopping and an awesome natural foods store called Sprouts (wish we had one in Madison!).  One of the most quiet places I've stayed at, but if you don't want to hear people out by the pool or outdoor lounge area, don't get a room with your balcony overlooking the pool.  Wish there was something that could be done about people smoking outside their room in the morning while people are eating breakfast outside close by.  Other then that, breakfast was very good - great selection of real fruit and outdoor seating.  Also love that the room was so spacious with awesome internet connection!  Would definitely stay here
Manager Response: Dear ZumbaDeb -  It was wonderful having the opportunity to welcome you to our hotel once again. Thank you for your kind review and for choosing our hotel once again. We love welcoming return guests as it gives us the chance to show them how consistently comfortable a stay at Ayres Hotels can be. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we look forward to your next visit.  Many thanks,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Spacious rooms; comfy beds; outstanding breakfast with chef for made to order omelettes, eggs, french toast, pancakes.  Responsive leadership.  Engaging staff.  Locally-owned and operated chain of hotels, the Ayres family is a long-standing pillar in Southern California.  Ayres compares favorably with and surpasses Hampton Inn.
Manager Response: Dear Hifast -  Thank you for taking the time to share your review with fellow travelers and for choosing our hotel for your stay. It means a great deal that you found each element of the hotel conducive to a comfortable and convenient stay. We wish for nothing more than for each guest to leave our hotel feeling relaxed and valued, so it is wonderful to know that your experience with the entire Ayres chain, and our hotel specifically, was so remarkable. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will think of us again the next time you are in the area.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for a week.  The rooms are nice and include a microwave and refrigerator.  The pool and hot tub were relaxing.  The work out room is better than most.  The breakfast buffet which is included with your stay was fresh and good.  There is no charge for parking which is another bonus.
Manager Response: Dear AllyeL -  I appreciate your very kind review and thank you for choosing our hotel for your week long visit. It is always wonderful to know that a guest has found his or her stay so accommodating. It appears as if many of the complimentary amenities offered met your expectations and for that I am very pleased. Thank you again for your recommendation and please think of us should you visit Seal Beach again in the future.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I was surprised by the decor of this hotel. It was very tasteful and charming.  The hotel offered free breakfast and an evening reception buffet of fruit and drinks. The food was delightful, with whole grain options. The floor we stayed on was quiet and my parents were in a separate room around the corner. They had no complaints, on the contrary they were very complementary of our experiences. It was right off the freeway exit, so very easy to find and there was a grocery store less than one mile from where we were staying.  We also ate at Spaghettini's across the street, literally a 5 minute walk. It was wonderful and tasty but higher end price-wise.    It was rather far from the beach and other attractions in the LA area, but a nice relaxing hotel.
Manager Response: Dear MietteMom -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to surprise you with everything our hotel has to offer! We love showing guests that a stay with us can be comfortable, relaxing, and convenient. I am so pleased you found the location accommodating and were able to take advantage of our close proximity to restaurants and shopping. We are very appreciative of your recommendation and hope to welcome you again very soon.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: This hotel is a little gem in Orange County!  It is so well maintained with beautiful antique-style furnishings, a lanai balcony, spacious rooms and the feeling of luxury.  The breakfast is wonderful and it's conveniently located just off the 405.  Free WiFi let's me post this review! Sean at the Front Desk checked us in and was very friendly and helpful when we were looking for an auto repair place on a Sunday.  I highly recommend it for vacationers or business travelers!
Manager Response: Dear VegasWeddingsAnn -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your visit and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We love having to opportunity to show guests that a stay with us can be comfortable and convenient. It is wonderful to hear that the location, ambiance,  and welcoming service contributed to such a satisfactory hotel stay. We appreciate your very enthusiastic recommendation and look forward to welcoming you in the future.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We always stay at the Ayers when traveling to my home town of Seal Beach.  It's comfortable  in a faux luxurious way, very spacious and easy-going with a friendly staff, good breakfast and location.  If you're looking for a seaside spot this is not the place, but it's a quick drive to the beach.
Manager Response: Dear Laurie -  Thank you so much for making us your choice of hotel in the Seal Beach area. We appreciate the repeated opportunities to show you how comfortable and enjoyable a stay at our location can be. I am pleased to know you find the service and accommodations so consistently remarkable. Your recommendation is most appreciated and we look forward to your next visit.   Regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Warm, safe, and comfortable hotel to stay!
Summary: This  hotel is so accommodating,. It has a Eroupeann flare, but way nicer. It's really more like a bed and breakfast, as they provide  a full breakfast.  The hotel puts out some sort of fruit in the afternoon as well. They offer a wash room for those who have been traveling and would like to wash their cloths. They also have a small pool and jaquzzi.  I wish this hotel chain extended beyond Southern California, it's a great place to stay. Also warm and comfortable!
Manager Response: Dear Laughinglulu -  Thank you for giving us the opportunity to welcome you and for taking the time to review our hotel. We relish the chance to provide our guests with comfortable accommodations and warm service in a European-inspired atmosphere, so it is fantastic that you found your experience so remarkable. It is also wonderful that you were able to utilize our guest laundry room as we know many guests find it very convenient when traveling. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will visit us again in the future.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: The decor in the hotel was lovely and very clean.  The free breakfast had a wide variety of hot and cold foods in a pleasant environment including inside eating area or patio tables.  We stayed on one of their advertized "summer specials" and only paid $125.00 for a weekend night.  We would definitely stay at an Ayres Hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Katrina -  We appreciate you allowing us the opportunity to welcome you. Thank you so much for choosing our hotel and for your very kind review. I am so pleased you were able to take advantage of our Summer on Fire sale and experience our hotel. We absolutely love the chance to show our guests that a stay at our hotel can be exceptional. We are so thankful for your recommendation and hope you will visit us again in the future.   Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Seal Beach for business.  I'll just list the good and not so good:  Good: - Friendly service at check-in and check-out - Clean, spacious, nicely appointed hallways - Attractively furnished, luxurious feeling rooms - Very quiet (except for the AC - see below)  Not so Good: - Scratchy sheets and towels - Low water pressure in shower (shower head exacerbated problem) - Internet took forever to connect at night, didn't work the next morning - AC has only one speed (high) and is VERY loud - Breakfast mostly processed sugar and fat - very limited fruit selection was only "healthy" option.  Coffee bitter.  I would basically put this hotel on a par with a Courtyard, Embassy Suites, etc., without the generic corporate feel.  For the price paid, it was a good deal
Manager Response: Dear Acek -  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased you found the decor inviting and the service friendly, although I do apologize if the issues noted caused you any inconvenience. We do our utmost to provide guests with clean, soft linens so rest assured I will discuss your comments with the Housekeeping Team to ensure proper laundering procedures are being followed. As to the breakfast selections, we regularly review our breakfast offerings and your comments will be referred to during our next evaluation. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will choose us again in the future.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Very pleased with our short stay at Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach. Facilities were as depicted in the photos and by most favorable reviews. Staff was professional and friendly. Room was very clean and comfortable. Water pressure in shower was very low, but based on everything else, assumed it was a fluke of some sort. Again, very pleased with our stay and would highly recommend this location for a stay. Conveniently located to shopping in the area and freeways.
Manager Response: Dear M S -  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We take the guest experience very seriously, so it is fantastic to hear that you found the cleanliness of the hotel, its location, and the service so conducive to a comfortable hotel stay. I also appreciate your comment regarding the shower pressure and will discuss this with the maintenance team. Perhaps during your next visit you will have the opportunity to dine at the legendary Spaghettini Grill & Lounge and take in some wonderful jazz music as it is located directly across the street and many of our guests find the experience amazing. Your recommendation is most appreciated.   Many thanks,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Great Hotel for the price! Free Parking! Hot Breakfast included even though it was buffet everything was fresh and made right then & there. Room was very clean & classy. Staff was very courteous. & helpful. We will stay there again
Manager Response: Dear Allie -  Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you and impress you with our service and complimentary amenities. We know a great breakfast is key to a guest starting off his/her day on the right foot so do our best to provide tasty options. I am thrilled we were able to meet your expectations with our breakfast offerings. I am also pleased you found the decor and service so amenable. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you again very soon.   Warm regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We only stayed one night as we were attending a wedding next door - the room was clean and nice. The complimentary breakfast was a nice touch.  We would definitely stay here again if we were in the area.  Clean, comfortable, nice room, free breakfast.....for a good price.
Manager Response: Dear Darmenta1230 -  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for your visit and for taking the time to share your experience on TripAdvisor. We relish the opportunity to provide our guests with exceptional service and comfortable accommodations, so it is fantastic to know that we were able to do so for you during this celebratory event. I am also pleased you found the cleanliness of the hotel up to our very high standards. Thank you again for your review and please keep us in mind for any future travels to Seal Beach.   Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We must have had twenty rooms for our extended family and friends! Perfect place to stay for a wedding at the Old Ranch Country Club across the street.  Comfortable, clean rooms and the breakfast was great.
Manager Response: Dear Pegdes -  Thank you for allowing us to accommodate your family and friends during this celebratory event! We understand the importance of having a comfortable place to rest and visit with family when a wedding is taking place, so I am pleased we were able to provide you with such an exceptional hotel experience. I will be sure to pass along your compliments to the team here at the hotel. We appreciate your review and hope to welcome you again in the future.   Many thanks,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Service, facilities, breakfast, location, room amenities, I stay in this area frequently, and this is my go to location.
Manager Response: Dear BobTheMighty -  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your comments on TripAdvisor and for making us your "go to" hotel in Seal Beach, CA. Nothing pleases us more than to know we are able to consistently provide exceptional service and comfortable accommodations to our guests. We greatly appreciate your recommendation and hope you will make us a part of your future travel plans.   Warm regards,   Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: The aroma of freshly-baked cookies greeted our family upon check-in.  From that point, things just got better.  We found outstanding amenities, a friendly and professional staff, and quiet, meticulously-kept rooms.  The breakfast buffet was excellent, featuring omelets-to-order.   I seldom submit reviews, but the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach deserves my accolades.  It is one of the best hotels in which my family has ever stayed.

We have stayed here before and chose to stay again.  You can not beat the price for the room you get. We are a family of 5 and the rooms are very large.  The breakfast buffet is nice and has something all of us will eat.  We stayed at a much more expensive hotel the first 2 nights of our trip because we to get the full Disneyland experience, and I have to say this room at Ayers was as nice as that one and bigger and we didn't get any breakfast the other hotel.  In fact for more than the double the money we still had to pay for parking and park a block away!  So my opinion is Ayers all the way!

I stayed two nights in this hotel.  It was perfect for my stay as almost all of the other travelers were business travelers.  The room was spacious and lovely.  Very clean!  The morning complimentary breakfast was wonderful!  The outside courtyard was quiet and perfect for having a glass of wine in the evening with their free happy hour drinks and appetizers!  Decor was second to none and the staff were extremely friendly! The hotel is also very close to excellent restaurants and the beach.  We took a relaxing walk in downtown Seal Beach by the water and enjoyed the quaint little surf town.  I only have one complaint and that was that the bed was too firm for my tastes.  My hips hurt both days after sleeping on the bed.  Other than that, I was more than pleased with the hotel.

Nice hotel, nice amenities.  Clean.  Pretty hotel.  Very nice and helpfull staff.  I wondered, though, why they went to the trouble to do the whole "hang towels if you don't want them changed" if they were going to change them anyway.  Out of a 5 day stay, they did that 3 times.  Pillows, though, had seen better days...er nights; hard, and flat.  Kobe restaurant across the street was EXTREMELY disappointing... I would steer clear of that place.

Summary Heading: Really enjoyed our stay. Another tastefully decorated Ayers.
Summary: Large rooms and  beautiful lobby ( i just sat and put my feet up for a while) I think it would be better if they had classical music in lobby instead of just average radio. I wanted to absorb the ambiance of the pretty lobby , but the radio did 13 minutes of ads and it turned me off a little. The reason that I liked everything so much was that it was done with classical high quality victorian decor. Nice chairs and paintings. The detail they put in the hotel is crazy good. Even my husband notices the beautiful floors and tile work. Our bathroom was super attractive with lots of marble and decorated with muted golds . The 2 queen beds had really expensive headboards and the other furniture was really nice quality. I was to happy the Jacuzzi was being redone, but I quess it has to

We went to a Jazz show at Spaghettini Restaurant & Jazz Club across the street from Ayres Seal Beach.  Perfect to walk to & from the show and slept great, the most comfortable beds!! Breakfast was great & the Courtyard is adjacent so nice to sit outside.  The staff could not have been more helpful with suggestions of other things to do in the area.

This really is the first time I've been really impressed by a hotel in a while. Beautiful rooms, real (and free) cooked breakfast, fast free wifi, good service, clean and modern hotel. Unless you go to a $200+ per night hotel, it's very unusual to get this quality any more. The location is very accessible by the highway, but it's a 5-10 minute drive to the beach. My only complaints was the water pressure in the shower was a tad weak (top floor, in the far corner, so maybe that's why) and the pool was pretty average. But even so, this was still one of the best hotels I've been to in a while!

I had a group in town for a family event and got a block of rooms for them. The hotel staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. The breakfast buffet was excellent- great fresh fruit and coffee etc. The patio is lovely with plenty of seating and a fireplace. the lobby is comfortable. You can't go wrong staying here- it was great.
A great place to stay, especially if you are coming in for an event and have a large party staying in the area! They were so accommodating , and made us all feel so welcome!

We stayed here for a wedding and a long weekend. The decor was very nice. While it does not have a restaurant it is conveniently located (Walking distance) to lots of restaurants and shopping.  Having the Enterprise rental car office in the hotel made it easy to rent a car and go the beach which is not walking distance (with kids). The continental breakfast was also very nice and my kids loved the pool.

Great hotel with friendly staff! We enjoyed our 1 night stay after our cruise. Quiet area, comfy beds and a good atmosphere.  Hot Off the Grill directly behind the hotel offers excellent food! We will stay again!
The hotel was wonderful.  It made a bad situation much better.  Thank you to Kelli at the counter for being such a great hostess!

This is a relatively small hotel in Southern California.  It offers quiet, well appointed rooms.  The complimentary breakfast buffet is excellent.  The staff are good and make you feel at home. All together it is a pleasant place to stay.  The downside is that there is no food service other than breakfast.  They do supply a list of local eateries, but no indication of quality.  Hard to find a good place to eat close by unless you like fast food.

We've stayed in this beautiful hotel 3 more times since my original review. It's just perfect every time!!! They have an evening manager's reception that's complimentary, a gorgeous lobby, luxurious bedding and linens for an excellent night's sleep! and a wonderful full hot breakfast is included, complete with omelet and waffle station, cooked to order, sausage, bacon, fruit, etc. Not your ordinary continental breakfast! This was important to us, because we had friends and family flying in for our son's wedding last year, and I felt good knowing they got a good price for a wonderful hotel, impeccably clean, great staff, and could enjoy a great breakfast on the house! When we were there for the wedding, as many guests checked in in the evening, the kind staff opened up their
Manager Response: Dear 6boys4me -   Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to welcome you on three more occasions and, specifically, during such a celebratory event. We know weddings are a time for joy, laughter, and catching up with family so it was our pleasure to provide you with a venue for the latter. We also know that a wedding can be stressful and it is important for the guests of the bride and groom to be as comfortable as possible. I am pleased that the provided accommodations as well as the hotel's close proximity to shopping and restaurants assisted in meeting this goal. You truly honor us with your recommendation. We look forward to having you during your son's upcoming wedding. Thank you again.  Warm regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Accommodations/Service for the Price
Summary: The Ayres Seal Beach is an elegant hotel at a family price.  An internet discount made my cost far less than any other comparable, surrounding area hotels that still didn't live up to the quality of Ayres Seal Beach.  I have very high standards for customer service and cleanliness.  The Ayres exceeded those standards.  I appreciated no charge for using the parking lot that so many other like-hotels charge.   The lobby is beautiful and comfortable.  Check-in and check-out are very quickly handled by the friendly and helpful staff.  The location is smack in the center of 3 freeways that will connect you to many popular areas of So Cal.  Having a full breakfast included in the price can save a family money. The only thing I would suggest is for the chef to alternate each day the
Manager Response: Dear APH2012 -  Thank so so much for your very kind and thorough review of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your stay and are so pleased that you found every aspect of the hotel exceptional. Our team strives exceedingly hard to ensure every aspect of the hotel, from the warm welcome to the accommodations to the complimentary full breakfast, lends itself to comfort and convenience. I am proud we were able to provide these things for you and will be sure to share your comments with the team here at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. The highest honor a hotel can achieve is a guest recommendation, so yours is greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you back very soon.   Many thanks,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Great hotel with very clean rooms and courteous staff. About 4 miles from the Seal Beach Pier so a bit of a walk. Lots of amenities close by. Staff are excellent and extremely helpful and friendly, especially Jerry.
Manager Response: Dear Darn_119 -   Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your stay and for taking the time to share your experience with fellow travelers. We strive to provide our guest with exceptional accommodations and amenities, so it is wonderful to know that found your stay so remarkable. As you stated, we are close to the pier and also have many local restaurants and shops nearby, so there is always something to entertain. Perhaps next time you will have the opportunity to visit Spaghettini Grill & Lounge, which offers delicious food and phenomenal entertainment. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel stay in a long time!
Summary: The hotel appears to be fairly new.  The rooms are extremely clean and spacious.  The beds are so comfortable.  Our room had a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave & coffee maker.  Free managers reception in the evening, and really good breakfast in the morning.  The staff is friendly and accomodating.  The hotel is located right off the 405 freeway, but the rooms were super quiet and comfortable.  Will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Patty -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. I am thrilled that everything from the cleanliness of the hotel to the various complimentary amenities offered made for a comfortable stay. A hotel's greatest desire is to provide the type of service and accommodations that make a guest excited about a return visit, so I am pleased we will have the opportunity to welcome you again soon. Thank you for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about our hotel.  Warm regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, breakfast and rooms but the location is not close to beach. It was a nice stay but I prefer to be closer to the cute town of seal beach and the ocean.
Manager Response: Dear Mazz5 -  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for choosing us for your visit. While I am delighted you found the hotel accommodating and your overall stay satisfactory, I do wish the location would have been more pleasing. Many of our guests appreciate our location as it is central to so many shops and restaurants, including right across the street from the legendary Spaghettini, as well as just minutes from the various beaches. However, we do know that guests have varying preferences and some would prefer to be right at the sand and water. We do hope you will allow us the opportunity to welcome you again and show you that our location can be perfection.  Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: We stayed here at the end of March - Fantastic Hotel!  Clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a great breakfast - so much to choose from!  Hotel staff was very friendly and saw to it that we enjoyed our time here.  We attended the Managers Reception one evening - great assortment of appetizers and drinks.  Only a few minutes from the beach (Seal, Huntington, Long Beach), and close to area attractions.  We would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Allison -  Thank you so much for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach and for your very kind review. Nothing makes us prouder than to know we have provided the most exceptional service and accommodations for our guests. I am also pleased you found the location so convenient to the various local beaches and attractions in the Seal Beach and Long Beach areas. We appreciate the recommendation and look forward to your next visit.  Warm regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: staff is so supportive....cant do enough to make your stay enjoyable.....morning breakfast is superb with Jose's omelets .....Kelly ( manager) is so dedicated to making sure our stays there are wonderful....she goes out of her way to help us with our schedules and remembers every detail...she is an extraordinary employee.....  We have stayed there 7-8 times in the past year and love everything about the hotel and the staff.  We would not stay anywhere else in LA.....we would rather drive for an hour to get to other parts of LA for business than stay somewhere else.....you can't miss staying with these folks at the Seal Beach Ayers......dave p
Fabulous hotel. Clean and comfy. Nice people. GREAT breakfast--best I ever had
Manager Response: Dear Shelli -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for choosing Ayres Hotel Seal Beach as well as sharing your experience with fellow travelers. I am pleased that your found the amenities, particularly the complimentary full American breakfast, to your liking and that your stay with us was a comfortable and convenient one. We hope to welcome you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for a week with the family over March Break.  Rooms were comfortable and clean.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Free breakfast (lots of selection), free wifi, and free parking all big plusses.  Only 10 min. to Seal Beach and another 10 to Huntington.  Overall, really happy with our experience and would stay again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Dear Burtonrider -  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. It was an honor welcoming you as our guest and I appreciate you sharing your positive experience on TripAdvisor. Nothing is more important to the team here at Ayres Hotel Seal Beach than providing the best and most comfortable hotel stay for our guests, so I am pleased that we were able to provide you with the service and amenities that made your stay comfortable. I will be sure to share your comments with the team so they know that their efforts are noticed and appreciated. Thank you again.  Safe travels,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: Our  trip to So. Ca. March of 2012
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach on several occasions. We have never been disappointed !!
Manager Response: Dear Delline -  Thank you for sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. Nothing makes the team at Ayres Hotel Seal beach more proud than to know that we are providing the service and accommodations that make for a consistently comfortable stay for our guests, so I am pleased that we are able to satisfy you time and again. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Because of various family issues, we have had to make 5 trips to California during the past year. Fortunately we discovered The Ayres Hotel and have stayed there four times. The elegance of this hotel far surpasses any other hotel in the area. I don't think any so-called 5-Star hotel could equal the Ayres as far as comfort, service, and amenities. The breakfast included and weekday happy hour are wonderful, and the decor is fresh and pleasing. The staff are helpful and dignified, dressed very nicely at all times. There are areas in the lobby and by the pool to relax, and the location is extremely convenient. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel, or any of their properties in the future.
Manager Response: Dear Cbarlow -  Thank you very much for your review of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. We are honored to be your second home in Seal Beach and appreciate your continued patronage. Thank you for your kind words regarding the hotel service, decor, and amenities, including the weekday Manager's Reception and complimentary breakfast. It is always a pleasure to know that a guest has had a comfortable stay with us. We hope you will choose us again for your next visit to Seal Beach.  Warm regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary Heading: A wonderful hotel in Seal Beach
Summary: The room was wonderful. I normally don't like being on the ground floor, and I was leery of being so close to the freeway. The room was comfortable, and surprisingly quiet, even though I could see the freeway. The AC worked really well once I figured it out, and the blackout curtains made it comfortable even when people were driving by.  Breakfast was fantastic, and all the staff were courteous and professional. I travel down to this area somewhat regularly, and I will definitely be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear BobTheMighty -  It was such a pleasure to have you as our guest. Thank you for choosing the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach for your stay and for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about the hotel. I am happy to hear that the accommodations and complimentary full breakfast made for a comfortable experience. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: This hotel is great as far as room  is concerned. The day staff we checked in with were also great. Beware of the swing shift, I found the male desk clerk extremely inconsiderate and lacking in basic social skills. We as a family rented four rooms so we could attend an concert event my nephew was playing in. At the time of booking we were told they had a jacuzzi spa and that it was always Hot. Upon my first trip out there it was taped of with a "Out of Order" sign. When we asked if it was going to be repaired soon, we were given a blank stare and told it had been that way for days and they had no expected time of it to be working. Also no apology when we informed them it was the priciple reason we booked there.   Plus... If you expect it to be this place with an ocean view
Manager Response: Dear HonestAbe_11-  Thank you so much for your review of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. Your comments regarding the housekeeping and maintenance team are greatly appreciated, but I am very sorry that your stay with us was not as expected. Unfortunately the Jacuzzi was not running as it was in need of specific parts that were on order and had yet to arrive at the hotel. I apologize if this in any way hampered your stay and that the information was not relayed to you appropriately. I have spoken with the Front Desk team regarding your comments and the Jacuzzi is functioning appropriately. I hope you will return to the hotel in the near future to use it.   Regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: A stunning hotel conveniently off the 405 freeway.  French themes and accents.  Rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable.  Breakfast was enjoyable with outstanding sausage links!  Staff are courteous and on par with the Ritz Carlton.  I want to stay here over and over again.

This hotel compares favorably to some of the finest hotels (e.g. See my review of the Carlton-Ritz in Phoenix.).  The rooms are spacious with elegant furniture.  The breakfast buffet is extensive (great scrambled eggs; sausage; cereals; yogurt; variety of breads and sweets; fresh fruit; coffee; tea varieties; juice).  The in-room coffee bar includes a mini refrigerator, a microwave oven and, of course, a single-cup coffee/tea machine with coffees, teas, and condiments.  A flat-screen TV with HBO, in-room free wifi, iron & ironing board, and hair dryer are also included.  Finally, we asked for an inside room (away from the freeway) and were graciously accommodated.  Great place and great people!
Manager Response: Dear Travel4Bee -  Thank you so much for your kind review of our hotel. It is fantastic to read that the accommodations, amenities, and service were pleasing and comparable to such high caliber hotels. We strive to give the ultimate in comfort and convenience at an affordable price, so it is always a treat to learn that our efforts are appreciated. I will be sure to share your comments with my team. Again thank you for your review. We look forward to your next stay.  Regards,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Have stayed here multiple times. The last time we stayed, it was extremely dirty!  My socks were black.  I was very disappointed.
Manager Response: Dear Kelly O -   Thank you very much for your candid review of Ayres Hotel Seal Beach. I was so disappointed to learn that your stay with us was anything less than exceptional.   Our hotel is known for its unique European-inspired decor as well as our friendly service and cleanliness. We have a rigorous cleaning process performed by a dedicated and hard working housekeeping team. I am truly sorry if the cleanliness of the hotel did not live up to your expectations or our very high standards. I will be reviewing your comments with the housekeeping team immediately to ensure against anything even remotely like what you describe in the future.  Again, I apologize for any inconvenience or distress caused and I hope you will choose to be our guest again soon.  Sincerely,  Bill Dolan General Manager

Summary: Thank you for opperating such a first class organization. The Ayers Hotel is one of the best I've ever experienced; from the pleasant (professional) staff at the front desk, to the beautiful room, and the fabulous breakfast, I felt as though I was visiting the home of a close friend. Thank you again.    Rodney Greene San Diego

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach -- A gem among hotels
Summary: The atmosphere at the Ayres Hotel at Seal Beach was very comfortable and pleasant, with courteous and helpful front desk staff.  Our room was spacious, clean and contained everything we needed.  Beds were very comfortable,   Breakfast was much more than expected -- delicious, good variety, and very filling!  The hotel's proximity to the highway made it easier for my family to get to our vacation sightseeing destinations.  I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay at other Ayres locations in Southern California.
The staff and the rooms were all fabulous. Breakfast was great as indeed was happy hour. Highly recommended. Phillip N. Alexander
Had to lug all my bags to my room on a valet cart. Full service??  I don't think so. Boutique Hotel is The W or Kinpton, not The Ayres.

Summary Heading: Great friendly hotel in Seal Beach
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres for 5 nights whilst on business in Seal Beach.  The room was very spacious, spotlessly clean with plenty of seating area and space for clothes etc. Also had good desk with wired & wireless internet for working at. Very comfortable bed. The radio alarm with iPod doc is a nice touch. The hotel is right at the junction of I-405, so there is a little road noise.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful in pointing out local restaurants etc, there are a couple (not cheap, but very good) directly opposite the hotel. Overall a great friendly hotel in Seal Beach, I'll be using it again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Pleasantly "putting on airs" at the Ayres...Spacious and comfortable, more than expected
Summary: Traveling to a high school regatta,  I was pleasantly surprised by the spacious, comfortable and inviting atmosphere at the Ayres. Rooms were elegantly decorated, plush with spacious rooms. The 2 queen beds were very comfortable with a partition of shutters between for needed privacy.  The grounds were well manicured with a beautiful fountain ouside our room, and many places to sit, gather and enjoy the warm 75-80 degree weather in January.  Breakfast was more than Continental and fit for our teen Kings; eggs, hashbrowns and sausages kept well stocked, along with coffee, sliced fruits and a bread-bagel-muffin-pastry station, as well.  Before arrival, I requested by email  2 beds. Bill dolan, manager, forwarded to Kelly Phillips, which communicated by email. After a long day of

Summary Heading: Get away so close to Home : )
Summary: My husband and I decided to get away for an overnighter, even though the Seal Beach Ayres Hotel is just a few miles from home, it was such a wonderful place to get away...they obviously care about people! Clean/Beautiful/Full breakfast/Noon check-out/Friendly Staff (All)...Planning to have a Mom/Daughters get-away here soon, Highly recommend staying here!  Yvonne F  : )

For the last 3.5 years, I have been traveling to Long Beach for work several times a month and have found the Ayers Seal Beach to be my home away from home. Amazing staff, clean comfortable accommodations, conveniently located, and great complimentary breakfast and managers social in the evenings. Highly recommend Ayers to anyone.

I always stay here when visiting my mother in Los Alamitos. The rooms are spacious, nicely decorated and the bed is comfortable.  Breakfast is very good with lots of options. Staff is friendly and helpful.  Rack rates are a bit high, but with AAA or online specials, they are quite competitive with nearby Hampton Inn.  My only complaint, plastic cups.  I think a hotel of this caliber should have glass drinking glasses and ceramic mugs in the rooms

We wanted to spend our evening at Spaghettini Grill & Bar and the Ayers is right across the street - how convenient !!  This hotel is reasonably priced and right off the freeway in Seal Beach.  The decor was fabulous and the front desk staff were on their "A" game (were they trained with Nordstrom staff in customer service or what ?).  It was my pleasure to stay here and hope that soon they could transform the breakfast experience into an actual dining room with a cook to order menu and real glasses in each room - this would bring them up a notch and completely separate them from the likes of a Comfort or Holiday Inn who do the buffet breakfast thing also.

This is the first time we stayed at an Ayres Hotel and the experience was excellent!  The room was spacious with extra tall ceilings (we were on the 3rd floor).  Although adjacent to the 405 freeway, it was amazingly quiet.  We will defimitely stay there again!
We love the relaxed feel of this hotel. The breakfast was exceptional and our room was spacious and immaculate. It is our first choice in So. Cal.

We've been staying here once a year for the past five years when we visit family for the holidays and the hotel is consistently great. I'm pretty good about finding the best deal and haven't been able to beat them for the quality of hotel. Staff is always very kind and courteous. It's conveniently located and always clean. Great place for families to stay. Look forward to our stay next year!

We stay at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach every Christmas holiday (my mother-in-law lives at the Leisure World retirement place nearby). Every year it's a great experience. The staff is attentive and friendly; the rooms are large and comfortable; and the breakfast in the mornings cannot be beat. We look forward to going there every year.

Room was very nice & clean.  Little noise from outside, above or next door except for the in room heater which sounded like a space shuttle taking off whenever it started and a loud gurgling stomach when it shut down...very cold with the heater shut off so.....!?  Other than the sleepless nights it was a great stay...bring an electric blanket or something & turn the heater, or a/c, off!!  Also problems with the free internet made for a line up at the one and only guest computer but everybody was good about making their computer time short.

I stayed at the Ayres in Seal Beach back in August and it was enjoyable. Upon arrival I was quickly able to do an early check in. The front desk staff was friendly and attentive. The local area has many chain restaurants and you can easily find other great restaurants in a 15 minute drive. The bed was comfortable. The hotel was in a quiet area, even though it was conveniently located right off the highway.

I have stayed previously and always find this hotel to be clean and the front desk very helpful.  On this stay traveled with kids and was not disappointed.  The complimentary breakfast is one of the better ones I have had.

The Ayres is a European-style relative small hotel.  3 stories.  I stay there frequently.  It's always clean, and the beds and pillows are good.  The TVs are not high-def, and my one negative is that they don't carry CNBC, the stock-market channel.  They offer a complimentary, full help-yourself breakfast, with one cook making eggs, pancakes, and french toast.  They serve bagels, muffins, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc.  Free USA Today newspapers are offered.  The staff is very friendly.  They have in the lobby in the late afternoon cookies, wine and cheese, crackers, etc., again complimentary.  Even though the hotel is not really upscale, it is comfortable, and the value is good.

We always look forward to our stay at Ayers Hotel at Seal Beach. We are always greeted warmly when we come in the door. They have always been able to accomodate our early arrivals within minutes. The rooms are always very clean, comfortable furniture, everything we need to make our stay enjoyable. Most of all, we are close to a freeway and have never been kept awake by the sound of traffic! And, oh, did I mention the full course breakfast? The smell of morning coffee, eggs, bacon, potatoes, bagels, toast, fruit, yogurt,etc...etc...! Wonderful! It's our 4th year coming here!

This hotel is very close to the family we visited for Thanksgiving. It is very quiet and the room had lovely appointments. The morning breakfast was varied enough to accommodate all of our tastes. The single most useful item was the clock radio. It accommodated my iPhone which contains my music.   The bathroom was slightly odd in it's layout and the shower was not adjustable, but nonetheless, did the job.
From check in every aspect of my visit was an excellent

Summary Heading: A hotel that doesn't nickel and dime you.
Summary: For my recent trip to the LA area, I wanted a hotel that wasn't too expensive nor dirt cheap that will end up charging you for every little amenities anyway.  The Ayres chain of hotel seemed to be an upscale hotel at a reasonable rate.  It was more so when I found their fall discount deals on their website.  What's especially great about the hotel is that pretty much every amenities were complimentary.  The major ones to name a few are free parking, buffet breakfast, and internet access.  If that wasn't enough you have free evening reception on mon-thurs with snacks and drinks.  The rooms were spacious and quiet even though it was next to the 405 freeway.  The only blemish on the entire stay was the fact that on my last day they forgot to clean my room.  I called reception and

Excellent, convenient location if you are visiting friends in Leisure World. You can stay here, yet be close at hand, and have some privacy. Full breakfast is a very nice addition to start your day. Staff is very helpful and professional. I am very glad this hotel is here.
My fourth stay  Excellent quiet rooms Very reasonably priced Decent breakfast Clean

Summary Heading: Best hotel in the Seal Beach area
Summary: My mom lives in Leisure World, and we stay here often when visiting. I've stayed at every hotel in the area, and Ayres is the best. The staff is always friendly and professional.  The rooms and beds are comfortable. Each room has a refrigerator and microwave. Not much of a view, other than the parking lot, but drive a few miles and you're at the beach.  Breakfast is very good--not your average hotel breakfast. Everything cooked and served fresh.  The only downside is that because they are so good, sometimes they fill up--best to reserve early.

We stayed in this hotel for a family reunion and absolutely loved it!  The staff was so helpful in accommodating our large group. The rooms were clean.  The nightly reception and breakfast were delicious!  We plan to stay here every year!!

CLean rooms, Great Breakfast, Nice patio and pool area, comfy beds! Every room has a microwave and a refrigerator. The rooms are spacious and provide free WIFI. M-F they serve appetizers, beer, wine and soda at 5:30 in the lobby. Great location. Within walking distance to Target, Chipotle, Sprouts, Coffee Bean and Tea leaf, Panera etc. There is a park for kids 1.5 miles away on Heather rd. We travel with my husband when he is on business so  I look for things to keep the kids busy. Great for business and families.

The Ayres hotel chain does a nice job of making you feel comfortable.  Good location, close to the beach, dining and entertainment.  Excellent value for the money.  They offer breakfast in the morning.  Good selection of hot and cold items and lots of tables inside or out on the patio by the pool.  I am partial to the Costa Mesa Ayres, which has its own restaurant and the breakfast alone is worth the stay.  However, the Seal Beach Ayers leaves you satisfied, although they could probably use another person to help with the making of omlettes or pancakes.  There was a bit of a wait for hot entrees.  The hotel staff is friendly and efficient.  If you have a sweet tooth attack late at night, they have a little mini snack store, downstairs by the front desk.  A little bit of

We were visiting Long Beach, but the prices downtown were SUPER high the weekend we were there.  I found this hotel.. and it was GREAT!!!   Perfect for families!  Our queen room was split with a half wall between the beds with half the room vaulted which helped to make it seem even bigger.  Front desk staff was delightful and they had the type of room requested, which seems to be hard to come by these days!  Seal Beach is much nicer than Long Beach, although windy in the evenings on the shore.  I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

We have stayed at this hotel twice - 2 nigths each time. We love the place . . . nicely appointed comfortable rooms, helpful staff and a great breakfast. The room rates are great for how nice this hotel is. It looks as good in person as it does on the website.

Location can't be beat, just off of 405 but rooms were quiet.   Deco is faux Spanish and nicely done.   Bath was spacious and lots of hot water.   First hotel I have ever stayed in where  the bath tub had a heavy curtain swag decoration.  Breakfast included in the rate and the chef made me an excellent omelet.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance which was good as hotel has no room service.   Spagattini's restaurant is across the street, medium $$, but great food and martinis.   Hotel has a lot more charm than an Embassy Suites but you give up the bar and the room service.

I used to swear by Embassy Suites because of the breakfast and manager's reception but Ayres pretty matches what they offer at a cheaper price.  The internet is accessible and free, the parking is free, the rooms are spacious and it's a fairly quiet and peaceful place to stay.  This paritcular location is right off 405 freeway and withn 10 minutes of the beach.  Anything else you can think of is probably less than 30 minutes away.  The breakfast service and offerings are not quiet as extensive as an Embassy but still far more extensive than a typical continental breakfast.  The manager's recepiton is self-serve but the staff seems to keep drinks and snacks stocked.   The property is also very well decorated and maintained plus the surrounding Seal Beach neighborhoods are safe

Summary Heading: The only place I'll stay in Orange County
Summary: The breakfast buffet is superior to any. The staff is exceptional and the rooms are clean with a comfy bed.

We stayed here for a night this past weekend, while in the area for some tennis playoffs.  The hotel is very nice and clean.  Parking was great (lots of it and free).  The rooms were spacious and the free breakfast was awesome.  There were lots of different choices (hot and cold) and we sat outside on the beautiful patio.  For $112/ night, this plave is a gem!!

‚ÄúWe were very pleased at how quiet our room was. No worries of noise from another room or bumping from upstairs. Great! The room decor was pleasant and very clean. We look forward to staying with you on our next visit.‚Äù

Summary Heading: We felt so welcomed and comfortable, the hotel was a definite winner
Summary: The hotel was extremely comfortable and clean. All of the staff, from the gentleman taking our reservations, to the people welcoming us from behind the desk, to the cheerful breakfast chef, to the housekeepers.  All of the employees  were all very friendly, professional and always greeted us with a warm smile. The breakfast was delicious and I looked forward each morning to having a great meal. The beds were comfortable and the room was meticulously straightened.  I would most definitely stay here again.

We have stayed at the Seal Beach Ayres several times the most recent two weeks ago.  It is in very nice condition, very clean, nicely appointed, has a very nice continental breakfast, and the customer service is always good.  I recommend it to everyone.

Summary Heading: Very Clean with a full breakfast!
Summary: Our soccer team stayed at They Ayres Hotel in June 2011 for a soccer tournament in Long Beach.  Although this hotel is in Seal Beach it was a quick transit to Long Beach.  It's location is right off the freeway and only a mile from the PCH.  It was local to many restaurants and stores.  The hotel was found very clean and comfortable.  By calling ahead the hotel worked out a group rate that was very reasonable.  The best feature was the full complimentary breakfast.  Unlike other hotel chains, this breakfast wasn't just a waffle or some dried cereal.  Not only were sausage links, potatoes, and scrambled eggs kept ready to serve, a chef was there to prepare fresh pancakes, french toast or omelets.  Wonderful fresh fruit, yogurt and many different types of breads and muffins were

I have family that live right down Lampson Ave., so the location of the Ayres could NOT be beat! The staff was mostly friendly - there was one concierge who didn't smile, but was very efficient - and the room had everything we needed! A mini-fridge held all the snacks we'd brought for the kids, a spacious bathtub and two large beds were great. When our son woke up in the middle of the night, I was able to take him down to the ample lobby so he wouldn't disturb other guests. Breakfast was AMAZING - a ton of food of all kinds - and we were able to invite family members to join us for $6 each, which was much less than we would have paid at a restaurant. We will definitely be back as long as we can get a similarly inexpensive rate ($106). Usually the hotel is much more expensive.

Summary Heading: Love this chain of Hotel.. both in Seal Beach and Costa Mesa
Summary: Nice clean rooms and friendly staff.. Close to freeways for easy travel. Stared at both loacations

Summary Heading: Will return when in the area.
Summary: We have never stayed at an Ayres Hotel in the past but came across it when looking at another hotel that was recommended by friends. We booked the Ayres because it was actually about $12 less expensive and offered a full hot breakfast. We were extremely pleased when we checked in. Staff is friendly and our hotel room was really nice. It was very clean, beautifully decorated and even had a sofa. There was an exercise room and the full hot breakfast was excellent. When we are back in the area we will definitely stay there again. We highly recommend the Ayres Seal Beach.

Summary Heading: I always look forward to my stay at Ayres Seal Beach.
Summary: I always look forward to my stay at Ayres Seal Beach. It is the best accommodation in the area and I have tried several. I visit my aunt at Leisure World and it is very convenient. Thank you for an excellent, affordable place to stay.

Summary Heading: Very nice place except for the Processed breakfast.
Summary: I have stayed at Ayres many times as the location is good for me and the rooms are really very nice. However, I just find the breakfast awful and hope that the Management read this review and think about it. The food is just so processed, it is almost inedible. Processed egg mix (not a fresh egg in sight), processed breakfast potatoes, processed sausage links, procesed everything. I suggest adding $5 per night and hiring a proper chef to cook proper food. The hotel would then be delightful.
We love the warm cookies!! We love the cleanliness. We love the breakfast. We love the privacy between the two beds in the room. We love the comfortable beds/beddings. We will definitely be back!

I have stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago and was very satisfied, so this time, I booked it again but I was  quite disappointed with the room. My husband and I like to sleep with open window, we prefer fresh air to air-conditioning unless the weather is too hot to bear. When we were there (last week of October) the weather was pleasant, more on the cooler side during evenings and early mornings. We arrived on a Sunday and we were given a room on the third floor facing the freeway although I have requested for a quiet room facing the pool. According to the reception, there was no room available to our preference, but we could move next day to the more quiet side of the building. The next day, when we inquired about the room, it was still not available, so we decided to

PERFECT LOCATION, FAST CHECK IN, GREAT MORNING BREAKFAST, GREAT STAFF  Been here 4 different times, right next the freeway, great access, Cal-State University, Long Beach is a so close you could hit it with a stone. Not one complaint about this hotel.
Clean. Quiet. Great service. Great breakfast included. Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Can't beat it for the price.

Reviews for this were mixed however i took a chance and boy was I glad! The hotelis small and quaint and I was alittle unsure about it being right off the highway but it was fabulous! The rooms are cute with a microwave and fridge. The hotel has coin laundry which was useful. The pool was small but nice and quiet. The breakfast which was included was a good deal and made it an easy start to the day not having to think about another meal. I would definetly saty here again and I am tough to please!

Summary Heading: Convenient location - close to Long Beach State
Summary: This is a cute hotel with very comfortable rooms. The European decor is a little gaudy, but at least they are trying to show some style. The outdoor pool looked a little nasty; we didn't use it. Breakfast buffet is quite good, and all the staff were friendly. Overall a good place to stay if you're visiting Long Beach State.

Nice hotel but don't ask for anything special.  We asked to get our room cleaned in the AM on two different days.  When we came back afternoon, the room wasn't yet cleaned.  They took their time about getting it done when we went and complained.
Manager Response: Dbski4it,  I apologize for the Housekeeping issue you encountered during your recent stay.  I have spoken with our Guest Service Agents and Housekeeping Manager regarding this matter, and have taken several steps to avoid this in the future.  Please accept my apology and feel free to contact me if you are returning to the area.  Sincerely, Tom Witt Asst. GM

Summary: Have stayed here 20+ times.  This past trip was with a group of 4 friends just in from Australia.  They are picky and complemented the hotel as clean, nice, and welcome after a long flight.   A great pick for any travel to SW Orange County or SE LA county.  Good location, quiet and good staff.  Rooms are very comfortable.  10 years old or so and very well maintained.  Quiet upscale for the price.  Staff friendly and helpful.  Only complaint if you can call it one, is that the restaurant keeps serving the same meal for breakfast.  A little variety would be appreciated.

This hotel was a rare find. We stayed only 1 night,but will return again because of the wonderful hotel. The hotel is so clean and decorated with a nice flair.Our bed was the best hotel bed I have ever slept in.The breakfast was great and the chef on site was willing to cook any request. The food was plentiful and very good.It felt more like a bed and breakfast type of stay in this hotel. My only wish would of been a ceiling fan over the bed. I have personal preference for air movement in a bedroom. The AC was really great and the room was quiet despite being close to a freeway.I enjoyed this hotel so much we will stay in other Ayers hotels in future visits.

I found Ayres through TripAdvisor, liked the way it looked, read the good reviews, and booked. It was a 2-night stay in the middle of a busy week driving all over Southern CA. I have to say I was a bit let down.  The energy-saving card-activated electricity is a great idea, and I appreciate that this hotel is trying to be environmentally conscious. However, I did not appreciate the energy-saving air conditioner. It was truly annoying. It operated from a separate thermostat, and regardless of the temperature it was set on, it turned on and off frequently. This was quite disruptive to the temperature of the room, not to mention our sleep. It would run for a bit, maybe 15 minutes, loudly shut off for about 5 minutes, then come back on, starting the cycle again. Thinking the a/c was

Summary Heading: Still a Nice Hotel - Excellent Value
Summary: I stayed again at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach. This is an update to my report from 3/08.   Since I was visiting someone at nearby Leisure World, the cost was $112/night on weekends & $124 during the week ‚Äì No increase from last year.  I had previously negotiated a rate of $128 for government employees.   Rooms are nice. Refrigerator & microwave in room. Coffee in room. Nice carpeting. High ceiling. We saw the staff dusting paintings in the hallways. Clean hotel. The only drawback is plastic toilet seats and plastic shower walls and tub. But to me this is no big deal. It does make the claim of a European style hotel a little hollow. Clean washers & driers are on the 2nd & 3rd floors. It cost $1.50 each to wash & dry. It took 34 minutes to wash & 45 minutes to dry. You can buy

Very clean, big room with microwave and mini bar. Serve yourself breakfast was free, buffet style. We booked this hotel because it was the nearest to relatives we were visiting in the area. It was comfortable, but I wish I'd taken more notice of the style before booking. If you like modern hotels-light bright and airy, then this hotel is not for you. The furniture is large, heavy and very dark. The furnishings are heavily patterned and the overall colour is mustard. If you like this style of decor, then you will love it. If modern, light and minimalistic is your taste, then you will find it opressive. Nice staff.

The physical property itself is excellent and the hotel is located directly off a main freeway in Southern California, making it easily accessible to many local attractions.  It appeared to be a fairly new property with a small but nice pool area, complimentary breakfast served off the lobby, and well-appointed rooms although certainly not the "suite" type they advertise.    The first problem we ran into is the limited staff.  We had a rather late arrival and when we got to the hotel we found it locked up.  We waited for about 15 minutes, even calling the hotel, but no response.  As we were heading back to our car to leave, someone (night auditor) opened the door and let us in.  He said he had been walking around.  After check in, we inquired about the bell staff and he said the

Stayed at the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach this past week for a nearby conference. Had read the reviews on TripAdvisor and took an informed gamble. Large rooms with marvelously comfortable beds, "euro-style" furniture, microwave and refrigerator in room. The decorating not to my personal taste (gold flocked wall paper) but staying not living there.  The best breakfast ever!! Eggs, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit including berries, mango, papaya, melon.  Very helpful staff all around with restaurant questions, directions, suggestions.  Nice pool and jaccuzi.  Near by shopping, 2 miles from Seal Beach with pier, cute town center, good restaurants. Easy on/off 405, only 15 mins to Long Beach and 30 miles from LAX. Would definately go again when in area.

We loved this hotel. Wish they were all over the US. Great "free" breakfast. Easy access to/from highway. No noise from roads. Clean. Pretty.  Only draw back was how for it was from Hollywood/Beverly Hills area.  About 45 minutes one way .  The hotel in itself was GREAT.  Would stay again!!!!!!

We stayed at this hotel for five days.  I requested a quiet top(third) floor room when making the online reservation and that's what they gave me.  Some rooms face the freeway and/or road.  Others, the quieter ones, face the courtyard, pool and parking lot.   The room was in good shape and clean. The decor was as shown on their website.  The bed was comfortable and included plenty of pillows and  a down comforter.  The breakfast was above average and included scrambled eggs, meat, potatoes, waffles and/or pancakes, sweet rolls, bagels, and fruit.  Plenty of juice and coffee and some cereals.  Better get there before the last half hour because things seem to run out.  The evening reception included snacks, wine and beer.  Housekeeping service could have been better.  One day they

Summary Heading: My favorite place to stay in Seal Beach
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in at 12850 Seal Beach Blvd in Seal Beach, California is a great boutique hotel located right at the 405 and Seal Beach Blvd.  Everything about this hotel is excellent from the rooms, to the service, to the location.  I have stayed at this hotel probably a dozen times over the past 4 years, always for business travel but I would stay here for personal travel, too.  Description & Amenities:  Small, 3 story boutique hotel decorated in a French/European style.  Rooms are very spacious with large bathrooms and the most comfortable beds that I think I have ever slept in anywhere!  Even better than my home bed (yes, that's kinda sad!).  I stayed in a king-sized room complete with poster bed, desk, sofa, coffee table, TV amoire, refrigerator, coffee machine, microwave

Summary Heading: Clean, Elegant, Good Price, Perfect!  - YOU GOTTA STAY HERE!!!
Summary: Wow, this place was amazing. The rates are surprisingly affordable. The rooms are very, very clean and classy. The breakfast was decent--a nice warm meal with good ham and fresh fruit. Again it was the room that really impressed me..high ceiling, spacious, comfy bed, stylish European style decor. Remember that you've to put in the card to activate the electricity. I wish Ayres was everywhere so I can stay in their hotels more often. I've to come back here again. You've to experience this place. GREAT EXPERIENCE! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

I am used to staying at the Ayres in Laguna Woods, so I was not disappointed with this location in Seal Beach. It is a great hotel for the business traveler and vacationer alike.   The rooms come with a small fridge and microwave. There is a breakfast buffet with tons of hot and cold offerings and they will make egg dishes to order for you. In the evening they have freshly baked cookies and from 5:00 to 7:00 they have a small free happy hour cocktail offering with wine, beer, soda, cheeses, and crackers in the entance lobby.  My room had a king size bed and a full couch (opens to a bed).   It is right off of the Seal Beach Blvd exit of the 405. Long Beach is only 10 minutes away by either the 405 or driving along the coast.

We were pleasantly surprised with our stay at the Ayers.  At check-in the clerk remembered that I had asked for a quiet room away from the elevators.  The room was very nice, the beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was outstanding.  On the weekends you can even get an omelet of your choice.  They have a managers reception during the week with beer, wine and various snacks.  And then there was the cookies... The desk staff was courteous and helpful and the property was well kept up.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again.

We picked this hotel because of the good reviews and we were not disappointed in any way...from the friendly and helpful staff to the great full breakfast to the quality of the rooms... we had no problems and enjoyed our 5 days very much.

This hotel was absolutely beautiful!!! The rooms were large and spacious, and impeccably appointed. The bathroom was beautiful, it had a nice sofa and coffee table in there. And the beds? They were about the most comfortable beds we'd ever slept on. The linens and down pillows and comforters were SO luxurious! Check in and checkout were easy, and the staff pleasant. Only thing I was surprised at was seeing a $1.00 charge for calling the restaurant across the street to make a reservation. (I thought that was kind of ridiculous). Upon entering the hotel lobby around 5:30, I could smell fresh baked cookies, and saw and empty platter, which was never refilled for the remainder of the evening. Kind of a tease! but I would highly recommend staying at the hotel for comfort,

We chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews, and we were not at all surprised to find this hotel perfect in every way. The beds are very comfortable, room is spacious and very clean, located in a quiet and good neighborhood, what can we ask for more? Thumbs up!  We will definitely stay here again if we are in L.A.

Unless you are visiting an elderly  resident at Sunrise (next door) this is not the best location, but the beds are really comfortable, the furnishings romantic yet new, very clean, very roomy and efficient layout, and the included breakfast is Great!   The fitness room is nothing to right home about - very small, a couple of pieces of cardio, etc. but the outdoor pool and jacuzzi looked nice but surrounded by parking lot screened by bushes. The staff are OK -nothing to write home about. Actually the best staff member is there graveyard shift guy - the others are mediocre.  I choose this place because of the consistency of the comfort of the beds and the breakfast. I once did get nubby sheets and changed rooms immediately - very unusual as usually the sheets are great. The decor

I love the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach.    The staff is polite and friendly.  The lobby and common areas are tastefully decorated and very clean.    The rooms are LARGE (both big rooms and tall ceilings) and tastefully decorated.  The beds are very comfortable.  The bathrooms are spacious.  The breakfast is quite good for a free hotel breakfast.  They have a nice outdoor patio with a small waterfall and vines growing overhead.  Very peaceful.  There is a nice, small pool.  For this part of California, the prices are very fair.   I've stayed at the Ayres several times on business, and am very pleased every time.  It is a great value, and a wonderful hotel.  I wish the managers of many other hotels would come to the Ayres and learn how to run a proper hotel...

This hotel is a great place to stay. Easy access off the freeway, close to stores (CVS, Target, Kohl's, Bed Bath and Beyond) and very comfortable accomodations.  Big and clean rooms and  if you stay on the 3rd floor, there are high ceilings. Free complimentry breakfast and free newspapers, both USA Today and a local newspaper. Staff is extremely professional and responsive.  Small pool and jazuzzi with towels available poolside. Even thought the hotel is located right next to Hwy 405/22, there was very little freeway noise and my room was facing the freeway.

Just a great stay at Ayres Seal Beach.  I really needed a good night sleep in the middle of a very hectic business trip and that's exactly what they delivered.  Room was very comfortable and well appointed.  Breakfast generous.  Location convenient.  Check in and check out handled with outmost professionalism.  What more can I say?

I was booked in this hotel for a visit to California State University, Long Beach--which is about ten minues away. (I later learned that the university uses this facility because it will bill them directly for sponsored stays.)  At any rate this is a remarkably good hotel.  The staff were friendly and responsive; the rooms were done in the style that I call "boutique"--that is not Danish modern.  But my room was very clean, and very quiet even though it faced the San Diego Freeway (405)..    I suppose that that is what makes the hotel a bit different--it's like a boutique facility in, say, San Francisco, in a Holiday Inn location. There are several restaurants nearby and it is about a two and a half block walk to a shopping mall wth a full Ralph's Grocery and a Target, CVS

We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times in the past, and once again we have NOT been dissapointed. It is a european boutique type of hotel. The hallways to the 3-story hotel are well appointed-in fact it is hard to find any painted walls. They are are covered with beautiful wallpaper. Our room had 2 comfortable queen beds, although 1 large king bed is available as well. Each bed had 4 pillows. Weekend stays are about $25 cheaper per night. The rooms are very spacious, with high ceilings. The area is relatively quiet, even though it is adjoining the intersection of I-405 aand Seal Beach Boulevard.  The bathroom is nice as well, with large tile on the floor and partially up the wall. Small, but thick bars of soap, hair conditioner and shampoo is provided. They will tell you

My family and I made an excellent decision when we selected the Ayers Hotel, Seal Beach. Conveniently located at the seal beach blvd. exit of the 405 the hotel is a breath of fresh air. The only drawback, if any, is that it is about five miles or so from the beach and the main town of seal beach itself, other than this I can't really think of any issues that we encountered. The breakfast buffet, FREE, was good and saved a family of four at least a hundred dollars over the course of our stay. The pool isn't the biggest in the world but it is heated and the jacuzzi right next to it is of above average size. All of the grounds are extremely clean from the parking lots to the restrooms in the lobby area. The rooms, we had 2 queens, are very nicely done and are much larger than the

As far as I'm concerned, this is the perfect hotel for me.  It's too bad there aren't more Ayres Hotels around the state.  CLEANLINESS is my top priority when selecting a hotel, and the Ayres in Seal Beach met my requirements, and then some.  The decor is lovely -- new and luxurious -- and it has every amenity that one could wish for in a home-away-from-home, including a complimentary full breakfast served buffet style.  Taking the family out for breakfast can be pricey and time-consuming.   Freshly-baked cookies and fruit are served in the lobby in the afternoon.   In addition, there are several fantastic places to eat on the same side of the street, within walking distance.  We got take-out and brought it back to the room.  The staff was charming and helpful.  Parking is very

My idea of ‚ÄòAbove Average‚Äô may be much different from most willing to settle for an inexpensive room‚Ä¶ However, as a business traveler, I look for cleanliness, bed comfort, fast internet, and conveniences like a refrigerator and microwave. A view is always the cherry on top of my rapid rewards.   Okay ‚Äì Ayres Hotel, Seal Beach.  So far, I cannot think of anything bad to say about this hotel. I have yet to try the breakfast or the pool, however, this is my second night here, and I am very impressed.   I cancelled a reservation at another Long Beach hotel and booked a room at the Ayres on Saturday night. I liked this property so much that I cancelled my Sheraton reservation and continued my stay.   Hey ‚Äì here is a shout out to the only negative reviewer who thought this was a

The Ayers was our base for a nearby conference.  The staff members were all very friendly and helpful. The room was large with a king bed and sofa, coffee pot, microwave, and refrigerator.  There was a good, simple buffet breakfast with hot and cold items.  The place was very comfortable and well equipped.  The only drawback was the air conditioner that roared when on.  We would stay there again.

My wife and I stayed here for two nights in the summer, having driven up from the San Diego airport on a Saturday evening. The hotel was close to the interstate, a short drive to the ocean, and was next to a relatively quiet road (that passes by a country club and military base) with a wide sidewalk that was good for running on. There is a fitness room, but it is very small. Our room on the third floor had a very high ceiling, making the room feel less shoebox-like than the usual hotel room. The breakfast spread was quite good, and we even used the pool briefly. Finally, the high-speed Internet in the room came in useful. I'm not sure I'd call it a "boutique" hotel, but it is a step up from the usual Hampton Inn-type places.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Seal Beach on Saturday, Feb 12, 2005.  We enjoyed the hotel.  The room was nice and spacious, the hotel was very clean.  We did not hear any noise from the freeway.  Used the pool and hot tub and they were fine.  Breakfast was okay about what you get at any hotel breakfast bar.  We paid $125.00 per night and felt that was a good value for the money in the area.  We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we were in the Seal Beach area.

I think people writing the reviews are responding to things like cleanliness, breakfast, everything new etc. But what a monstrosity to look at! Really fake-oh cheap-oh nouvelle riche furniture in scary burgundy colors. We walked into our room and were extremely disappointed. In fact we were frightened. The headboards look like giant carved pineapples from WalMart or something. And the artwork is very phony pretentious. It basically looks like some no-taste executive decided to build a chain of hotels using the same phony "upscale" furniture everywhere, every location, every room. It's like cookie cutter ugly. It really gave nightmares. We ended up staying anyway and didn't like it at all. The pool was okay, the breakfast mediocre, the staff friendly but this place really was a
Manager Response: The pictures shown of the Ayres Hotel Seal Beach are actual photos of the hotel. The picture of the guest room is an actual photo of our deluxe studio suite, our standard room. We invite you to come see the hotel and please contact us if we can be of assistance in any way or answer any questions you may have.

Summary: Someone in my company suggested the Ayres Hotel to me as it was near the company that I was going to work with in Cypress, Ca. I was very hesitant as I had never heard of this hotel and hated to stay somewhere I did not know. What a surprise when I walked in.  It is gorgeous European Boutique hotel. Very nice professional staff.  Try the two restaurants across the street Spaghettini and Kobe's (the sushi at Kobe's is best Ihave ever had).  Spaghettini is not an Italian restaurant even though the name sounds like it. I was told it was one of the most popular restaurants in the county! Great Food and Great live Jazz.  the breakfast at the hotel is very good and is included in the great rate I was charged. I have found a new home and will always stay there. only wish they had a

This place was an incredible gem! Gorgeously appointed rooms, perfectly clean, great staff....good breakfast, hors d'oeuvres in the evening, lots of parking, near a convenient strip mall. Near the highway but very quiet. Great beds, too...best sleep I've had in weeks. And at $109 it's a joke!  If you are thinking of a chain hotel in Long Beach, do yourself a favor and stay 7 minutes away in Seal Beach at this incredible hidden gem. Next time I'm in SoCal, I'll seek out this little chain over the big names, since they seem to do everything right.

What a great hotel! We opened the door to our room to find ourselves in an enormous suite; it completely took us by surprise. There was a very large sitting room, complete with a wet bar and TV, which opened out on to a good sized balcony with a table and chairs. There were two large marble bathrooms with luxurious deep tubs and separate vanities. The separate bedroom had it's own TV, and there was a small area off the second bathroom with a coffee maker, microwave and refrigerator. A full breakfast was served buffet-style every morning at no charge in a dining room that opened onto a beautifully landscaped patio area. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and there were even self-serve laundry facilities on each floor.  The one small drawback -- there is no restaurant

My wife and I were pleased to find a hotel that is brand new and stunningly beautiful. The free breakfast in the morning was outstanding and the chef was very accomodating. The front desk staff really made us feel special. If you want to stay in a hotel that has fresh baked cookies waiting for you at check-in, and has the nicest rooms in town, then this is the hotel for you. My wife and I will look foreward to our next stay at the Ayres Hotel. Las Vegas eat your heart out.
